so basic - and excellent coffee!

beautifull interior

Good food, great service!
Supercool. Murphy's irish red. Beste
Super Service
Super leckere Spare-Ribs
Great Austrian food and polite service
Must stop for Sunday brunch
Excellent friendly advice.
Excellent food and service. Very nice old german ambience. Highly recommended.
Good service, reasonable prices and - of course - good food

A most enjoyable experience! I lived close to this restaurant & frequented it several times a week for three months. Always enjoyed the 'craic' with both staff & customers whom I got to know . The food & drinks were excellent & very competitive pricewise.Superb atmosphere, very busy & very successful . Congratulations to Marco, Sabina and all their wonderful staff,especially the zany Sicilian waiter from Agrigento & the wonderful barmaids. Magnifico!
This is without doubt the best restaurant in Berlin. Friendly staff excellent cuisine.
hearty welcome, attentive service, delicious food - a perfect diner
My new favourite chinese in Tegel
Asso pack
Very good pizza and good staff! Hope to come back to Berlin and taste the best pizza and pasta with shrimps in the world! Greetings from Minsk, Belarus!!!
Fine place with high prices and slow service. Beer was okay though.
A great local place with very delicious food, a lot of Vegan/Vegetarian dishes, and lovely service, definitely check it out if you can.
the food is incredibly bad. you feel like you´re in a third class chipper´s. prices are high enough.
Very nice food!personal super nett,

Lovely, helping workmates, a nice and friendly team atmosphere, both professional and relaxed at the same time, a great care for the food quality and preparation and last but not least, the chance to work during important events in many interesting locations. These are the reasons why I like - and enjoy- to be part of the team of Select Catering.
Top experience.
Very good variety, a bit expensive though.
do you see anything wrong here?

We bought a wash machine and some other things here cuz it's one of the few places in Germany that accepts credit card (visa/master), well... the wash machine was broken (like it had fall from the truck or something...) along with about the 50% of the other things we bought, and the good ones had defects, like an elliptic crosstrainer machine that didn't fit while putting pieces together. I think this place only sells the crappy defect leftovers of all the brands... we changed 2 times the wash machine and the 2d one was even worse... at the end we asked our money back and went to some other place to buy our stuff... And they gave us (no joke) a 500ml bottle of crappy wine as apology gift... In general customer service in Germany is bad, but this was ridiculous... Food maybe... but other stuff don't risk it... I hope stores realize that there is a lot of auslander in Germany that don't have EC-karte and start spending some money in a universal method of payment....
We were there last saturday, perfect dinner from the starters to the dessert, easy mood, friendly waiters and excellent food quality.
Very well composed. Not overly complicated and high quality food.

We visited there today since it was recommended by our friends who used to live in Wedding. The place is truely "unauffällig". With some doubt, we entered and ordered a pizza and one fish-soup. Compared to the understated look of the restaurant, the food, is excellent! For this price, the pizza is truely thin enough and tasty as well; the fish-soup is full of all kinds of fishes and shell-fishes and shrimps.Most of all, it tastes amazingly fresh which you seldom get in Germany except Hamburg. It proofs again that a brilliant dinner experience surprises you usually in such sweet little restaurant in your neighborhood, not necessarily in those with michelin stars.

I have seen tricks in my over 50 years, but I had never seen this one before. This little restaurant with 6-7 tables and 20-25 crammed sittings, a 2-room shop, advertises itself as having Stone-Oven pizza, (Steinofen). Well, when I asked the waiter or owner (I don't know who he was) why it would take 45 minutes to bake 6 pizzas ( 3-5 minutes tops in any given stone-oven which can cook up to 4-5 pizzas in one setting), he, at last, could only explain it with the truth: they actually don't have a stone-oven! What they have is a granite stone on which they lay the pizza which is then baked in an electric oven. Agh! What a cheat! I have seen those ads, where you can buy a granite round stone and bake your pizza at home, trying to replicate Italy's best. Did not want to waste time even trying out the cheat, it could have been the best pizza in the world, I don't know and I don't want to know. Lost my appetite at the lie.

Simply the best coffee, and most expertly made cappucinos, I've had in Berlin! It's also a great and unpretentious place in general, which could be easily overlooked due to the numerous coffee and bakery spots on Müllerstrasse. But don't be fooled! This is a gem. It's the real deal. The coffee is roasted in house, in small batches. The barristas are expert and there's a reason that it's always crowded. I must admit that the decision to move from Charlottenburg to Wedding was made easier by the idea that I could go to Coffee Star on a daily basis. It's a bit crazy, but a good neighborhood must have a great coffee shop.
A must... Awsome coffee, great selection of blends. You should definitely try those coffee variations, when you are near by!

The meat at this Döner is top quality. It tastes more like a nice cut of steak than the fishy sausage which is typical. The prices are a bit steep and the amount of meat in a dürüm is below average. Complete meals are tasty and the portions are large. Among the grill specialties, Adana kebap is to be recommended, but best of all are the daily specials, which are comparable to what one might eat in a decent restaurant in Turkey.
Most solid adress for oriental grilled food in this area.
LOVE the bagels and cakes. And the ambience and feinkost products are wonderful

Just stopped in here for the first time yesterday, and I was quite impressed. It's at a new location, just down the street on the corner of Hochstadtstrasse, and it's a beautiful space, with a great selection of wine, from a 4 Euro 1 L bottle of Ventoux I picked up, to much more expensive. Also some nice bagel sandwiches, cheesecake, etc. Friendly people, too.

Run by three Americans who've made it their mission to bring the micro/craft beer culture of the States to Berlin. The brewery and taproom are Germany's first community supported GmbH. They've got an imperial IPA that'll give you a punch in the face. Amazing.

Went there today. 3 stars is 'It's okay'. Asked for L-Lysine very clearly, and was given L-Leucine. The shop selection was small and other than that, I give it three stars. They could do better but it didn't suck!

Worst pizza delivery service i've ever ordered. You'll have better pizza with a frozen one from the supermarket. its over salted, and the cheese is like a hard tasteless layer. 1 hour wait and it arrives cold. French fries seem to have been made hours ago and are completly soft and also tasteless. Onion rings came black. I'll neeeever order here again and don't recomend it to anyone.
Spicy food that will have your stomach in a wreck for hours... Deliciously fried brats with a habenero salsa to accompany your curry up to 7 million scoville.
Good, fair and fair priced Croatian food. Big portions, lots of meat or fish and a great Djuvec!

Friendly to your belly, friendly for your budget! Especially for people staying in hotels nearby: Avoid high bills and go here to eat. Very friendly people, a (mayby too) big menu and an enjoyable atmosphere. And remember: Italian food is not only pizza's and pasta. Try some other dishes like meat, fish or fowl! The chickenbreast (at most times in most places a dull dry piece of food, but not here) is amazingly good, moist and tasty. A real secret of the chef. A good example of how extremely friendly the guys of Sara are: One day it seemed to be hard to get someone in a wheelchair into the restaurant. No problem for them, because the next day they constructed a very good and solid ramp out of stone! Just try this place. And especially for the Dutch: Food is OK, portions are big and, the most important to the Dutchies: It's all against unbelievably low costs!

This amazing Irish Pub is the best thing the Gesundbrunnen area in Berlin can have! check out the different kind of beers (some speical ones in whole Berlin) and Whiskys. Everyone speaks English and the food is great! Check it out!!! P.S. Pub Quiz every Monday and free concerts on weekends.
A wonderful restaurant with the most enthusiastic and friendly staff. Great, German food and a nice community feel. Will definitely have dinner next time I am in Berlin.

Like many, I really love a good burger, and I'm over the top madly in love with a really great burger. I've traveled and tried burgers in dozen countries or two, and yet to this day none are better then the ones they serve here. I never expect to find the best burger ever in a little place in Berlin that makes faux-fun of American culture, but golly, did they nail it. Go here, make no delay - your taste buds will thank you

Don't even waste your time. Go straight to White Trash Fast Food if you value good food, authenticity and no bullshit. I was at The Bird last evening and after waiting for 50min for our order the man who was "investigating" our case had the face to say they have forgotten it and didn't even apologise. We got up and left and we will never go back. In addition, the ambiance of the place is awful. I felt like I was in a glorified McDonald's. And what's the problem with "the other place" that they seem to mention throughout their menu?! If they were that good, they shouldn't worry so much about the competition. Verdict: 100% bullshit.

The Bird, Berlin american style Burger restaurant. I was there with my girl last thursday 29/08/2013, we like real burgers, we need to wait to get placed, (no reservation, my failure) cause the bar was full, during a beer we get a place. The burger was the best i got ever, in any german restaurant. I orderd medium raw and i got medium raw. Best beef this guys know how to handle beef. Enjoy it.

We ate The Bird during a short stay in Berlin. It was the perfect spot for our family. Everyone found something on the menu to their taste (although not necessarily to my pocket with my son selecting the €40 steak!), the service was brisk but good ( they're pretty keen to turn those tables!), the drinks flowed and the eclectic soundtrack was great. Would definitely recommend The Bird and would go back again without a shadow of a doubt if I happened to find myself in Berlin again.
GREAT burgers! The place is cool without trying to hard. I just wish it wasn't always that packed. Definitely worth it.
Good and cheap
Awesome food & amazing decor
Tofu - naja... Alles andere: top.

what an awful night! the food is terrible. ugh. the crepes are flimsy - tasteless and small. the staff rude. the atmosphere bland. there is nothing good to say about this place. what a waste of time and money!
Excellent creperie! Food is cooked by an authentic french chef. The prices are way below 10 euros and you can make a meal out of 2 of them. A nice change from the local cuisine!
Great bar, there are about a million ;-) different Whiskeys at really reasonable prices. Probably the best bar in wedding, definitely one of the best whiskeybars in Berlin
great place !!! massive verity of beers cool music
Nice little bar with absolutely friendly staff and a great selection of beers.
Good German food, especially Bavarian food for reasonable prices.
Best south indian restourant ever
Nice food for good prices.

The place is super smokey and the ambience not really nice. BUT they have a really old Kegelbahn from 1904 downstairs, which is just awesome to play on. For this you need to make a reservation though!
All those that love a good steak and good wine will love this place

After spending 5 months in Italy, it was relieving to find such a delicious pizza in Berlin. Fresh ingredients, yummy thin crust and an authentic pizzaiolo! If you're up for dessert, you'll be able to enjoy an authentic Italian tiramisu that will surely make you fall in love with 'A Magica. It is a small place, so if you're not comfortable in crowded environments, I'd suggest you to order your pizza to go.
Very small place, be prepared to share you table, but the food was delicious and the staff was friendly and very efficient.
The very Italian pizza in Berlin! The pizzeria is small and loud, but it's worth. Don't miss it if you love pizza...
Laundromat / Cafe on the very pretty Paul Robeson stressed. Sit outside with a book or magazine what you waiting for your laundry to be done...
Good atmosphere, good service, good food. Details are done right.

Waiter we had was extremely helpful, translating the whole specials menu into English for us. Food was very tasty and fresh and the wine was excellent. The schnitzels are especially good and great value at 9 euros for the "small" serve which was very generous, especially if you have an entree beforehand.
Cool pub, nice location, pretty big, nice staff
Really cool to go with friends. Better only drink beer, there are better placer for food.

Simply great! Food was fantastic and wine also. I checked many sushi places in Berlin and this one is for the time the best one. A bit hard to find because there is no label at all from the street but it's worth to look for it a bit.
Friendly staff and great Japanese food. Try the sushi with tempura.

great food, fair price! Very Fresh and absolutely delicious. I think people turn their noses up as it's a Korean restaurant serving sushi, but it really is top notch, probably the best I've ever tasted to be honest!

If everything goes normal it's a fine place to go. Good sushi and nice traditional teas to choose from. But things have changed. I had not such nice experience during my last visit and I don't think I would go again. First of all, apparently it's not possible anymore to order a pot of tea. I always like the social act of sharing tea with friends instead of everyone having an individual cup with hot fluids. Anyhow, we ordered tea, soup, sushi and when the young clumsy waiter came with the miso, he just threw it over my legs. The very next moment I found myself jumping through the restaurant with my legs on fire. Running to the toilet to get rid of the heat and trying clean my soaked clothes. My pants were wet of hot miso soup and my legs were burned. After asking they gave me some ice to cool. Back in the restaurant a new misosoup was waiting. Without spoon. A girl took over the boys duty. Not asking if everything was fine. We ate, we drink, we ordered extra. We had a fine dinner, but with a dent of course. The bill was hand out by the boy and said full price! We even had to pay for the miso! Not very courteous. I travelled half hour for a nice night out, we could have gone to a sushi in our neighborhood, but we had good experiences and expectations of Omoni. Instead I went home with a wet trousers smelling like miso and the nasty feeling being treated unfair. one tip for Omoni: don't serve your soup in plastic bowls but treat them like your tea, in heavy ceramic cups.

In 1 word: Discusting! Probably my worst fastfood experience. Cold, uncooked fries. Chicken McNuggets reak and taste like old oil used to cook fish too many times. Service: simply horrible. Your best choice there: grab a coffee and run.

Sehr zu empfehlen und authentisch! Das Grüne Currygericht mit Tofu, rotes Currygericht mit Hähnchen und die gebratenen Nudeln mit Hähnchen waren alle sehr lecker und mit viel frischen, knackigen Gemüse. Auch die gebratenen Bananen mit Honig und Mango-Lassi waren sehr lecker. Die Bedienung war sehr freundlich und schnell. Die Preise sind auch sehr moderat. The green curry with Tofu, red curry with chicken and fried noodles with chicken were delicious and made with plenty of fresh vegetables cooked "al dente". The fried bananas with honey and mango lassi were also delicious. The waiter was very friendly and the food was cooked quickly. Very reasonable prices.
Great coffee. Great frozen yogurt. Lovely ambiance. Nice Italian owners...
Very cozy and amazingly nice service! Well worth a visit!
The best yogurt in berlin :)
Best cappuccino I have had in Berlin.

It's a very nice cafe with a daily menu for lunch and very delicious breakfast offers. You can go there all day but it tends to be crowded on the weekends and summer evenings. The service is very nice and they offer a free Wifi for customers.
Excellent atmosphere, very tasty coffee (specially their coffee elf) ..it gives u the feeling of the '60s

Elf is a cafe which attracts local hipsters but since the neighborhood is not completely overrun by them yet it's also a nice spot for "normal" people. I have had a great müsli here and the cakes are amazing.
Free wifi if you ask!

Many people say the place is not pretentious, but the waiter in fact it is. It is not nice to pay 3 euros for a pippermint tee in a dirty place where the waiter treats you like a s**t... Do not forget to use the "Zauberwort (Magical Word) to treat your "stateliness"... No, if you are thinking of "Hocus Pocus" you are wrong.
By far my favourite bar in Prenzlauerberg!!!!!! Good food, big chill area downstair and the bartender are top!!!!

a nice, not to pretentious "kiezkantine/kneipe" (i guess). Nice waiters, everything 's pretty easygoing. The only thing is that the space itself sounds a little hollow - which is somehow part of its charme.
Super easy going place, great coffee an giant caiparinias. Reccomended.
Great Frozen Yoghurt. Good Soups. Bad imitation 'bubble-tea'

Great simple food accompanies the best italian style espresso and cappuccino i've had in Berlin. This place is really nice and offers free Wi-Fi too! It is even possible to have a chat about coffee-making and Latte Art with the friendly barista - Absolutly worth checking out, especcially for coffee-lovers!!!

Best coffee. This coffeeshop is delightful and a wonderful place to enjoy it. A great location! I still love curling up on the couch with a book or journal and my coffee. This is the place to be. If you' re looking for a cappuccino like the one you had in Italy... you've found the place. Surprisingly nice atmosphere.
Really nice café with a wonderful atmosphere.

A large variety of vietnamese food. Phohs, soups, buns (noodles), grilled meats and tofu, glass noodle soups and courses, and rice courses based on green or red curries v, peanut, mango, or lemongrass sauces. Check out the cool drinks imported from asia as well. Food is very moderately priced - probably the most bang for your euros you care for tasty wholesome food. It's is vegan-friendly as well. There's an English menu, but the local host did not speak a word in English, so you will need help from some of the local in if you speak German.
Pleasant little créperie that is easy to miss. Tasteful interior, high quality crepes, and it looks like a passion venture, which is always nice.
Very good food served fast for a reasonable price. Lots of vegetarian dishes. Only a tiny selection of desserts. Food varies considerably in hotness, be careful! ;)
Excellent Indian food, very friendly service. My favorite restaurant in Berlin.
This is a really wonderful place to experience quality cuisine inspired by the traditional German kitchen. Had a dish, inspired by "Labskaus" that was unexpectedly creative creation of the cook.

I've been there Yesterday and I can only say positive things about the place. The dumplings are hand made and great in taste. You can feel that everything is freshly prepared. The prices are also not so high if you take into account the amount of food you get! 4 stars instead of 5 because I felt a bit squizzed inside (tables are really close to each other) and also we didn't get the food at the same time so when everybody finally got their dumplings, the first person was eating cold stuff. In general: VEEERY GOOD!

Too many Krauts in Berlin are confused by what 'Chinese' food is- the Thai/Viet influence here makes them think that what is essentially 'asian' food should be the same etc. Anyway, come here for the dumplings and specialty dishes - no rice with meat and veg. The dumplings are all hand made and taste just like my mum used to make them. This is a family run business, so if the service isn't 5 star, then you've got you're head in the wrong spot.
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in Berlin. Service isn't always the best, but authentic and delicious food. Berlin needs more places like this.
Some of the best service I've had in a while. Extremely polite and friendly, Italian charme. Delicious Buscetta.
Bad music, average food, unpredictable wine.

The food was excellent and a great value price, will definitely visit here again. Finest meats and salads and for half the price you would pay in the centre of Berlin. Wish we had found this on the first night there.
Super Shisha und geile Location
Perfect on walking distance from Spandauerdamm en close from my house. Friendly people and only cash payments,and no food,other side of the street good Italian too

The pizza was pretty gross. The cheese had a questionable texture, and it tasted a little like dirt (perhaps from low quality dried herbs). They also didn't bother to cut the pizza into slices. The tiramisu was surprisingly decent and is the only reason I didn't give this place just 1 star.
It's a fast place to get a varied meal, but too much salt, etc to make the food seem "good". Then the portions seem to vary from day to day somehow.

I was working with these guys for 5 months. Every week i would order something, and they would always add something extra to the order that I didn't order. EVERY WEEK. Then at the end, they overstated what I owed them by 100 euros +, which was hard to prove otherwise, because they kept some of the receipts which stated that I DID pay it. Okay, stupid on my part, but still: Couldn't I at least count on some honesty? I beg anyone out there, please, please, please do not do business with this company. I felt very ripped off from beginning to the end.
This is one of my favorite places in Berlin! They probably have the best Schnitzel Wiener Art with the best Kartoffeln Salat.... Dont forget to drink a big glass of beer with it!!
You're not exactly spoilt for choice in this area, but the food is pretty good and the staff are friendly. Definitely the place to go in this area.

My personal favourite place for breakfast or brunch with visiting friends and family, or just to sit and read or write in. Try the weekly specials, they are usually better than the (also good) standard menu. If you're going on the weekend, make sure to reserve a table!
good prices, good food, friendly staff, good atmosphere... interesting deco :)
I liked the wide choice and late kitchen, weekly menu, bar, and a smoking room. Recommanded.
Great food and service. A la carte brunch and close to Hotel Moa.
High prices, average food.
Big portions, small prices. Great beer selection on draught. Place is very nice looking and staff helpful. Unfortunately there is a smell of smoke a they have a smoking section (behind glass).

some of their prices dont make sense.. €4,20 for a glass of juice (not fresh)... after contacting lichtblick's management with constructive critisism i was told "if you dont like it, dont come back" thats all i can say for customer service! i hope after this review, lichtblick team can take customer feedback more eligantly and constructively...
Very friendly, Good Food!

Great food in big ammounts! A lot of locals are coming which is the best advertisement for the place. Sometimes have to wait a while for ordering and new people could be confused by the way the ordering works. It's a bit chaotic.
Good grilled lamb, felafel, schwarma.
Lovely. Just as it is supposed to be. =)
love it! great food, great people! I especially recommend: the greeks from Anemone, the bread from the bakeries, the italian prosciutto from the italian place, the local brewery!
Nice and sleazy - Berlin at it's best.
Amazing beer - the best in Berlin at any price. The only thing wrong with this place is that it seems to have erratic opening hours.
This is not a cafe. Supermarket only, you can get coffee but you better take some boiling water with you. (Oh, and a chair!)
great place with an old rock (not only) mood of 80'th music. Good people inside (3 times they was young and friendly :).
Berlin atmosphere, nice, cheap, friendly.
They have traditional "harina pan". Venezuelan "must" for breakfast!. Besides... Clean supermarket friendly staff!
Best restaurant in Berlin, freshest food imaginable, awesome service and great prices for an all-you-can-eat. A must if you are in the area.
The best entrecote steak and perfect service! Order at least 400g if you consider yourself a real beef lover
Great food, good service, and good value. house brewed beer was delicious. Overall highly recommended
Cosy restaurant near Charlottenburg Schloss. Food was simple an good, if a little pricey. Beer was excellent. I would visit again just for the beer. Visited November 2012.
Good food, warm welcome.
Fantastic food and great waiters.

Very friendly, good service. My wife and I were shown to a table straightaway - as it was a busy time of day we had to share with others, but the company was very friendly and we had a good conversation with a couple of locals. The beer was excellent with a good variety. The food was simple, tasty and substantial - if you don't like pork, don't eat here! By English standards, the beer was expensive and the food was cheap - I don't know if this is typical as it was my first visit to Berlin - but overall I would say it was good value.

An amazing restaurant. True Italian food and atmosphere. All the waiters were very very nice, food was delicious and the price was also really good. I would recommend this place to anyone that likes Italian food with no hesitation.

This is a really excellent choice in Berlin. They work with a fantastic way of presenting the food choices and using fresh ingredients. The result is very delicious italian food. I am surely going back.
Very nice, clean and friendly place. When it comes to food, it is really outstanding. Big portions, tasty meals and cosy interior makes this restaurant a real gem.
Bio at its best!

A good neighborhood Italian place. I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to come here from another part of Berlin to eat here, but I am glad that it is where it is. We had bruschetta, pizza, and spaghetti; all were good.
Excellent Italian food!
I will try at next trip to Berlin
Excellent beer with friendly service. Cheap and most importantly for me a smoking pub!
Excellent shop, superb service! Ask Boris for a "Bier-Empfehlung" Hofmühl Helles = #1
When the food has just been cooked/served, its wonderful! Some of the 'all you can eat' dishes look like theyve been there for a while though...
The simplicity of the food, and the quality of the food for a '' buffet '' are excellent.
a litte far off is this gem of an indian restaurant, featuring a bar/lounge area and ample outside seating. well worth the trip to westend.

Excellent Indian recipes. The quality is excellent and very consistent. We go twice a week and never grow tired. The service is the best. The India Spiced Rum is delicious. Their wine selection is perfect for pairing with their foods. Fresh and delicious!!

was delicious and the price was also really good. I would recommend this place to anyone that likes Italian food with no hesitation. An amazing restaurant. True Italian food and atmosphere. All the waiters were very very nice, food

The best Lasagne in the world! We returned to Berlin after 21 years and can honestly say that the food here, is as good (if not better) than I remember from all those years ago. We found it to be very inexpensive, it cost more for two currywursts with pommes at an Imbiss in the centre of the city, than it did for two courses for two with drinks here! The very friendly staff speak excellent English, although I did try my best to remember my German! I have tried many other Italian restaurants in the hope of finding the 'one' which equals adelino, and in 21 years, I have been unsuccessful. Well done Adelino, you are the best.
Great atmosphere, quiet and nice, good food.
Coole bedienung hotbaby L.....
Very expensive
Prompt, tasty, reasonably priced delivery pizza with online ordering.
Really enjoyed my Brownie and cappuccino. Not the best ive ever had but definitely worth a detour
Very good choice of food, very goo food. We ate Mosaka and Okra, excellent. Good quantity...all excellent!
Good food and wines.
Live music, cool
Enjoyed the food, little inside from the main road but was worth visiting.
Good food needs no introduction.
We've been going here for the last 4 years and we have never been disappointed. Probably the best Indian restaurant in Germany

It was surprising to find an Indian Restaurant in Berlin that was serving such delicious and authentic Indian Cuisines. Ably supported by an excellent and friendly staff , it was worthwhile to sit out in the portico, and enjoy our food amidst the quiet and natural surroundings.

I've eaten at numerous Indian's mainly 'cause I really luv Indian food & I have to say this is by far the BEST. After eating here, you won't want to go to another Indian Restaurant in Berlin again. Try it you won't be disappointed. Absolutely superb, food was great, staffs were fab - very easy going and really pleasant - there when you needed them but not in your face, excellent prices also, great value for money. What you say in German for such case - einfach nur schön!!!
Took a Wiener Schnitzel, as I was encouraged to. Even though I've been let down at many other rest's by this dish, I've no other choice than to set this on the 1st place of those I've ever had.
Good food, good beer, very nice.
food superb -- no beer and schnitzel here.
Outstanding food, excellent and personal service, nice ambiance. It's always precious and good value.

I love Georgian food, and the food here is top notch. The first time I came was with my husband. We had the walnut-paste-filled eggplant, lamb shashlik (shishkabob), and Adjaruli khachapuri (boat-shaped dough filled with Georgian cheese and topped with butter and an egg), accompanied by the house red. It was a fantastic meal. I just returned with a group of 10 people. Although the service at first was a bit confusing (only half of the drink orders were taken at a time), everyone had a lovely evening. This time my husband and I tried a Menü (specifically Menü 1), which was a really nice way to try a variety of Georgian foods, but be warned, it is a lot of food. One of our friends who has always hated eggplant ended up loving the walnut-stuffed eggplant (which comes with each Menü). At one point, they started showing a video of Georgian dancing, which was really quite interesting.
Delicious food for very little money.
Very good. I can only recommend you.

Great value, shame about other customers. The horrible screaming kids of Charlottenberg did not add much to the atmosphere but the coffee and cake were excellent. Stick to Kreuzberg if you have a child allergy like mine.
Permanently closed!
Original taste, good quality and fair prices!
Super Service, Super lecker
coolest whiskey shop in town. best brands, friendly owner, nice collection, great location. check it out!

I visited this nice easy place based on others feedback here, and it was correct. I found the food great and fresh. Prices are reasonable too. The only issue is the language lack as it seems as a family business.
Very delitious and cheap place with huge portions
Much better than anticipated, great starters and very kind staff. Avoid the schnitzel - really boring... :-)
Good Schnitzel, friendly staff, small free beer as welcome drink

Meat and fish are good, cooked and served in generous portions, menu is large and quite diverse. Ambient is nice and people working there are gentle and fast. Only disadvantage are opening hours, bieng 15:00 quite late for Lunch.
This is possibly the best laundromat in the world. I would come back to Berlin just to do my washing here.
Really great and cozy place. Nice people and atmosphere like at home :)

What a launderette ! So beautyfull, charming, exellent service, very nice people there. The Owner is kind of crazy….but sweet and lovely. He loves his maschines. Kompliment. The best launderette I`ve ever seen in my life..Thank you
very comfortable environment, and most importantly we have our clothes cleaned!

Laundrettes seem to be a rarity these days. This place is worth a visit, even if you have a washing machine at home. Very clean well kept place. Stylish decor with tasteful sprinkles of washing related kitsch. Really reasonable prices and you can buy powder there. Have a coffee or beer while you wait. And the service from the boys in charge was immaculate. Very professional. Freddy was lovely. You don't normally expect to enjoy your trip to the laundrette, but I loved my trip to Freddy's. And I finished reading my book, another good reason to go to a laundrette!
I am Persian and I know the good persian food! the place is super, the food is tasty and not so expensive. it has a nice atmosphere and a good service. I Recommend it strongly...

I do not understand the poor reviews. We came with a big group (11 people) based on the recommendation of two Persian colleagues. The food was fantastic and the service friendly and attentive. Sure, you can find cheaper food in Berlin, but it is not an expensive restaurant. The group split two Super gemischter Teller as an appetizer. My husband and I split the Chelo Kabab Hafis and Chelo Khoresh Gheymeh as main dishes. I recommend them all. One of my Persian friends recommended putting a pat of butter inside the rice for the kebab and dusting it with this red powder on the table -- both things really added a nice flavor component. The tea was quite nice. The dugh was interesting, but a little too salty for me.
Good value chinese food and fast, friendly service.

Great! I didn't expect to find such good indian food in Berlin. If you like spicy, ask for the Chicken Chilli "sehr pikant". Very tasty and perfect with a Berliner beer in the sun. Chicken, rice, salad and a large beer for 12, very good value for money.
Great food
Jerk chicken, deep fried plantain, rum punch, excellent! Free WiFi too!
Agree with previous reviews. Been there quite a few times now, and the food is just incredible, the service great. Go and give it a shot, you'll be surprised.
The food here is simply sensational. Attention to detail, wonderful taste & texture. You might have to wait, but it's worth every minute.
Best Indian cuisines you would find in this restaurant. If you are looking for an authentic Indian restaurant in Berlin then Agni is the place to come!!
Great food and service. A little family run gem of a restaurant. They do Indian/Asian fusion food, and it's always great!

LAN, non smoking, nice people, affordable prices, great food and drinks, area for kids to play and loads of books. What more do you want? Unfortunately they started now to prohibit skype calls, even in extremely low voice. I guess they want to make sure you can enjoy your books ...
Great cakes. Great selection of teas. I love the collection of postcard by Michael Sowa.
Loved it! Service is great! Food is great! Wine is awesome! Just go there, eat, drink and talk to the people there :)
Thats a thrilling place for students, really funny to talk to some really "long time students" and enjoy a good and very cheap coffee.

My husband and I stayed in the apartments behind the Giraffe 4 years ago and ate there. We found the food wonderful and the staff including the bartender very accommadating. We recently returned to Berlin on vacation from the San Antonio, TX area and went back to the Giraffe mid September 2013. We found the food and the staff as good as it was 4 years ago. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

A good place to avoid tourists (although ironically I was a tourist myself), Tiergarten Quelle is popular with the locals, and both them and the staff are very friendly and welcoming. Situated in an arch underneath a railway line, this dark and atmospheric pub is a great place to mingle with the locals and enjoy their own beers and schnitzels (of which the portions are huge!). We went on a Sunday evening so expected it to be fairly quiet, but were pleasantly surprised by how lively the place was!
Cheap, delicious, big portions, good atmosphere, excellent climatization. But make an rsv cause is always full.
Really a cool place.

This place serves well-executed traditional German food (slightly more South German in provenance - e.g. Spätzle, Wiener Schnitzel, Kaiserschmarrn) and good beer from a small Berlin brewery. The portions are enormous and extremely good value: a big Wiener Schnitzel costs c. 8 Euro and comes with chips and loads of salad. It isn't soggy or chewy either; this is a good schnitzel! Their version of Kaiserschmarrn, an Austrian dessert a bit like a fluffy pancake. is the best I've had anywhere, full of raisins and almonds and served with hot cherries and cream. One portion of this delicacy costs about EUR 6 and is so big that three people can share it for dessert and not finish it (this has happened to me twice!) I highly recommend this place if you are ever in Berlin - you will not be disappointed!
Great german food, big size portions and good price.

A full service butcher/deli/fishmonger/smokehouse. I was able to preorder a full turkey here for Thanksgiving. This is one of the few places in the city that offers this service. The price per kilo was 7.95€. The innards and neck were removed, which I prefer, but I'm sure that you could order a turkey with those parts if you use them to make gravy, soup, etc. The turkey was also fresh, which made it so much juicier. I'm never going back to frozen turkeys again. I'm definitely planning on returning to try out some of the seafood since the seafood selection in German grocery stores is quite meager.
ohh it was amazing some many flavors gutantagen NOBODY LEAVES REVIEWS ABOUT A BURGIN KING USA USA USA USA USA USA USA

This place offers really great thai food at reasonable prices. Definitely a must-try if you like asian food, even if its interior seems a little bit basic at first - the staff is very nice and helpful!
An okay place at the busy Ernst-Reuter-Platz, pretty much your generic restaurant. I had a schnitzel with fries and the quality wasn't anywhere above fast food.
A good place to eat. :) Not too expensiv.

The delivery guy clearly had some serious personal hygiene issues...it made me wonder about the state of their kitchen! The food looked disgusting and tasted worse, we threw it away. The worst experience in Berlin so far.
I'd probably spend more money in this store if there were people around to help. You're totally on your own. Good example: fourth floor. Try to get some help there. You'll see what I mean.

Have always found it just fine in here. Beers is good, food is good, atmosphere is also top. If you don't like the service you can always go ronnd the corner to La Folie where the service is infinitelty better

First of all let me say: It is Berlin and it is not Berlin's strong point to give service. if you can arrange with this fact then Thomas Eck is just amnazing. Since 2006 I've been eating at least 20 times: Big portions, real, very good German and Berlin food, the Schitzel amazing, Rinderroulade like at my Mom's and amazing dishes. They offer International food too but (like Flammenkuchen) I would suggest to eat Berlin/German food as this is what they do really great.

I agree with what was said about the service, they are a bit slow. But I went there three times with different people from the US and the food is really good. They serve the soups in tiny pots and the Schnitzle is really big and tasty. So in sum it is good
Good prices and tasty food, a lot of vegetarian choices+ a fast service
Good prices, good Food and Fast Service!
Very nice place and owner, defiantly recommend.
Excellent food, truly Italian. Well assorted wine menu. Will definitely go back when I visit Berlin again. If you are looking for low cost pizza, this is not the right place.

Just like it says -- it's an Asian Supermarket. Some fresh vegetables, some fresh prepared items, and a lot of packaged goods like sauces, frozen items, noodles, rice, soft drinks, crackers, candy, cookware, utensils, etc. They have some things here that apparently don't exist at all in normal German supermarkets, like: unusual flavors of instant ramen, decent soy sauce, canned kidney beans without added sugar. A lot of the stuff is imported and not especially cheap, but I go here now and then to stock up on specialty items.
Hard Rocking dishes. I wouldn't go for the regular egg noodles though...seems I've tasted this same premade noodle in 3-4 restaurants in the city and its crap. Trust me, get the flat or rice noodle.

Explicit shop! I love drinking tea, since my wife is around me. She drinks more than 5 cups of tea per day! Drinking tea makes you more motivated, refreshed and I can say that I feel the difference. There is a type of tea for almost every health problem!

My wife and I and her sister and husband had a few nights at the hotel while we explored Berlin. Food was great and the service from a very friendly and helpfull staff was excellent. No complaints at all except for the unusual snow conditions but maybe we will return in summer for a different outlook.
Found by chance, it's certainly the best chinese restaurant in Berlin! Very delicious meals and very nice service.

Persino il caffè vietnamita, a fine pasto è ottimo ! Si cena in due con soli 18,00 euro. La qualità e la freschezza dei prodotti è altissima. Bravi ! Even the Vietnamese espresso coffee at the end of the meal is great! A dinner for two only 18.00 EUR. The quality and freshness of the products is very high. Bravi !!!
This place have good free internet .
Am in cafe au lait right now waiting for a friend and the wi-fi help kill the time nice relaxed atmosphere !
Leckere Cocktails und super Cafe.
There is not much to say about McDonald's. I just happened to have lunch here because I was at MediaMarkt just nearby.
Wow. I did not know that there was a McDonalds in Europe.
Great place for a quick snack or. Baked goods. Self service and. Inexpensive.

This is my favorite Italian Restaurant in Berlin. The service is very personal, friendly, yet efficient. It's owed by a married couple, so there is a family atmosphere. The food is out of this world good. The wine is amazing. Everything on the menu is fantastic. Pasta portions are a bit small, so if you are super hungry, order an extra portion. It's worth every cent. The place even looks cool. It's a tad pricey, but if you want to impress a date or spoil yourself to perfect service and food, go here! LOVE IT!

We came with a large group from TU, and the service was good. The waitstaff was bilingual and able to handle the non-German speakers in the group. The food was also quite good. Unfortunately, I don't remember the name of what I ordered, but it was a shrimp dish with a fantastic sauce. The table shared a few appetizer platters, which I also enjoyed. They served a free round of ouzo at the end. I was pleasantly surprised by the decor of the restaurant.

Admission fees for Berlin lets say almost ok but not really. The wine tasted like vinegar. The space is very limited so you need to be there in time in order to get a seat. The sound-system is perfect. The restrooms are clean. Service was good but prices in comparison to other clubs in Berlin were just too dear for my taste.
One of the best places in Berlin.
Awesome beef, great service, good pana cotta... overall a very positive experience - and pretty cheep too... and did i mention the perfect beef? ;-) Only bad thing was luke-warm vegetables...
Very good food in an open kitchen layout. Young and friendly staff. Great dinner!
Very good food.
All good! Very nice food, very nice atmos :)
Great and affordable sushi. Lovely pho. And super friendly service. Was a joy. I'd go every week if i lived in Berlin
Nice restaurant with good sushi for really nice budget prices. They serve nice and fresh sushi which you can eat inside or on there outside terras on the pavement.
Das Essen ist super sehr freundliche Mitarbeiter, Pho schmeckt so gut!! highly recommended... would like to visit every tiems i am in Berlin, the price is reasonable

The restaurant is well place, nicely decorated and has a nice atmosphere, on arrival we were quickly seated and servered. After a short while our drinks and some bread arrived. 3/4 of an hour later our food arrived. (The food tasted fine, but nothing special.) 1/2 an hour after we finished our food our plates were cleared. 3/4 hour passed with our waiter chatting to friends outside, avoiding serving anyone and every other waiter activly ignore the area of the resteraunt he was due to serve. We finally gave up on the prospect of desert or coffee and got up and got a waiter to get us the bill. What should have been a good dining experience was ruined by appauling service. To top it off, it was expensive. My advice would be to avoid the place, there are plenty of restaurants around with better food and who actually know how to serve thier clients.
Excellent service. I'm a single traveller and they put me at a 5 person table so I don't have to wait. The food was also excellent. Would go back here again.
By far one of the best Chinese restaurants in Berlin and the place where all of my visitors are taken to upon arriving to the city. Killer dim sum.

I think Aroma is one of the best Chinese restaurants in Berlin. Sure it doesn't boast this Western-style smart looking interior, and it may not be among the cheaper ones, but it's definitely a great value restaurant. The food is very good and the service is simply amazing. My wife, who was in several restaurants in Shanghai, said that food is definitely up to the standards she encountered there.
Ich fands Toll .

We staid 2 days in Berlin. First evening we were looking for a place to eat and accidentally ran across this restaurant. Cozy atmosphere, excellent food and affordable prices. Menu: pastas, pizzas, steaks, fish, pastry and of course good wine. The food was as tasty as in good restaurants in Italy. As we noted most of the ingredients were imported from Italy. Second day of our stay we had a lunch in this restaurant. As expected, excellent experience! We would definitely come back during our next stay in Berlin.

Very nice restaurant, stylish look and modern food with a friendly service. I had the mini burger, good size and great taste and presentation. The price was just about the same as the other restaurants around, but it was the only one with the option of a mini burger, which costs half the price! I definitely recommend it and would come back!!
One of the best culinary experiences. The prices weren't low, but they were definitely worth it. :-)
Magnificent. Best drinks ever. Period. Owner is fab an the place feels more Barcelona than Berlin hence the Asian menu.
Love this place's spirit and food, order the spicy soup!
Fantastic thai and cocktails, very good, friendly service and the tastiest white wine i had in Berlin
Nice atmosphere, great staff & really good food at slightly above-average prices. Like!
If they would use more fresh ingredients then I would understand the pricing.

Loved this place. Really nice atmosphere, I had the goose and my friends had the risotto all well received. They have a nice balance between fine dining and German charm. The sancere was also particularly good. Lovely evening.
Very interesting pizzas with decently high enough quality. The large pizzas they bring you make it a reasonable value (or a little pricy, according to Berlin prices).
Very nice place, good pizzas and very big (we're 2 adults and 2 children and 2 pizzas are enough) we like very much!
It was a busy night and they squeezed us in. Food was really good though and good sized portions. Felt like service lacked more because they were busy than anything else.
Just for tourists, did'nt like the food at all.
Nice sushi but the gyoza were overcooked (Deepfried!) and the tempura was lousy and overcooked. A bit disapointing.
Go here for the quality and the value ... best sushi in Europe! (especially for the price)

I went with a friend for lunch. The Sushi Special Lunch is misleading, there is more maki than actual sushi (16 pieces of maki, and 4 pieces of sushi). There is nothing unique about the sushi. The fish was also not fresh, and I felt sick the entire afternoon after eating the food for lunch.
My favorite sushi restaurant. Crunchy sushi is just yummy. Anytime again. Service has never disappointed.
My favourite Chinese restaurant in Berlin. Authentic Cantonese cuisine. Homely atmosphere, most friendly staff, literally family.
Nice food!
Nice food!
Perfekte Sundowner Location dank Kirstin & Jens!
Very nice restaurant. Worth a visit.

We were in Berlin for only 6 nights, yet ate here on 3 of them. The food was excellent on all three ocassions, traditional german food..I know the Germans don't have a reputation for great food, but ignore that and try it! The food is good honest food, yet tasty and filling. Also, their home brew beer is well worth a try. The staff were friendly, helpfull and efficient. The restaurant is traditionally decorated, clean and welcoming. Best of all, it is very good value.
This restaurent is one of the best japanese in the city. Authentic japanese agemono cuisine. This is a must visit, for anyone who wants the taste of japan - a alternative japanese food to sushi.
Poor service & Cold food
Chili wontons are outstanding! For a different good tasting fast food this is the best option!!!!
The best (and only) Taiwanese food in Berlin! What more does one need to know?
Checked out this place in my recent trip to Berlin with mom. This is a typical taiwanese noodle/snack shop, selling noodles mainly. We tried the noodle and the woh tieh. It was really nice.

Super restaurant located on an old freight boat converted to a restaurant with a unique surrounding atmosphere. They even organize boat tours around the canals in berlin on their smaller towboat with live barbequing.
V.good & tasty food. we ordered chicken curry and jeera alo. Rice is served free. Good portion.
The food and service was superb, we got home made Ravioli and Cabonara. Feels and tastes like a nice little restaurant in Rome.
Nice little restaurant with very good food
Go upstairsto find it. Bring or buy your card to pay. It offers something for everybody.

Simple food correctly prepared. I've come here for brunch, breakfast, and to buy bread from the bakery. The bread is simply fantastic. The side salads are the best I've had in Berlin. The British sodas are quite nice, particularly the rose lemonade. The Brotzeit Platte only contains high quality meats and cheeses from around Europe -- from Leberkäse to Manchego & Chorizo to Fiegensenf & Camembert and more. Note that the menu is larger that what is written on the board -- ask for a full menu. Also the prices are a bit steep for Berlin. For example, the Brotzeit Platte für Zwei, a coffee, and a cappuccino costs about 26€. Update: I just purchased a Mohn Schnecke (poppy roll) that was incredibly chewy. It was hard to eat without any water to drink. For 2,50€, the pastry should be perfect. Because of this experience, I had to lower my rating.

I am surprised to see that the rating is a bit low. I thought that this was an awesome cafe in terms of the food, price, service, and quality. I was worried that I would be restricted in my choices since I am a vegetarian, but there was plenty for me to choose from and it was great. The group I went with (non vegetetarians) also raved about their food. I might go as far as saying this was my favorite place to eat during my stay in Berlin. The food is fresh & delicious, the prices low, and the ambiance fantastic. What else can you ask for?
Lovely soup. Good beer. Nice atmosphere.
Good atmosphere on a nice day.
Nice beer garden next to a watergate within the Tiergarten. Good - but somewhat expensive - food. Reasonable Beer prices. Self Service.
A great Biergarten to spend a lazy summer afternoon.
Really enjoyed the chips. Friendly service. Next time in Berlin, will make a point to go there again.

The dosas were a little bit too thick for my liking and there was no chutney to go with it, the shredded coconut provided instead of a chutney was not bad but it still does not make up for the absense of the chutney. Amon the sweet dishes we tries gulab jamun and barfi. The gulab jamun was fine but the barfi was different from kaju barfi (it resembled more the barfi for eid, made of dal instead of kaju barfi, word of caution, it is very very heavy on the stomach!)
The dosa was amazingly good at rock-bottom prices. I hope Satyam shows German how good Vegatarian food can be and it become more popular.
Good Indian vegetarian food -- for Berlin. Overall, however, mediocre because the curry itself was thin and just seemed to lack something. Friendly service and inexpensive.

We walked in, no reservation, and were promptl seated. The menu was hand written and hard to read, and in German. The waiter was kind enough to translate it for me. The food was excellent, as was the service. All around us diners were enjoying their meals, and by the time we left the place was full of happy patrons. Definately worth the money. Enjoy!
Very friendly, quick, and helpful service. Food tasted well, hotter options are available. For a dinner-for-two, reserve the cosy table next to the entrance.
Music fits the ambiente and the prices are good.
A Home away from home...

waited for 1 hour to get served and then what we got was wrong order,,,,,and again wait 30 minutes...for what......bad food.....Sour Shahi Paneer and same taste sour Chicken Tikka ......I think they use bad quality tomatoes in their curry....The only difference in two entirely dishes was the presence of meat or cheese. it was terrible experience. ...by the way..Naan is not freshly baked but bought from asian store for cheap price and served as fresh one.... The price was not at all justified with the quality..
Nice food, good service. All in all recomendable.

Really pleasant place. Relatively small, great food and prices are reasonable. Especially if you consider the portion sizes. If you are into Mediterranean food, you can't go wrong here. Mezes are great and my favorite but what is also surprising is the quality of their meat. If you like your meat, try the Mixed Grill.

Lovely Syrian restaurant. Quite possibly the best middle eastern food I've ever had. The Kibbe appetizer was wonderful. Babaghanoush was unlike any I've had before, with a greak smokey flavor and walnuts that added to the taste and texture. Finally, the Maloube was delicious, although the rice was a bit on the uncooked side. The service was quite friendly. Overall, I highly recommend the place.
Nice show restaurant. Lovely interior. Food did not impress or maybe just not to my taste. I prefer another indian restaurant.
Stay away. Cook and waitress equally incompetent.
The were no locals eating there, only american turists. The service was not great. The food was just ok.

Also very happy with the meal, drinks and atmosphere at Franke Brasserie. A large party of us had a great night, food was consistently good and reasonably priced. The cocktail menu is vast with some old school favorites and some unique and creative cocktails. Would recommend a visit when in Berlin

Franke's is best! Denis, why the service was fair, I visit Franke's many times when visiting Berlin and the service was always the very best level. Food is always very good and consistent and the drinks menu is one of the best priced in Berlin. I would highly recommend on Franke Brasserie Bar and Lounge for a relaxing meal, drinks and one of the best atmospheres is Berlin!
Expensive, but ordinary food. Quite a lot of street noise when windows are open during summertime. We were disappointed...

Jacques is a franchise, and both the selection and the service you can expect vary from city to city. I like them because this is a store where you don't feel like some ignorant dweeb among wine snobs - you can sample the wines, ask questions and take your time. This place has a really good selection of European and American wines. Affordable, friendly atmosphere - just perfect. Note they have several subsidiaries in Berlin; I prefer this one.

Glass restaurant offers delicious dishes inspired by the manyfold art forms in the vibrant city of Berlin. Modern cuisine is served here in a tasteful ambiance and with a high level of service. Warmly recommended!

Visiting Glass is like coming to a wonderful performance. Every detail has been taken care of, the service is impeccable, the food is exquisite, and the ambience is fresh and vibrant. The price is significantly lower than what I'd expect from a restaurant of this quality. In short - just go.

Glass Berlin was a total surprise for me! there is not enough words to describe this special experience. although I was never the typical customer for a fine dining meal this was pure ecstasy. The food is forged into a piece of art and tastes even better, the staff is professional and we even got a few visits from the Chef of the restaurant with extra goodies! I recommend this experience if you are in Berlin, Oh and it's not as expensive as I expected...

If you are looking for a place to be served with selfish stupid people you should go to this cafe. I was there today with my friend and I didn't have cash in my wallet! I didn't know that they dont accept the bank cards. so they treated us like we were thieves! OMG! the most terrible people that I have ever seen!

If you're near Savignyplatz or Zoologischer garden, be sure to check out this small but amazing restaurant/cafe. The food is truly amazing and the selections are endless. I highly recommend having breakfast here, I love the scrambled eggs combo with the freshly squeezed OJ. Want a snack? The mozzarella and tomato salad was amazing, and their humus appetizer is light and delicious. Their latte's and espressos are very well made, and the staff was always there to help me decipher the german menu (into english). My only regret is that I never went there for dinner. The look of the place from the outside makes it seem like a bar, and the inside isn't very flattering either, yet the the food and service make up for these in the end. A hidden gem of the city.
Good food and drinks. Nice atmosphere. A lot of students around here.
I love this place! Excellent food and sevice! :)

Another old mansion turned into a funky cafe. Seems small from the outside but opens up upstairs. Excellent food, although the atmosphere is run-down student-hall chic. Would be at home in Brick Lane, East Village or Newtown.
French-styled café and restaurant near Savigny platz. Perfect breakfast place, but be prepared for not so cheap prices (compared to average Berlin prices)
The decor is all that remained. The restaurant must have changed its owner. The food has become inedible. It has nothing to do with a French restaurant.
High prices but good food. In the evening very crowdy.
It is nice inside and good food quality but quite not so calm! Specially because of these danish ladies in near table :D

Best Spanish food we've had in Berlin! Very nice atmosphere! Good prices! We go there regularly. Yes, it is true that you cannot order "Leitungswasser" (tap water), we thought this was strange at the beginning as well, and they should definitely change that, but appart from that, everything is really good. Great choice of wines (order the "Fontal"!!!). We never experienced that service was bad. However, they are always pretty busy in the evenings, especially on the weekends (reservation is recommended!), and it sometimes takes up to ~15 minutes until you can order and up to ~20 minutes until the drinks and first appetizers arrive, thus if after being seated you expect to get out of this place again as soon as possible, you should definitely not go there! It's a great place for a relaxing evening!

I have given it 3 chances. The selection is large, but very bland, never hot when it's supposed to be. But above all the service all 3 times was horrible. I asked for a glass of water, while I was paying the too pricey check, and was insulted by not only the wiatress, but the manager as well. As long as you buy the most expensive wine in the house, they will take that order with a smile. 3 Strikes! And the food is really not good.
We were there for lunch and enjoyed. Dale and I both had moulles and french fries. Wonderful, not busy, relaxed.
Very nice pub. Good food and lovely beer. Very busy so book ahead
Very good value for money, exceptional food quality (and quantity!), excellent service, great atmosphere. An almost must - do when in Berlin!
Top food, great price, great atmosphere (especially the three piece band that busked for 15 minutes in the bar) lots of happy faces. What else can you ask for? Really enjoyed it.
Very tasty food and a proper plate size of food!

I have been going here to unwind on business trips since 1991. Since about 1993 I have made it a point to stay in a hotel nearby so I can walk here and back easily late at night. The food is good and reasonable. There is always something going on or people from all over to talk to. It is a real neighborhood pub in every sense of the word. I once took my friend Harry from Philly there and he said that apart from the language, it was just like the the haunts where he grew up. The clientele is a mix of travelers, students, neighborhood people and real Berliners. If you want a piece of the real Berlin, this is it.

The food was tasty, but the place is very small and tables are very close to each other. Beverages are very exepensive and the price for service (2 euro per person) is included in the bill. It is not a place for rexaling, just eat and leave! I wont go back there.
Classic "local" bar, expect .3L glasses of Pils, schnaps and older folks around you enjoying their day.

While one commenter had a bad experience, the place is consistently good, and more than anything else UNIQUE. It's a neighborhood tavern in a neighborhood that is beautiful and unique, and captures beautifully each of the decades that it has inhabited. The senior bartender is just about the nicest man you will ever meet in your life. While the menu is small, it is done very well, and quite honestly, remains true to it's Berliner roots in a way that is almost impossible to experience any more. I can't say enough good stuff about the place. Oh, and by the way, Frank Zappa used to hang out there. I would suspect that it's for a couple of reasons, including likemindedness with the artful and social-thinking clientele, and the fact that people would ignore his celebrity and cult status.

The worst place I have visited in Berlin by a long, long way. Food was cooked in a microwave and served cold and tasteless. The staff were rude and unfriendly. Do not go here there are plenty of other reasonably priced cafe's and restaurants around the square that offer better service and food.
What's not to love?

When I packed my carry on for Germany it was filled with elastic waist skirts and some leggings. I figured the meat, potatoes, and beer would leave me sleepy, happy, and desiring some unrestricted clothing articles. While planning dinner my travel mate sent me the sushi emoji-- I hadn't had sushi in a long time. Why not? Visiting a landlocked country didn't promise much for incredible seafood, but Sachiko Sushi is hands down the best sushi I've ever had. This is coming from a New Yorker. The fish was so incredibly fresh and the flavors really innovative. The male chef we had was efficient, working to keep a full bar of diners happy. The rotating sushi bar effect is kitschy with little floating boats in a rotating moat. I wish I could visit this restaurant again. For out-of-towners there was an English speaking waitress and free wifi!
Good sushi, nice personnel. A good place to go eating sushi.
Have the Hot Sake, stunning!
Just food. Service ok.
Good food, nice service and good location.

I went to this place in February when it was -15 just looking for somewhere affordable and warm! I was greeted by a friendly mai‧tre d' given a seat near a welcoming fireplace and a menu in several languages (which really helps when you don't speak the language!) I found it to be well priced and varied enough for what I wanted. it was a while ago but I think there was a set menu or menu of the day as well as an a la carte'. The place is genuinely run by Italians so the food was good and authentic, the staff served me very well and spoke to me in English, Overall I enjoyed my visit here very much and would definitely go back when I'm in Berlin again

Horrible pastas combined with unpersonal service makes this a place not worth visiting. So was ist los? The carborana is the worst I ever tasted in my whole life. Cheap bad quality bacon and cheese, disgusting. My partner had a an arrabattia with the only taste being the hot spices which ruined the rest of any flavours that could have been in there. It was eating pure peppers, such a waste of what could have been a great dish. When they noticed I did not finished my plate one of them came hanging over it and starting do some strange hand gesture and asked me what is wrong. I told him it did not taste good and he just me told the food is not meant for me and I should leave. Worst service ever. Avoid this place at all times.

So we come into La Piazza, and it looks great, you get the italian feel of it all, even though ur in the middle of Berlin. La Piazza combines great service with good food, and full specked menu that dosent disappoint. What ever you like, or prefer, you will find something for you. So relax, take a beer, or wine! Pick the food of your choice and wait e merely 10-15 minutes for it to be served. How much is this gonna set you back? Not much at all. Suprisingly its affordable for most, 2 meals and 2 beers for only 42Euros. Thats not to bad is it? So stop searching for places to eat, cause uve just found it.
A bit slow service, but good service. Pizza was excelent! Perfect thicknes, great taste and good size!! Will go back

I'm from Belgium, and Vietnamese/Thai kitchen is something very popular in Brussels. I live there and I know a lot about these kind of kitchens. Mr. Hai and friends is a wonderful Vietnamese restaurant, very nicely decorated, a very trendy look and excellent food. They are very fast, but it doesn't feel like they want to get you out of the restaurant as fast as possible. They are very correct with there timings. You can see straight through the kitchen as it is a glass 'box' where they cook. Maybe one remark I can make is that we were eating our main course and our wine, which we ordered wasn't there yet, but they gave it afterwards, they weren't forgot. But they didn't assume we wanted it during our meal. But no problem was made and we enjoyed everything. As a last positive point: it's not too expensive. I have paid 95 euros for 3 persons, we had 1 fruit Daiqiri (cocktail) and 2 mojito's. 3 times summer rolls as a starter, 3 times beef with curry and cocomilk and rice, 3 glasses of wine and a bottle of San Pellegrino. So this was a very nice price for all the things we enjoyed. I hope this was helpful and I really recommend this Vietnamese pearl in Berlin!
Best food ive tasted, ever! If im ever going to Berlin again, im going to Mr. Hai & Friends. Excellent service, you get the food fast!
Also includes excellent choice of vegetarian dishes. Food is prepared and cooked in visible kitchen.
No wifi, helpful staff
Nice bar. Setup for cocktails. A bit quiet when I was there but it's been busy when I've passed.
Nice bar. Pretty busy. Smoking allowed at the bar area

I arrived in Berlin on a lousy monday evening and all I needed was a stiff drink. As I stumbled into Gainsbourg, the joint was packed. Before I found my place at the very end of the bar I also stumbled over a novelist fighting his incognito with a little lady and a big cigar. I always thought he's gay, but in this city you never know. People call themselves Max in the morning and end up as Madeleine at night, or vice versa. My first drink was a vodka martini with olives. I didn't had anything to eat the whole day, and you know, it's very bad to pour c2h5oh in an empty stomack, so I eat the olives first! The Gainsbourg has a french background and subtitles itself " bar americain". So the barchef suggested a Manhattan. There it was again, with my first sip I smelled the steaming asphalt of 5th Avenue after a summershower, the heavy perfume of an imported russian demimondain, hastyly smoked cigarettes... I could even hear the sirens of the Staten Island Ferry. A prefect drink. Before I could realise that the boat isn't going today, because of big waves, suddenly this woman appeared next to me...Let's swing over to Long Island now. Many Bartenders, mixologists, say Long Island Ice(d) Tea is not a real drink, it's just a concoction out of a promiscuous compilation of second class alcohols. That might be true, but if the bartender finds the right composition of rum, gin, vodka, tequila, lemon juice and coke, this knock out drink will look and taste as virgin as a cup of tea in Prince Faisals reception Hall. ( Don't try to find out what's in HIS tea!) The guy behind the bar realised exactly what I needed. Two innocent looking ice teas. Her name was Karin, very tall, even taller than me, with a very distinct political view, and the formula to stop all wars and myseries on this planet, and she was gorgeous... ( listen son, when you want to impress a woman, you have two options: If she's beautiful, admire her intelligence, if she's ugly, praise her beauty) and her lips were leaving sentences like: "In the west we live in a Socialism Of The Few. While some of the biggest companies do not pay one single cent taxes, they are subsidized with the money of millions of tax-payers... we need a revolution," "Tonight!?" I asked. Green eyes, red lips, high cheeks,long blond hair, and when she came back from the powderroom she had renewed her lipstick. - I was trapped. This temptation I couldn't resist, and after our third cup I invited her to take the Staten Island ferry all the way from Savignyplatz to my private Statue Of Freedom, big waves or not. ......... After she dressed I had to drive her back to the bar. She is hard to forget.
Worth the trouble to find this place. Under the railroad tracks so turn into the arched entry way (looks like a back ally) just after/before you go under the tracks.

Nice artistic atmosphere, tasty beer and interesting Greek cuisine. There is a separate room with a stage and seats for the public and the regular concerts there. The place has kind of a character and you feel that it was there for ages...

Not bad for a franchise place - not bad at all. It's actually a franchise with a perfect fit for west-Berlin coolish with a slight are of art-school-grad pretention, but not enough to provoke a mass shooting. This coffee shop is really well situated, has good coffee, and is actually a nice small room to loiter in on a Sunday with the papers. Big windows from which to watch the world go by, and outdoor seating.

Best Food in Town: If you were blind-folded and brought to Tastees the Vibes and the Jamaican Soul Food, would make you believe you were on the actual Caribbean island of Jamaica. I have been to Berlin on many occasions and would normally dine at other local eateries. But when I stumbled into this dream dinner, I had dinner here every day. The curry shrimps with coconut sauce is a must have, did I mention the Jerk chicken is out of this world. Moreover, when you talk to the owner Chris, you don't have a choice but to come back over and over again; he is just a hard working down to earth young man, who enjoys making his customers feel at home.
Poor service on two separate ocassions. Unmotivated staff, though the food was tasty.
Nice cafee house, but the underground jazz club is the real attraction.
We visted Berlin in a 30+ degree period. Therefore the terrace of Q was a good place for an evening drink. Good service.
One of my favourite place in BErlin

Rude and ruined my part of my holiday! Very disappointed in this restaurant, we had wondered round the area on our first day there which was close to our hotel looking for somewhere to eat, we thought it looked like a nice quiet traditional German restaurant. When we got in and ordered drinks I ordered a water and my father ordered a Coke Cola as he is tea total he was completely ignored and wasn't provided with a drink or told that they don't sell Coke Cola or offer an alternative which I would have expected from any place with good service, but we let it go as it had been a long day and we just wanted to eat and head back to the hotel. I ordered the Boiled Beef and apple horseradish, what I didn't order however was the cup of water that the beef was boiled in on my plate and the bout of food poisoning I got that night, it was so bad I couldn't leave the hotel the next day so out of a four day holiday we only got three, I was feeling better the day after but still not at my best. I am not one to get ill from food often so it surprised me that something I've had before beef, horseradish, veg and garlic made me ill, I can only assume it was the way it was prepared! safe to say we didn't go back again and if we ever return to Germany we definitely wont!
Fantastic Austrian food and great selection of Austrian wines.
Excellent Food. Great Flavor, traditional.
If you like an ant-hill and to sit on your neighbours lap, you have to go there! We canceled our reservation!
Great view and friendly service.
The cakes and sweets at Kranzler surely need to be improved because now the high prices are not adequate. However the service is at a pretty good level and very professional.
Too expensive and doesn't worth the price. Good cafe but the cakes are not so much

Me (25) and my girlfriend stayed in Berlin for a week. We wanted to go to a Thermen and read the bad feedback on this one. But because there were no alternatives close-by we still went here.. It was a very good experience! Very nice restaurant en swimming area which are extra nice to look at when the it turns dark and the little lights go on. We tried 6 different sauna's and small baths and the large Thermal bad. I liked how one of the warm smaller baths was really warm. The food was cheap and very good, I believe it was a total of around 17 euro for the main meal with several drinks. The main bad is not very large but I experienced it as large enough and enjoyed the possibility to look into the city from the pool which goes around outside ( This Thermen is located high in a large building). All together I would recommend this to other people that visit Berlin for a longer time and seek some relaxation after sightseeing.

Das Personal ist unhöflich und sehr freh! Der Preis ist nicht so klein, dass die Thermen so schlimmer Service anbieten sollen. Absolutely bad place for international visitors also. I would name several reasons for this: no privacy (video surveillance), ridiculous rules (it is prohibited to wear swimming trunks and suits, though men and women should visit together), other visitors kissing naked in the public pool and feel up each other (this seems ok for local personnel), and absolutely impolite personnel (nothing to say they don't speak English, though its a touristic center still and advertisement prospects are also in English).
Nice location with good view over the city. Interior deco not very exciting and IMHO poor soundsystem. Had a good night but was expecting more.

Everything was great , the service, the food is really good, and the prices are OK, if you can ask for a waiter called Alili. This guy is a G-R-E-A-T waiter. speaks 6-7 languages and knows the value of good service. dont forget to TIP him...

Went here for a drink and bar staff tried to rip us off. I ordered a larger and a vodka and coke, what I got was a radler and a glass of coke. When I questioned it they agreed but I could see them laugh as the exchanged the drinks. Don't go there.

Its a fantastic warm place to be and feel comfortable. The selection of draught beers is more that u can expect and the barkeeper is your friend and a nice bird :-) The saloon is designed with love and spirit. German Football can be watched in nearly every direction you are able to look - there is no better place in Prenzlberg!

Very very average and not even in the upper half of that. Greasy tables, simply wiped off with a moist cloth, but not cleaned! We checked a whole lot of cutelry and guess what? Apart from one fork and two knifes we found dirt and rests of food on every part. The place itself is designed to serve as many people as possible what makes the quality of food not the priority of this place. And that you can taste! When the place is full, it clearly is understaffed what makes that people have to wait pretty long before they are being served or they are given the opportunity to pay their bill. It's a fair place to people who don't care about quality or taste, but just want to have a quick filling of their stomach.

The food was fair. We haven't eaten Thai in Berlin so we don't know how it compares but we were hoping for better. We hope to try some of the other Thai restaurants further from Ku'damm next time we're in Berlin.
Great place! Good food for good money. Thank you and hope to visit once more!
They have never been in thailand, or had Thai food in their life. If you like thai food don't visit this place. The worst orange juice ever
Absolutely fantastic food, service, atmosphere, and drink.
one of the worst sushi places in Berlin, pricey and fish tasted like it was cooked the previous day. stay away !!

I do not recommend, food is slitly better than a fast food, but the worst part is the service. 5 out of 7 people served and the other 2 waited for more than 30 minutes, they got their food after we finished. we had to ask for silverware after the food was served, we had to ask for the rest of the beverage twice. ...and the service was based on angry and rude girls. bye bye Berlin

I do not recommend, food is slitly better than a fast food, but the worst part is the service. 5 out of 7 people served and the other 2 waited for more than 30 minutes, they got their food after we finished. we had to ask for silverware after the food was served, we had to ask for the rest of the beverage twice. ...and the service was based on angry and rude girls. bye bye Berlin
Great service, food and location at a very fair price - like it here
De prime rib was fantastic! Fresh sliced by the chef.
Usually very fresh burgers and also fresh fries. The best McDonald's restaurant in Berlin.
easy order mashine is good for traveler.

OK, but not great. Barely acceptable pizza (ordered one with mushrooms, saw those mushrooms on the pie, were unable to taste them) - but large enough for two moderate appetites, terrible house Valpolicella, standard service.
