The food and service was very good. Try the steamed mix of dumplings.
One of the few Chinese restaurants doing fried tofu. Really special!
Raw meat, awful food, tasteless. Absolutely bad place. Worse chinese food ever!
Good basic food and pretty good value!...
April 30, 2013..Real Japanese... Great suchi...great cooking..highly recommended
Impressive cooking show right infront of you! Really traditional japanese atmosphere and awesome quality of food! Really enjoyed my stay there with my wife - ONE IN A LIFETIME MUST!
Had a nice private party there. Very nice location with good view of the city and cool retro style deco.
Stopped by at 9am on Thursday morning and it was not open. Steel door still pulled down in front. Very disappointed :-(

Being in Berlin for a short city-trip and having eaten enough Schnitzels we went for a restaurant that could offer something different. We found Bavarium at the bottom of the Europa-Center, and went for the two-person grillplate with fries and green beans. The grillplate was huge (at least for our standards) and tasted great, so did the beans which I want to mention because it were some of the best I've ever tasted. The atmosphere, the food and the great service made us decide not to say 'goodbye' at the end of the evening but 'see you tomorrow'. The next day we went again, went for some steaks and had the same experience as the day before, great food and great service. Next time in Berlin this will be our restaurant of choice.
Pizza quality is very low. Thin cake, sigly undercooked. If you have a little more time there is dominos near by.

Absolutly awful: the waitress that served us was very rude and unfriendly; we have been charged more than the price written in a blackboard in front of the restaurant; there is no the possibility to pay with a crediti card; the quality of the food was just decent to call it Italian Restaurant.
Good food... The variety of fried rice is really good.
Excellent self made beer for reasonable prices. A great selection and changing seasonal beers. Self made ciders and liqueurs are offered as well.
This is a local brewery of beer and brandy, they also make excellent fresh apple juice. They have some flatbread pizzas but allow you to bring your own food, which we often do.
Cool!
When we are in Berlin we often go here to eat and have something to drink. The food and service is always a great.

You can find here everything you need, the grocery are the best and Halal meat is offered with different types like for Kabab for example! the only place I found flowered rice! which is my best meal ever! Turkish people are running the place, I don't speak turkey but I found them very nice with customers.
Cheaper meals for students and pupils
Love it here

This was for me, the absolute best dinner i had in Berlin. The restaurant décor is amazing and looks very rich, very welcoming atmosphere. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful and service was spot on. the food tasted amazing, from start to end! well done. A must in Berlin!

The pictures make this place look very sterile but it is not, in person. The food is very good, I recommend the spicy meatballs. While the grilled peppers still have their seeds and are inedible for all but the capsaicin lover, overall the dish is very good and I would order it again. The service is very prompt and polite and street foot traffic at dinner time is light, making the patio, quiet and more intimate than most.

What a find! This little restaurant is such a charming place. I'm so glad I found it because there aren't a ton of restaurant options in Moabit. This is the kind of restaurant where they make you feel like you're visiting their home, and that only comes from a passionate owner and operator who conveys that passion to their staff so the love of what they do reverberates throughout. The decor is rustic and homey. Not your typical hip Berlin scene, but I think it works here. The first time I came here with my girlfriend she asked for a glass of tap water, not realizing that water isn't usually free in Germany. But they were more than happy to oblige. Later in the evening the owner came over and chatted with us (me rather, because the conversation was in German). What a character! Soon after I moved away and it was a year before I came back, but they remembered me! I think it was probably by chance, but I was touched none the less. I might also mention that the food was fantastic. Seasonal and fresh with notes on the menu written by hand, adding to the homey eccentric atmosphere. Not exactly the kind of restaurant where it's so fresh you walk in and just eat whatever they've made for the day, but a bit of that kind of feel, you know? I was torn in grading the prices moderate, as opposed to cheap, and the only reason I did so is because it's more toward moderate for the neighbourhood, which is inexpensive even by Berlin standards. But in any other city this menu would easily be twice as expensive-- no joke. And these are good portion sizes. You can see their menu and prices on their website. If I had a friend or family who was going to be in Moabit I would insist that they not go anywhere else. Check them out.

Total discrimination to us Asian from Singapore and Malaysia. Food was ok only considering the price we paid. Bad service and attitude when the casher with not good tone inform us the total price not include tips. Seem like looking down at us. Juz tips them 2eur. Note we tips other local restaurants with 10eur. Really disappointed of Paulaner standard. Not recommend for any tourist to Germany! !
Nice but I could feel the hectic at the buffet.. ;D

Spent two weeks visiting Berlin, and we stayed a few blocks from Thea & Coffee. We tried coffee shops all over the city, Kreuzberg, Prenzl'berg, Schöneberg, Mitte, and this one was by far the best. Very friendly staff, a nice place to sit for a while, fantastic French press - coffee but most of all extravagantly good espresso, with top-notch foam for their cappuccino and macchiato. Sehr toll!

This lovely, modern cafe creates the perfect environment for reading/studying and enjoying a coffee or meeting up a friend for a quick bite to eat. They have a nice assortment of light and healthy food, and serve exceptional coffee. I can highly recommend this place!
Very nice place, with a lot of nice people!
best karaoke in town!!! i love it!
Very very delicious. I liked it very much. Nice crew.
Delicious food and nice surroundings.

I had telephoned this restaurant to reserve a table for 8 people as you cannot book online for over 6 people. I was told to email the restaurant to confirm reservation which I did immediately following phone call. I didn't receive any confirmation and sent another email to reserve - as i received no response I rang the restaurant again and was ultimately told that they hadn't read my emails until after my most recent phone call and subsequently they didn't have any tables available. Very disappointed with attitude and treatment by this alleged excellent restaurant

Wow, this was one of the most creative meals I've ever had. Compares favorably with WD~50 in New York, although the food is not technically molecular gastronomy. I had the "Far Away" menu. Of the 8 dishes, at least 4 blew me away. I don't know how often the menu changes, but if you go soon, I suggest taking the 6-course menu, since it includes the best items, and the 8-course menu was too much food. Make sure you have the Pear Wood & Borgmann Liqueur dish.
Great authentic french food at fair Prices. Highly recommended.
Great food, great service.
Best french restaurant around here.
Swift service by Berlin standards. We didn't have to wait, neither for the appetizers nor for the main course.

After a year of looking for a decent french restaurant in Berlin with an honestly priced set lunch menu, my girlfriend stumbled across this place. Great, friendly service and decent food. The atmosphere really did remove us from the bitter winter outside! Great wine list... Highly recommended!

Great jazz music and atmosphere with a fantastic tap made out of a bari sax. Great acoustics, and when i was there there was no cover charge but they have signs that encourage you to contribute to the band or buy their CD. Decent prices on the bier and wonderful music - what more could you want? Jeff from Ann Arbor

If you like Big Band Jazz, and Jazz Vocals, this is your place. The instructors and student musicians and vocalists all do a fantastic job in great suroundings. They put a lot of work into their arrangements and it really shows. I recommend this 100%. Go and enjoy the music, you will never be disappointed! Gary Kulesus, Berlin
Delicious. There are a lot of choices. You can choose whatever you want. And it tastes fantastic.
Excellent Italian pasta. I had rigatonni with truffles which were really good! Great friendly service.

Great atmosphere and great food at this restaurant that is meant to be the place where Brecht lived when he was in Berlin. Not so expensive and very good food make this place a great place to go in Berlin. Reservation Needed
Nice atmosphere. Food was good. Friendly staff

Stayed at hotel nearby and for the first two nights we didn't eat at Old Shangai because we never saw any customers in it which we thought was strange. We decided to try Old Shangai on our last night in Berlin and what a very pleasant surprise! It was one of the best Chinese meals we have ever eaten! A big thumbs up to Old Shangai.

I just tried the Old Shanghai restaurant I thought it was good. The food wasn't bad but I didn't finish my food. One person with three dishes an appetizer and a shot of some Chinese liquor that I have no idea the name of offered to me, hard to eat all of it. Good spot try it out
Free wi-fi but there are no tables and seats, you have to seat on the floor or stand nearby using wi-fi)
Great coffee as always, but you can't sit down anywhere (or use the "Free WiFi"). No tables, no chairs. Just a small selling point.
Excellent food, at least everything we had. The beef was just delicious. Prices are higher than average for Berlin but definitely worth the splurge.
Ok food but doesn't live up to the decor or the price. I also found a hair in the food, and the waitress was unapologetic.
Excellent food in a really nice setting ! Can only recommend the pan fried dumplings Hong Kong style...delicious!

I've been here several times for lunch and have really enjoyed the focaccia. An Italian colleague introduced me to this place and he says the food tastes very authentic. There's not much seating space inside, but they have outside seating for nice days as well. Espresso is also very good.
Looks more like a Tea Room than a Coffee, nice cakes, very good sandwiches.
Good coffee. Good service. Half hour free wifi.

Simply the best croissants (and pastries in general) in Berlin (and in the world?). As a born Parisian I've never tasted anything that good, even in France! And contrary to what other people say, people working there are nice and chilled. You shouldnt go anywhere else for a french breakfast!
Nice baguettes and pastries
It was a bad experience or bad luck, the food share only the name of the meal with reality it was totally something else. The workers are not experienced and the food looks and taste below average.
Suprisingly the best Indian we've had in Berlin yet (out of about five). Looks like a very average place, but the food really is good.
Very good food and price. With 6 euros you can have a great lunch :)
cool place and attitude of the staff, and the bbq ribs were OK - not as good as expected as for my taste the sauce was not strong / spicy enough, but overall a good experience!
Yummmy!
The best waffles I have ever had! :)) Definitely will return!!
Super cozy on a rainy Tuesday in October. Sat down, let the kids play in the play corner, got treated. Will return.
Simply Brilliant
This is one of the most popular coffee shops in Berlin. It is small, but nice, decent and cosy. Great coffee and nice atmosphere!

I heared so many positive things about this coffee place. Maybe I put my hopes up too high. The milk they use has a fun(n)(k)y taste and the lady seemed not interested at all. As I understoot they existed for 4,5 yrs now, but they still place the supplies on the floor instead of a shelf. Industrial is ok, but this is too much. You could fool people with an interesting story, but this shop is totally overrated.
Good coffee, super friendly staff.
They truly deserve every positive review they have. The first and only coffee place in Berlin that actually cares about artisanship. They are true barristas!
A special place with a Dutch touch. Love the coffee and the exentric barista's. Bit overpriced though, if you buy beans.
Lovely food and wait staff, who were polite, attentive and spoke excellent English. The duck and vegetarian option was great. Would visit again.

This restaurant is absolutely wonderful! The service was EXCELLENT And the food was nothing short of delicious! They were so attentive and gave good recommendations. I will absolutely always come back here!
Love it! The people who work there are very nice and friendly and the food is very good. It's the only place I go for sushi with my wife.

This place is a shit hole with the most horible service i ever experienced. I was there with a friend of mine, sitting inside, actually we were the only clients chilling there, so one can understand that there is not so much hustle for a waiter. Suddenly, 2 gypses came inside, scary, dirty and started begging us for money. The waiter didn't care that there are gypsis running around INSIDE of the cafe. So in the end the gypsy stole my phone which was lying on the table. I found it out several minutes after the gypsis left the cafe. So i asked the waitress to call the police. But she answered that she doesn't know the number. I ran after the gypsis, tried to get my phone back but eventually couldn't. The waitress was just standing in the cafe looking, didn't even move to call the police or help me. Eventually i payed and left. She didn't offer a drink on the house, didn't excuse that something like that happened inside of the cafe and she didn't kick the gypsis out. Such a mean and useless personal. Never go to that place again, there are much more nicer places.

This place is ridiculous. I pride myself on my waffle-making abilities. I have to say I do make a mean Belgian waffle, the only proper way, with yeast, let it sit an rise for an hour, etc. I have serious opinions on Maple Syrup. But this place takes waffles to a level I didn't know existed. The crepes are also very good. Especially their savory one, Neopolitan something or other.... I ask for a waffle with nutella and cherries. It's not on the menu but they'll give it to you with no problem. Shear blessed decadence :-) And everything comes with a beautiful cape gooseberry on the side as a garnish. Napoljonska‎ is also very child friendly, but seems equally popular with the indigenous, 20-30 something, Berlin hipster crowd as it does the under 10 crowd. I love watching how happy one pancake seems to make the little guys. It also makes me feel less guilty about how much I'm enjoying my waffle....
Went here several times during my visit! Great staff, great food.

Unfortunately had a very bad experience at this place. Went there on the First of January afternoon with a group of friends to have breakfast. We ordered at the counter and were said that there would be some wait, 20 minutes or so. We ordered straightforward breakfast as listed on the menu combined with coffees, teas and hot chocolates. After about 1 hour and fifty minutes we left very disappointed. Some people hadn't received any of their ordered items yet! It took an extremely long time to prepare those items. It doesn't take one hour and a half to prepare a tea, right? Or to put two slices of bread and a cup of butter on a plate? Some of the items were very disappointing after a long wait; we for example got a boiled egg that probably had been boiling for over an hour (according to the menu this was the "English breakfast"). Personally, I got a hot panini after about one hour (actually we ordered three - and the paninis itself were already prepared as they had them in the cool counter). The owner/responsible was very arrogant towards us and this is mainly the reason why I want to share this negative experience. He claimed they were very understaffed, but in my opinion three people should be enough to run a business like this. Or you have to admit that you can't run your business properly and run in a "safe mode", only offering certain items or only do take-away/eat ins. There were no hints to how long the other items would take or a form of compensation in the meanwhile (this business offers sweets and cookies and it literary would have taken them less than thirty seconds to save the situation with a small treat). This business does take away and those customers were given preference. Funny detail; after about one hour waiting in the business and after the first question on how long they expected the remainder of our order would take, suddenly one of the staff members showed up with one coffee, which nobody ordered, and which was clearly a mistake. Later, when we started to discuss the situation with the owner/responsible, the only thing he could offer us was a coffee! But before it had taken others already more than one hour and thirty minutes to get their ordered tea, so we refused the offer. We almost had to start a scene to get our money back for the things that we didn't receive. So conclusion: clearly has a lot of potential and apparently their food is widely appreciated. We got some reasonable items, some very disappointing and some never. The owner/responsible needs to learn to keep his customers happy.
Delicious Pasta .....Ravioli with exotic stuffings e.g. Blutwurst-Apfel | friendly service | cozy location
A very nice place.
The burger and fries is to die for. No two ways about it.
One of the greatest rock n roll cellars in the world !
Excellent toasted sandwiches, loved the gnocchi too. Small but cosy, very friendly service.
Dope place, sweet people, good food.
Great place, it has a great atmosphere. We felt it really embodied the feeling of Berlin!
Nice and calm place for an aperitif! And free wifi.
Cosy place to eat tasty vegetarian bio food and nice little shop in the back.

This cafe is a real hidden gem. Not only is the coffee good (with soy milk available) and staff very friendly, but the food is really great - obviously very fresh ingredients as the taste is amazing! Even better, it's not even expensive - about €5-7 for a main dish. Well worth hunting down :)
We went here for falafels after visiting flee market, best damn thing I ate in a whale. If it's on your way, I recommend it.
Nice,but too expensive for the quality. I had better African food in Berlin.

I had a meal there, we came as a couple in the evening. The food was great, fantastic, I had the Afrikana Plate which features different courses, and it was really very tasty food, I was overwhelmed by it. However, the service was really not appealing; one waitress was really nice and smiling, but the other were really grumpy and seemed unhappy to be there or to serve us. I didn't feel welcome. However, I would maybe come back for the food... I just wish the service would be nicer because it definatly affects the atmosphere!!!

They say you will experience "The original Brazilian Rodizio", however what they offer is not even close to the Brazilian Churrasco. Except for the Caipirinha and a couple of Brazilian flags, nothing else reminds of the south american country Cuisine. The cold and warm buffet were not that bad (there are plenty of salads, vegetables and mexican food), but if you are expecting to eat something Brazilian, just forget it. Not even the traditional mandioca, vinagrete or a simple white rice with beans can be found. But the most frustrating part was the one supposed to be the best! Meat... They simply have no idea what do Brazilians eat nor how to serve a customer. They offer you things like: A complete grilled chicken breast, lamb, chorizo sausage, pork and etc. (Things you will NEVER see in a Brazilian rodizio). The main meat, called Picanha, was served raw and cold. Besides that the waiter had a horrible knife which simply destroyed the slices. It takes really long until you get meat served. Like 15min between the options, which is unacceptable. I won't go back there nor would recommend it.

had the chicken and rice dish (spicy) with a nice soothing bowl of tea for only 8Euro. it was so good, especially the spicy thick curry and the mx salad with groundnuts! it was really good and affordable!
Such an amazing Vietnamese restaurant! We've never had a bad meal and I've eat there once per for a year!
very tasty
It's pretty noisy and overcrowded there. Nevertheless, it's a perfect place for drinking beer with friends and having fun. It's very popular place in Berlin.
Your ordinary "Tu m'a vu?" bar in heart of Prenzl'berg. Overcrowded on Friday and Saturday nights, quite comfy otherwise.
Great bar - one of the last remaining pieces of what used to be a cool neighborhood.
Very cool bar

The coffee is good (but not as good as Godshot's). There is plenty of seating and outlets, and there is no time limit for the wireless. They also have a completely vegetarian cafe menu with a number of vegan options. I tried the vegan brownie, which was not a proper brownie but was like a piece of tasty chocolate gingerbread. They also have a full calendar of nightly events.

Uberkool Berliner cafe. Thursday night folk music is always an event. And i've been to the language exchange too and it was an unforgettable evening. I only wish i had more time in Berlin.....But i always go there when i'm in town and would say its about as nice a place to hang out in Berlin for a few hours as you'll find. ~Good prices too, unlike some of the other good coffee houses in the area. And great for breakfast or lunch.
awesome coffee, really nice staff, really nice owners, really good waffles...
Home-made fries and fancy burgers, om nom nom!

We ended up there one Saturday for lunch because another burger place we like was closed and what a nice surprise! The burgers were really "lecker" and the service impeccable and friendly. Since then I've been recommending this place to all my friends.
Great value buffet with good selection of meats and cheese. I enjoyed the coffee and the atmosphere.
The Breakfast Buffet is one of the best in Berlin... Relatively cheap and delicious to boot! Loved it.
Tufuburger tastes like nothing

wir haben diesen Ort als "Ratenburger" getauft. i wanted to cry. i went out specially because i was hungry, ordered 2 burgers and 2 orders of fries for me and my husband. when i got home and opened it, there was only one order of fries, and the burger was actually inedible. the meat was of the absolute worst quality. this is the first time EVER i haven't been able to eat something.
Smaller menu BUT everything on it is great! Nice intimate setting, great service, very good selection of wines - a great meal out!! Upmarket menu with reasonable prices
Nice place, laid back, good service. Very authentic, with a regional menu with a modern twist.
Alles top
lecker Sushi
average indian food. its ok.
I'm so excited I found this place. The fish & chips were steaming hot, fresh, and delicious! Portions were generous as well. I can't wait to go back to try everything else. Yum!

Whenever I have guests from abroad and we happen to be in Berlin I take them here. Only few bakeries produce so delicious and traditional Baumkuchen and every time my friends and I come here we spend really good time together. Welcoming and friendly staff. Quality hand made bakery and pastries. They don`t make the cakes as my mother but rest is excellent !
Very friendly team, good food, quite cheap.
Small, friendly and good quality Restaurant! ;)

The best lunch deal on the block! For a max of 6 Euros you get a great variety of dishes. The food is always fresh and very tasty . Two cute women will take care of your order professionally and with a smile (which is rare for this city). The food is ready before you know it, and the whole experience has made Pattaya my first choice for the business lunch.
good japanese green teas for reasonable prices amongst lots of others.

The food was tasty but a little bit to pricey for what it was. 8€ for some beef, rice and vegetables(although everything was fresh and delicious) is a bit to much. They should consider calling it restaurant rather than 'imbiss'.
Nice little cafe, friendly staff who speak English.
Tasty fast food.....vego is highly recommended.
FC jeff Jas
Nice place, wendsdays night is gay, crowded of handsome and nice men.

Went with two friends on a Wednesday night. Over the course of the evening we tried 18 cocktails. The quality of each was quite high but continually over stirred. As a result I would put Becketts in the same class as my favorites in other cities but I would definitely go again if asked. The bar is small, with about 12 seats in the non-smoking room and a handful of chairs and the bar in the front, smoking portion. The smoke was stifling in the early part of the evening, even in the non smoking area due to several cigar smokers in the front room. A small meat plate and olives were a tasty addition to a cocktail sequence that showed our server knew how to read our tastes. The highlight of the night was a Portuguese Brandy and house made kirchewasser drink the Lusitania. Garnished with some nutmeg, the sweet drink was a fine 4am last call.
Overrated. Smoking area at the bar, so you cannot really taste anything very well. Coats are stored in the smoking area and come back stinking of smoke. Small selection of Gins and tonics.

Meat lovers will become regulars of this restaurant because the meat is delicious. It isn't a cheap place though so if you're not looking to spend that much money, I would suggest you to share your entrée and dessert -in case that's a possibility. The atmosphere is just perfect: low lights and nice music. And the service is really fast, which is always a great thing to say about a restaurant! Another plus: the waitresses were super friendly and patient with our basic German skills.
Good happy hour
Great Icecream.
really really good pizza, very thin crust, huge pizzas, cool atmosphere, quick service. my girlfriend is italian and we love this place
The pizza is ok although it isn't a real Italian pizza. They use flat crunchy bread like base, but the service is good.
Some of the best, lightest pizza anywhere.
Delicious!

Don't bother! I went here because I absolutely love garlic but this place unfortunately severely disappointed for the following reasons. 1) badly cooked food - unseasoned and generally pretty tasteless with *only* some garlic for flavour. 2) expensive - especially a problem because of no. 1 3) the weird foods *don't* work, we tried the garlic beer, garlic & egg soup and garlic ice cream to be adventurous, thinking as a garlic specialist they might've found a way to pull it off. They didn't. They all tasted as bad as they sound. Normal foods with *raw* garlic sprinkled on top. Not nice! 4) incredibly slow service, one man was doing everything?! Ludicrous. 5) assumed tip at the end, we're usually ones to tip at a restaurant but when the experience is this bad, we certainly don't. Needless to say, the meal for 2 cost €44 and we received no change from a 50
A really awesome place, specially during the night. Cool music, cool people and great atmosphere. A must when in Berlin.
Best place to have an early morning coffee in winter
Great mojitos and comfortable couches.
Lovely authentic Japanese restaurant with traditional sushi, fish dishes and a great selection of sake. Insider tip: Come on Sundays, sit on the floor mats and have a super cheap lunch meal.
Had a great food, with really excellent service! Would definitely go there again!

Very bad service. We were served late, then when were reminded by the waitress to take our last order (i.e. deserts) before we started eating because the next customors arrived soon. Although the food was good, the place is quite overrun and expensive, so your time and money is probably better spent elsewhere.
authentic japanase food in berlin. don't miss the daily specials
I am still eating and this is the best sushi I have had since I was in japan... thank you for bringing that back to me.
We didn't know the meaning of the dishes on the menu, because we don't speak spanish. we ordered something and got some steak. It was pretty good, although we don't like it.
Mexican, average.
Super Personal. Klasse Essen ( Chili con carne, 7,50€ + Brot und Salat) Original Mex. Küche.

FANTASTIC! My colleague and I were in Berlin for the evening, flying out of Tegel in the morning. We took a taxi over to Tres Tapas and had one of the best meals either of us had ever eaten. Delicious tapas, extremely fresh ingredients. Try the grilled sardines. The prices were very reasonable for the 5-star food quality. Also very friendly service and atmosphere, and great wine list. Highest recommendation.
Beautiful place. Great coffee. Delicious cakes.
The atmosphere is so relaxed... I love the old mismatching piece of furniture and the cakes are good too. I will definitely come back for an afternoon tea.
Great food, great wine and only a few meters from home...
Very cosy, friendly, exquisite german meals and very good taste. Although high price, I highly recomend it!
Delicious sushis for cheap, the cocktails were also good and unexpensive. the service guys are really nice. n / from paris, france.
Super Soups, nice crew. Love the Deco, and good concerts are given..
Good food. Kind waiter
Waited for over an hour for our food...
Great value, tastes great. A kind of fusion of Thai/Viet/Chinese food Thai Ice Tea is a winner on hot summer days.
Pretty cheat.

Fantastic brunch spot. Eggs (laced with spring onions), cheese (go for the cheese special and be surprised!) and bread (fresh from the oven) never tasted so good. Served with plenty of fresh fruit and veg. Milkshakes are also delicious and the coffee is served with a cookie and gummi bears!
very good breakfast place. both the pancakes and the scrambled eggs were remarkably good. fresh bread rolls even on a Sunday.
top ambiente, sympathischer service tolles essen.. immer wieder gerne.
i've never seen such bad brunch ever in Berlin. the service was crap, and the brunch was almost no-existing. The only thing good about the place was the playground.

finally an american diner in my neighborhood - i thought ... but a visit left me disappointed: quite bad service (sleepy american girls who never would get a job as waitresses in the US), breakfast was on the level of a cheapo-hotel-buffet, for not that cheapo price, coffee really bad (maybe that supposed to be on purpose) a closer look at the german version of the menu also showed that the place is run by one of those new berlin fun-loving-north-american-part-time-immigrants, who probably don't speak one word german, and who probably live by the premise "life is too short to learn german" and who were too arrogant and/or too ignorant to spend some $$$ on grammar-check before printing the german version of their menu ... anyway: bon voyage
Very good breakfast and friendly staff. Also open for feedback. Love to go there with friends and kids.

I like having a diner for nasty American breakfast but this place could be more. Food was ok, bacon burnt, brisket sandwich so so. Waited 1.5h for food which is just too much, even when every seat in the joint is filled.
Little italian place, offering brunch and simple dishes (ex. omlettes). They make really good cappucino and you can sit down in the street and do some people watching :)
Delicious but not exactly inexpensive. Great service, fresh an often regional ingredients.
currywurst mit pommes rot weiss
Very, very good food. We had a discount with the Berlin Welcome Card, but felt uncomfortable using it. We were happy to pay the full price and will come back asap!
Meena kumari is an excellent place for Indian cuisine in Berlin - yummy food, friendly stuff and very pleasant ambient !
Very good and delicious food and cocktails :)) Cosy. Will return to try out more ;)
The expectation was quite high, but at the end, the food wasn't anything special. It was missing the Indian kick of spices... Service is good and it has good atmosphere

your search for delicious and finger licking indian food in berlin will stop here, i have felt the same taste of spices like indian food. prices are reasonable and service is outstanding. very much recommended.
White mocha - to die for. Great atmosphere, breakfast buffet from 9 a.m. on Sundays.
Nice atmosphere and 24/7 open. Every now and then with djsets. But way too much people and tourists and hip guys and Berlin-Mitte girls!
Chill!

I had a good late-night meeting with friends here. It has a rather cramped layout, but that just encourages you to talk to the person/people next to you that much more. Decor was interesting. Having had a beer or so, it was a little odd figuring out the bathrooms, which had an even more odd layout. Prices were reasonable. Bartenders were friendly it didn't take forever to get a drink. I'd go here again. Cash only.

The food here is nothing special, but the extraordinarily low price of the breakfast buffet - 2.95 Euros per person - is worth mentioning. Their tea and coffee is obviously priced higher to make this worthwhile - 2.10 Euro for a glass of black tea - but it's still a cheap breakfast. The area inside has a very Berlinish atmosphere with battered sofas and mixed up furniture, quite nice for a rainy day, but the outside seating area is more worth mentioning. At the top of Kastanienallee there's lots of people-watching to do, and it really is not a bad place to come on a Sunday in August!
Great food and service!
Worst sushi on earth. Other dishes are ok. Self service. There are better places to go for example the 2 asian ones next to it and opposite of it.

I ordered online - NEVER AGAIN!! First of all - waited for a long time considering that I live close to the place. Sushi was very poor quality and completely tasteless. As was the ginger also by the way. And they put too little soy sauce so I was needed to eat one set without it - ew! Don't go there!
Good value burgers, especially when using pizza.de site to order so you can configure the burger perfectly.

Nice place. I came here 3 times and I'm pleased with the great work of the staff. They are always friendly and caring. Atmosphere is cosy and you can have a nice talk with friends, without having to shout. Recommend it.

Michael provided the most excellent and friendly service together with amazing beef & delicious wine. Although expensive, it is well worth every euro for one of the best restaurant experiences in Berlin.
Best value sushi in Berlin, basically my casual sushi place. Really solid sushi, good choice and very reasonable pricing.

For lack of alternatives, we landed on a freezing winter evening in this dimly lit Pseudo-Asian place. The Miso & Sumi Shiros we ordered to warm us up were lukewarm and nothing special. Horror: Kamo Yaki Curry! Fried duck breast on hard (not crunchy!), chunky European vegetables, undefined, tasteless curry sauce with overcooked (re-heated?), soft rice. This has ABSOLUTELY NOTHING TO DO WITH ASIAN FOOD, especially Japanese Curry!!! The staff was incapable to explain menu properly and had a good laugh at their customers behind the counter. Hard to believe that Asians run this place! What a rip-off!
Great bar excellent beer very good german food very thin on the ground places like this alas
Hi uncle iam one of the students who had food in your restaurant on our berlin trip you are awesome u serve food with wih love in your hands truly the best we had it needs not a description

Prima!! wunderbar!! i have been to berlin and i found this Best indian restaurent available in Berlin. Super food..with lingering taste of indian authentic cuisine!! and ofcourse priceworthy and service friendly. Superlike!! :)

food - super service - great prices - very reasonable portions - very big service in hindi is an added advantage for Indians you can ask for free onions and green chilli and feel at home highly recommended --- I will be back
Great food and very cheap. Typical German service though.
Too expensive. Some things are too greasy. A bit less oil would be better. Otherwise excellent lasagna, tiramisu is 5***** and excellent quality of the sandwhiches!

I have eaten a LOT of pizza in my lifetime, and this was the best I've ever had. The dining room is very small - only a few tables - so it might be difficult to get a seat during busy times. IT'S WORTH IT.
Best food in town.

Amazing place, with live music, great food that comes with free salad, free dessert, and they keep filling your ouzo constantly. It feels more like taking part in some family fiesta than being in a restaurant with waiters. Definitely coming back!

A great place to spend a Sunday evening in. My friends and I usually go there every week, and the cakes are awesome. Nevertheless, the best thing is the mocha. Both black and white are outstanding, far better than in a, eg, Starbucks.
Nice pizza, good wine and excellent staff. And the price was right.
Brunch was excellent, one of the best I've had. Also I liked the idea of people paying for the brunch according to their income level. 6-10€.
Love the concept of solidarian priced lunch buffet. Really friendly staff, good value and appropriately crowded.
my coffee was good. my girlfriends wasn't drinkable. the cake was ok..
Pay-what-you-can communist dining catering to vegans. What more can you ask?
Buffet breakfast for vegan exceeded all my expectations. Staff was helpful and friendly and let us in before opening to wait for the breakfast to get ready.

Some of the best cocktails I've ever had - they are using fresh fruit instead of sugary syrups. Staff was friendly and service is prompt. It's pricy but you're paying for quality so I guess it's OK. Didn't try the sushi, so cannot comment on that, it just seemed like an odd combination to me...
the bar is nice.. staff friendly. but there where super loud and very dumb Nazis from Marzahn. that really ruined it....

First time at Entweder-Oder Cafe, while the food was ok, we had to wait 75 minutes for it! We had to wait 15 minutes to order, another 30min (!) till we got our coffees and additional 30 minutes till we got our food! In addition I had to ask 3 times (!!!) for the complementary sparkling wine that came with my friend's breakfast choice! We actually were't in a rush at all, and given it was a busy Sunday morning weren't expecting wonders, but the service was truly appalling. So a no-go on Sunday mornings!
We had a delicous breakfast at this place.
The food was amazing, but my favourite definitely was the mango soup!
Food was overly salted and overly fried.
Untasty cocktails.
Cheap and good food. Household food - nothing fancy just food that everyone likes with a real sense of authentic homemade food - the service is great.
Breakfast, midday, afternoon, late night - the place for every time of the day!
I love the place. They make an excellent pizza at a fair price. Authentic Italien Restaurant. Not a tourist trap at all.
OK place... But truly uninspired tapas plate!

Kind helpful staff. The beer is well-sized and reasonably priced. 3,50 Euro for their Prater Pils, which was smooth and light. I ordered a pickle for 1 Euro and it was crunchy and lightly sweet. In the day, Prater is a green oasis in the middle of the city with large chestnut trees gently swaying above and providing ample shade below. Perfect for a quiet read or a summer lunch with friends. At night, strings of lights between the trees and happy chatter amongst the guests dominate the scene. I didn't see much mingling, but everyone is happy to make room for you to sit and enjoy your beer with the other 600 guests. It is a lovely place and everything you'd expect from a German beer garden. A 5 star biergarten for me.
Great place! It's a "Biergarden" which is situated in a former public swimming pool. Price for beer is still moderate and you can eat some german food here. Atmosphere is good!
The beer garden was really cool surrounded by Chestnut Trees. The atmosphere was relaxed and it really is a place for anyone. We had the house weissbeer and it was freakin delicious.

A genuine Berlin beer hall and beer garden. Visit it while it lasts, as it is a dying breed. Short trip out on metro or tram from town centre leads to lovely old beer hall and nice garden; we visited at night - so we drank indoors. Short choice of local beers and genuine local food at prices that were lower than Berlin centre. The meat balls and potato tasted very much better than it looks! (see photo).

If you want to show a Berlin guest a beer garden or just want to dive into a mass of people this might be the place. It's green, loud, has hundreds of seats and relatively cheap prices. All what you would expect of a beer garden.

Beer gardens are typically found more frequently in the south of Germany (Munich being the capital of beer gardens). But for those who are in Berlin, this is the place to be. In the summer, of course.
Great spacious beer garden, unfortunately the don't serve spirits in it.
Good place when it's sunny.
Great French food, excellent wine and good service in a cosy bistro in the heart of Prenzlauerberg, can't ask for much more!
Surprisingly excellent renditions of french country classics, in a relaxed friendly bistro atmosphere. Loved the charcuterie and the duck confit.
Lauschige Lounge, gute Cocktails und ideale Partylocation
Awesome food in a pretty cozy place. Prices are reasonable and it's really close to U Eberswalder Str - highly recommended.

Had a meal with my father and brother. We all ordered filet steaks. After having a couple of bites we realised we got sirloin cut in two and disguised as filet under the sauce. They offered us desert on the house as apology which we declined. Don't like this sort of dishonesty in a restaurant.
very nice place with good italien food
Yes the espresso isn't bad, and that aint no easy to find good coffee in Berlin. But, the atmosphere is terrible and they are cheap.
One of my favourite breakfast locations in Berlin. Great food presented beautifully, with good quality coffee at reasonable prices. Service can slow down when busy, but its always worth the wait ;)
warm place
good good good :) visit the place n see for your self! good coffee good atmosphere nice deco.. like like like!
Proper Mexican food. Sets the bar for the rest of the restaurants in Europe.
Decent mexican food for a really reasonable price. Recommendable.
It was cheap but not great value. Wouldn't write home about the food. Went based on the reviews here and won't be returning.
One of my favorite places!
Yummy food
Tune carpaccio with deepfried kapers...we need to say nothing more
romantic and small Italian...
Highly recommended, perfect cocktails
Hope Tony is still there, as he is a legend from the old days of 94. 250 cocktails in his head and I'm still making his Melon Margaritas in Beijing. The X rocks!
Huge (!!) cocktail menu in a cozy atmosphere. Can become a little pricy though ;)
About as close to good Mexican in the States that we've found in Germany. The complimentary frozen strawberry margarita shot was a nice touch. We will definitely be back.
Very good food. Reasonable prices.
Yes, one of my faves in Berlin!

It's an interesting place, I'd expect a 4-8 years old to have fun for 2-3 hours there. This is essentially a converted church with very high ceilings that they divided into a museum on the bottom floor (German only) and a 2nd floor that consists of 4 stations where your child can craft something anchored with a massive maze like play structure where kids can run/climb around. There is a small cafe so you can relax and watch.

This mueum is a nice idea and will especially appeal to antroposophical parents, but it is NOT SAFE for children under five. The steps of the auditorium are very steep and easily accessible from downstairs. The tables of the workshops are much to high and cannot be reached properly from a normal chair even for an older child. Moreover they have these cardboard stools which topple easily. Our two-year-old daughter tumbled forwards and first hit the table with her head and then fell backwards and would have hit the floor if I wouldn't have managed to catch her. Her tongue was badly bitten and bleeded profusely upsetting her a lot. If you have a small child you should only visit the mueum if you are able to keep a constant eye on him/her, preferably holding onto them as well. ONE WOULD EXPECT A MUSEUM FOR CHILDREN TO BE SAFE FOR CHILDREN.

Excellent coffees and very good light snacks: the espressos were perfect, using a light city roast (not the Seattle style bitter blackened roasts), the flat white was excellent. The filled bagels were unusually good too, with a gentle, elegant layering of flavours. The café itself is very relaxed, very indie-cheerful, you can rock up with sex-hair and your one night stand, or in hipster-casual and no one will raise an eyebrow. Service was really really nice and kind, with that certain precision ("the second espresso will be here in 10 seconds, sir") that is so charming in Germany. I love this café and more importantly, the coffee that they serve here!
This place brought back memories of the independent craft coffee shops in the Mission District of San Francisco. Coffee prepared with excellence.
The Best Coffee Ever Yummie Yummie Yummie, it's love in my tummy
What a find! Everything one needs for the best appointed kitchen. They can even teach you how to cook.

This is a wonderful English-language bookstore with an excellent selection of books. They also serve bagels good enough to satisfy any New Yorker and coffee good enough to rival excellent coffee shops. The interior is beautiful, the staff knowledgeable. These are clearly people committed to quality on all levels. A great place.
The best cafe to become your office. Don't miss the special cheese cake, at least if you're into cheese cakes.
Great house baked cake. Berlin made gifts and tons of crazy stuff. Definitely worth a visit.
Fast, nice, exotic and delicious.
Simple but stylish with superior quality food at competitive prices. Quiet and cozy, good place for couples.
Lovely thin crepes and delicious coffees. Bit of a wannabe place but that's Prenzlauer Berg
No space, claustrofobic, VERY expensive for the tiny bit you get. Loud guests, absolutely no peace to eat or drink a bit in a relaxed way, breakfast is horror! Crowded and loud.
Worth waiting some time for a free table on a weekend morning. Delicious breakfast meals for two! A little packed with tourists, as it is listed in nearly every city guide.
Lovely setting for breakfast, but though most people go for the buffet (read afternoon tea cakestand of continental breakfast options), the crepes, cakes and eggs are better
Good coffee, cake and ambience
Good cake, cosy place. In summer/spring the outside is plentiful and pleasant
coffee?
friendly atmosphere, lovely waiter and an amazing breakfast: the perfect welcome to berlin.
Wonderful cakes and pastries...
This place is located on a nice a quite street.A very nice place to relax and have a great meal service was excellent.would highly recomend this place.
Good and cozy environment, and the food is excelent. Like it very much, and go there often.
Probably the best hummus outside Israel. This place is fantastic. The food is delicious and service good. The hummus is super delicious.
So far probably the best hummus I've had in Berlin, great bread. Great to sit outside on a nice summer day.
Great food
Food is amazing!
One of my favourites in Berlin. If you are into asian food or just want to try something different from the trypical curry wurst or kebab, stop here! Everytime I go to Berlin I stop here!

I lived in Berlin this past summer and tried many restaurants while there. Zum dritten Mann is charming & romantic with both indoor & outdoor seating. Nice friendly & helpful service. Their schnitzel really is the best in Berlin. It's lightly breaded and not greasy at all. The fish & chicken dishes were also fantastic. I highly recommend going there when in Berlin. It's kinda expensive... but well worth it!!!
good breakfast, especially the eggs!
Warm band nice irish pub.
price is right and the food is always spot on. the service could be nicer, they are rude as any other Berlin waiters
Guatemala espresso and scrambled eggs with real bacon - best ever! :)
Slow service. Average food.
Love fresh pasta and saltimbocca

This place was terrible! An Aussie bar with no Aussie beers to sell! Not even Fosters which isn't even Australian owned. The waiter was a creep and the 'locals' were all yobbos. My fellow Aussies, steer clear to avoid the disappointment I endured

I stopped in here for a drink off a recommendation and was so delighted I did! The outside of the building is incredible and the inside is just as interesting. The bartenders were friendly and made me one of the best cocktails I have ever experienced. Highly recommend!
Great food & wine, cosy location - combined with Berlin-style service (expect laid-back charming hipsters)
Very special hidden gem in Berlin Mitte with great food accompanied by a lovely casual atmosphere and nice people.

Veal entrecote correctly cooked but not warm enough, more asparagus tails than heads in our plates, quite hard and fibrous, slices of potatoes probably cooked in wild garlic, neither soft nor mellow. A glass of tasteless burgund wine and a standardized spanish wine. Verdict : uninteresting address, overrated, overcrowded, overpriced. Moreover when you go out your wardrobe smells just as if you've been cooking your meal yourself. A place to avoid in Berlin !!
Really nice atmosphere, attentive staff and the food is delicious with an interesting Swiss influence.
Great for dinner with your girlfriend. An ensuing walk in the park is recommended as well.
Typical German establishment! The food is great! People are glad to come here!
Great place! I love the huge companions coming for a bite! Everybody is in love with this place and the garden!
best eat as you can res in town! very good food!
a must to visit place but they dont deserve a wine with quality....
Amazing food, friendly service, good atmosphere. The food (especially the plat du jour/daily menu) is mind-blowing, nearing (sometimes clearly surpassing) a Michelin-star restaurant.

Horrible service! We have been here three times. Every time the food had been really good but the experience so unpleasant as a whole that we decided to avoid this restaurant in the future. Our personal opinion is that for some reason the staff are so under pressure (by the owner?) that guests are bumped, glass breaks all the time and there is a general sense of being expedited out of the restaurant as soon as possible.
Good Food, good Service. Pricing is ok.
Eat The palak paneer! Best dish in house.
Relatively good Indian food. Chicken Tikka and Chicken Korma are my favourites here.
Relaxed, laid-back people there. Not a real club but rather a bar with a dancefloor
Special Place: 1920s movies, cheap drinks, good after 10p.m.
Very tasty food and nice location to hung around with friends. Prices are very reasonable. Don't miss the pink lamb!
Gourmet handmade Dumplings, with fresh ingredients. Best ever dumplings tasted. Fun place with great service. Highly recommended.
Some great dim sum flavours, funky atmosphere and good service... The prices are quite reasonable too
Food is not bad, the only problem is that the servings are tiny...You get 4 dumplings for 5-6€, which makes it very expensive.
Contemporary chinese and asian food. Happily adding it to my everyday favourite restaurants.

Dingy expensive dump. Supposed to be a live footy pub but only if you are German. Does not cater in any way for the thousands of expats from around the world that live in the area. Turns off top-tier non german games before the end to show a low key 3rd division nobody german league game. If you want to watch an important game that does not involve a German team then find somewhere else.
Cool bar, great interior, reasonably priced drinks, that taste very good, sweet and nice service. once im back to berlin, i def. stay until the early morning there again.
A fully vegetarian comfort food place. Naan pizzas.

Really good indian fusion food! Naan-pizza with grilled salmon tastes great. A few years ago the interior was designed a little bit different, the oven was part of the guest-room which gave it a really nice atmosphere. But it is still a great alternative to the real "Imbiss" its logo is derived from!
A place not only for great food, but can be vegan too. Just ask for your naan bread without ghee. Dahl soup was great. Friendly multi-lingual staff.
I don't drink coffee, but I *love* their Pastel de Nata!

I used to live right around the corner from this place. Now moving back to Berlin for a short time I'm actually going to be spending most of my time working not far from Hangi, and the close proximity played no small role in making that decision. Seriously. The sushi here is cheap, and fantastic. No frills amazing sushi. My main concern when I see cheap sushi, or any sushi for that matter, is freshness. But they get so much turnover at Hangi, I've never noticed anything wanting when it came to freshness. I LOVE it!

Really cool place with a really awesome concept. You pay €2 for a glass, fill it with wine from the counter, keep tally of how many glasses you had and at the end pay what you feel ia fair. It gets really busy most nights so get there early if you want a seat.

A total cheat. We were in 6 there, among which a couple of non Germans, and they must have thought that it was a good occasion to steal some extra money hearing English spoken. We ordered three beers, two cocktails and one bottle of wine, and they put us an extra FOUR large beers on the bill; when paying we pointed out no one had had them, and rather than apologising they got aggressive and claimed that we were drunk and forgotten, though we clearly weren't drunk after a beer each, and we can count up to two. Honestly perhaps the worst service ever. It's a shame, otherwise the place would have also been nice. But no one enjoys getting ripped off.
the smoking inside is so bad, any positive the bar might have are well & truly lost.
great place, probably the best bar around
Beautiful waffles, coffee and crêpes in a lovely setting near the park
Wao! beautiful place, yummy food, super friendly staff... Don't miss it!
Great bar. Well hidden and you need to knock at the door. Take your time if you come here because the barkeeper knows how to mix great drinks.
Loved it
Perfect pizza slices (southern italy style). If you are there around, this is a must! And it's also quite cheap!
Great atmosphere... and superb pizza slices.
Very good Chicken Tandoori with fresh ginger, a huge salad on the house, nice & friendly atmosphere, quite cheap for al that.

The place is gorgeous, the staff is friendly and helpful, and then there is the food and wine! We split about a dozen dishes, all great. Two that really stood out were the goat cheese and hazelnut pasta and the pork belly. While not really a dish, the potato salad that came with th schnitzel was a knockout. Our server was amazing in finding us a series of wonderful wines to match our specific tastes.
Loved spending the night here.

Because eating it's not everything in life, I have chosen Themroc! What can happen in Themroc, nobody knows. One certitude, food is like mummy giving a kiss on your stomach. If you dare, just walk in!
Hipster restaurant. Good food, three items

I can not imagine why this restaurant became good notes before. Interior simple modern, a lot of tables and chairs. Entre looked/tasted good, main-corse trocken meat. On our way home we became stomic-problems.!

The food was delicious and flavorful, the service was accommodating and prompt, and the atmosphere was comfortable yet simply elegant. I cannot comment on the value because I fortunately didn't take the cheque. :-)

We visited on St.-Patrick's Day, so obviously when we walked in at 7pm, the place was already packed. We din't eat there because we couldn't sit anywhere, so I don't know about the food (Google wants me to fill something in). Beer was good though, and they worked hard to get everybody their drinks at the very busy bar. Overall atmosphere was good, but someone decided to put the smoking area behind the stage, so when you're trying to watch a live band, you're gonna have to let groups of smokers through. They didn't think that through very well.
Even though we were one of the first ones entering that day, the pub had some short of weird smell and all the tables were totally sticky. Also very unfriendly bar keepers, totally unpolite.
The place is a f*cking joke. No seats at all to watch the tv-screen. Choose another place.
This place is horrible! Unfriendly and lazy stuff! Choose another place like the Irish Pub at Europe Center or Giesebrechtsraße!
Nice place, german and italian food, Rathaus beer, good service!

very nice restaurant, with good food, good beer and good service. If you want to hear some german, this is not the place to be since this nice restaurant seems to be quoted in every guide of Berlin, which means that it is very popular among tourists that go a bit out of Unten den Linden, but it doesn't take off the quality of the stay at this restaurant.
Very nice restaurant in a quiet area. The waitress was very nice and the food great. Special recommendation for the "kaiserschmarrn" which was a delicious dessert!

Cute little place with warm service and fanciful decor. Got the tender, juicy, pink pork with sauerkraut and fried potatoes. The sauerkraut was fine, the pork was like a hybrid of a really thick-sliced ham and what an American would think of as pork, but the fried potatoes were delicious and stole the show. Piping hot with a wonderful flavor that came from frying them with little bits of meat.
Typical German food, yet in a modern fashion, nice!
Great shnizel, old fashioned decor
Cool cocktails bar at Berlin city center. Wide selection of different drinks.
I would rate the drinks on the upper end of "good" were less attention paid to the ambience of the bar.

Actually i can't say anything about the food or the interior because we finally didn't eat and sat outside. But i give 3 times the most negative score because of the following. Very bad service. I miss here the option horrible. We waited for coffee and lunch but after 20 minutes we still got nothing. We thought they possibly waited with serving the coffee till the sandwiches were ready. Until we saw that other people who arrived later already got their drinks. So we called the waiter; he was forgotten our order. Okay, this can happen we thought. But in the first place a real excuse was hardly audible. But it even got worser. We immediately got our coffee but In the second place, after another 20 minutes we still got no food. Resuming: waiting for almost one hour for fa meal and not even a serious excuse from no member of the staff!! And finally when we left without eating because our appetite was gone, they even let us pay for our coffee and still no sincere excuse. Advise: don't go there! There are lot's of great restaurants in Berlin with marvelous food and excellent friendly staff. This one is not Berlin worth. Save your money and time!
Took forever to be served. Rude service.
Bad Service, rude staff, tasteless and overpriced food!

Had the Falafel plate, which was sublime. I have never tasted such a delicious falafel in my life, and the hommus and other sauces were outstanding too. For 5 euro, one of the best meals I have had in Berlin.
After Golan Heights in NYC, I thought I'd reached the peak of falafel perfection. Dada is on par in terms of quality, but with much nicer Decor. You won't be disappointed.
Excellent food but very unhelpful staff. For example where in this day refuses tap water and insists on you taking the smallest table in the quietest time? Avoid.
Absolutely excellent, get the vegatarian plate (it's pretty amazing) Even better than Mamoun's in NYC.

I can really recommend the place! 6 € for really good pizza, pasta starting from 10 € . My friend and i went there for dinner and spend 52€ for four really good main dishes and two soft drinks. We found nothing to complain about. So for really good food that is not too expensive you should check out this place.
Outside an amazing contemporary art museum. Has free WiFi and the building is known for its architecture
Very basic food amd very nasic setting. Nothing special at all really.
The place we had our phantastic marriage!

One of the few places in mitte without a posh athmosphere. The interior looks like it was from 30 year back. Which is a good thing. The staff is really helpfull and nice. They have great self cooked food which also is not too expensive. Also do not forget to get one of the huge burgers they have.
One of the best café in town, can't believe it's closed now. In case it is still operative (and it worth checkin), don't miss it. It's just next to the Kunsthaus Tacheles, the famous art-gallery.

This is definitely the most wicked place I have been to when in Berlin. Check for concerts before you plan to go. A downside is that it is still allowed to smoke inside and your clothes might end up pretty stinky.
Had a great night there: location is elegant but it's ridiculously overpriced

food is ok, but shamelessly overpriced. wine prices ok, though. the interior design of this place set in a historic former jewish girls school's gymnasium is questionable at best (why is there a red and white striped rocket over the kitchen counter?)
OK, everything is nice and tasty, in this little corner of Berlin, but my judgment could be biased, cause I've fallen in love with one of the waitresses :-)
Excellent food and great service
Amazing food! Great staff!!!
It is like a little holiday on cuba :)
Place is just awesome

This place is a cuban restaurant/bar with live music. After 3 (perfectly made) mojitos my usual uptight Britishness flew out the window and I danced to the music with new found friends from the expat cuban community. People were incredibly friendly, bar staff came to your table and you paid at the end of your evening rather than for each round. Lively, fun atmosphere this is a great place would definitely come again!

We had a milkshake and a chocolate bar. The milkshake was tasty but expensive and more like chocolate milk than the milk shakes we have in the US. The dark chocolate bar was quite good. We enjoyed seeing them making the chocolate in the basement and the cafe looked like a nice place to spend some time.
Good food, friendly service, good atmosphere. Excellent toilets!
Amazing food!
Great, original food. Portions sizes can leave you wanting more
Mogg & Melzer is here. It's "The Bird" for sandwiches.
A real find! Choice between three three-course basic French meals from excellent produce for a ridiculously low price. Buzzing atmosphere, efficient and friendly staff.

In the MITTE district, a really cosy bistrot. wonderful atmosphere, very very very nice, original and helpful (french) owner. the service is quite slow, but the success of your meal is guaranteed. In particula I have appreciated the soup and the chicken with potatoes.. Very cheap! I absolutely reccomend it. (the room is quite small so I suggest to reserve a table).
Great restaurant, the owner operator is amazing, very friendly and the prices are so low for what you get!
Quality of coffee can differ but a fun place to be, the coffee's good and there's wi-fi! (the reason we stepped in the first time ='))
Caramel macchiato with double espresso is a must here. But actually everything you order here is bound to be great.

I enter into this restaurant by a mere fortuity, and what I found was simply the best Middle East food that I have ever eaten. Furthermore they try (and honestly achieve!!) to present the plate in the most possible traditional way... So...Firstly your eyes get a overdose of geometric colours and then your taste buds are not less joyful as soon as the first bite is taken. Finally the Arabic coffee...wow! perfect! Plus, the staff is fantastic and the price is just wonderful. Highly recommendable
Really cool place with cool art...
Great atmosphere and very nice food!
Nice cafe with some sweets :-)
It's a dirty Starbucks with horror lighting. You don't want to give your money to these people.
Fresh tasty great products delicius cakes best prezels
home-made amazing, fresh cakes. people I went out with told me it was the best lemon tart they've tried.
super tolle Location, gerne wieder
Nice music !! If you want to play kicker & have fun with your friends without being broke because of Wochenende, then Schokoladen is the place for you. Familiar & respectful enviroment.
Every tuesday LSD event - best poetry slam night in town!
Fantastic evening with great food, atmosphere and the most sweet waiter, whom made the evening even more great.
Very Good Food. Just make sure to make a reservation far in advance!
Very cool place, good atmosphere, just the right one to sit down for a drink or two... or more :)
Come on, doorman ?? Prices don't worth it.
What would I do without the Muschi.
If you want the real "absturz"...
Great coffee, knowledgeable staff.
top coffee
best coffee in town
It's like the bar in you little town! I loved it!
Great place. Located in a very nice building. Attended a great concert on a Thursday. Spleen were playing.
Nice atmosphere and good music but takes ages to get a drink.
Fun atmosphere, fills up pretty early at around 2100
Too many people! But nice to hang out, study or just checking out hot hipster guys and sweet berlin-mitte tussis :-)

I love the walls here -- they are their own works of art. The stadium seating couches are pretty cool. They use all -atural Monin syrups for their flavoring syrups. The "girly" cocktail I had was quite good. I haven't yet tried their food or checked out their beer selection.
Pretty great

To start with, the staff on site was super friendly upon our entry and throughout our entire dinner (no reservation), yet the owner (as he got introduced by a staff member) seemed to be rather unfriendly and arrogant. Our starters were pretty tasty and nicely presented (one special, a veggie roll and a soup from the menu). Our mains were ok (tofu curry) but missed the special touch to make them outstanding or great. We ate at Monsieur Vuong the day before and thus compared both meals - Vuong clearly won the race in terms of culinary taste and overall ambiance. If I could rate the food alone, 4 stars would probably be fair - based on our negative feeling upon entering the place, 3 is all I can give.
The staff were quite unfriendly, but the place was pumping and the vibe was great. Oh, and the food was fantastic.
Very nice. The mood and decor is decidedly "hip" but not terribly over done. I've been there twice and had a good experience both times.
Great place.. very nice sushi, great main courses as well.. I hope they keep the standard and don't become dull... I will be ack to check if they keep performing.
great fusion of asian and mexican cuisines. light, fresh, tasty cooking and great value for money.
Service is lousy! Bartender is very impolite and slow.
So awesome. Been here twice now. The Black Sea is excellent.
Solyanka is an absolute must!
Decent coffee, free Wi-Fi and good atmosphere to work. Plenty of electricity plugs for your laptop and the staff does not disturb you.
Very unfriendly staffs and Very arrogant. Would they here be new "german" generation as past?? Never !!
Good wifi ;) When connected, you can see a webpage with stuff people forgot in the caffee. Very nice of them.

The Oberholz is one of a kind. You get what you expect. Like it or not. No use complaining. Food and drinks are good, if somewhat expensive. Service berlin-clichéish but okay. Audiobooks playing in the restrooms — nice. And then there's hipsters and Apples, so what.

The coffee here is decent but not as good as Godshot or No Fire No Glory. I haven't experienced rude service there, but the staff isn't as friendly as at NFNG . The main reason to go here is to do work: there are tons of places to sit, numerous outlets and extension cords, and fast Wifi. Bonus points for playing Flying Lotus.
Netter Service und die sushi is ok

We entered asking whether it's happy hour (as indicated outside). The waitress confirmed. A minute later we ordered two plates, without being advised that happy hour did not apply tho our choice (because it came with miso soup!). And the sushi tasted average at best. Have fun with the construction site next to your place!
waited for the order the longest time in my life: 1h40min.
Staff unfriendly. Food like frozen one from Supermarket. Not Authentic. High Price low Quality and Quantity.
Was there a while ago but have good memories about it. The sardinian cuisine was quite authentic.
Amazing pizzas and great atmosphere among atmospheric lighting and dark bookshelves filled to the rim.

Ate here tonight. We are usually pretty easy-going with restaurant service, including restaurant service in Berlin, but felt clearly that we were an inconvenience to the staff. We flagged down the waiter for menus, to order food, for oil (not received, grabbed our own), to ask for the bill and to pay the bill. So the only 'service' was to put the food on the table. The salad we ordered did not appear. Would not recommend.
Excellent place! Great coffee and wonderful owners, who are ready to help with anything, constantly asking customers if they are fine!!

Even though I don't speak German, the man running this laundromat was kind, patient and super helpful. His English is broken, but he took his time with me and pointed out how the laundromat operates. The costs are: 3 Euro for a wash, 0,70 Euro for 10min of dry cycle, and 0,50 Euro for detergent powder. Cash only. There is an ATM just around the corner. The wash cycle takes 30 min, and there is a computer as well as reasonably priced cafe connected to the laundromat. I recommend the macchiato for 2 Euro. Tall and filled with foam. The coffee is 1,50 Euro and an espresso is 1 Euro. After touring the city, these prices were most welcome. 5 stars from me. I couldn't ask for more from a laundromat. Thank you!
Nice guy and good service

they have just changed ownership. i just spent over €5 & 1 x hr drying my clothes ... & they are still wet! when I told the manager there was a problem he said it as my clothes?? (even though I'd been going to this place for 2yrs & never had a problem before it changed hands). DO NOT GO THERE. if you need a laundromat in this neighbourhood there is one about 20 yards down the street toward tho post office.
A laundry with great kuchen, wifi, and a host!
Very nice place. If you're in the area and you need wi-fi, that's the place.
A great place - the Banh Mi's (vietnamese sandwiches) taste delicious and everything is really fresh. The prices are absolutely fair and the staff is very friendly! Any time again!
Delicious sandwich! Nothing to add.
one of the best trattorias in berlin. innovative, but affordable dishes, nice wines. caters mostly to the younger berlin-mitte crowd.
Very good, god food, good service, possibly the sound level could have been a bit lower.
Nice venue with sexy staff, but Soviet service with Western prices.
U rock cccp

Tourist trap! Touristenfalle! Ecessevely overpriced - there are so many Bars in Berlin with a nice ambience and good drinks to an appropriate price - already beginning at the next street corner. Take on of these :-) Völlig überteuert - es gibt so viele schöne nette Bars in Berlin.
Amazing! I used to go there twice a week when I was living in Berlin. Rice Chicken and Curry are great!

Went here accidentally to warm up with while having a soup. I was pleasantly surprised by the great quality and tastiness of the food. This is truly the first place in Berlin I've been to that is comparable to some of the Asian places I've been to in San Francisco.
great food, great location, fair prices.
good and fresh food, relaxed atmosphere, good wine. very charming! a place to be in berlin mitte.
verry nice place. good to relax.

I had the worst sushi of my life here. The conveyor belt sushi -idea works when there are lot of customers. I've never seen a lot of people here, so thats probably why the food gets old, just doing rounds waiting for someone to eat. That is however no reason to sell crap food to people. Way overpriced as well. To the owner: close your business or take a moment to rethink your concept!

I don't really understand sushi on conveyor belts.. much less having fried dishes with plastic covers on them on conveyor belts.. that just says soggy fried katsu / egg rolls / tempura. When you eat here, you get a menu to eat all you can eat for €20 which is really expensive for this not so super quality I think, or you can eat dish by dish, for which there are 5 price levels by dish color. We REALLY DID NOT APPRECIATE that they only had the MOST EXPENSIVE dishes on the conveyor belt. I was like.. what kind of marketing scam is this? Most of the dishes weren't available, and what was is limited. After about half an hour of this bullshit, we flagged down the salesperson and requested vegetarian options they said they had but were not providing- but overall they seemed unwilling to put many dishes out that were under €3. Note that for €3 you get 3-4 small pieces of sushi. Overall I thought it was expensive to eat very meager plain options. I would've gone to... any other choice I could've taken. I felt like I was at a Walmart warehouse begging the sales associate to give me the item advertised on sale at the actual sale price which they didn't want to offer.
Best FroYo in town!!!
Great Frozen Yogurt, Waffles and "Milchreis". Try the hot toppings.
Had no food there, but drinks are good, service friendly, and place is unique.
Spot on place found after wondering the streets as a hungry tourist. Menu in English. Excellent food. Solid base for drinking session. Came back again

be aware of your drinks- if you dont watch them while placed on your table they will be taken by others, as the waitress told me. And if you dont pay them - even when full glasses are taken away by the waiters- you are thrown out immediately by the waitress.So dont dare to go to the toilet without watching your glas!!!!Happend to me on 22.12.12bad experience in service

I tried the Schnitzel, it was more than delicious. Huge plate, lovingly cooked. About the place: the interior has many typical decorative contrasts, could be a great film set. The premises include a dance floor and a nice garden...

I had a lunch in this restaurant. Food is good: we have tried the soup of the day, meatballs and a pizza, and we found them all very good and tasty. The place is a bit "strange", since the building around is quite old and poorly maintened, but this fact contributes to give the place an original atmosphere (then there is a dancefloor inside - and maybe also the outside could be used to dance as well but we haven't tried it!) Final note: we didn't like the service, since it was not very kind (compared also to other restaurants we have been!)
Fantastic atmosphere and food
This place was recommended to us, and its COOOOL! live music, great bar, great prices and great atmosphere! Swing music, pop and FUN! GO there and be amazed

I loved this spot! The coffee was delicious and the walnut, thyme, cranberry scone was amazing. They don't serve a hot breakfast, just pastries, so it's a great spot to stop for coffee on your way to brunch or your next destination. There are some nice outdoor seats and a pleasant ambience both indoors and out. The team that works there is very friendly.
Good coffee, friendly staff, tasty sweet treats. Small seating area makes it intimate but can be tricky to find space due to popularity.
Lovely Ethopian pourover. Small little shop. They also had some nice food.

Excellent coffe. The staff is always ready to explain the origin of all their beans, the different ways to prepare a cup of coffee and even how they got into third wave coffee. I love going to the Barn and feeling like I've both learned something new and enjoyed a great espresso :) Edit: I meant the Rosenthaler Str. place, only been to Auguststr. once!
Great coffee and atmosphere. You might find startupers talking to investors about the next big thing from Berlin. Enjoy your coffee!
Excellent, excellent restaurant. The place is small. You better be patient and wait outside if you just happen to come by.
Best German restaurant in berlin about
Food was good, but the service was hell. Waited forever to get food.
Good quality regional products, good draft beer, freshly cooked regional German cuisine. Friendly service & good atmosphere.
Great sushi and well priced
Too expensive for what I had!!!
Go for Cocolo ("nexto"), right next to Kuchi. Authentic ramen noodles, yummi!
We had takeout sushi, which was nice but not over the top. The sashimi could have been better.
Tasty and lean tagines.. Relaxing atmosphere
We went with a group of 7 and had a really great time. Nice atmosphere, very excellent food (we all had different tajines) and friendly staff. Will definitely go back!
The brunchs are properly amazing ! and you eat here the whole day
The friendliest and most relaxing place around. Good also for families.
Best ramen place ever. Food is delicious, and it's so nice to sit outside in the backyard. Recommended!
So far, the only place in Europe that sells tonkotsu ramen - that I know of! Most excellent!!
Great ramen. Taste is delicious. Have it with warm sake
My absolute favorite place to eat in Berlin
One word says it all: Sugoi!

I was in a hurry for a quick lunch, so I had the 2 way business lunch. You need to take the 3 way for a full meal (still cheap though). The food was very good with refined presentation. The guy serving the dishes was very fast, accurate and efficient. I was in and out in no time and had a nice lunch for a very decent price! Free wifi.
Looking for some good vegan food go here.. Nice location and nice hipster interior. The online booking worked for us :)
vegan food

Factory girl at Berlin has excellent service that makes you come back for more, but Factory Girl is also an attitude - a happy appreciative for life and caring about people attitude that permeates the F.G. Her coffee crew is always smiling, happy to help and they remember you and what you like.

REALLY good breakfast - beautiful combinations of food, I can tell that lots of love has been put into their wonderful creations. Service is very friendly and there is a great vibe. I want to come back for brekkie tomorrow!
Really enjoyed my night here. I just moved to Berlin and plan to make this a staple hang out spot.
very nice bar, good place to hang around
great experience... good vietnamese food, good service, beautiful deco... highly recommended :)
a bit pricier than nearby alternatives, but the place is so pretty. the black vodka is pretty delicious
the best asie tea ever
