It feels like this is a place run by an Italian family. Simple wooden tables, a naturally friendly staff and really good food. The vitello tonnato was phantastic. The main dish was beef cheeks with polenta and a salat. Simple and with a wonderful taste.
fresh delicious italians and moderately priced wines. a little gem before you head off to listen to some jazz.
far too noisy, far too simple food, far to sloppy service - overcrowed anyway.

The food is very good and comes out very fast. The service was fine but sort of took a backseat because the food came out so quickly and I was by myself. The food was so good I ordered two additional small plates after the three i started with. The whole meal with a large bier came to 20 euro and I didn´t feel overcharged. A very great dining experience for this very hungry American traveler. Not that being American matters. It doesnt.

You get what you pay for. The majority of the menu is small plates for 3 Euros, and few larger dishes for 8. That sounds like a great deal until you realize the food arrived way too quickly because it was nearly pre-made. Coming from SF where Asian food is so ubiquitous and fresh makes me a lot more picky and Transit is just OK. Everything was bland, probably to suit the German taste buds but also because the sauces were added at the end.
Great food with a easy selection tapas style. It may take a whole to be seated on busier days but worth the wait
Excellent food, great concept for social dining and discovering food. Seating a bit tight.
Great concept, food was goog though not great.
Great italian food. The price is completely worth of the quality of the food!
friendly service and the ingredients seem fresh and good. But the portions are small and the menue is not creative. Not worth the price.
Go for the delicious Japanese tapas.
Pleasant on a summer evening! Easy vibe, great food and conveniently situated away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist main streets. Highly recommended.

This is the place to bring your friends if you want them to experience that distinct type of rudeness you get from time to time in Berlin. It was getting late and we asked for the bill but were pretty much ignored. Then at exactly 1AM the entire staff set down at the bar and started smoking. Ignored and now being smoked at we decided to wait outside for the bill. That did draw their attention and we were called some names. We had the money ready but were told never to come back. Not that there was much of a risk of that of course.

I had heard about good food and a charming atmosphere, but I was also wary of poor service. I was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is lovely - pretty art, wide-planked wooden floors, a rustic feel...the service is friendly (for example, I don't speak any German, but our waiter read and translated the menu to us)...and best of all, the food is outstanding and reasonably priced. Dinner for 2, including wine and beer and several courses, came to about 35,00 euro total for both of us. Take note Brooklyn restaurants: Altes Europa is the model.
Take your friends, spend some hours here, trust the staff in their recommendations and you'll have a blast like we did! I almost don't want to recommend it - this is MY spot!!!!
Just an amazing place. A must! Nice people, good food
Good food and service! Recommend for sandwich!
Good Food and a nice place apart from the terrible service, it took 30mins for a salad not to arrive. Staff were rude when i asked for it.
Has a nice atmosphere and the sandwiches we tried tasted very good.
Freshly prepared sandwiches. Good espresso. And both NY Cheese Cake and Grandma's Apple Pie are just delicious.
Good food and drink, generous portions, unpretentious, great atmosphere with the kitchen in the middle of the room - this is a must visit for us each time we go to Berlin!
Value for money, great service and very nice food! We had pizza which was awesome!
Great food!!! Warm reception, a little italy style...Soup and Piadina were tasty. Take a cake also.
Warm, autentic ambience, friendly, attentive service and yummy homemade food. The Piadina taste delicious. And a nice range of Italian products to bring home to be found here.
I don't know the two reviews are about but the meals were flavoursome and delicious. Try the Xin Chào drink. The prices, waiters and atmosphere were great

This restaurant was a huge disappointment. Terrible service, rude waiters, and I paid €8.50 for a tiny bowl of fried noodles. You can get much, much better food for less money at any of the other Vietnamese restaurants in the area.
Seems promising from the outside but the food is terrible. Vietnamese street food without even a hint of the spiciness of the original. Not recommended.
great bar in in lounge area. best bourbon sour i had in a long time!
I was there on busy Friday evening. Staff didn't pay attention to us at all. The table wasn't cleaned properly... Food after 40 mins of waiting was ok.

Absolutely fantastic. We went to quite a few Indians in Berlin and were often disappointed because we were used to London and Amsterdam standards. This restaurant can easily keep up and all the three dishes we ordered were just amazing.
Best Indian restaurant I've had in a long time! Lots of vegetarian options
food is excellent and service is great too. For Indian food lovers highly recommended
Excellent food, great service. Nothing else to say!

I have never in my life had a worse meal. We hade two courses. The first i had was goat cheese that was baked until we could only taste the goat. After 1,5 hours of waiting we finally had a steak which was totally uneatable. We were 6 people who all agreed on this. When we complained the waiter didn't even blink with his eyes before he fetched the chef. Assumable he was a costumed to the practice.
One word : Fantastic
Small bar/venue with a great atmosphere -- even on a Tuesday night. They project visually stunning or strange videos onto a screen that are quite interesting to watch.
The food was good,but the service was horribly slow and un-attentive.
the pizza is very good as it is thin...I came hungry and I didnt feel anything after I ate! the service is no good at all...to much costomers on one waiter, and it is very crowdy....
Very good pizza but WORST SERVICE EVER !!

Great food, ok service. It's all part of the Italian charm though! Personally, I love it! You throw your order at a passing waiter and hope that what you ordered turns up. Good prices and a great atmosphere.
the best bar in town. a great barkeeper and low prices. great atmosphere.
Open Sunday for a great morning after brunch. Buffet style, with great coffee. 5 dollars.
Do reserve if you're going for dinner

I would never go back. Went for a friends birthday party, and the food took so long, he and others had their plates cleared away before ours showed any signs of being ready. Myself and another guest cancelled our order eventually and didn't even receive an apology although they didn't charge me for my drinks. Ironically, one of the last dishes to come out for our group was a salad! Total lack of organisation.
Such a cute little cafe. People are all friendly and the coffee is very good.
One of the best flat whites I've had in Europe. Simple, delicious food. Super friendly staff.

One of my fave places in Berlin! Officially the friendliest staff, who will allow you to customize whichever delicious meal you order. Try the pepper steak pie! The coffee's also great, and they also do something I wish more places in Germany would do - provide free water to accompany your meal/drink :) much appreciated!
Excellent coffee and food, and a nice cosy place to hide from the weather
Awesome little coffee shop and friendly staff!
Fantastic place and atmosphere! Flat white was the best in the northern hemisphere! Afgan cookies a must! Of course the service is brilliant.

Spectacular falafel! I'm no falafel expert, but it's the best I've ever eaten, and in combination with the veg and hummus on a plate ("teller") it's makes truly wonderful meal. Prices are not quite as cheap as they get in Berlin, but not in any way expensive, I think a plate was around €7. Enjoy!
Best falafel I have ever had! For €7 you get a plate packed with falafel and the very best of sallads, haloumi and hummos etc. Go there if you are nearby!
Just a cool place

What can I say? Bohemian pleasures at its best. I recommend the Hemingway Cocktail....actually I recommend everything they have. A cool, out of the way place where the staff are amazing, the atmosphere very relaxed, and the drinks.....incredible. Being able to smoke in the basement is a plus!!!
This is a tucked away little spot in Berlin with a cozy vibe.
Great thai food, with a large choice.
Huge bowls, good flavor, and the food arrives quickly which is great if you're hungry! The chicken curry had a good amount of spice and the pho was really aromatic.
Tast very good
Great place! Very lively! Excellent service and tasty food.
good food, good drinks, great service. close to the U-Bahn. perfect!
Awesome healthy TASTY food; very nice place + good vibes atmosphere + owners. I went just to see the "momos" concept and I loved it!!! A place to go back!!!!
Nice addition to the Berlin food scene. Friendly people and good food

We had a great meal here last night. I don't typically review restaurants, but when I saw that this place didn't seem to have any online reviews, I figured I should step up to the plate. We had intended to bring friends visiting from the US to Ars Vini, a highly-recommended fondue restaurant nearby, but when we arrived there, we found that they were booked. The maitre d' suggested we try Giuliano Dorigo (also called Osteria Donath?), a block away. The food was awesome. Many of the dishes listed on the blackboard menu looked tempting. The mozzarella/tomato salad was served with big chunks of melt-in-your-mouth buffalo mozzarella. My hausgemacht artichoke ravioli was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The mixed clientele gave the place a lively atmosphere. My only criticism was that it was noisy -- our group had a bit of trouble carrying on a conversation across the wide communal table at which we were seated. Would give the food 5 stars, and the atmosphere 4.

One of the best meals I've had. The price range is significant: main dishes from 7 to 18+ Euro. The sauces were fantastic, the meat cooked perfectly, the atmosphere and presentation excellent. Very multilingual staff (English, French, etc.).
over the weekend and just happened into Gugelhof. We both thought it was fabulous! The brown rice pilaf and the spring slaw that comes with everything is subtle and perfectly seasoned tnx

Unique brunch experience on sundays. Huge range of food I'd never tried (Russian) and full of local people which is a good sign. Ingredients were definitely high quality which made this place good value at around 20EUR inc. coffee, however a little concerned that food was not chilled while left on display in the warm and disappointed that they refused to serve free tap water for thee table.
My favorite brunch place

I showed the menu for my Russian friend who said they had gotten things right. I was a little disappointed that the waitor did not speak Russian, but the service was excellent nonetheless. The 50's music and suiting interior made a nice atmosphere even though it did not feel very Russian. The food was good and the prices were fair. This restaurant was surely an inspiring cultural touch in the neighbourhood.
Great food, nice ambience, very good service... what do you wish more from a restaurant?
Great brunch!
Good coffee, great atmosphere, and a large comfortable space to relax in.

My father and I went to this coffee shop after searching for a cool place to sip and enjoy a latte or two. This place is amazing, the food was good and the coffee was great tasting. The artistry of the free pour was also intricate and pretty. :) There were still a few choices of cakes and brownies left (it was around 1 pm when we went) and the brownies we got were still very moist. I definitely recommend this place to any coffee lover. :)

This is my favorite coffee shop in Berlin. The cafe is very open with nice outdoor seating. Perfect for a beautiful day. The coffee was excellent, but I'm still partial to the coffee at Godshot. The cakes are fantastic as are the bagel sandwiches. The brownies are fudgy not dry like other places. They have a Soundcloud page so that you can easily access music that you like that was played at the cafe. I liked the cardamom notes in the chai, but I would have liked it to be a bit spicier. The fresh pressed juice is really fresh -- the barista brought out a whole pineapple for my juice. The Fire Cup juice is spicy (pineapple, carrot, lime, cilantro, chili) and quite good. The giant, antique cash register is almost as big as the espresso machine and is a nice touch. The wireless is free and unlimited but does slow down a bit at times.
Delicious coffee, tasty food, great staff. Pity they moved from Friedrichshain, but the new place is bigger & lovelier, and on a sunny Sunday morning, one of the best places to have breakfast.
Nice coffee
Maybe heretofore the best Thai I have had in Berlin. I was pleased not to find a trace of sushi on the menu.
Pricy Thai

Went to this restaurant for the first time last week. My friend ordered soup and I, an entree. When the food arrived, my friend found his soup too salty to eat. I tasted it and thought that it tasted like brining water - something you'd use to brine a turkey in, for example. My friend sent it back and I shared my meal with him. When the bill came, we realized that he had been charged for the soup. The waiter, (after having snippily removed the bowl of soup), refused to remove the charge and claimed that it was their policy not to do so. In any case, I will not be returning, not because of the soup (things happen), but because of the poor, overall service.
Great food. Spicy beef salad recommended.
Beautiful Sunday Breakfasts!
Excellent Sushi in Berlin, decent pricing but high quality foof
Great place! Good cocktails. The Zombie in particular! But the music dosnt suit the place. I was there all night once! Maybe Ill go back tonight!?
The very good French kitchen place near the Alexander platz, just 2 stations away. I highly recommend menu for 35 euros per person.
Under average good. Nothing special really. We regret coming here. The noodles are not hand made, we had something that supposedly hat pesto and spinach, but it wasn't noticeable.
Ok, but the food is perhaps not the best I've tried.
Great breakfast!

The last guy that made a review must have been eating at a completely different restaurant because the place I went to was amazing! The atmosphere, food and pianist really made me feel like I was in a 10 star restaurant! It's almost as if the owners of the place figured out how to make a movie set come to life and have you smack right in the middle of it all. Aznavourian is definitely a place I will visit again and again whenever I am in Berlin. The house pianist was also incredibly good. It's almost like having your own composer conduct the soundtrack for your evening! The whole experience is something very hard to put into words and you would definitely have to experience it for yourself. I highly recommend this place.

Rather dull. We went there for dinner on a Thursday evening and the food was not that great. We had pasta and pizza, and most of it was pretty dull. There is much better Italian food in Berlin. I guess its a place where they bet on the constant flow of tourists rather than on returning guests.
Great food, great atmosphere – really nice without being pretentious and overly fancy.
Great Italian food, nice atmosphere
Favourite Italian for children!

Very good Italian restaurant... great wines, starters, pasta's and mains. Great prices in the afternoon, at night a bit more expensive then most restaurants in this area but well worth it. Pasta's are huge and are more then enough as a main course. The bread was very nice & fresh and came with an amazing tapenade. Very nice starters (try the mixed starter, you get a little bit of everything! And one plate is enough for two) The fresh al dente pasta's (a big portion, enough as a main course - about 12 euro) were just delicious and the meat we ordered was also very good (average 19 euro or so). Unlike a lot of restaurants in Germany it is not too salty but the tastes are very much in balance. Fantastic wines (the house wines are very good and cheap, a great price / quality ratio: 0,2 liter for about 3,50) Add to this the very attentive service and the nice atmosphere inside. Ca'nova is a very good Italian restaurant if you're looking for a bit more upscale place and not for the 1001st pizza place in Berlin, prenzlauer berg.

Das Essen ist überaus köstlich. Lediglich die manchmal ruppige Art der Köche ist gewöhnungsbedrüfig. Sie meinen es aber nicht böse. Food is incredeble tasty! Just the sometimes rugh mood of the cheff speaks against it. But no worrys at the end there are nice by all means.

Very good restaurant, good atmosphere. Delicous pasta, they hired some new chef, which makes pizza much better. It's no longer dry. Very tasty. You can also sit outside, if you want. From 11:00 to 18:00 offers all pasta and pizza for 4.90 Euro.

The quality of the burguers is getting awful, also the owner & the personal are very unprofessional & unfriendly, seems like you are making them a favor to shop there. They have a big lack of hygiene.

The restaurant had a cozy atmosphere, fun with great music. The BBQ burger was okay, but the burger not really hot, and had quite a bit of sauce, making it very messy. The veggie burger was not fresh (like you could buy it in a freezer section of a grocery store). The wedges were quite tasty and satisfying.
Awesome burgers, nice personnel, good priced!
Good burger and fries.
nice burgers, nice service!
I had a great shot of espresso (oddly served in a preheated tumbler).

The flat white was pretty good, probably between Godshot and St. Gaudy in quality. The carrot cake was delicious and complemented well by the spicy masala chai, although I'm not sure I would want the chai by itself. There are a number of couches and upholstered chairs as well as plenty of outlets and wireless without a time limit. They also have a few high end beers: Orval, Duval, Trappist Rochefort, and Brew Dog. The ambiance (decor, music, staff), cakes, and coffee are better at No Fire No Glory, so if I'm in the area and don't want a beer, I'll head to No Fire No Glory instead of Cafe CK.
Place looks nice from the outside. Inside, however, coffee tasted yucky, the chocolate cookie soso and the whole place had a niffy smell. All in all: one time experience for me.
great coffee, nice people, good music, a record player and always the latest newspapers.
The winner of World Cup Tasters Championship 2012 is owner of this cafe :) Go Cory!

Very friendly service at least from the Italian guy who works here. Love that they serve a little free food with your first drink. The wine is very nice, the atmosphere is great - always packed and the prices are reasonable enough. It's got all bases covered!
Absolutly gorgious place to have an excellent Italian wine outside in Berlin Prenzlauer Ber and talk!
Italian style aperitivo in Berlin ...excellent wine. Only flaw, it is full of smokers.
Great Brunch! For this price (9,90€) one of the best in town.
Excellent Food, great atmosphere & service
I've had a "Goldener Curry mit Lachs" and it was excellent. :)

Great! How can I tell you the feeling whenever I came here...the dishes are very delicious, the price is affordable as well as the waiters are nice and friendly....especially you can indulge yourself in a unique designed place...

A-Petit is a must-go for food lovers like myself. The restaurant offers dishes that are among the best of Asian and Asian-fusion food. I recommend you check out their Summer Salmon, this is a blow-out that could blow your mind away in an instant. A-Petit also boasts a great environment with top-notch services. Check it out and you will not regret that you did.

A-Petit is a recently opened local restaurant. While visiting the area, I was recommended by a friend to visit this place. Being new to the area and not knowing where to go, I took the advice and came to A-Petit with skeptic. Wow, the place surprised me with their food. They are among the best I have ever tasted to date. I strongly recommend the place. Don't let the size or their recent history doubt you.
This is one of my farvourible restaurent. Food is not only fresh but also delicious. I love i at all.
Food are very tasty, I love Japanese food in A-petit restaurant, especially the summer salmon...<3

Ordered two pizzas for take out - got home and discovered they were black on top - that's how burned they were! Poor experience - who wants to reorder after a complaint so just lost that 16,10 euro...

A truly amazing and unexpected pleasure. This isn't a good tex-mex restaurant, its something much better. I can't say if its 'authentic', because I've never been to Mexico, but the flavours are rich and deep and satisfying. The sauces in particular are built of combinations of smokey, sour, hot and sweet flavours that all complement each other. The venue is casual but warm and colourful and the host was extremely helpful and she translated and talked us through the menu. If you have any interest in Mexican food I can't recommend this place enough. P.s. start with one of the amazing cocktails :-)
These guys deserve the good ratings they have: Amazing food and cocktails. Highly recommend the deer (venado) and the pork with the white chocolate poblano.

Authentic, well-prepared Mexican food somewhere in Europe. It is almost completely unbelievable. Most "Mexican" restaurants in Europe serve bad imitations of Tex Mex or Cali Mex, but this is the real deal: mole, tomatillo salsa, 100% agave tequila. The service was incredibly friendly, some of the best that I've had in Germany. We had shredded duck tacos with tomatillo salsa, filet with chocolate-chili sauce, venison steak with mole, and an amazing flan that almost tasted like lebkuchen/gingerbread. I wouldn't call the restaurant expensive, but be aware that the prices reflect the level of preparation and special ingredients. I would give this 5.5 stars if I could.
As a former resident of California, this is probably some of the best Mexican food I have had since moving to Berlin.
really great Mexican food.

absolutely the best restaurant in the kiez. every time we are there we wish we would come more often. the food never ceases to amaze us. the complexity of the flavours in each dish is always so perfectly balanced, and not over the top. very relaxed atmosphere, with children or without. great view of the kitchen. service impeccable. absolute recommendation.

A cozy restaurant, the food is always very delicious, extra wishes, e.g. Indian hot and I always get it; I can compare the food as I lived in India for a long time. Very reasonable prices for the amount of food you get, the owner himself cooks the food, the services & personal are great, possibility to sit outside are given definitely worth a visit! Only recommended
I've had a Chicken Korma and a Mango Lassi to drink. Really good!

We stumbled upon this local-laden restaurant after eating at another nearby Indian restaurant, and we couldn't even compare the food. "Punjab" was so good we went back a second time the next night. The prices can't be beat for the amount of food you get, and for the flavor. The owner himself cooks the food. If you know your Punjabi food, he'll make you special Punjabi dishes if you ask, but the menu isn't shy of great choices. My family and I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant, no doubt our favorite find in Germany so far (we're from the U.S.A). You can't go wrong stopping here. Dishes we had: Aubergine (my Personal favorite) Mattar Paneer Palak Paneer (another favorite) Curry Chicken Bengan Shimla Mirch Dessert: Basin Burfi (The desserts aren't overly sweet, and the chai and mango lassis are must-trys.)

Was cycling past this place, decided to stop for a look to check it out for a possible future visit. The lady at the door refused to let me in, even though I had stated that I just wanted to take a look. Didn't really understand what was wrong with that, she just kept repeating my sentence like a retard making stupid confused faces "take a look?". (I don't mean retard in the old negative context of referring to mentally disabled people, I think by now most people use retard for those types of people)

I am a New Yorker, seasonally in Miami, The Hamptons, and Worldwide. I really don't get the hype...it is just a normal restaurant/bar, with two plain jane girls in front acting like divas...if you want to play the part--you have to look the part;) a lot of wannabes, but nothing really of substance---I guess you would have to be a student, or a foreigner to be fooled, and think this is cool...total thumbs down!

Okay, so we knew this was a hipster bar going in, but that didn't prepare us for such attitude. We bought a bottle of wine and sat down in the outdoor area in front. About forty minutes in the rude door girl barreled up to us and loudly asked us to leave. Another guy in the bar (who sometimes works there we were eventually told) ratted to her that we had smuggled in our own bottle of wine. Rather than just asking our waiter she decided to make a scene evicting us. When we told her that it had been purchased here, she simply turned and walked away. No apology. Nothing. I can handle posers and hipsters, but not assholes.

Hipster bar. I give them a "1" on Atmosphere and Decor because, even when hipsteria is not my thing, they got the idea right. Rather poor Softdrinks menu at high prices, that might suffice those willing to pretend to be classy, though. The waiters were really unfriendly, but I guess that's what hipsters expect. Note: Some guys sitting on the table next to ours were literally "invited to leave" because (IMHO) they did not fit in the coolness. When they asked for a reason, they were told that they had been rude to the waitress, but I don't remember the situation to be exactly like that...
So much fun, great music, great cocktails at affordable prices, loved it

Great place with a friendly atmosphere. Stumbled upon this place with friends and stayed until 6am playing table fussball, table tennis and darts, tried several local beers and went back the following night.

Terrible service and ruined my entire night. We paid the admission fee and entered. Instantly it was clear that we were not welcome from attitude of the staff when we told them we were just there for drinks. I ordered a beer and a cocktail for my girlfriend. I have the bartender 20€ for 12.50€ of drinks. He gave me part of my change back and demanded that I tip him. When I explained that I hadn't got my change back to get a chance to tip him, he went on a rant about how you guys never tip and you always expect more. I don't know what he meant by you guys, was it because we were students, foreigners, Irish???? I don't know. Then when I asked for the manger he told me I was a dick and making a pussy move, and refused to get the manager. I told another member of staff and they just said sorry about that and offered no resolution, so we just left. I would recommend to any tourist, student foreign person to never visit this bar.
Great place and great hamburgers will sure come back next time when i'm in berlin

Atmosphere reigns supreme in this joint. Food was okay but would have been better in the back not in the bar and on a week day not on the weekend. The DJs hard rock & the band's performance were awesome but not good for the digestion. Service was excellent -- host, servers, & bar tender all very attentive. Will try again soon.

Have not eaten there but the decor alone makes it worth a visit. The tattoo parlor in the lounge completes the decor and provides a nice atmosphere of rockstar decadence. The prices are not outrageous.
Great food, nice music and a very impressive interior
The traditional German food is excellent - especially the Schnitzel can be highly recommended. The service is friendly and English-speaking.

We went here with a friend who heard it was a metal bar. After paying 5.50€ for entrance and coat check, we entered a place that was more faux goth than anything else. The decorations were similar to a haunted house ride at some traveling carnival. The music selection was just baffling, and included some horrible Europop and techno.
LOVE IT :)

We had a great time until the waiter became very rude and was very unfriendly. After 6 cocktails two water pipes and food denied us tap water and claimed that we only ordered water and refuse to give us a second tiny glass of tap water next to our drinks. The humus was also terrible, and after pointing it upu they merely confirmed that they received many complaints because of the food and a bad cheff. Never again!
Good coffee and a good view to the street. Perfect on a cold day.
One of my favorite coffee places in Berlin - don´t miss the banana cake!!

Disgustingly greasy, soft nachos. Obviously a pre-frozen burger patty with pre-packaged buns. Not Mexican food at all... more like tex-mex, but with horrendous food quality. Have not been there again since my one and only visit, not long after they opened. Service was ok - friendly server.

Spent 2 nights there over a week end in Berlin, there was a great atmosphere, and it was never closing. Not very fancy, but excellent if you want to have a good time with friend. Not a must, but very good if you're in the area looking for a place to party.
This is the place you go where when you're banned from everywhere else
30s-era east German revivalist bar; simply fabulous, with the best coat-check staff in Berlin.

I have been 4 or 5 times in this "kaffee" and allways there was something going on. I've been into some "fights" with Mexican surburbians, picked up great girls and saw some concerts. I like the atmosphere of the merely red interiour, with beautifull wallpaper. Nice and strange atmosphere, i think there's something in the ground as well (also in the whole neighbourhood of the Torstrasse)
the bald bouncer is an idiot!!

Great experience. Come early, if you don't want to wait. Great food, good drinks to go with it too. Great service! Ordering and getting the food is somewhat a short experience, but it's really good to wait less. The springrolls with prawns are highly recommended. Most Excellent! Cherry on top? It's not expensive. THANK YOU!
Top notch light curries, great pho, outrageous satay and a Pilsner Urquell to wash it down. These guys throw in only so many ingredients, but god, do they know how to use them!

To start with, all staff was super friendly, accommodating and service oriented. We visited M. Vuong without a reservation (as we learned, they don't take reservations) and got looked after immediately (it was early though, about 6-7pm'ish on a tuesday). The food was outstandingly good; nicely presented (but not overdone), tasty and refreshingly original. Portions were of ok size to be satisfied after a starter (soup - quite large portion) and a main. It was no problem whatsoever to change meat dishes to tofu; furthermore, it wasn't just plain tofu but marinated and very tasty! We'll be back for sure and can only recommend to stop by for nice dinner.
Great pho and the best fried spring rolls I've ever had. Price is decent too. Might be crowded if you go at dinner time.

5 stars for the bowl of beef pho. 2 stars for the service. I think I must have some bad luck, as my waitress was huffy and annoyed when she found out that I don't speak German. It was all smiles before I carefully asked if English was okay. When I asked whether there was coconut in the special dish that day, she gestured hurriedly at the blackboard, rolled her eyes and nodded with annoyance. So I chose the beef pho quickly to simply end the experience. But the food was fantastic. Perhaps she was just having a bad day. So I'm still giving it 4 stars for the wonderful dish I was served. I mean, that's why I was there in the first place: delicious Vietnamese pho.

Unusual. Home-made Mandu, steamed or fried. Fine kimbap, sesame-oiled. Bibimbap is local standard, which is not bad at all. Interesting hot nut drink. Some desserts are not available, the menu needs updating. Contrary to the printed information, orders are taken at the table, not at the counter. Had I not found the little bibimbap place in the South-West, I would have held YamYam as the preliminary favorite for my Berlin visits. For dumplings and Kimbap, it is.
Korean food! Pretty good and cheap(8€): sit, select, go and order at the counter, then wait for the goodies!
The portions are huuuuge!
Very good for work lunch. Was a bit pricey for Berlin for basically a little meat and lots of rice but it tasted good and was authentic.

Go for the experience, more than anything else - but go. Compared to Berlin prices, the place is rather expensive - but the unique experience makes it clearly worth it. The food is adequate to good, the service great (as it has to be), and the atmosphere is reason enough in itself to go.
Fun experience, but maybe since it was dark the food tasted so so.

Since this restaurant is kinda pricey, you expect the food to be perfect. And it was lovely to a certain point, but since it's brought to you in such a slow pace over more than 2 hours, by the time I realized how disguising my main dish from the Surprise menu was, they could not give me any substitute. I basically left the place both hungry and 60 euros lighter. But the dark dining experience is beyond this world, since you can feel the hugeness of the place, hear many people chatting (and occasional glass shattering) but not see anything. You could take your shoes off, make funny faces, be all smudged with food all over your face, grope with the person next to you... Nobody can tell. You completely lose sense of time, space and shame.The waiters are very friendly and amusing, and I would recommend this as a fun go out idea for those who already ate.
Extremely good food. Great experience, exceptional atmosphere. Not to be missed.
Great experience, dont know why its only 3 stars
Luckly another popular asia dining place on the same street were fully booked and we found this place. Definatelly recommend it. Great food, happy and friendly waiters.
Nice place! the food is very good and cheap, I recommend
The food and especially the home made cocktails are very delicious!

I was in Berlin for a weekend and found myself eating here. The place was pretty crowded so we had to wait a few minutes to get a table but the personnel was very nice. The food tasted very good and the prices were reasonable. Suggested!
great food, friendly service
Good food. Nice service. Reasonable price.

I eat @ Makoto twice...the first time with 4 friends and it was horrible. The service was not good at all. We all got your food separate. 2 of us got our food and the other 3 wait for 30 min. then they got a wrong meal. After we asked to correct the order the stuff got more unpolite. And I dont know why but it was a big problem to split the bill. The second time I was there with my japanese hunsband and the service was again bad. The food, specialy the ramen is not good at all. Its not even close to ramen! Never ever

Lovely dinner here on Monday 14th October. Quite liked the surroundings and the dinner was delicious. Monica had haehnchenbrustsalat and I had Kalbsschitzel. I would thoroughly recommend eating in here.

Good food, good coffee, free wireless lan. A perfect cafe for the traveler to have a lunch with a good cafe and check your emails. The breakfast is delicious, too. The staff could be friendlier. They are acceptable when it's empty and unfriendly when it's a little full.
Generally good breakfast and friendly service. As I've been staying close to this restaurant many times I seem to be a loyal customer.
Very cute cafe with to-die-for desserts such as the sesame cheese cake and green tea tiramisu.
Very nice place with a relaxing interiour, fantastic teas, japanese sweets and bento boxes. A little feeling of Japan in the Mitte of Berlin.
Fantastic breakfast and one of the better coffees I could find in Berlin (not easy).
Fresh cinnamon rolls are excellent. Coffee is ok. Tea selection is only bagged teas. But the fact they bake bread on premises is a definite plus. A lot of wasps outside, both insects and human.

i highly recommand to try the spaguetty with fig, didnt sound good for me at first but its just delicious im still dreaming about it, trying to get its recipe,something as a mix of spaguetti and pinion and a special sauce... (if someone can tell me what it is ill be very happy) and they have delicious olive oil.
Make sure to try the fig tagliatelle with fennel and salami
...i don't need to say any more. Oh, except for the service, that was also great! And all within a small budget! Perfect! I was in Berlin for 5 days and ate here twice!!
Had the burger - big and juicy with a huge portion of fries. Decent food for a decent price.
Let's REGGAE all night
The place is nice but the waiters are really rude and unfriendly, we had to wait for almost 20 minuits to order during the staff was having lunch.

Very cool place to be while you're out in Berlin. It's not a typical club, but more like a classy lounge. At the time I was there, a big jazz orchestra was belting out hits while a few local dancers were being filmed by a television crew. Make sure to dress well when you come. You'll need to leave your athletic gear at home and wear at least respectable footwear and bottoms.

A friend of mine recommend this place. So I went there with 2 friends. It was really nice. The mixed appetizer plate was delicious served with 2 fine sauces. we all had different main dishes and everybody was totally pleased. all in all a nice little place with very good food and a pleasant atmosphere.
Great Food!

We had dinner at the Nocti Vagus restaurant last Saturday and expected a special experience. Unfortunately, a number of guests were unpleasantly loud, which created a tense atmosphere. The food was good, but not extremely special. Our waiter was a very friendly guy, Andreas. We decided to leave before the evening show started, after about 90 minutes in the dark. I commented to the owner (?) that we disliked the atmosphere and indicated that I decided not to tip. I was once more unpleasantly surprised when I found out afterwards that my credit card was billed for 10 Euros more than the price of the diner... At 154 Euro for two people, including drinks, I can't say it felt like good value for money. Maybe weekdays are better?

A gem in the Prenzlauer Berg neighborhood. High quality products including organic teas, fair trade coffee and friendly English speaking staff. Breakfast time during the weekend can get busy so its a good idea to reserve in advance. Evenings are chilled with bistro food and nice wines. Highly recommended!!

I love this place. Personal service from staff who clearly enjoy working with each other. A great interior, not only beautiful but also super comfy and the food is super. They also support local business which is a major plus to me. Long live Cafe Hilde
good lunch for good price!

We went there during our trip to Berlin because our hotel was next to it. And we came back the next day!! The meat was the best we ever ate in a Steakhouse (we live in Hamburg)! We also tried the shrimps who were excellent! The prices are cheap for the quality of the food, and the staff very friendly! If we ever come back to Berlin, we'll go there definitely!

This place is best avoided. An extensive menu, and all prices cut in half (a very bad sign indeed), the food was appalling. I ordered a tex-mex platter for starters, where the so-called buffalo wings were without any spiced heat and the cook had cremated the poor things. The cheese sticks were the only decent thing on the plate. For my main I had ordered a skewer with beef, pork and chicken. The only meat not dry as parchment was the pork. The rest had been fried beyond recognition. This came served with an appalling dipping sauce made from some vile sour cream and ketchup, and a baked potato drowned in sour cream that had split. Greasy, overcooked and withotu any flavour. The wife had ordered a steak with green beans. The meat was again fried beyond recoginition, and the green beans were so overcooked and terrible we both spat them out. I'm sure I've had worse meals, but I can't really remember when. Stay away from this place.

Great atmosphere with friendly, fun, & courteous staff - the perfect place to meet friends, take a date, enjoy drinks/something to eat & start or end a night! Brunch is a must & the outside seating is charming. Overall the perfect spot in Berlin that the tour books don't tell you about - but should. Try it next time you're in Berlin - you won't be disappointed & you'll be glad to find something new & fresh!

Seems like they don't really like foreigners there, Ive never had problems in another bars /restaurants before in Germany, but in his one, the guy was totally rude and took ages to finally go to our table to see what we were going to order,even if there was only about 5 people in the place,he was very arrogant to us all the time we were there,its a shame,because is very close to my new place, but unfortunately I'm not going back,because the service is terrible.
One of my first favorite Berlin restaurant/bars. They make spatzle! In the summer, it's wonderful to sit outside under the trees. Nice music, great vibe.

The ambiance of the place is quite impressive. Located in an old beer brewery, the restaurant is located in an old industrial setting. With simple furniture, vintage china and the combination with contemporary art the restaurant felt exciting and ambitious. The waiting service was pleasant, with a friendly and professional stance. However, the food was really mediocre. We expected way more – both in terms of quality and quantity – also knowing the kitchen is led by the allegedly famous chef Tim Raue. The portions are way too small, lacked taste and color, and are therefore slightly overpriced. We did not experience the 'culinary art' at all that was supposedly behind the menu. I would not particularly recommend this restaurant.
Super Service, super Location!
Great food and service.
too snob, there are lot better restaurant in Berlin

Don't miss this place — it is outstanding. I live in Paris, and I live to eat, and this place is right up there with the best in its price range anywhere. I had the Steckrüben-Quitten soup and the succulent Ibérico pork. Both were amazing, as were the sides that came with them. I can highly recommend the Spanish Onix red wine, which resembles a Chateauneuf du Pape. The only minor disappointment was the "tepid chocolate cake," just slightly overcooked (these need to be one-third liquid to be perfect; this one had a small liquid center but not quite enough.) The shipboard setting is absolutely lovely. I was there at night in January, but still two swans hung around near the boat and the light on the water is beautiful. A magical evening.

I came here with a conference group. The entire lower level was reserved, and there was an open bar and fixed menu. Thus, my experience might not be typical. I started with a chestnut soup with a lingonberry ravioli. The soup was fantastic. Simple but delicious. For an entree, I had a salmon filet with sparkling white wine foam, parsley root puree, apple-horseradish confit, and sautéed red beet leaves. To be completely honest, I chose this dish because it had the most elements that I'd never had before. Fortunately, everything worked quite well together. Other people at my table chose the duck (which doesn't seem to be on the menu posted on the restaurant's website). The duck looked a bit dry to me, and I asked them how it was. Both of the people who had ordered the duck said it was dry. For a place that it so expensive, meat should not be overcooked like that. On the other hand, people from another table who had the duck said it wasn't dry. Perhaps the duck wasn't uniformly cooked. Again, a restaurant at this level should cook items uniformly. For dessert, I chose the caramelized almond-semolina cake with banana-passion fruit compote and pistachio ice cream. It was pretty good but not flawless. The bananas were noticeably underripe, even though they were covered in passion fruit sauce and topped with micro-mint. The pistachio ice cream was decent but not as good as, say, the pistachio ice cream at Vanille Marille. My main complaint with the service was that it was at times too attentive. My water glass was cleaned off while there was water still in it. The waitress also topped off my wine a few times without even asking first. However, waiters tend to be very under-attentive in Germany, so I prefer this extreme over the other. The location on the water was nice.

Pretentious frame, lousy service (slow, cold, self-service at the terrace...), unrefined food totally not worth the calories. What a waist! it could have been a wonderful place, instead of quite a mediocre one. I still can't understand why other comments are so praiseful. These people should come to Paris and try a hot chocolate at Angelina's to realize how low Buchwald's standards are.... not at all in the expected league.
A must every time I'm in town. Coffee and cakes.
Had both the marzipan and Baumkuchen torte, both delicious. They were so friendly to me.

what is wrong with this restaurant? we were on the victory column and wanted to have lunch. the service was rude and extremely slow. no welcome or smile. after 20 minutes we were allowed to order. the salads were loveless and the dressing was absolutely bland. the kaesespaetzle were a solid mass of cheese spaetzle and already lukewarm. the beer was good. well we are in Germany! :-) ok we are tourists. but we also saw many discontented German guests. never again
Worth the cost. Traditional thatched roof surrounded by forest and gardens. Look for evening outdoor summer concerts of multi cultural music. Good wines beers and espresso. Nice selection of foods.
Great irish pub, great chicken wings with honey sauce :-)
Friendly staff....great food....typical irish pub ! Fish n chips were amazing, highly recommended !
Great fish & chips. As a tourist, it's a great place to get off the beaten path.
a nice cozy place offering a selection of specialities for very reasonable prices. tastes like home-made food, recommended!
The no. 1 restaurant in Berlin! Big portion, tasty and fresh. Friendly professional service!
The food is very good, service is very fast and very friendly. The decoration is interesting. Prices are reasonable. What more can one want? Top marks!
Great food, friendly service, reasonable prices. Does not have baby changing facilities.
Very good food for very reasonable prices and the service is also quite nice, I can recommend this place without any doubt :)
One of my favourite restaurants in Berlin!!! The food is light and wonderful. The staff is great and make you feel so welcome. If you love spicy food this is the place to be.
all sorts of grat fresh fish grilled or fried.
good bar,good boss, good beer and when on sunday there is football they stay to the end
bloody good boss and team
Great selection of international and German beers. A treasure chest full of new discoveries (a little costly, which is understandable given import costs)

The place to go for good beer in Berlin. The selection is small but well-curated. The regular themed beer tastings are a great way to experience new beers and meet new people. Rainer, the owner, is incredibly knowledgable about the beer scene all over the world.
Very friendly place. The choice of cooking is mostly local German, done well in most cases. Do take under consideration especially when asparagus season starts :-) Sensibly low prices. Enjoy :-)
I ordered a double espresso and a home made apple strudel and it was wonderful. The service was excellent.
Loved the waffles and their coffee. Authentic and better than Starbucks for sure!
not as famous or quirky as the original branch but the smaller crowd means service is better.
I recommend the Schnitzel for dinner and Apple Strudel for dessert.
Expensive but the food is simple and well done
They seems dislike Asian. Try to push our table clean so earlier to take western guests.
Very nice pub, good atmosphere, prices in the average (10€ for a pizza). Very nice staff!
Unfriendly waiters and bad service.
A great bar. Very busy. The food was excellent and the staff were very helpful and English speaking. They have a good selection of beer, even for those of us who don't drink alcohol.
Great Place! Most likely the best spot for a drink in Berlin Mitte. You have to know where it is, because there are no signs, just a door.
Day 2: Have dinner at übercool Shiro i Shiro, the town's ultimate Asian-fusion culinary hot spot.
Arrogance and style - gotta love it or leave it!

Went there to have dinner (Thursday 7pm) with a youth group, 32 ppl in total. Service was prompt and friendly. Food was good and came quickly. Prices are a bit above average, but the location is very nice (right next to the river Spree) and the place is very close to the station "Friedrichstraße" and many sights like the Bundestag or the Brandenburger Tor.
Fantastic restaurant...Reasonable prices. I recommend the veal schnitzel and the strudel.

Aka The Bier Bourse; Very nice bar just on river side. We visited twice; I recommend it. Good choice of German beers in up to 1 litre glasses and an unusual "Stock Market" pricing scheme that meant prices go up and down while you drink (you can see the price screen in my photo) - You have to watch and pounce when your favourite beer is priced low! Food was excellent also, with good choice and nice service. Although not an "authentic German" Berlin experience, any visitor will feel very welcome here. Prices seemed fair to me given that this is a city-centre venue.
The food was wonderful. I had a white sausage salad and some of the beer. Good service at their own pace. Helped me shrug off the mornings travelling and set me up to head out in the afternoon.
Great food and they had a stock market approach to drinks when I was there. We had some really cheap drinks even by Berlin standards as a consequence!
An excellent place to celebrate an event in a closed circle of friends. Prices are moderate, yet meals are delicious.

Unglaublich Unfreundlich! Unbelievably unfriendly waiters. VERY BAD DISAPPOINTMENT! Here is what happened: We sat at one of the tables yesterday evening expecting to get a menu card for 20 minutes, but still unsuccessful. Then we have caught one of the waiters and he said he can not bring a menu card because he is a waiter only dedicated to serve plates from the kitchen to the tables and he disappeared. Then the same waiter takes the unprepared steak tartare plates of some other guests in the restaurants and start to prepare them on our table. Amazingly rude attitude. I have than talked to the manager but just got the same kind of stupid feedback that the restaurant is full therefore we should have waited. I have eaten at this place before and the food I know is below average and overpriced but their location is good so that's why we tried to eat something, but after this incident he only thing I can tell you is THIS RESTAURANT SUCKS!
OmG, what a mean service! The most unfriendly faces I've seen in a long time
If you plan to sit outside and watch the square, make sure you do it in the morning do the sun is not glaring behind the Gate.
To small to sit and enjoy a very good cup of cofee great torilets thank you starbucks ;)
A real Argentinean steak house in the middle of Berlin. Superb steak, decent burgers and friendly service.

It wouldn't be fair to compare the Margaux with other restaurants, it is one of a kind with it's focus on vegetables and herbs. Don't expect molecular hocus pocus here. This is cooking with a focus on the best ingredients available. The service is friendly and very attentive, the dining is an experience beyond the simple intake of well prepared food. It is pricey, but IMO well worth the money. If you don't drink wine, I recommend the fruit juice pairings, which are simply brilliant. Not something for every day, but IMO something to experience at least once in your lifetime.
tiny portions. huge prices. awful service.
chic and delicious

My wife and me "enjoyed" this restauran during our stay in berlin before christmas. I was really amazed, when I called for reservation and found this place almost complete empty. We ordered the dinner menu with 7 or 8 dishes and found the taste really "experimental" maybe even innovative, but nevertheless not good. The portions are extremely small and the taste not everyone's pleasure. It was an expensive experience for me and my wife and we will prefer christmas shopping in Munich in the future (they have better restaurants) Mr. & Ms. Haas
Hoffmann cooked really good i nthe past. Now total rip-off, absurd wine prices.

Awesome dishes - we had the yellow curry (2 different versions) and the dish served in a banana leaf, a few salads and the corn patties, all were great. The service was very fast - we got the menus quickly, and he was patient enough when we were questioning and had special request (make one dish vegan, make another dish tofu-free, etc.), and the dishes arrived quickly. The curry was really good and not too sweet, and the banana-leaf dish was a bit salty and very delicious. Even the meat-eaters loved it!
A little piece of Thailand in Berlin. Amazing food!

After walking out of another, nearby, restaurant (because of off-hand service) my colleague and I were impressed by the excellence of the polite, helpful, but unobtrusive, service in Brechts. Our food was also fine - an outstanding Caesar salad and a very good Wiener schnitzel, with excellent house wine and coffee. A really excellent experience, and a highlight of a weekend in Berlin.
Only thing going for it is location. Damned shame.
great views, good food, and the ability to bypass the long line to the reichstag

Atmospheric and good food! I am a repeat customer and I nearly always visit kartoffelkeller when in Berlin. Warm dunkel lighting and the tree in the entrance makes for a good atmosphere. It can get quite warm though.
My daughter's favorite club sandwich.

Berliner meatballs were a pork hamburger just warmed up in the microwave before being served and currywursts have been standing in the boiling water waiting for a costumer for so long that the peel became a soft, thick crust that didn't stick to the meat anymore. On the positive sides portions are abundant, but what is sold as bottled water is just tap water with a 4.2 euros price tag.
Great German food and beer :-D

I had fantastic brunch here. Lot of different fooods including lamp vindaloo and chicken curry. If you find yourself close to this place on sunday don't hesitate and give it a try. Make sure to try our mango drink as well...

The only reason I am bothering to write this review is because of the first review that is so far from the truth, so false and clearly so negative that I believe it needs to countered with a honest opinion that the restaurant deserves. I have eaten there many times and mostly because many years ago they did this €5 all you can eat lunchtime deal which is now €7 (I think). I have taken visitors to Berlin there on 2-3 occasions. The food has always been of a good, fresh and authentic quality. I highly recommend them.

Single handedly the WORST curry I've ever seen / tasted / heard about / imagined. We ordered four currys, we got given what tasted like two pasta bakes, a chinese and a bowl of salt. Collectively we ate about 9 mouthfuls, and 8 of them were whilst in tears. If you like your garlic naans to be like a half cooked flat pitta bread then you're gonna be laughing. The onion bhajis were acceptable, although we suspect that they picked them up on the way. We were forced into giving one star in the rating. Saying that Anands deserves anything other than getting turned into a block of flats is a disgrace.
Great desserts and coffee. Prices are good compared to other places in Berlin.

Very nice restaurant with very good service and affordable prices. Clear recommendation if you look for all-you-can-eat sushi. Be careful, the AYCE is only available till 9pm. I would recommend to reserve a spot.
12 € is a reasonable price, and also it is good quality. Service is nice.

Brilliant Italian restaurant with amazing atmosphere! Great service, very helpful and pleasant. All food was cooked to perfection. Everything we ordered was nicely prepared, super fresh and delicious. Highly recommend it! Visited August 2013
We don't recommend this restaurant. We have been waiting for two dishes more than 45'. The insalate was too small

I've never had such bad food and bad service in my life. Pasta soaked in olive oil with a little bit of parsley in it was presented as 'Penne with pesto' and some bare overcooked vegetables as 'creamsauce with vegetables'. When I told them this wasn't what was on the menu the waitress got angry, walked away and ignored us untill we wanted to pay. Do NOT eat here!
Horrible food made by the tired people.. Probably fine only if you drunk...

Great comfortable cafe/bar with reasonable pricing. Came in by chance and felt warm and welcome from the beginning. Served very tasteful snacks and salads. Good place for chatting and hanging out with friends. Will be coming back for sure. Looking at the other comments I have to admit that this is a quite quirly place with very unformal and relaxed service.

very different quality of the service, depending of where were working there. We went there 3 times: once for breakfast and twice for an evening drink. The breakfast was good and priceworth, the service this morning a bit cold. The first evening we spent there was very nice, with very good service and normal prices for Berlin but the second time was bad because of the almost unpolite waitress and the attempt to play bad jazz music. It would almost have been better to play the radio.
awesome atmosphere. nice cheap beer.
Cool
loved the pizza, mmmmmm. liked the drinks, slurp. liked the waitress, fapfapfap.
simply the best ;)
Categoría: Hotel "The service is excellent, the rooms are divine, and the food fantastic" ... "Food was ok in the restaurant but nothing great for that price!!!!" ..
Next time again - best hotel in this area. Tea and coffee before breakfast served for weakup at the room.
I love this hotel, I always stay in it when I am in Berlin! I think it is the best!
Pizza 10min to takeaway. And free wifi

If you're from the USA, you'll be surprised to discover that the pizza from Domino's here tastes just like it does back at home - which is great! We ordered Domino's from this location to test it, and it was delicious. This kind of American pizza has a different crust from the pizza you typically find in Germany, and it's quite good (it's a thicker, doughier kind of crust). Also, the quality of the toppings was top-notch. I will be ordering again...

One of, if not the, best restaurants in the area! Amazing food and service. I work nearby and eat here almost everyday. The staff are super receptive to customer feedback and always greet with a smile. I can especially recommend the Jones Burger and the gratin of the day. Great atmosphere and a must do if you're in the area!

I was in Berlin for a family ceremony and we stopped off here for lunch. I have to say the Wiener Schnitzel was amazing, and along with the mashed potato and cucumber salad, was definitely one of the best meals I have ever had. There is a nice ambiance to the place and you can just have a coffee and read the paper if you want.
The best coffee in Germany, and great service and food, plus a bit of culture. Also near to the Berlin Gates.

After reading many good reviews, I had high expectation when visiting this café. It is not the classy viennese coffee house that I had in mind, but rather an old-fashioned coffee house which, as one of the reviews says, seems not having been renovated for some time. I only tried the coffee mélange and applestrudel. The coffee was good, but the applestudel was not as refined as the ones I had in Vienna years ago. It was an a filo pastry sheet wrapping a huge amount of sliced apple with almond and raisin. The texture was totally uninteresting, the taste was just ok. There were bits of non chewable bits of apple. If I go back, I would try something different.
Worth a visit, this is unlike the Einstein chain restaurants - a classy breakfast /brunch in a fine old bourgeois mansion. Excellent value for money and great coffee.
Visited today for a coffe and waffle, service level was unacceptable by female staff
German "Biergarden"! Very nice in summer if you go here with some friends to enjoy german beer and bretzels. It also possible to rend a boat and go around the little lake beside the biergarden.

In May 2013, I booked a wedding reception here for June 28. I have a contract. I went there June 18 to check the final arrangements. The boss Herr Koch was rude and evasive and cancelled my party without giving any reason. The location is lovely. It is very sad that Herr Koch's attitude permeates his staff and they are often lazy and inattentive. There is an expression in Germany: "Die Kunde ist der König aber der Kaufmann ist der Kaiser." The customer is king but the salesman is emperor. This theme is fully applied at Cafe Neuensee. Happily I had contingency plans. The wedding party is bigger and better without the Koch. I will not go back there, except to hiss on it. If I wrote what I mean my comment would be banned.

A gorgeous forest retreat in the middle of the city, by the side of a glittering whimsical lake, with gliding ducks and drifting rowboats. On the shore, under a canopy of leafy trees, the ambiance of this traditional beer garden rivals the best in Southern Germany despite being Northern and in the middle of Berlin. It's serve yourself, cafeteria style, but the food is hearty, tasty and typical. Get a refreshing Pils or a mineral-rich Hefeweizen to wash it down. Next door is a smaller restaurant where indoor seating and table service is available.

This is a very nice place to sit on a sunny day, you can even rent a boat and do a small tripp with it. They serve pizza, salads, ect, and have good cakes. Perfect place to relax after a heqtic day of sightseeing.

Delightful biergarten in the park! We were here on a sunny weekend day in August. We rowed a boat around the pond and then had a nice meal at the cafe. The service wasn't fast but the place was *packed* and the servers were super friendly despite being extremely busy. The food was fairly expensive as well although it was very good and the location is hard to beat.
Fine cuisine, very pleasant interiors and brilliant service. Still, do not expect your average diner prices - this place costs as much as good it tastes.
You won't regret a dinner at this restaurant!
The Intercontinental recommended this restaurant and it was superb. We came 3 nights to have dinner.

Food at its best. The service & views are great, but the food is truly exceptional. The menu was simple, straightforward. The chef came out to talk with us during the 3+ hour meal. Hands down a wonderful dining experience and well worth it.

Day 3: Afterward, get some fresh air while walking to Hugos, where you'll savor French-German nouvelle cuisine in the city's only intimate gourmet restaurant with stunning views of the glittering skyline.
Good food & top service

I was highly disappointed with Edd's Thai of Berlin. Not that overall the food was terrible... it was acceptable. But all the reviews said this place was GREAT, but it was AVERAGE, at best! We trekked through the city to eat here, and I have nothing positive to say. The service was crap. The food mediocre, and they had no rice or noodle dishes. They were very interested in pushing their highly priced fish and prawn courses only. Thai is my favorite style asian food, and I would never go back to this over priced tourist trap.
My entire family and I have been going here for over 20 years to celebrate life-events or just to have a fantastic meal- I could not recommend it more sincerely than that.

Who want to enjoy "real" german food have to go there!!!! The best Food for minimal prices!!!! I never had so good food before! Like: "Roulade mit Kloße und Rotkraut" or "Kasseler". I like Germans! German Food and Beer is the best in world. Go home with French Cousine..... Das nächste Mal in Berlin kommen wir wieder!
Recently closed down unfortunately

Good quality. Portions are big, so having soup, salad and main course was even too much. Staff is also very friendly, speaks perfect English. 25 EUR for three dishes, a coffee and glass of apple juice. I definitely can recommend it.

Good food. A nice place to eat breakfast or lunch (many dishes). They do have main courses also, I but haven't tried them. The scrambled eggs and bacon was a bit dull, but scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and salad was really nice. 20€ for both dishes, bread, two coffees and two glasses of fresh orange juice.
Everything was fantastic. Wonderful food, great atmosphere and great service. I will definitely come back. Thank you!

This one was close to my hotel. I had the crispy duck in coconut curry. Excellent value for the money. The food was very good and the service fast and friendly. Overall a very good vietamise restaurant.
Has free wifi connection. Very friendly and warm staff
Better taste Pho and friendly atmosphere.

Man what is going on here the worst customer service I have had from a mc donalds. Asked to leave top floor because they wanted to close it and left customers standing. Very surprised at how bad this was. A smile is still free?
This is the best cocktail bar I've been to anywhere. The bartenders highly professional and have an incredible selection of alcohol to mix with. Only drawback is that it is allowed to smoke inside.
here we come tonite

We had an enjoyable meal here and I was surprised to see the negative reviews. The place was quiet with only a few other customers, but we had a great welcome in Italian, menu choice and price was good, service was quick and the house wine excellent. Recommend for a casual meal that is well cooked and good service in pleasant surroundings.
Risotto wasn't a real risotto. And as other noted, they still do not accept VISA.

Beware, no VISA accepted. The food was pretty average and the service was not much better. I will NEVER be visiting this restaurant ever again and I urge you not to either. Having spent a few hours over a meal here, I came to pay and it turned out I had no other card but VISA and MAESTRO (they take neither). At this point the waitress summoned her boss who came over and asked if I had a problem. I told him no and was prepared to pay but since they hadn't the facilities I would have to go and get the cash from the cash machine just over the way. I was confronted by both the manager and his wife as though I was a criminal and they said they would ring the Police if I didn't pay. Eventually I was marched to the cash point by the manager. It was completely and unacceptably rude and humiliating. I had spent three hours in the restaurant with plenty of opportunity to run away. They were seemingly too stupid to realise this and instead chose to be aggressive. I urge you not to visit.

Superb pizzas, the dough is crispy and exactly as thin as it should be -a perfect balance with its toppings. A real Italian runs the place, nice and cheerful. Conveniently located in the street opposite to KaDeWe near the U-bahn station Wittenbergplatz (U2).
This is a typical Cantonese cuisine restaurant. We ordered the claypot seafood for dinner. The food turned out to be quite good.
Delicious food, friendly staff and reasonable price.

We hadn't had Persian food this good since we were in Los Angeles. The atmosphere is simple, but the service was very friendly (our waiter could also speak German, English and Farsi) and the chef was obviously very experienced in Persian cuisine. The prices were reasonable as well and the menu included an array of wines and beers as well as strong tea, Persian style. We traveled halfway across Berlin for this meal, and it was well worth the trip!
Lovely original taste. Has all the stews (like Gormeh Sabzi) . Best iranian food in Berlin. Not to be missed.

While I worked on my previous job my colleagues and I used to come here often for some beer and sausages. We gather occasionally nowadays but the food has the same excellent taste as it had had before.
Fantastic place service was superb and the beers where fabulous. Try the mango wheat beer.

Very bad service.... The food is OK for the price... sorry I don't have much good things to say as the awful service can ruin the whole experience. They must train their staff to care and attend the clients/customers and not to make them feel they are making a favor.

My family and friends visited Lindenbrau Sony Center at the beginning of January 2011. We waited waiter during 20 minutes. He had seen us but ever didn't bring menu. I took menu by myself. After that we waited also 10 minutes. Than my wife asked him to take our order. And after 5 minutes he brought a bill to an near table and told us : “ IF you are hurry leave our place” and some other rude words. I was shocked. I traveled a lot, but even in 3rd world countries service is better. Downstairs at bar we asked for manager, but staff told us go out. After 5 minutes discussion they told us that manager was on meeting and couldn't join us. The name of waiter is Jolg M. Hope this was exception, not the rule.

We ordered 2 hamburgers, the burgers was extremely well done. Born, not eatable. We ate only one.. The service was extremely slow, we waited 5 min only for the bill.. And it cost 21€ for the 2 burgers..
Delicious food and amazing location! Other than many negative tips, waiting time was okay, and the staff was nice and friendly! The prices are a little bit higher than expected.
Burnt hamburger, staff couldn't care less about you, avoid. Wish I'd read the rating before I walked in. Hopefully I'll stop someone else from doing so. :-)

There is nothing particularly wrong with this place. It's a typical medico chain restaurant. It has English on the menu so that's helpful. You might get a bad experience the waiters are probably student and so not professional (I guess). If you want authentic Australian Food probably don't got Berlin it's just burgers and stake. I insisted on using my broken GCSE German when ordering but the waiter quite obviously could speak perfect English.
This place is a joke for tourists.

My daughter told me about this place. I tried it and it turned out quite a nice lunch. Elegant and pleasant decor, delicious and rich meals. Service was so professional. My waitress was lovely and friendly. I am thinking of visiting it again soon if I get the opportunity.
Excellent food and service, The veal is to die for.
Day 2: You have surely worked up an appetite during your walking tour of the new cityscape, so go back to Alte Potsdamer Strasse for a business-style lunch at the Michelin-starred Facil.

Just bad as it gets. Quality of the food is worst as it get's!!! Everything is dirty and the staff didn't serve the food for more than 40 minutes without any excuse. Safe your money for anything but not for that restaurant

Super drinks close to the bahnhof, excellent quality drinks! I Can't drink drinks containing White sugar and the staff was very welcoming, Even creating non-sugar varianter :) very cozy! Will come here again :)

Just the worst. Terrible service. Bad smell. Really long wait for everything. It's got a great location, which must be the only reason they have any business. If you're in Potsdamer, save your evening and go elsewhere!
Long wait for expensive but good cocktails
This the most stupid bar in all Berlin. I recommend it for posh snobby hipster rich kids wannabe whatever.
I have never been treated so poorly at a bar, restaurant, or cafe in my life. Unless you enjoy being unnecessarily berated by cranky waiters, I would not recommend this establishment.

If I could rate this with -5 stars I would! WORST dunkin donuts I've ever been to! Super dirty (were talkin trash on the tables and even on the floor!), extremely annoyed and unfriendly staff (quote of one staff-member when we came in: "I need a cigarette break before I freak out in this place") and the donuts tasted very old and dry! Overall rating: yuckie!

I am just back from a weekend trip with one of my friends to Berlin. Having read about Qiu in all our guidebooks we thought it would be worth a try and we were not disappointed, We were staying near by at the Ritz so ideally located for a short 3 minute walk over to the Mandala Hotel where it is situated. So to start we arrived at Qiu and asked to see the cocktail menu, from that we ordered Vespa's and they were incredible, really very good and the service matched. We both ate from a very reasonable menu in the small restaurant and were given a lovely table with a view of the Sony Centre and Film Museum so lots of activity out of the window. I had spaghetti with truffle oil and fillet steak which was divine and my eating partner had fillet steak cooked medium and it was also perfect. We enjoyed many a glass of Veuve Rose which was better value by the glass at 14euro than by the bottle which was around 70euro. We did actually notice that in a few restaurants in Berlin, there didn't seem to be any encouragement to buy a bottle of champagne as it was always better value by the glass assuming only 5.5 glasses in each bottle at the most. So to end, I would not hesitate to go back to Qiu or to recommend it. Enjoy!
Perfect place for morning coffee! You can read your newspaper watching people go by. A good beginning of a good day.
Not the most romantic italian resto but very efficient and decent food. In and out is the way to go. Interesting concept.

The waitress on the Pizza Stand was very rude and frowned at me when she heard me speak english and look Middle-eastern. She asked me to step aside and served the rest of the people. And when the stand was totally empty, she acted as if I'm not there. I had to raise my tone to grab her attention and she even didn't have the curtsey to look at me and passed on her colleague to deal with me in a condescending tone. I thought that was very unfriendly
Food ok but inattentive staff in this one. Or they are just plain understaffed.
very good pasta, not expensive but small dishes...not easy to get a sit.
Were not able to get a seat, speak to someone or eat

The steak was ok - but not as remarkable as the price. The service was really slow, and from I ordered something to drink 'till I got it took 10 minutes. The sauce and the chips where not homemade as annouced but standard "supermarket quality". I pointed this out to the staff and they said that this was a mistake and "only tonight". I don't know... I don't think they where just after me :-| Not good enough.

The food was delicious! Unfortunately, there was a bit of a language barrier, so it was hard to convey that we wanted an English menu. Even after we were struggling with the German menu, the waiter didn't pay attention at all.
Had a really good time,

They were unexpectedly very busy and the whole operation was negatively impacted. Staff stayed nice and it recovered when manager came in. Girl with the tattoos on arm stood out positively. Customers need to learn to act human..
One of the best Asian restaurants I know.
this place is a train wreck. please stop by if you need bad food and terrible service. not to mention a nice evening in the bathroom. never again!

not only did the food not taste good, but my tofu dish had beef bits in it. when my boyfriend (in german) pointed this out to the waitress, she shrugged it off and said it was just tofu. on top of it all, both of us were in and out of the bathroom for many hours after eating the meal.
Was just ok for a weekday lunch. People who love Asian cuisine will like it.
such a beautiful restaurant yet marred by robotic service and luke warm cafeteria food....
are we still in berlin? quality french bistro food, literally in a french bistro.
The food is good, but not great .It needed more spices. The Waiters and Waitresses are not very talkative.
Splashed out on a glass of Dom. Amazing drinks selection!
Looks great. Great black and white photos of fashion models.
The service is the worst i have experienced in any Starbucks around the world.
Leckerer Frozen Yogurt, super Toppings, coole Location, nette Bedienung.
We had a lovely diner at this local charm. The food, wine and service was as good, or better then on our Italian holiday last summer. I can highly recommend this Italian!

I don't know what happen here, but I would love if the owner could read this review. The food doesn't taste the same than in the other Filialen, also the Customer Service is awful, they take ages to bring your order, gives you the feeling that they have no lust to work.
My daughter had her birthday party here. Very classy and decent place. Professional service, rich and delicious meals. I was more than impressed!
Excellent restaurant with fantastic foods. Recommended!
fusion cuisine in a highly designed setting. unfortunately, service does not always match the high price level.
Cool place. Nice view over the city. Stick floor, one cannot take a drink to the balcony...

Went here for food, it was a disaster. We ordered two dinners at 18:20. They brought out two plates of steak fries at 18:40. The fries were supposed to be part of a meal, ate some of them anyway presuming the rest would be along soon but no. Asked the waitress where our food was and she asked what had we ordered and then left us without telling us it would be along soon or sorry for the delay etc. By 7pm there was no sign of the food so I just had to leave, I was going to pay for the steak fries and cokes but was left waiting in the queue for too long. I'd avoid like the plague! The staff are terrible and incompetent. A glass of coke costs almost €4 and there are no free refills! The seats are all on top of each other and it's really cramped. Do yourself a favour and go somewhere else! So glad I didn't have to pay for anything in this substandard venue.

Not exactly the cheapest place to eat in the Arkaden mall, but we decided to go for it. The food was good and served within 5 minutes. All staff members were friendly and polite, especially the young man who originally took our order and brought the cheque at the end. I gave him a tip, which is normally not required in Germany, so he was clearly very happy about it.
Not bad at all... Nice atmosphere, good food, but a little pricier. Still worth it.

Prices are a bit expensive but I was happy to pay more for proper food given some of the other 'food' I was served in Berlin. We found the food to be very nice, well cooked and presented. Our waitress was very friendly. As I said, it was pricey but the meat was nice not like what I was served in another american diner joint.

This drives me crazy and american restaurant that does not offer refills.
