I ordered a filet and the first one that came was awful so i complained and the server was friendly and got me another which was excellent. The cheese cake was great too, but you still can not compare it to NY Style Cheese Cake.
Delicious!
Too crowded and suprisingly small.
It's a small place, but coffee's nice.
YUM!!! The best combination of great ambiance, delicious and super well prepared food and great service, probably the best service in Berlin!

The entranced is located in the backyard of a car repair, class lift to the top, good and stylish restaurant and bar with a great view over the whole city. Old CIA HQ of the western part of Berlin. Close to Potsdamer Platz. Reservations strongly recommended. One of my favorit spots in town.
Excellent views of Berlin but the service doesn't reach the same heights.
Super !!! One of the best Steakhaus. .. leckeren Cocktails. ..
Stopped by this little pub for some food and drink and was not disappointed with the relativeky cheap, hearty fare it had on offer.

Simple food. Excellent taste. Fire in Fireplace... Home atmosphere... The right pub you are looking forward after the horrible experience of globalised asexual restaurants around Potsdamer Platz. I felt happy back in old Europe. Beer, bread, cheese, meat, home!
Awesome lunch and atmosfare.
The staff is really nice and the food is very good. I'd go again without hesitation.
We had a very good experience in the restaurant. The food and the staff were very good and nice. I can only recommend the restaurant.
Best gelato in Berlin by far.
Awesome icecream ;)
Very good Pasta and Pizza!! Staff is friendly and courteous! Very nice place to get away from the crowded city.

First time I tried out conveyor belt sushi. Sushi Circle in Arkaden Shoppincentre is a good place to have some sushi. You pick what you want to eat as it passes you on the conveyor belt and pay according to the number and colours of your plates. A waiter comes around so you can order something to drink. Recommended if you want to have sushi in central Berlin.
Worst smoothie ever - just orange juice, mango juice and icecubes. But the staff were friendly, the location nice, and interior pleasant. Just stay away from the joke of a smoothie.
Great latte, decent croissants, thou not quite the French kind. Efficient baristas. Too hot inside.
Good, cheap, healthy. They don't have air con which was a minor inconvenience on the 32+ degree day I was there.

Definitely the best Arab food in town. If you take the big menu, be warned - after you feel really, really full, you're about half-way through. Leave some space :) The 'smaller' menus are really neat, they have a nice and yummy selection of starters followed by a big meat plate. I have to say that I'm totally in love with the starters, I don't remember eating such good eggplant in a restaurant before. Hummus and meatballs are also top notch. I love the self-made Lebanese lemonade with rosewater. As for the service - yes, avoid the 'rush hours'. Since we went there several times already, the boss recognizes us and is very friendly, as is the staff. However, when the restaurant is full, waiting periods go up and the timing of the food is not always optimal, e.g. main dish arriving too early, drinks are delayed, etc. Go there during the week and you'll have a very pleasant dining experience.

Overall I was very pleased with the food. The menu is more on the Lebanese side. Some dishes were off on the flavor, especially the Hummus or Babaganoush. Both were good but not the kind I prefer. Everything was very fresh and well prepared. We ordered the Mezze plate for 2, Shish Taouk and the vegetarian eggplant special. The chicken was succulent, the eggplant was well prepared and I really like the fresh made pitta bread. Service was slow and very impersonal. Didn't bother me at all but I can see some people getting worked up.
Good quality, nice location, avarage pricing

Soulless-yet-comfy bar with a wide (not especially good) selection of mostly European beers, mostly the most famous of each region. Located in one of Berlin's main tourist areas and usually crowded (that's not usually a bad thing). On the contrary to some of the reviewers, I would not recommend going there with big groups, as we, a group of 10-15 well-behaved, non-drunk german and international grad students, got kicked out by one of the waiters for trying to join to tables together, being the excuse that it blocked his path to other tables. No, he could not have walked to steps to the right to get to the other table. When a bar forgets that it's more about selling happiness than beer and thinks that it can afford to lose customers because they have enough, it should not be recommended. I say that because I work in a bar far more crowded. I also recommend you to just continue your path to the Auguststraße and drink a beer somewhere around there… CHEERS!
Excelent food and service! The sausages with fried fries and bacon are incredible! The apple strudel is very good too! Go there for a wide range of beers and good food!

They have over 100 beers, and each is served in the proper glassware. However, this isn't exactly a haven for beer snobs as there aren't many standout beers. The food was decent. The Milchkaffee was surprisingly good for a bar. Our waiter was nice. Some people in our group didn't speak German, and he was easily able to speak English with them.
Value for money. Pretty nice a place to have a pint, with a cozy & buzzy.atmosphere.
huge assortment of international beers. WLAN. Nice english speaking staff. Good basement club for private or public parties.

We've been living in Berlin for 3 months, and this was the worst service experience so far. It was hard to get the servers' attention, and we were obviously being ignored. Our orders were forgotten, and we had to beg for a second round of drinks. My wife and guests were visibly frustrated with the experience, and what could have been a very enjoyable "Kaffe ind Kuchen" turned into a wasted 100 Euro.
We didnt get not good food, the place seems better than the service and the food was! They dont care of thems customers.... :-[

I had the Turkey Tajine and, wow. I know turkey can be hard to cook but this was just ridiculously dry and tough. It tasted like overheated leftovers. The reason I compare it to airline food is that the sauce it came in tasted like that sauce they cook airline chicken in-- like something you could have gotten out of a jar at Rewe. But at least airline chicken is moist! The date, almond rice was also of the same caliber. I could easily do better cooking for myself. Really, excepting a few small touches like fresh herbs cut on top, I could have gotten this at Ikea... I'm actually going to try Oranium again though because I feel like this just had to be a fluke. I'll update my review when I do. But until then, I can't recommend it.
Very average sandwich. Terrible fish and chips. Big menu, nice atmosphere. Wouldnt come back.
Best thaï food I've ever had, for a ridiculous price!
Very much enjoyed it. They serve authentic thai food. I strongly recommend the Gaeng.
Some of the best Thai I've had.
Third time at Cafe Orange today, immer schøn¡
A fun pub, well located.
What a night! Barca won and the atmosphere was great! Check out the red bull shot!

What a winner! We were seated a bit to the side but still we had a great time. The clientelle (Saturday) was classy - the place was buzzing. Waiters were alert, but managed to toss me a GT in place of a Whisky Sour. This was delivered minutes later, and was worth the wait. Their Porterhouse did wonders - juicy, reach floavoured, delicious sides. The wine card was very good - I believe we had a Cheval Blanc, which we savoured.

Service terrible. Waitstaff has too many tables and cannot do its job. When food comes out served by 3 busboys they have no idea "who gets". Took 3 hours for dinner and we never got to order dessert and coffee. We were one of a dozen tables for 10 and they are set up for that. However, the system of service is simply impossible. None of us would ever return. There are more than enough terrific restaurants in Berlin. FORGETABOUTIT.
stuffy atmosphere and overpriced food.

Total Scene. Food is excellent. But not exceptional. Atmosphere is loud with public made of bankers, artists, tall, buxom eastern european hostesses, bulldogish bling-bling bald-headed russians....and more...worth the trip and the experience.
Nice place. We didn't eat there, but the setting is great

This restaurant is truly awful - the food is disgusting and badly prepared and the menus are sticky. The odour of the place leaves a lot to be desired - it smells filthy.The sauces are generic and over oily and the waiters are the worst waiters I have ever been served by anywhere in this city Berlin.There is nothing about this food that is Indian - one would do better on an aeroplane or Marks and Spencers..This was a waste of time and money. Aggressive macho backward male idiots serving is not a good idea.
Food was delicious. Service was great. Priced were fare. Couldn't ask for more.
next to Freicdrichstadt Platz, nace place to go before or after the show
Food was excellent. Service was even great

I loved/did not like Murphy's Pub & this is why... -First time we went in, it was raining. We were cold, wet & very hungry. I ordered the potato soup with sausages (I think it was potato.) & my husband ordered the baked potato w chili. My soup was fine, except the sausage was more like three little pieces of weiny (smaller then a hot dog). My husband's potato with chili was sans the potato & frozen in the center. We were too hungry to not eat it anyways & just chased it down with a beer & stopped at the market down the street. -The second time, was around 11pm for a night cap, which turned into whiskey shots, which turned into a raucous night that lasted until about 6am. Overall, great bar. Find food somewhere else.
Awesome bar with a great atmosphere, live music shows, and cheap prices. Try there rump stake cooked on a heated rock!
Awesome Irish Coffee:)
Had a GIGANTIC Berlin-style pork joint there, absolutely worth the money, and I shamefully didn't finish it... It's a nice place to dine & drink, with lovely staff members in cute galluses.
Really nice place. Good beer, simple and good food.
We stayed here for 4 nights during the Ifa and were in love with the service, the buffet breakfast and the hotels location. On the side of the river you get a great view from Cafe madrid.
Loved it. Would highly recommend it to any fan. Well worth €5 considering a bottle of beer is included with that.
Small but great museum with lots of letters, photos, posters and other stuff. A must for any fan of Ramones, that is, for any thinking person.
If you love the Ramones and you're in the area, there's no excuse for not visiting!

A brilliantly put together tribute to one of the most influential bands of all time. With a mix of the collection built up by Flo Hayter who created the museum plus recent contributions from the band and key figures like Arturo Vega (designer of the Eagle logo) and Danny Fields (original Ramones manager) this is a must visit for anyone who is a fan of the band. Great cafe too! Martin
Awesome muesum, with great acustic shows from time to time!

I went to this restaurant with the family after reading the positive reviews here and was not disappointed. We got a selection of dishes, all were very good. Services was OK, but not great - so they lose one star from me. Decor only average, but the great sushi compensates for it. I'd go back.
Best Sushi in Berlin!!! no other is as good!! try number 161 and 138 from the menu- ull love it!
Nice sushi place with ok prices
Quepasa-Mexican restaurant in Berlin. The best Mexican restaurant I have seen so far. I like Suppen and Nudeln in Quepasa. Great food with good service and for reasonable price. Deserves Full mark!!!
One of the best Mexikanisches restaurant in Berlin. We had great Mexican food with good quality for cheaper price. I feel its the Best Mexican restaurant in Berlin.
Nice place, good food, moderate price.. All in all... Big like
Very nice staff actually from India, good food and decent prices for the zone, especially for lunch. Highly recommended.

good atmosphere, nice location, cool interior design, loungy music and tasty sushi - so far so good. very arrogant staff, they expect you to be grateful for being placed and giving the order instead being friendly and thankful because the guests paying their vages, crazy... they really think to be that unique that they can treat the guests like that. maybe the boss should have a look more often whats going on there

overprized and unhappy staff ... waiter complained about the tip ... please note: first of all, by LAW! in Germany tip is not required! All service fees have to be included in the final bill. So, commonly people simply round up ... and add a Euro or 2 or 3 - sometimes 5 if it was outstanding ... Our waiter though, for just putting 3 bottles of wine on the table (that's all we had and really doesn't require much service at all and took 3 minutes of his time, wasn't happy with our 7 Euro tip and followed us outside complaining. I have never experienced anything like that. I guess one should remind them of whats custom in Germany. Americans: DO NOT feel obliged to tip like you do in America - as a matter of fact, waiters won;t say anything of course. But in Germany we do not like to have our customs ruined by your excessive tipping, which is based on the fact, that you don;t pay your waiters anything in the states (not even talking about benefits or health insurance) and they primarily have to live off their tips. NOT SO HERE! And PanAsia, please educate your staff!
Best asian food in town? The offer a variety of fish, meat, vegetarian and vegan food. During lunch time a reservation is helpful.

Location: Just 200 meters from Berlin's tourist vortex (Hackescher Markt). Stylish, but not over the top. Food: kind of generic, Asia-something. IMO, too expensive for what's being offered. Service: (usually) friendly, but sometimes overwhelmed. Beverages: You may find the wine prices adequate - until you realize they are for 0,1 l glasses (not the usual 0,2 l). I like their smoothies, though. All in all: Too little in terms of quality, too expensive. But a nice location to meet friends when you're in Berlin-Mitte.
Found the food to be unremarkable. The Hot & Sour soup was salty.
Very disapointing and expensive. By the way the waiter forced us to order some meals and finally the tip we wrote on the card ticket was modified!

First of all.. I went twice to the restaurant because I thought maybe I picked the wrong dish.. But I didn't. I know a couple of turkish restaurants in Berlin and the Hasir Restaurant is way not the best in Berlin. It is totally overpriced (for Berlin), the dishes are way too small and the service is also bad. Our waiter wasn't friendly at all and I did not feel comfortable there. We payed for meat around 12 euros, as I said, small dish and not very good quality of the meat. So if you would like to get to know turkish food you should better go to another restaurant (for example Honca restaurant, which is a little bit more expensive but it is worth the price!). The only good thing in the restaurant was Künefe, a turkish dessert.
Good value, nice surrounds, could have been fresher.

This place seems to have gone downhill. We visited Goko three times over the last two years, most recently on the last night of our visit to Berlin. The food was poor. Gyoza were luke warm and tasteless and served on brown iceburg lettuce. The avocado unagi don was overpriced for a minuscule and tasteless portion of eel with old avocado. The decor and toilet resemble more a cheap basement restaurant in London's Soho than a restaurant that prices itself at this level. Items we tried to order were unavailable and we couldn't pay with a card because their machine was broken. Maybe we were just unlucky, but we'll be breaking our tradition of coming here next time we're in Berlin.
Fairly expensive but food tastes like in Japan. Tuna was not as good as at Tsukiji fish market in Tokyo, but I guess that it's impossible to match.
The food and lemon cheesecake were just OK, not the Brownie that tasted industrial. The staff was in the limit of rudeness. There are better places to go in Berlin.

I travel to Berlin every 2 months and people have been telling me about Barcomi's for some time. Finally went there today. It took us @ 30 mins to receive our food. There were 13 customers, 4 waitstaff and 3 kitchen workers. A long wait. My 8 Euro rueben arrived with 2 small slivers of less than avg quality corned beef, a small spoonful of sauerkraut, and dime- sized amount of dressing you couldn't taste on Potato bread instead of rye. They were out of rye but didn't inform me when I ordered. It was garnished with 2 tomato slices and browned lettuce - unbelievable! My wife's Turkey Club had a small slab of uncooked bacon on it - think it may have been slightly warmed in the microwave. I complained to the waiter who then brought me a half frozen sliver of cheesecake as consolation - half a full piece. My wife and I considered enjoying it w/coffee on the way back - tasted it on the U-bahn and threw it away - it was gooey and didn't taste good at all. My tab was 20.60 w/2 teas. You can get good quality warm meals for 2 for that price or a few euro more in Berlin or better sandwiches and cheesecake for half Barcomi's prices at most German bakeries. Turns out that Barcomi's is only a bit of hipster hype - nothing more.
very nice place, even better after they refurbished the place

A shameless Spanish restaurant in the centre of the Mitte in Berlin. The food is crap -to cold served - ready on a plate in the fridge. Gamba's in garlic - tasteless like water. A poster of a bull in a place doesn't mean you can call yourself a Spanish restaurant. Don't go there. 27 sep 2010. Patrick
don't forget to reserve a table if you are more than 2 people. It's not very big, but very tasty.

We went here one night and we all had the best steak experience of all times, BUT the next night we went again, since we wanted to relive it before heading home to Norway, but ended up VERY dissapointed. Our meat was way overcooked and the seasoning to the potatoes and vegetables were non-existing. The waitor even said he had tasted it and it was not good, and that it was another chef then the previous night. (I had asked for a medium-rare and got a well done steak for 25 euro). We asked for a discount, but the chief said no (Probably since we were tourists..). The waitor was so sweet though, and we all saw he was really embarrased. But, awful customer service.

This corner Italian Eatery is a trusted place to stop for dinner! Nice furnishing, they take VISA without pain. The food is of the expected quality. Heavy on the Italian seafood choices which are not my main interest, but everyone at my table was VERY happy with their meal as I was with my spaget and meatballs. 4 stars also carries a higher than average price for food/drink but well worth it if you want to impress friends or say thankyou for their hosting you in the Mitte area!

Food was quite nice and used some interesting flavour and ingredient combinations, which was refreshing to find. However, the service ruined everything. We had an extremely rude waiter (even for Berlin standards!) who spoke to us like we were stupid with a very derisive and aggressive tone, and did not miss a chance to patronise us. The experience was tainted and I won't be going there again.
We only had cocktails but they were delicious and the waitress was charming.

Nice food for a fair price. Classy and warm atmosphere. The waitress spoke English and was helpful with recommending lunch. We had the continental breakfast and the risotto with chicken. Both meals were very tasty.

This tourist trap, cleverly disguised as a hole-in-the-wall restaurant, serves decent food and revolting service. Can you find worse places to eat in Berlin? Sure. But why put yourself through the service nightmare? I had just moved into the neighborhood and decided to try a local restaurant my first night - the meal at Oxy was quite tasty. However, I was treated as a burden. I waited 20 minutes for a waiter to take my order (they were standing in the door way chatting while I made eye contact. Rolling their eyes, one finally came over) and after literally throwing a basket of bread onto my table, I was allowed to order my meal. Tasted good, yes, but it wasn't some gourmet extravaganza. Could have gone to any place and enjoyed better service.

Fantastic curry wurst in Berlin. We almost didn't stop because of the line, but figured the locals must know that it was worth it. Staff was very friendly and quick. The currywurst itself was fantastic. Who knew a sausage and fries smothered in curry sauce and powder could be so good? Well I guess I did, which is why we stopped, but I digress. Fries were fresh made and nice and crispy. Definitely a great quick stop for lunch of a snack. Convenient when exploring Berlin.
Perfect meeting spot, or chilling spot. Staff speaks english and german. Location is convenient, good shops all around. Food, coffee, salads, etc.
Best coffee in town! Amazing Bircher Mursli! Must have! Great sitting outside!!!
Amazing whiskey selection and super helpful staff

Die Lokalität hat zwar eine schöne Atmosphäre aber der Wirt war sehr unfreundlich und respektlos, als ob ihm alle Gäste zu viel wären. Darauf angesprochen blieb er trotzdem auf seinem hohen Ross und konnte sich nicht zu einer netten Kommunikation durchringen. Nice ambience. But the host was unbelievably unfriendly and had no respect for his guests!! It actually seemed like the guests weren't even welcome (even though the place was half empty). After bringing that up, he wasn't even able to apologize or try to comfort his guests.

I arrived around 8 and found the atmosphere slightly drab with only 5 or so others dining, which then resulted in the service being slightly too snappy, leaving only seconds between most of dishes... Saying that, the waiting team and sommelier were friendly and knowledgeable. The food was of a very high quality indeed - I took the small taster menu which was hugely accomplished and most of the dishes were on point: the oyster with ponzu was superb, as was the kimchi and the vegetable dumpling. If you catch Dos Palillos on a busy Berlin evening it could be the one.
Had a very nice lunch..
Slow, forgot my breakfast, unpolite. Bref a nogo
The best ice cream ive had in berlin
great place with climate! fanatastic place for drink coffee, wine or something else!

In the heart of Mitte on Rosenthaler Strasse. Lots of fresh fish, traditional Italian! Atmosphere, a 5* Waiters a bit curt, but works in this place. Food, wine, never a letdown. Only reason not 5* is the price. Bruchetta, Bolonase, 1/2 liter of wine 25 EUROS with TIP...too much to just drop by regular. But if you want to impress your hosts, or visitors, take them here!!!

Horrible restaurant. I went there with my girlfriend and ordered a chinabox. Sat down and because she's not into chinese she took out her own sandwich. Manager starts yelling in german, I ask what is the problem - "no outside food! no outside food!". I try to be reasonable and politely explain I have made an order there and the table is already occupied by us so it doesn't matter whether she eats the sandwich. Manager keeps yelling in a very rude fashion and ultimately kicks us out. Went there regularly. Will never go again. Zero stars, poorest customer treatment I have ever encountered :(
A really good place with delicious fresh pizza or pasta :) you can pay with card and bring your dog, which was a totally nice touch and another reason to love this place :)
Great location and good drinks.
Lovely restaurant at the riverside, good food, good service.

Can recommend the pizza with parma ham, rucola, parmesan. the location by the spree is unbeatable. be there early to get hold on the menu of the day too. they've run out of the set lunch when we arrived at 2pm.
This is an awesome place for chilling with your friends into the wee hours of the morning!
Great food and service at a reasonable price.
Great beer. Ruthlessly efficient staff. They are brusque but get it done.
Too touristy for me but the beer was very good!...

Avoid this place. I came to this place today just to be insulted. I came to the place, had a look around, then approached the waiter and asked in English (sorry, I never studied German) “Can I have a lunch here”, the waiter said “No” and left as if I wasn't welcome at that place. If I was an owner of that place I would fire that guy right away. It was the very first place I visited after arriving to Germany, and I had a very warm welcome, didn't I? There are better places nearby, just 2 minutes away. Visited on 9 April 2012.
A bit touristy but good for small or big groups

Good food, good beer and good service. It's a very touristic place, but we couldn't find nothing similar in the streets nearby so we decided to eat here. Service is good (quite slow but it's something usual on a big restaurant like this) and food is tasty and affordable. Nice place!

Avoid at all cost! If you want the tourist trap, this is the place to go. With that comes slow, slow service, forgetful waiters and bland, food. And at quite steep prices. If you want to look like a moronic tourist, feel free.
Very good food and service. Was open on New Years day which was a god send with three hungry kids moaning after been dragged around for six hours. Thought it was part of a chain?
Friendly, prompt service,great beer, nice atmosphere, great beer. Very good food for the price.
Fantastic food, very authentic Mexican tacos. Service is friendly but the kitchen is quite slow - we waited almost an hour for our main course and were glad we'd ordered a starter.
Great food, service is a little slow though.

Looks well and pleasent surroundings. Clean and simple. Food was ok in fact quit tasty, but dont expect anything included. No water no bread no smiles. The service was slow but functional. Clearly they pay the cook better.

Well, they certainly don't close at midnight, given that I missed the last train more than once while there. While there isn't much to say about the place, there is something strange and beautiful about this dump - seriously. It's a dude's bar, and that's a good thing. It's not a kneipe. It's not looking for a Michelin star. It's a bar, and that in itself is a glorious thing.
good drinking place. one of the best places in berlin.!!
Typical "Irish" pub for homesick tourists

If you are under 50 years old and in Berlin on a weeknight, do yourself a favour and find another Irish Pub. This pub closes around midnight if it's not full. You may waste quite a lot of time on the U or S Bahn to get to Hackescher Markt only to find it closed. Disappointing for an Irish Pub in a city like Berlin.
they show spanish football!
The only place to go - hands down. This is a must to get your night started and to have a great time with no further destination. A++
Great place to hang with old friends and make new ones.
Great barkeepers and a very friendly atmosphere.
The service is nice and the food is great ! Delicious pizzas for a good price !
Kind fast service

I have passed this place several times and only recently had a chance to try this place out and I am very glad I did. The lighting and decor put you at ease and the menu has an excellent variety of pastas and mediterranean tapas...oh man I didnt even get to the main courses because the entre variety platter for two was more than enough for me, talk about delicious: dates and apricots wrapped in bacon, tomato/basel/mozzarella, one spicy variety of bruschetta the other with an olive spread, a refreshing tomato based salsa (still tasted great the next day too), and a small cup of sweet beef carpaccio. The waitress was also very engaging and friendly with a good knowledge of which wine to pair with our taste buds. All around excellent evening. Word of advice, the concept of tap water is not the same as in the States, here you order Stilles Wasser which is water without gas.
Can you believe they *refused* to serve me a glas of tap water with my fully ordered meal? At noon, do not expect good, friendly service, the food be as good as it may.

Spent 2 hrs there enjoying beer, coffee and cocktails wif my bro and dad. Found it excellent. They make a mean mojito, they're open 24/7 and we were waited on in an exemplary way. Never intrusive, always attentive. The hanging chairs are a lovable extra and the decor is worth watching - for at least a day or two. I didn't experience the food, so ignore the mark I had to give in order to be allowed to submit the form.
I've been there for lunch with my friends. We ordered mainly cheesburgers with beer and cokes. Nothing to report.
got in for a cuple of beer and aa bruskata , was all tasty and good , the atmosphire is excellent.

I add a very bad experience in that restaurant. When the bill came: bottle of water was billed 6,50 euros and there was an additional cost of 3 euros. When I asked the waiter about this unexcpected cost he said it was automatically added to the bills: when I asked where it was written on the menu then he finnaly removed it. Best way to avoid it: don't go !
I was there for breakfast with my friends. The portions are small compared to other restaurants.
30 minutes to get 3 coffees. Very unfriendly and unprofessional service stuff.
Poor service, very long waiting
The salad and spaghetti were amazing!
TOLLE COCKTAILS. LECKERSTES SUSHI EVER
Good place to grab a sandwich or a cake. My serrano ham sandwich with parmesan was a bit small, but good value for the money. The apple-pie thingy could have had more apple in it...
Nice coffee and pastry... Try the Danish :-)
I've experienced seriously indifferent service from waiters who just seem a bit "too cool for school". Or, as it's also known, arrogant. I would definitely not return.

Not a gastronomic gem Neither a good dining experience Little variety in the menu and poor presentation of the dishes Poor service: too much waiting time for ordering too much waiting time for being served.... Overall a poor experience
We felt very welcome when we went there! The meals were fantastic at taste and beautifully decorated!
I called them once for a friend's party! They did ok! The food was fresh and tasty! The service was on time!
Zagar's overall review is right except for the snooty part. The place is great. Everything about it is terrific. Having been in Berlin for a week, this was my favorite.
Poor service, unfriendly atmosphere. No style whatsoever. Is it a sports bar? It seemed of lower niveau. Food and taste is not the only reason why people dine out.

Food at Savignyplatz outlet is much better though i like the decor at this one better. Pizzas def the highlight. though i have to say that it's rather pricey considering you can get better italian quite easily for less.

Food is alright, not great. Portion sizes are decent. The place can get loud - there are trains passing overhead, and if it's packed, there's a lot of noise. Service seems to have deteriorated considerably since I went there for the first time, and I probably won't return anymore.

The food was ok - good taste and nice size. However, they charge you around 4 euros per coke. You just find out when you get the check because they don't show the coke price on menu. If they've not scammed me, definitely i could give them a nice recommendation. However, when you pay 9 euros for two cokes and 9 euros for a good pasta, the entire meal tastes bad.
"veggie heaven! despite the ""shabby chic"" of the place, staff can be quite snobby sometimes. and it would help, if the rather pricey menu changed from time to time."

We are heavy people and enjoy a lot of food.this time on our family trip to Berlin, we stopped in and were extremely happy with everything we had. The service was exemplary, the food exceptional, and a wine selection you don't find in most Italian restaurant . The only thing if you can critique at all this little Gem in Berlin would be the portion size. But as I said in the beginning, were big people with huge appetite. So what do ya do? Order triple the servings as we all did. The food is exquisite so your wallet wont mind. My best to Massimo

What a terrific restaurant. Good size. Beautifully appointed. Staff is smiling and wonderful. Food is great. Tables well spaced. Busy by 9pm so there's a great vibe. Nicely priced. We were a group of 8 and had a terrific time.
For me it's a must stop during the Berlinale in February. Gracious and inviting, I am never disappointed.
Decor is nice, service is good. Food is of good quality, but portions are really small. This makes the place a bit overpriced.

Great place. You can make your own chocolate, have a hot chocolate upstairs in the cafe, or browse through all the different kinds of Ritter Sport chocolate they have. The prices of the chocolate are very reasonable. Absolutely worth a visit!
Amazing place. Can get a custom made chocolate (takes 30 min to make). Very reasonable prices.

Kids and Adults alike will enjoy a visit to Ritter. Ritter has been a favorite chocolate of mine for years. This store is a great way to take advantage of trying all those flavors you haven't as of yet. Of course, then there is the ultimate benefit, you get to make your own chocolate bar. You get to choose 3 ingredients to make your own particular flavor. Just make sure to budget at least 30 minutes for the bar to set and the line can be long to make your own bar.
I like this place !!!
Great for chocolate lovers.
excellent food in a wonderful setting on the gendarmenmarkt filled with very pretty and fashionable people. zehr schon!!!
Their staff does not like guests, that is for sure.
Reasonable Japanese food. Reasonable price. Gyudon was great. Gyoza was boiled rather than fried and served with chilli sauce instead of gyoza sauce but still pretty nice!
They only had the 3rd dish I wanted to order! Why keep the rest of them on the menu at all? Went with Japanese people who found the food ok-ish, especially given that the prices are reasonable.
Excellent if you like seafood ;)
Feels liek Fast food but still in a good quality and nice pice

We went for lunch and you can choose from the menu and do one, two or three courses. The food is great and the fish dishes are particularly good. Lunch is a very good deal compared to the dinner menu prices. The atmosphere is formal and the service is all very attentive.

I went with friends and we chose the lunch menu option to check it out the quality and all in gerneral (before spending a fortune at a special dinner). - Excellent service, - Great but not terribly innovative food (my sole was a bit on the boring side) . However, the prices for drinks were a nasty surprise. Charging me 10+€ for a fruit juice (home made ok, but still) and a truckload for water leaves a bitter after taste. Especially if you consider that my friends who did accompanying wines for each course and paid almost the same per glass! Those wines were really excellent and the sommelier, an amazing guy, knows what he is doing. Then there was me, sitting there and missing all the fun because I had to drive. I felt really taken aback, to be charged the same price for a simple glass of juice as my wine enjoying friends. Not only that, I had to actively ask what non alcoholic options there would be for me. Noone bothered to check whether I wanted to have something else instead, after I declined the wine with the argument I had to drive. Also the glas of champagne, offered in the beginning was with over 20€ too much for a friendly starter. I would expect a glas to be 15€ if it was offered like that without price information. It was not a mind blowing champagne either. I fully understand that the the low lunch menu price has to be cross financed and drinks is were the money comes in. However, with a glass of champangne, some water and one glass of juice, I managed to DOUBLE my bill. This is not ok. I honestly rather pay 10 - 15€ more for the set menu and feel like prices somewhat correlate to the actual worth. Yes so, great restaurant with fresh and amazing ingredients. Not terribly exciting when it comes to composition and beware of drinks.

We were staying at the hotel and decided to come for a light lunch. Mistake. You can't do that. What we had was excellent but it's a formal, 2 star restaurant (they told us) and so our "light lunch" included 2 different amuse bouche and an appetizer. Naturally, it took a while and was hideously expensive.....but that was our fault, not theirs. For a long, relaxing lunch or for a proper dinner, this would be great.
Keine Seife in WC - No soap in WC - Kakerlake auf dem Teller!! - Not expected live cockroach at the plate!!
Fantastic service, and possibly the greatest steak I've ever had (medium rib-eye). Slightly above average prices for Berlin but absolutely worth the extra few Euros. Thoroughly recommended!
Currywurst was better in a street shop...

Situated under the S-Bahn arches, a bit of old Berlin, with food to match. The decor is of another era, 1900 or so, but the food is today, fresh, well prepared, well presented. In our group of 4 we all enjoyed our choices, and had a great time. Check it out, on an interesting street. Enjoy!

While the food wasn't so bad, the service there was just terrible. We had this horrible waitress 'Bahr' (I believe that's her name) who was the rudest person I ever met in my life and gave us reason enough to never set foot in that restaurant ever again. No respect for the client, for no reason she would yell at us, she wouldn't even serve us as requested then tell us to shut up if we try to argue. I do not recommend anyone going there.
Cold soup food can be bettet
Decebt place. Nice beer n price was ok
Pleasant atmoshpere, interesting decor. Good but simple food, very good value.
Love this place. Best veiner schnitzel in Berlin. Beautiful restaurant in old bank building. Very clean. Great service. Nice crowd.
Fantastic service and food. Can't understand how anyone could fault it!
Horrible Experience- Staff is not competent - did not bring correct meals or describe meals correclty, Ok tastingy food but not special for the price,
Horrible Experience- Staff is not competent - did not bring correct meals or describe meals correclty, Ok tastingy food but not special for the price,
Excellent food but also quite pricy
Good to eat when you are hungry nearby... Not memorable food but good enough. Friendly staff.

The bouncer had no systematic approach of who can pass and who doesnt. His excuse for not letting us pass was too many guys r already in there. When we told him well com back with our girls, he said no we cant mix tue foreigners with the locals. WTF
Don't waste your time. Don't go there! Poor staff...
By far the worst club in Berlin! I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, the lady at the front only lets in specific people, there is no method to her selection.

Compared to the last 4-5 clubs I went to in Berlin, Cookies was by far the worst. Pretty lame music, expensive drinks, and the bouncers acted were looking for bribes unless you had attractive girls w/ you. Check out Prince Charles, similarly classy but not as douche
Nice and play good music Ska and Reggae
CROWDED!! Hell, left the shop after 5min, staff was completely overtaxed, something like 30 pax waiting in a row to get some coffee, typical german behaviour? ;-)

I had to find a place where I could spend 8 hours with free WiFi access, power outlets and nice atmosphere. WONDERPOTS frozen yogurt is surely the best place I could find. The frozen yogurt is simply amazing. A lot of fresh and natural toppings. I strongly recommend it if you need a place to chill out and eat delicious and healthy food.
The best Muffins & Frozen Yoghurt that you can get in the world... the bad point... you will get addicted haha, the store is also very cool.

Fantastic place to chill and meet friends. Used to be my favorite place in Mitte for an afternoon chat. Nice decor, not modern but just cozy and simple... Some staff are super nice and some are just ok. The ones working there when the place opened up were really service oriented and friendly. Went there yesterday and was not swept off my feet by service nor friendliness. Recently, all of a sudden the portions are smaller. At first the classic pot was a generously filled pot of yogurt with three toppings that were also not just a sprinkling. now, when I was there last, the portion has diminished and so has the quantity of topping. Since I love that place, I bought a card for ten classic yogurts and if they are not giving the full amount because of my voucher I am very disappointed! Will give it another shot (have to) but would not recommend the product- price ratio at the moment. While I still love that place, I am not a fan of buying overpriced yogurt. I guess I am disappointed because I know that they were more generous ... if you go there for the first time, you would not even know!
Fantasic yogurt and fruit toppings! I'm not really sure if its yogurt because it tastes so good it might be somethings greater.
Nice place to relax in. Do regimens it!
Great cocktails in the classic style, friendly owner and great Jazz tunes selected from an extensive Vinyl library

Maredo as a chain is always a good place to eat. It was my wife's first time in Berlin and after a bit of walking about she wanted something hearty to eat and as this is not a million miles from the major tourist sites in Berlin it's worth a visit. Service was a bit slow and the staff were a bit surly shall we say. The food itself was served quickly and was really, really tasty. For a day or night out with some decent food, it's worth a go if you want something less stereotypically German.
Not even a toilet... any restaurant should have a toilet
Wrong entry.

This review is for all the Subways in Berlin, why the hell they still don't accept Credit Card or EC ? You better be prepared with cash, because the guys NEVER tell you before you order that you cannot pay with card, we are in the 2013 & we are in Berlin, get it !! I will never go to Subway anymore. Also the staff is always unpolite, seems like Subway just hires mad & frustrated people !!

1. No Sub-of-the-Week or -Day offer. Rather expensive for Berlin. 2. Had quite a discussion with the staff about having my footlong cut in two halfes and packed separately - the discount for a footlong would not apply, they said. Eventually they accepted it, but still emphasized that it is an exception and they wouldn't do it next time.

Not up to the usual standard of Subway. The ingredients weren't the freshest which is what Subway has built it's name on. The lettuce was turning brown. Nice size unit for a Subway though with seating outside which is great. The staff were excellent and spoke good english. If the food was fresh it would've been one of the best Subways I ate in.
A lovely place to buy coffee. Or also quickly drink a coffee - free for Nespresso members.
I am loving it
Soooo excited to find a D&D in Europe!!!

Borchardt has style, personality and self-possession. It also serves excellent food (at a reasonable price) and gives one a real sense of being in a place that matters -- for one thing, the opportunities for people watching are unrivalled. Unfortunately, and as a number of reviews on this thread indicate -- this can be alienating. So, if you want your food served in a reliable, controlled and sterile sort of way, this is not the place for you. If, on the other hand, you prefer something a little bit less spiessig at dinner time, and can appreciate that eating in an excellent restaurant can have something of the theatre about it, you won't go far wrong here.

Day 1: The noise of the nation's top politicians and journalists and the occasional Hollywood star chit-chatting may be overwhelming at this French brasserie–style restaurant, but the nightly “see and be seen” game is fascinating.
Good place for people-watching. Bad place if you want to eat well.
Was there before that chef appeared and was ok with food and service. Now there's this big man in a chef's costume, trying to drag people into the restaurant. He is annoying.
Always be aware of a man dressed in chefs garb who drags customers off the street. The atmosphere is good. Service good... our food was poor. Only eat here if your hungry.

Not nice! This goes down as one of the worst restaurants i have ever eaten in! My main coyrse came out at the same time as my starter, the waiter didn't have a clue what we were saying/ asking for and he was slow and rude. Not sure why my friends paid the service charge.... horrible, horrible place!!! DO NOT GO HERE!!!
This place is horrible. The quality of their food is sub par and their service is atrocious. The servers avoid eye contact with patrons in fear they may have to serve them!
My favourite place to eat in Berlin, the steak is the best i've had and the Mexican food is first class. Very friendly staff and a nice atmosphere.

No, it will not make you proclaim that you've finally found everything you've missed about Tex-Mex cuisine in the States. But the quality is better than most Tex-Mex places here in Berlin and the portions are oof-tastic -- and that there's enough to bring you back.

I enjoyed their chicken Fajitas but they do not compare to what you get in the states, It did not say that they where HOT on the menu, nothing about Chilis and i can not handle HOT food… Staff are very friendly. I will definitely return but next time i am going to ask about what i order.
I like the atmosphere. Its a great place.
I've been there several times and the food is always wonderful, plus it's so convenient if your in the center of town.People are friendly & service really good!
Quality products, lean food, great coffees (espresso beats anyone in Germany, latte is stronger than most), good prices. Friendly. No seating at this place.

To find out why specialities are called specialities!! Imagine: You are walking through the centre of Berlin, coming from Alexanderplatz and willing to visit the Brandenburger Tor. Somewhere, halfway, you feel the need to rest and to have a little refreshment. Take a chair on the terrace of this place. Have the courage to order some Berlin speciality next to the drink you want. You'll be amazed, because if you taste the currywurst or the kartoffelsuppe, you will only want more of this superbly prepared food!
Brilliant beer and food. The service was first class. Choose the pork its gorgeous. Sat outside and watched a rabbit casualy eating flowers.
Fantastic pork knuckle and beer
Very tasty and cheap food. Nice portions which most people didn't finish. Go for the smoked pigshoulder!
Good beer, great location, nice place to warm up.
It's fine for what it is, a place to refuel in a shopping area.
Good steak, casual friendly. Salad was terrible though.
Delicious steak... very strategic location...i love Berlin ♥♥

Living in Europe I've been craving good steak... their Filet was amazing and loved the pepper and sour cream in my jacket potato. We went back for hamburgers for lunch a couple of days later. A little disappointed that they didn't come with on a hamburger bun (it was open faced with a slice of garlic bread underneath) but still very tasty and the quality of the meat showed.

We went to this Block House restaurant in Dec. 2009. Waitors smiling and very friendly. The steaks are perfectly cooked, and the side dishes are delicious. The selection of desserts are classic, but very tastful and nicely served. Quality, quantity and price suits each other. Block House are a pleasant experience every time.
Very good food and cosy environment . .rhe staff is nice but the food took ages to arrive.

First impression was a hectic but friendly atmosphere. The service was friendly, but the waitress waited to many tables which led to stressed ordering and long waits. We ordered a combination starter and a combination main course for two. The starter was huge, but tasted as it was forgotten in the fryer. It was too greasy and way to much for two people. The main dish was better, but not outstanding in any way. Another problem was that the main dish was served before we had time to digest the starter. The price didn't reflect the food quality which is the main reason for the low rating.
Cosy vegeterian restaurant. Excellent service and food. Exciting combination of flavors.You'll get an starter for about 6-8 Euro and a main course for 16 euro.
Food is five star, service is one star
I waited a lot of time for a disapointment . .

I visited this museum with several family members and we had mixed (but moderately positive) feelings about it. It appeared pretty new and the displays and signs were generally well done (with high-quality text in both German and English). It had an interesting format in the sense that displays were slightly "hidden" everywhere, and different signs could be seen by opening cabinets, pulling out drawers, and generally touching lots of things. The main downside was that the space inside was fairly small and there were a number of large student groups there, so it felt very crowded. It wasn't too expensive to get inside, so if you're interested in Cold War history, I'd recommend a visit -- just try to pick a time when it's not totally overrun with students (I'm not sure when that is).
Good food, service, decor. Traditional cuisine well executed.
Great place to be! Food good. Happy atmosphere.

I've been to Nordsee so many times… the food is always nice and affordable. BUT I can't say the same about customer service. On 09.10.2013, between 13h and 14h, my sister and I went to Nordsee in Spandauer Straße 4 10178 Berlin, and were quite shocked. The ladies serving food are arrogant and weird (the guys were friendly and professional though, and the lady cleaning the toilets was very nice too). I said Hi and made our order in English (I'm originally German but speak French and English). The lady who served me was thin, young, with a wild cherry red-coloured hair + double-plait Gretel style (couldn't see her name well, but maybe it was Anne/Anna). Anyway, she understood me making my order in English, I paid and we went to sit and eat. Shortly my sister wanted a coffee crème and gave me 50euro note as she had no more change. I joined the queue and was watching another lady (the one with the head half shaved) serving a customer on the other queue… the customer was to pay €23 or €25 and 10cents, and was giving the money… the lady asked the customer if she had 10cents, but the customer didn't have it, and you really – REALLY – should see her face!!! She was like an angry zombie!!! The customer started searching for any change and found 20cents… so the sick bastard zombie finally processed the order. My turn came to order the coffee crème, and I said “Hi, can I have a coffee crème”, and 'snobbish-Gretel' said “Hallo”, I said “yes a coffee crème please” (is she deaf?), and then she gave me a nasty stare and said with an angry arrogant tone “HALLO”, meaning that I must respond to her greeting first!!!!!!!!!!!!!! But I already greeted her 15 minutes ago (did she forget my face that quick?? We were sitting on a table just in front of her counter!), and then again said Hi when I wanted the coffee crème!! How many times should I say Hi before she takes my order????!!! Is she for real?? I mean, if the customer doesn't greet in German language and EVERY time they want something, she won't take orders??? Is she mad?? There are thousands of foreign customers who visit Berlin every month and go to eat at Nordsee; should they all learn and place orders in German to be served??? What kind of image is Nordsee giving about Germans and Germany??!! This is bad. This mentally-constipated woman thinks she can teach me manners??!! I had to say HALLO before she can process the order, and hey, she acted the same way as the zombie lady when she saw the €50 note! She was so annoyed I didn't give her coins… I started searching in my wallet for change, and thank God I found €2 because I really felt this b*tch was about to hit me. I live in Ireland, and never had to greet staff more than once (and was NEVER EVER treated like this in my life!). I thought 'Gretel' behaviour was robotic (not human), and you have to see the way she walks around, soooo arrogant, full of herself, and looking at people as if they were a piece of shit. I'd love to know how they hire 'people' like this at Nordsee (these ladies are more focused on their extravagant showy style than in providing reasonable and friendly customer service!)… Many tourists arrive at the Alexanderplatz station with only notes as money, so Nordsee staff won't take orders or would frown/be pissed off if these customers don't have the exact change?? Wow. Well, as the proverb says “there are plenty more fish in the sea”, and I'm sure there are so many other restaurants who would be pleased to take my orders when I visit Berlin in the future.
I've never been to this one, but when did Nordsee become GMBH? The day after Lufthansa GMBH or Deutsche Telekom GMBH?
Expensive and among the worst Asian restaurants I have tried in Berlin. Long waiting times. Freshness of the ingredients is also doubtful.

Lovely dinner. Had dinner there on our first night in Berlin and went back the last night. Very nice food. Portions are more then big enough to restore energy after an entire day exploring the city. Lovely place and recommended to all!
After a long day on the tourist trail, we found a gem at Emma's. A warm welcome + good food ; Paul, Alex, Geoff from UK & Wives would recommend it.
Very nice. we discovered Emmas last year during our holiday in berlin. Friendly staff and good food.
good burgers (really good burgers!) but very crowded, service is ok but takes a lot of time until menu is delivered, good: big screen inside for football
Good food, beer and service. Very friendly staff"..:)
Great ambiance and great food for acceptable prices. We love it and go there every time we are in Berlin
American style diner, with good atmosphere and great service. The menu is very authentic, both in selection and in taste.
Rude and child unfriendly.
To avoid, the lady who served us was so rude that I had to count until 10 before answering! It must be a characteristic of some Berlin service people. I don't think Berlin will see me again.
Decent food, nice place. I'd probably come back :)
Pretty small dishes but good quality..not cheap if you are habit to Italian standards :)..

We wanted a quick and delicious burrito after trekking around Berlin all day, and Dolores satisfied on both accounts. If you want to sit down and take a few minutes to eat your food, few restaurants I've seen in Germany can deliver something as high quality as a Dolores burrito for a similarly low price. So, the food meets urban chic Tex-Mex requirements (this coming from a Dallas resident with high expectations for any food that is remotely Mexican), but the hectic and somewhat cluttered nature of Dolores makes enjoying your food in the restaurant difficult. It didn't feel like a setting where one can linger over a meal with friends (if that's your kind of thing). Take it or leave it: Dolores is best enjoyed as a quick but thoroughly enjoyable aside to a full day of exploring a challenging city.
This is not mexican Food at all, the are not many dishes to choose, just burrito or bowl, the taste was ok, but it was more like a snack from a fast food restaurant!
Really good burritos that remind me of a couple of places in the Mission District. When I'm in Berlin, and in the neighbourhood, and hungry, I come here. Tasty, healthy and quite authentic.
Tasty, filling. Good vibes

This is the best burrito place that I've eaten at in Germany (better than a Qrito in Hamburg); however, I would only recommend it to expats who desperately want a burrito and won't be back in the States for awhile. American tourists should not come because this place does not compare even to a chain like Chipotle. Pros: they offer salsa verde, they have a number of vegan options (I'm not even vegetarian, but it's still a plus), they sell Anchor Steam, and they know enough not to call the place a "Mexican restaurant." Cons: my meat was a bit dry, my beans were a bit gummy, you have to pay extra if you get more than one salsa, and the paper wrapper was steamed into my tortilla meaning that I had to eat some paper with my burrito.
One of the best in the city.
Cute little cafe, they use La Marzzoco espresso machine so that was a good sign. They mostly serve pre prepared food, but great vegetarian options, salads and quiches. Excellent lunch spot

I loved this place, which is just off Alexanderplatz. It's a cool little cafe with minimalist and tasteful decor. Dishes are mainly light lunches - salads, quiches and soups, plus desserts. The chick pea and red-bean salad was excellent, as was the coffee. Staff are very friendly. Go for it!
Great atmosphere, organic food, friendly staff and the pumpkin soup is amazing! Love the cupholders!
Pricey but reliably delicious.
Love the coffee.
Service superb, treats with respect, food tastes delicious....
great food!
Very nice German food and the unfiltered pilsener is fantastic!...
Great beer, and an excellent bratwurst.
This is a very nice place near Alexanderplatz, with tasty german food. Informal and relaxed. You can also buy a meter of beer or a tower with beer for pouring youself.
No vegan soups
Cool

Popular place that is small and very well laid out, if a little crammed. The food is very good for the price. We ordered soup starters which comes in a very big bowel and would be suffice as a main course. The portion of duck meat that comes with the noodles is very generous. Service was average but not rude.

Since 2003 I've been (and still am) a regular visitor of Berlin. Eacht visit to Berlin, I need to go at least one time to ComViet! Superb food and nice people. The fresh springroll (frische fruhlungsrolle) is allmost to good to be true. Take 2 of them and a jasmine tea, and afterwards you feel like you have an energy burst you've never experienced :).
The most disgusting Asian place in Berlin. Soup was barely edible, the noodles undercooked. Terrible

Completely packed with hip and cool young people who are being served coffee, cakes and small lunch dishes by people who are way too hip and cool to work there. The coffee is good, but it takes a while, so be patient and use the opportunity to check out the latest fashion trends.
Good food

Of you äre looking for an Bavarian experience, you won't find it in Berlin. Look For a proper Beer Garden with tall green trees in the bavarian countryside, about 600km southward. Sorry, Not even recommended for foreign tourists!
pro: great beer & atmosphere. cons: no heating in summer garden, no blankets. no place to plug in mobile charger! not even a single one. very bad for touristic place.
Good food, meals are pretty big and the atmosphere was fun too.

I ate at the Hofbraeu Haus tonight, not really knowing what to expect from a restaurant that has seating for 2500 people. And the answer is, overall, it's just okay. The service was very good, fast and friendly, so no complaints there. The beer, while not cheap, is quite fairly priced for the biggest beer hall in Europe, and the beer is pretty good. The food however, was overpriced for what it was. I ordered the schweinesbraten, and it was mediocre as hell. The knoedel was sticky, spongey, and not very good with the gravy that tasted worse than something you'd get from the supermarket. And the meat was chewy and flavourless. The point is, you're not in Bavaria, you're in Berlin, and the illusion really fails to convince you otherwise. Also, you're not in some historical beer hall, you're in a brand new building, and it looks like it. By all means, try it out, it's the only place I know where you can get a litre mug of Bavarian beer, and the staff seemed nice and attentive. But I can't recommend the food. And the 'live music' seemed to be mimed, seeing as there was no bassist but a loud bass guitar sound the whole time. I give it 3 stars for effort, but if you want a Bavarian experience, you won't really find it here.

there is really nothing wrong enjoying German Food at all. Thanks to google+ local I know have found a great spot to get a traditional "falscher Hase" in Berlin. Its called Kartoffelhaus zum alten Fritz. Its a cute place around alexander platz where the waiters are really friendly and the Food is Amazing.
The service is poor, they bring different stuff which is written from the menu, dish size is small and the restaurant is very touristic.
I'm really satisfied, fast and efficient service, I warmly recommend it to anyone into Udon - soups
One of the best noodle bar I have been outside of Japan. Friendly staff, gorgeous decoration, excellent noodle, free wifi, japanese courses on the toilet, what else could one want?
The restaurant at the 1 st floor. Nice cosy place, very good food, nice steaks, fine prices, we can only recommend this place.
Good meat

Great food, great service. Very nice inside. Doesn´t look much on the outside, but the inside was very cosy. We went there with 2 small kids, and the staff was very kind to the kids as well. Recommended!
Wasn't very inviting from outside but once inside was welcoming and cosy. A beautiful steak to be got and not over priced either. Would return when back in Berlin.
This club is probably the worst in Berlin! Only stupid turists and rednecks are going there

Bouncers are real assholes, they where very rude to my wife with no reason. we are 26, but they said we look like kids and through us away. Will never ever go there again. this place has no respect to their clients.

I read other reviews and put some bad ones down to circumstance. We had a vip ticket which gets you a reservation in the restaurant. The view and atmosphere is great along with the decor. However, it seems that unless you are forceful with getting the attention of the waiter you will be waiting a while (we waited half an hour after we asked for the dessert menu, after which we just asked for the bill and left). The food is nice, but pricey - you pay more for the experience. But the service is inexcusable for such a location and cost. I agree with others to go for a drink (bar on the observation deck under the restaurant) but eat elsewhere.
Great view, service and atmosphere. However the food was sub par, especially for the price.

Great views of Berlin, however, BEWARE! Don't take any bottles of water or anything you wouldn't be allowed to take on a plane. They are very security conscious. I witnessed an Italian guy having to hand over his bottle of whisky, which he was not given back.. he was understandably furious! Worth a trip though - a must see in Berlin.
Cocktails at the top of the tower. Lovely way to end the day but busy between 7-9. Better after 9 - more peaceful/romantic

With its 368 meter this is the second highest building in Europe. You can get up to 203 where you can get a fantastic view. The tickets cost 12 euro and there is so many people that wants to visit that they also now sell a VIP ticket for 19 euros so you dont have to wait for so long. I would recommend to eat dinner there. If you make a reserveation in the restaurant you pay 12 euroes to get up, but you can pick up your ticket in the souvenirshop (where there is almost no people) and you do get to go in the VIP que. The restaurant goes around and you can sitt still and enjoy the view in a little more peacefull way than downstairs where there are lots of people and noice. The food is expensive, but the view is worth it, and I would also recommend to not do this the first day but after a few days where you can see some of the places you have visited from a different perspective. We ordered a table in july for 19.30 and we got to see Berlin getting darker and darker, which was so nice. Here you should also be a little early reserving. There is also a bar in the visiting room if you dont want to reserve a table.
Really good food and great atmosphere. Try the veal liver with onions
The veal liver and beer were good. The waitress was honest when asked whether the cabbage rouladen was good ("it's not the way that I would make it at home...").
Good food and great beer, the service was a little slow though!..

Food: 1.5, Beer: 3, Service: 4. The käsespätzle was greasy (not in a good way), and I'm pretty sure that the mashed potatoes were made from a mix because they tasted like glue. The Eisbein was tender, though. The beer was decent, and I like that they brew a seasonal and have a beer sampler (which includes toasted malt to snack on).
Brilliant place, excellent beer, really nice service and food is good.

I've been here for dinner with my friends. We ordered menu 1 and menu 2 and we really enjoyed them. Spectacular food. It was my first time with thai food. The only bad note was the water. The price for a bottle is almost 7 €.
Very stylish place. Friendly staff. Great for a quiet breakfast!

This place is brilliant. Self-service with class! Extremely friendly staff, great (light) dishes, fabulous sweets, unpretentious but still stylish. No need to cross the city but don't miss out if you are in the neighborhood. - At very reasonable prices!

THE definition of a classy cafeteria! Awesome place, really cozy and warm with a lot of foreign good looking people and a pleasant environment! I order a tea latte and blueberry pancakes and both of them were wop of their class. I'm really impressed by this cafe, you definitely want to come here when you visit Berlin!
Super delicious breakfast, all fresh and in a cool cosy environment! Must go there if you stay in Mitte for the city-trip.

cool atmosphere -- cocktail type place with hipsterish DJ working on a mac laptop. solid whiskey/whisky selection. my dad and i were visiting berlin and happened into this place. we ended up shooting the breeze with the bartender, who ended up also being the owner of the bar. jean-pierre was a super helpful about things we should see in berlin -- very good guy. i'd definitely recommend it.

This is not a good starbucks. The space is very small and crowded even on a monday during business hours. It is just the main floor and it is small. People walk around with trays of coffee and food in their hands and no place to sit. It is also full of children. I have been to few worse.

Thank God for this place in winter. Plus, the WiFi doesn't fizzle out. While this is a Sbux dominated by tourists and day-outers, it has the benefit of not having the sort of Berlin clientele who typically should not have unsupervised contact with children.
Same good service and food as everywere, but the wc could be better...

Great! Big Starbucks with plenty of room to sit down. Furnished upstairs with plenty of sofas to enjoy your coffee while studying or reading a book. Generally silent and very comfortable. Prices are a bit high, similar to other Starbucks.
Too much people sitting there just for the internet.

Tourist location with bad fatty and expensive food. This is a restaurant which lives from people that have no idea what a good German dish looks like. Everything is just swimming in fat and has near to no taste. Go to the bar that is right next to it a little down the alleyway.
Good portions for a nice price. Very much enjoyed my noodles.
The food was cheap and the drinks to . The food was exellent an so was the service . Went there 3 times and it was always fun and good food.

Best Pizza in Berlin! (that's what i've heard...) - it's really good food, excellent, very friendly service, good location (just across the street of the Alex...), and it's cheap! We spent a very nice evening as a group at Palermo's and we loved it!

While clean and up to date, it actually hasn't really changed since this location was a cafe / ice cream place in the days of the DDR, or ancien régime as we sophisticated, highfalootin' types like to call it. The same is true of the building it's in, which once hosted an outdoor spiral ramp to the second floor that only a central planner hiding in an office could think up. If you want traditional Berlin pastries, as the the good citizens of this fair city have always liked them, they are right here!
I can't say it's the best place to go for dinner. Food was nice, steak and beer at least. However, the environment is poor and I waited for 15 mins to pay.
Bad service

I knew Lang in this bar on the 14 of january 2010 at night. I´m not sure how writte LANG, maybe not is exactly. I think hi was with a big group of boys. DOES ANYBODY KNOW HI, PLEASE. Lang: you know my telephone number, call me! I can´t to forget how you dance whit me. Lali

There is not much to say about Burger King. It is pretty well known by most people. You shouldn't eat this kind of food but if you really have to, Burger King is a nice option. You'll pay around 7€ for a menu which is not that expensive. This one in particular is located in Alexanderplatz, which has some nice things to see if you're a tourist and also has some shopping places.
Nice place for a drink or three
Best coffee, best espresso, great wraps and salads and more. Sad there isn't more scoom shops around.
Went for saturday brunch.. selection was huge, quality only average. They had someone preparing egg freshly on demand, that was nice. Other than that, just okay or good for a hangover..
Good place for Brunch!
Great entrecôte. Take the gentleman's cut.

First a warning, you should probably book or you will probably be asked to come back another day. We had various dishes (I remember having the stuffed beef roulades, others having pork knuckle and meatballs), and everything was in tasty large portions. The decor is also interesting and I suggest you go to the toilet to take an opportunity to visit the whole place.
One of the best places in Berlin so far. Delicious meals and kind service. I enjoyed every bite of my dish and managed to visit it two more times, while I was in town.

I very much enjoy 'old' buildings. Unlike England, where most old buildings are just a pile of rocks, this is a beautiful space. It almost reminds myself of many of my family homes, but for the fact that this space is much newer. I have good feelings here. Everyone should stop in!
Had a great experience here. The food was exactly what I was looking for. The atmosphere was welcoming. And the service was very good.

This is an old Berlinese restaurant: it transmits you a great atmosphere! Generally speaking it's a bit expensive compared to other restaurants .. anyway the menu is filled with many typical Berlin's dishes!! don't miss the "Zeugen-Aussage" (Knuckle of Pork) (be careful: it's HUGE ;) ), that is the specialty of the restaurant
Great medieval restaurant with good service and an interesting selection of dishes. Tasty native food - a lot of meat. They could lower their prices a bit.

This was our first watering hole on a three day Stag trip... the beer was cold and wet, the schnapps were many and varied and the wurst were awesome. Don't think Petra (the duty barmaid) quite knew what to make of a fifteen strong invasionary force intent on drinking her pub dry but she soon warmed to us and even ended up buying us a round of schnapps. Absolutely loved this place... a tad on the small side for a large party, but a great introduction to the delights of Berlin. Bit surprised they didn't sell Apfel korn, but the bratwurst more than made up for that. I would love to go back there one day.
Perfect
Its a good restarunt...food is the best....

WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER, RUDE WAITER TOLD ME “ONCE YOU ORDER THE FOOD ITS YOUR PROBLEM NOT MINE” when I was uphappy with the quality of food that I was served. I was not given any other option of a main course and made to pay for a meal I did not eat. Apparently customer service is not offered to tourists at this restaurant and I have never had a more unpleasant eating experience in my life. Definately NOT the way to run a restaurant.
Saturday night, not nearly enough waiters, 1h+ wait for a drink

Me and my partner were looking for a place to have some drinks and as it was our first night/time in Berlin, we didnt know where to go. We thought Carambar looked nice. The cocktails were not bad though the Frozen Margarita was far to sweet for my liking. The place itself is nice though the waiters are not very friendly, would rather brush you off than attend to you unless you were having a meal. Would probably not go back.

It took a long, long time for our food to arrive. When it did, it was cold and sitting in a pool of grease( NY Steak). My friend's drink had a dead fly in it and the waiter ignored his request for a new one, shrugging. The waiter was completely indifferent to us, verging on contemptuous. We asked for some water to accompany our meal with the intention of having coffees and desserts afterwards. After a 25 minute wait, nothing had arrived. We asked for the bill. This did not arrive either. The restaurant was quite full outside but the staff mostly seemed to be ambling about chatting to each other, so it was difficult to understand the delay. Eventually our waiter told us that he refused to bring us water because it was too busy. We would have to go to the bar. When at the bar we watched him have a long chat with his colleague. He then shoved past me while I waited. The other members of staff were baffled as to why we were waiting at the bar. Other people left because of the non-existent service, although it should be noted that the staff were very attentive for large, bigger-spending groups of people. Even just sitting outside was unpleasant because of the combined wafting stench of the back of KFC and the pollution from the road and train. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.
Very friendly service, awesome food and nice atmosphere. The chefs are great, thank you very much for a beautiful evening!

Last two diners on Wednesday evening 16th October. Dining late was not a problem. very friendly and the food was really tasty. The "small" knuckle of pork was enormous. I felt so embarrassed that I couldn`t finish it. The restuarant was cosy and comfortable.
Bad food, cold, not tasty. Mushrooms had no sauce. I didn't ate so bad for a long time

Small and quiet with a bunch of typical German entrees (menu in multiple languages) reasonably priced in a convienent location. After having tasted the mushroom soup, potato soup, bratwurst and liver, I can definitely recommend.
Typical Berlin & German food. Quite inexpensive

Very pleasant restaurant in Nikolaiviertel serving traditional German food in big portions. The food was very good, and the service was excellent. There is an English language menu available. Expect to eat a lot of potato. Would definitely recommend, and I will be sure to go back next time I'm in Berlin. Visited November 2012.
nice donuts, cutelooking but unfriendly staff
It's what you'd expect from a Starbucks. Expensive coffee, great comfortable chairs and free wifi as much as you want.

If you ever felt like the hot sauce at your table needed an upgrade, this is the place to go. Run by a passionate owner, this shop offers everything related to chili. Sauces, spices, whole chili peppers, chips... Even chili soda. They have a large array of sauces to try and if you ask the nice business owner he will give you a chili tasting where he helps you find the sauce that's right for just you.

It was impossible to get anything worth mentioned as food in this place. Te service is snail slow, the salad looked like a twisted lettuce with something that would very much want to be named shrimps and the pasta seemed forgotten in some fridge for sometime, as for the sauce we are still trying to find it. Found this place in the Top 10 from eyewitness, yes it is overlooking the Spree river, it is the only catch this place has to offer, but you'better move on to another place to satisfy your apetite. Μακριά και από απόσταση φίλοι μου αν δεν θέλετε να βρίζετε τους ιταλούς για πολλλά πολλλλά (θεσσαλλλλλονικιός είμαι) χρόνια.

Nice, small coffee bar and pâtisserie in the berliner Nikolaiviertel, just in front of the Nikolaikirche. Kind service, flavoured coffee and gorgeous homemade cakes. Try their elaborated Fritztorte, specially made in 2012 to honour the 300th birthday of Friedrich the Great, king of Prussia, featuring nougat among other ingredients.
Unique ordering process with iPads at every table. Nice ambiance, a bit on the pricey aide but worth the experience.
Very pleasant atmosphere
Fantastic bar in ossie country, nice architectur

Great mini German selection with one of the best waiters ever. Sauerbraten and special local cakes. Their wine selection is just über gut. Top option if you want to eat in a cosy place and enjoy some very good German food!

Within the past week I have had dinner twice at Lutter & Wegner, once on New Year's Eve and the other the following Thursday. Both dinners were excellent. Being a lone--and foreign-- diner is sometimes an odd experience, often resulting in being given the worst table in the restaurant. This didn't happen here. Their sauerbraten is justly famous. I will return on every trip to Berlin.
As good a Sheppard's pie as you'll find in the States
Day 1: Grab a table on the terrace and order the giant, crispy Vienna schnitzel with potato salad (lukewarm, as it should be).

We were recommended by a friend and were certainly not disappointed. We went there on a Monday, late lunch, so the restaurant was fairly quiet, I have overheard the waiter saying for dinners, it is best to book. The waiters are all English speaking, friendly, with a good sense of humour. My friends were delighted to have a 1L beer glass and sausages, while I opted for a glass of Riesling, herring salad and cheese. We had an apple schnapps to digest it all. The prices are very reasonable too. I would definitely return.

The food is absolutely amazing and the service is great. Drinks come within seconds of ordering and the waiters are always friendly no matter how much stress they're under. The restaurant is packed all the time so the food takes around one hour to arrive. But when it does it is well worth the wait. The dish I had (sausages and mash!) was divine, and I can rarely say that about food, but it really was fantastic. If you are visiting Berlin and staying in the East this is a MUST on your to-do list. Augustiner am Gendermadkeksnzhwjh....(I don't know how to say it).
The food and the service was great! Ask for Wiener Schnitzel, the duck or if you are very hungry, Der Klassiker. Prost!

Sometimes they are very busy but the service is friendly. I go here for the ambiance and I prefer it to be crowded and expect a true sit down meal... this is not fast food after all! the waiters wear lederhosen and the food & beer flows quickly. The bill can be hard to get fast but this is a wonderful place to try German meats.
The food is good......just note steak tatar is raw. Make sure you order a litre!

Fassbender & Rausch, an exquisite store located only a stone's throw away from Löwenbräu am Gendarmenmarkt restaurant. Here, a large display of different types of chocolates awaits the customers. Decor include large chocolate bears and volcanoes as well. If you are a big chocolate fan, this is a must-go place.
