Chocolates range from simple chocolate bars to more intricate designs on the chocolate balls, and some even contain alcohol to augment the flavor. And from different types to different price ranges, the store has it covered. Say you wish to purchase a few pieces, you can at an expensive but affordable price. If you wish to purchase a bulk load, they'll have you covered as well with a discounted box set. Fassbender & Rausch indeed has the most and widest variety of chocolates available. Staff around there are really polite and friendly, and cashiers can clear long lines swiftly and easily with compromise. Fassbender & Rausch is a must-go place, even if you are not a big chocoholic, it is still a great attraction while you are here in Berlin.
Great hot chocolate, made from real fluid chocolate. Great little cakes. Delicious.
Heavenly chocolate
Maybe its just me but didn't quite like the hot chocolate

Excellent atmosphere and excellent food. The lighting was dim but bright enough to enjoy a meal. Service was the best, as the waitresses bantered with us a lot. The food was fantastic too. Main course was salmon with boiled potatoes and dessert was blueberry pie. Located at the heart of Berlin, this place is a MUST VISIT

If you are looking for a restaurant to go to, Maximilians is no exception. Located just a 10 minutes walk away from Checkpoint Charlie, it's a great place to stop at for lunch after souvenir shopping and sight-seeing. Food here is excellent. My meal was a main course of Salmon, with potatoes and veggies for the sides. Both balance each other out very well, as both are equally well cooked and simply scrumptious. Desert came in the form of a blueberry filling pancake topped with whipped cream. Very delicious food. The decor was gorgeous, retaining its fine dining style with wooden flooring, walls, tables and chairs. Service was probably the best in Berlin. Extremely friendly staff who can speak both German and English fluently, and very fast service-wise. Definitely a must go if you are roaming around Checkpoint Charlie. Delicious food, great decor and excellent service makes Maximilians a great restaurant.

The food here is excellent. The salmon was very soft and easy to chew and the vegetables in some kind of sauce tasted very good. The dessert was also delicious, strawberry pancake served with cream. Service was good and fast. The waiters and waitress are very friendly and even chatted with me.
Good service, friendly staff. Ideal lunch spot as they do a daily menu which changes every week which includes desert
Excellent but Michelin Star not merited if you compare to French Michelin 1 Star! Too high price for the value especially for the wines.
wonderful, warm room, professional service and outstanding, inventive food. plus a quality wine list.

in a neat location just off the gendarmenmarkt, this little gem offers very solid cooking in a modest setting. service is lacklustre; otherwise, would be a great place to rub shoulders with cabinet ministers!!
Nice atmosphere. Food quality inconsistent - owner and cook Kolja Kleeberg apparently spends more time in TV studios than in his kitchen.
Super fresh and great tasting. Not too expensive either.

Went with two 5-year olds and 3 adults for pizza and spaghetti. Very friendly service - they even joked around with the kids. Service was quick and the food came out swiftly. Food tasted wonderful. Fresh parmesan for the kids spaghetti was presented in a goblet that they had fun scooping into. I wanted to darker beer and they offered dunkel hefeweisen, which as an excellent recommendation. An excellent start to our vacation.
We had seafood pasta and spinach and ricotta gnocchi with truffle. And tirimasu. All pretty good.
food was good but it's like we had no waiter...
The quisine was wonderful, service great and overal feeling of the restaurant absolutely corresponds with its name " positive eating"
Went for lunch there. Lovely food. tasty and well presented. Reasonably priced too. Definitely recommend it
I made my reservation online, but I when I showed up, they had no place for me. Nothing serious, a shame of restaurant!
Good selection of cuban cigars. Quick service upstairs in the smoking area. I had a few mojitos which were top notch. Only complaint is that the ventilation in the smoking area isn't great.

First, I had to ask repeatedly for a menu. Then I was left to wait. The waitstaff couldn't care less about their customers. They avoid eye contact, were cold and extremely unfriendly. Needless to say, I left the restaurant without ordering. Went over to a better restaurant- shanrahimkhan, where i received much better service!
Location of the place is great. Food is just ok and it is a bit expensive, so not very good value for money.
The best !!

Feiret 80 års dag til min far og fikk et fint bord og bestilte 5 retters med tilhørende vinmeny. Bra service, kjempegod mat og kjempegod vin. Litt kjedelig dessert kanskje, ellers kjempebra! Celebrated my fathers 80 years old birthday and got a real nice table, and orders the 5 meal-menu with a corresponding wine-menu. Good service, very good and tasty food and very good wine. A bit boring dessert maybe, but overall GREAT!
Nice Starbucks in a very nice part of Berlin. All the workers speak English as well as German.
A perfect place to sunbathe in the afternoon sun, have a cuppa or some wine and enjoy yourself... Service is sometimes slow though...
Good, but overpriced. Service sometimes poor.

the food was good, large portions, ok priced but not a culinary experience of a lifetime. The staff was a little odd (couldn't say unfriendly) but not that talkative and quite slow. Horribly slow actually as we never got to get to order more drinks (which made us leave thirsty). The place wasn't crowded when we entered, maybe 1/4 full... I would eat there again if I am in the neighbourhood; but I surely wouldn't drive there for a meal.

Went there with my mom for dinner and i was really surprised i have to say. The restaurant is really nice, quiet, the Service was polite and fast. My mom and i both really liked the food and enjoyed the dinner quite a bit:-) i will come back next week.

Although service is very nice and polite, it's quality is decreasing in parallel with affluence. Meat was really not backed enough (near raw conditions) and flavour is too European style so that you're missing the real experience. Very deceptive ...

Catherine and I went last week and LOVED it... so much that we went for a second time. You can sit outside (side walk or a quiet courtyard) or inside with a nice ambience. There's a large window where you can get a great view of the kitchen. All that yummy food being prepared there. And... the place is clean - especially in the bathrooms which shows how classy this place is. Finally, the price is right. Overall highly recommended :-)

We stumbled across this restaurant whilst searching for an Asian restaurant using my GPS. I was a little afraid because Thai restaurants have always been a bit hit-and-miss for me. But this was a top-notch restaurant from the moment we stepped in. We were greeted by a waitress who was extremely professional. I've experienced a lot of bad service from Vietnamese/Thai waitresses who do not even understand the local language, but I could tell that this lady was well educated. Everything about this restaurant was good - the service, decor, tables, food, presentation, ambiance... The price is naturally higher than your average Thai restaurant but you're paying for quality.
Wonderful little resteraunt and exceptionally close to the u-bahn, well worth a visit
Mediocre in most ways. Nice view, nice waitress, but lukewarm, flat coke...
Poor service, some food poorly cooked. Service tried to impress.
Very nice Italian food and friendly waiters. We had vitello tornato, pizza and pasta, all of which were great.

A very good restaurant to go to if you wish to sample the German Cuisine. Very well cooked fish and rice, with a unique sauce to top up the flavor, followed by a simple desert of Strawberry Yogurt. One 200ml cup of drink was on the house which was a pleasure. The decor was great and simple, as if a traditional cottage house. Service was also fast and friendly, though I would have appreciated if they had given the right cutlery before hand. Knives or forks wasn't the most appropriate tool to consume rice. Still, a good restaurant to go to. Tasty meals makes Löwenbräu am Gendarmenmarkt a great restaurant.
Service of staff was very good and my food was served in a short amount of time. The food, chicken with rice was delicious and the place was also well decorated.

Friendly staff and good enough food, which was rice with chicken and followed by strawberry yogurt. I was rather puzzled why there was no spoon served as I thought it was rather difficult to eat rice with a fork. Nevertheless this issue was settled very quickly and the waitress gave us our spoons immediately.
Perfect beer from Bayern in the heart of Berlin. Luv it!

As an American, I hadn't heard of this company and didn't have high hopes when I stopped in here. Let's face it -- there are lots of mediocre chocolate shops in the world! But I bought two milk chocolate bars, one orange and one almond, and they were both wonderful. Very creamy, very high quality. I am a fan now.
Slow and uninspired, unreasonable prices for average food and drinks. Seems to cash-in on thirsty tourists on the free walking tour around Berlin. Strudel is pityful, frappe was better.

My wife and I recently spent a week in Berlin and this nice frozen yogurt store in the Friedrichstrasse became part of our daily routine, for a healthy mid-afternoon snack, that kept us going between our generous hotel brunch and dinner. We both weren't actually familiar with the frozen yogurt concept, and we were first attracted to this store because of its fresh and modern decoration, and cozy atmosphere. We were expecting the frozen yogurts to be more like an ice cream/ snack alternative though. The friendly staff then gave us a very thorough explanation of the nutritional virtues of frozen yogurts, which indeed have the good, tasty side of a snack, but at the same time, very few calories, and the nutritional benefits of a healthy meal, including protein (from the yogurt), vitamins and fiber (if you add the berries and the crunchy cereals to your cup, like I did). We found the store concept, which allows you to create your frozen yogurt cup as you want and then pay according to the weight, good, as we could fit the size of the cup based on our mood and hunger of the day. We only wished that they also had a store like this in Frankfurt too, where we live!

If you are in Berlin and you crave some frozen yogurt or great breakfast for on the go this is your number 1 address. Not only is the place neat to look at and sit it, it is also serving what looks like only the best ingredients and products. Went there a couple of times to get a nice bowl of cereal enriched with fresh fruits in the morning when time was tight. When I am in town I skip breakfast at the Ritz and go directly here.
super lecker hier und tolles catering in Berlin
For foreign customers this place isn't really the way to go. The waiters are distant and don't seem to care much.
Latte is Great!
They are not prepared for tourists and dont serve hot meals but sandw was good and fresh
Nice place to be . nice food fresh and yummy
Fresh meals with nice flavors.
March 29, 2013... Aurhentic Thai cuisine....Tom Yam soup the best have ever had.

First off, don't be down-put by my score, I vare rarely give a top rate (in this case a three) The design of the place is pretty good, with a lot of bamboo, folded violet napkins reminiscent of lotus blooms, etc. I've seen "subtle" done better though. The service in between courses was a little slow, though I think I happened to arrive right along with the early dinner rush around 18:30. The food was the closest thing that came to a "3" rating. The Tom Kha Gai was as delicious as ever, and definitely not lacking chicken (a good way to judge a Thai place, based on how much meat they provide with each dish). The duck curry had a little more fat and a little less duck than I would have preferred, and I got a couple of bits of gristle, but the meat was tender and delicious. There was plenty of it, as well as the curry and rice. All in all, go to this place for some tasty Thai food. Just don't expect high-class, 5-star dining.
The food is horrible. Good friends?? Really?
Great tasting Thai-food.
This place was much better years ago before they belonged to a chain. Though things didn t improve over the years, the food is still very good and authentic.
A lot of good food to a lower price. Great place, good service. Clean toilets.
we ate 3 times there: food is between "Very Good" and "Excellent" and the cost is "Moderate". A place we would return to eat!
Price-value is allright.

My wife told me I should try Chinese while in Berlin. This place was a block away from my hotel and I decided to give it a try. At lunchtime I was turned away. It didn't seem busy but I'm guessing they had reservations. I tried again at night as was not disappointed. For my main course I ordered 144, a cashew-chicken dish served on a sizzling platter (think how fajitas should be served). It was wonderful, if not a bit dangerous as the hot dish screamed its sauce. Nice atmosphere, reasonable prices, good service.

Good Chinese food. Large portions. Good, formal service. Plenty of space. Open late. I've been dozens of time. The only drawback ever was some of the German customers letting their bratty kids run wild. The restaurant staff was too polite to express disapproval (or toss the customers out) as they should have. Otherwise, very good Chinese restaurant. All the more impressive given the dearth of options in the area. South of this highway is a residential wasteland. North of this highway everything is overprices for tourists at Gendarmenmarkt. The Duck 3-course menu is good.
Great place to spend some time, it's worth it just to have a chat with the owner
Definietly irish!
Very nice restaurant in Berlin. We tried the grilled salmon which is marvelous! the service is extra with kind attention for the children. We'll get back again!!
Like Hidden treasury! Slow service but it's worth.
Great service, fantastic food. Real checken rotisserie and amazing ribs!
Best ice cream in the city. Plum and black vanilla are my favorites.

Had a wonderful evening at this restaurant. Service, food and atmosphere made ​​this night a special one. Can definitely recommend this restaurant. The food was very delicious. both the presentation and preparation was superb. Very friendly waiters who were attentive all the time. Next time we are in Berlin, we will visit this restaurant again. Thank you again for a wonderfull evening.

I waited just under a half an hour for my dessert! The maitre D, rather than acknowledging that someone had clearly forgotten my order, tried to explain that it needed warming. Patronizing, frankly. I would definitely not revisit. It's a bit of a cliche: Edith Piaf songs and all that.
Serving for the chicken was a bit small (one thigh piece) but other than that my steak was great. :)

The Carpaccio was by far the worst I've ever tasted. The little bit flesh tasted like it had been sitting in the fridge for ages. They just added a couple of leaves of rocket and some cheese that didn't even remotely taste like Parmesan, but nothing else. The pizza calzone was dripping wet, thick dough and little stuffing. The personal was cocky, but I suppose they just thought it was funny. The interior looked nice, but we sat outside.

The calzone was almost only stuffed with mushrooms and jallapeño (and it was not listed in the menu!), it was too hot and didn't taste pizza at all. The waitress took my soda before I had finished it. However a nice place, ok prices and a nice waiter.

Avoid this restaurant. The food is some of the worst we have found in Berlin and the service is even worse - rude and arrogant. It is hard to call this place an "Italian restaurant", as the kitchen cannot produce even the most basic foods like decent pasta. It is at best a pizza joint with a nice exterior.
This must be the best steakhouse in Berlin. The service is as good as it gets and the food is incredible!
Nice food, service. Atmosphere not so intimate.
Pricey but very good food
They dont have their 50% off on sushi and very greedy with the size of salmon inside the makis and inside out rolls
two michelin stars restaurant that offers modern fusion cusine (asian influences at most). set lunch menu is a very good deal.
I was very impressed. Top cuisine, European with Asian touch, very high quality. Very nice atmosphere. Service not too stiff, Berlin style. Can very much recommend it.

Usual Starbucks fare, good, but rather pricey. But worth it from time to time, especially if it is freezing cold outside. Cosy and relaxed, good place to warm up and get a few things done, like writing e-mails on your mobile phone or laptop. Normal Starbucks: gut, eher teuer, aber von Zeit zu Zeit definitiv das Geld wert. Speziell an eiskalten Tagen. Gemütlich und entspannt, und man kann in Ruhe Mails schreiben oder ein Buch lesen.

Worst Italian this side of the moon, everything about it was absolutely miserable. If you want better Italian go to one of the convenience shops on Kochstrasse and buy a packet mix. You will be less disappointed.

My favorite Café in Berlin. The place is super cozy, with design furniture and an incredible selection of coffees and drinks. The best also for cakes, sandwiches and quiches. In the cafe you can also buy international magazines or simply spend some time working with your PC (of course free WiFi!). Super recommended.

This place is superb! My favorite spot in Berlin to just sit down for hours with my laptop and get inspired while drinking great coffee. I have tried the salads, the sandwiches, the quiches and the (oh-so-good) cakes: always delicious. The place makes you feel at home and the guys working here are lovely. Must-try place in Berlin
The owner sat outside at a table drinking beer and barking orders at the poor overworked waitress the food was dreadful and everything overpriced
Very nice food! Great sushi and big selection of fresh dishes to choose from at the buffet. Good value for money and excellent service
It is soo good!!!!! it seems pricy but germany is really pricy. the curry worst is to die for. I would pay good money to go again just for this place.
Extensive menu, very good quality food at a very economical price. Spaghetti Carbonara was perfect. Highly recomend this restaurant.
Very good Croatian meat specialties, reasonable prices. Does not have baby facilities.
Good food! Amazing garden! Extremely nice service. Too bad the wi-fi did not work!
Very expensive but definitely worth the visit and the money. Supreme Filet Mignon, great staff and a very good "overall feeling".
Amazing meat! The pre-prohibition beer is also delicious! Definitely worth going but pricy!
Quiet restaurant with terrace to eat. Good food, nicely served (excellent Tandoori chicken). Staff very friendly, they served us kindly, though it was late. We will repeat in our next trip!

We are New Yorkers who were recently staying in a hotel closeby Pooja and one evening ventured out around 10 pm to find some dinner. In this part of town we would have gone to bed hungry if it was not for Pooja! But beyond relief we had also found a little gem of a restaurant as the service was friendly and efficient, the food was all very good with a menu that was rather extensive. My boyfriend generally avoids Indian cuisine, but he was very pleased with his meal. I don't think either of us left a spot of food on our plates.
Butter chicken is the best portion here and the best Indian dish in Berlin.
Not amazing food, bit good value for the money. Really cosy and quite to eat outdoors.

This is so close to the offices of mc Digital (who I work for) that it is almost our company canteen. So for this we are very lucky. Today I got a Tom Yam Gai, delicious Thai spicy soup. Absolutely excellent, and at €5 with some bread also very good value! Well recommended.

You can't go wrong with the soup here. The menu changes weekly and there is always great variety to choose from. If you're a vegetarian there is always one or two meat free options. I go here once or twice a week and never tire of it.
On a boat, nice service, short menu list. Easy atmosphere...

I came here with a large group. 4 people who hadn't RSVPed showed up, but the restaurant was very understanding and got us all fit in. The food here was very authentic, definitely not Deutsch-ified. I started with Kürbiskuchen mit dunkelroter Bohnen Paste-Füllung (pumpkin-glutinous rice buns filled with red bean paste) from the dim sum menu. I've had many red bean buns before but never with pumpkin added to the dough. It was a nice touch. Even though I usually don't like tripe, I ordered a small portion of the Gedämpfte Rinder Pansen mit schwarzen Bohnen (steamed book tripe with black beans). The dish had a nice flavor and wasn't too chewy (my usual complaint about tripe). Although one can certainly spend a lot of money at this restaurant, my dumplings, entree (with rice), and 2x0.5 L Köstrizter from tap cost 16€ plus tip.

My friends and I were at Ming Dynastie for lunch today. Service was slow and inconsistent, and the Dim Sum was overpriced. Also, we had to order a la carte which was disappointing since we generally enjoy the experience of ordering from a cart, which we expected to be able to do. Since the prices were a bit higher than they ought to have been, we didn't order as much as we would have with a traditional Dim Sum menu. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. On the positive side, the restaurant was beautifully furnished and decorated. It's too bad the quality of the service and food wasn't up to par.
One of the top 5 clubs in Berlin. Haters or tourists: go away.

Kater Holzig is a great mix of Hippie camp, dance club, restaurant, cinema, book readings, beer garden and many more. Spacious old factory area, Berlin style rotten stuff meets new instalations, culture + sub culture, a must visit in Berlin. People who has loved the Bar 25 will love Kater Holzig
Overpriced burt the decor and ambiance makes up for a lot... Just make sure You're not the one footing the bill.
Great place to be if you like an amience that reminds you of your hippie days ;-)
Truly dope!

One of the greatest places to meet excellent live music, dj's and different cultures. Very friendly atmosphere, moderate prices and great people. Every Wednesday there is the most interesting jam session in Berlin.
Great supermarket with loads of variety to choose from. Little hint for singles, in the afternoon, all them old overweight checkout-chicks are replaced with gorgeous young ones.

When we walked in there were no tables and seeing as we weren't Berliners the chances of finding a place looked slim. Luckily just as we were about to look elsewhere, a couple just finished up and we were able to grab their table. So glad we did as the food was great, very authentic and VERY generous portions. Biggest pork knuckle I have ever seen! Well worth it and would definitely recommend for anyone looking for an authentic German meal with some great beers on tap!
Fantastic food and a great selection of beers!...

One of the best restaurants/pub we have tried in Berlin It has only one plate (the half roast chicken - ½ Jungmasthähnchen) and two side dishes: potato (Kartoffelsalat) or sauerkraut (Krautsalat) salad => anyway they are all EXCELLENT!! it has also a large variety of beers (don't miss the "Berliner Weisse mit Schuß", typical of the place) and old Berlin specialities (try the "Mampe (halb und halb)" and the "Ingwerlikör" (ginger based), that are the most particular in our opinion) the only downside was the long wait time, but this was offset by a very kind staff!!
best chicken in the world. this is a reason to return to berlin.
Nothing vegan on the menu...
Excellent food, great staff, beautiful location!

Surprisingly good food for such a small place. Had a starter and a main. Both absolutely fantastic. Just the food concept was a little confusing since they serve Japanese, Chinese and Vietnamese food on one menu.
A inexpensive little Vietnamese/Thai/Sushi place. It's not a fancy place, but the food is nice and the price is right!
Simple supermarket. What really grabbed my attention was the low energy level of the employees. They seem to have so little motivation.
Excellent food. Good wines, though expensive.
Good food, reasonable price. Definitely recommended.
Always friendly. You almost ever get a welcome and/or passing drink.
Alles bestens... Nettes Personal, Ware 1 A.
It was original, the food also. It wasn't that good the food
Pretty delicious, everybody like it.
Charming Graphic Art Exhibition with homemade cheesecake.

Ich besuche regelmäßig Galeriecafé Emma-T. Es gibt dort jeden Monat neue Kunst an die Wand und man kann sich hinsetzen mit Kaffee und Kuchen. Freundliche Inhaber und im Sommer gibt es die Möglichkeit draußen zu sitzen. I am a frequent visitor of Galeriecafé Emma-T. Every month new art on the walls and you can sit down for a good cup of coffee and cake. Very kind owner and in summer you can sit down outside.
Great German food with outstanding service.
Friendly and fun staff and good food for a decent price.
sushi is really excellent, especially the unagi nigiri. very good soups and starters. however, the main courses tend to be a bit of a let down
Bland, plain tomato-juice sauce... supposed to be chicken jalfreezi, one of the spiciest dishes I know. very dissapointing
real turkish pizza... ahahaha don't go there. it's probably the worst 'pizzeria' (?) in prenzlauer berg.
Team has no knowlegde about Cocktails. They bought a book and opend this "bar".
Hühnerfleish in Massamancurry is awesome. It's M2 from the Mittagtish menu.
Nice italian food. Service can be slow.

So I haven't been here in about 8 years, but when I lived in Berlin, I frequently dined at Al Dente. Linguine al Parmigiana was on the menu which is what I believe the man in the picture on the webpage is making. It was a heavenly experience. I thought the selection of pastas was varied enough, but not overwhelming and the quality of food was a notch above the rest. I'd certainly recommend Al Dente to a friend.

This Italian restaurant is really nice. I recommend that you try "Cordon Blue San Marco mit Kartoffeln". They also have food for vegetarians. Even when the place is crowded they don't take too long to serve you.

Such a comfortable café. The staff are very friendly and the food is delicious. I had to buy some of their home made jam to take home! Stopped short of taking cake too, but I'll certainly try that next time. Highly recommended.
Great cakes and relaxed atmosphere
Really good coffee and a great atmosphere.
Very friendly staff, tons of space to work, fast+free wifi, very good food, very good prices, and my favorite cappuccino in Berlin (with illy to boot). I'm there often!

My wife and I go there every Sunday. The service is super friendly and the food is far too cheap, considering how fresh and delicious and generously portioned everything is. Tous les Jours is our absolute #1 favorite.
The food was great, the service was very friendly and 'die Berliner Gemütlichkeit' was ever so present. Thanks for being great! Tschüss!
Cheap, tasty and friendly service... A good start for the day
Best breakfast in Berlin! We keep coming back to this place every time we're in town. The service is great!
Very good food at a reasonable price.
Great coffee, delicious snacks, nice staff. All you'd expect from a café.
Great place, coffee and an amazing staff

The Restaurant Interior is very basic standard. It has a classic Italian Charme - a Restaurant that you see Italians would go to at home. I eat out there frequently, always a pleasure to my gum. I love their food, which is prepared freshly and with a variety. Pricing: - Pizza - very average and affordable. - Pasta and other dishes compared to Berlin price standards is a bit more pricey - though the quality fits and the prices thereof are more than acceptable. If you want to enjoy a high quality Italian dish among a relaxed, Italian tempted atmosphere, this is the place to go to!
Great pizza! Great place for families with children and a very relaxed atmosphere
Horrible service!
Flammkuchen comes highly recommended, tasty appetizers and desserts. Service is courteous, watch out because not all personnel speaks English.
Hausmannskost at very reasonable prices. Super nice owener.

A bit hidden in a side street, PILA is a good example of a restaurant with a touch of GDR cousine. Besides the food or good choice of beers you can enjoy the interesting samples (some of them very rare) of a vanished German state (it's not a must, but I'd recommend to ask for a look into the function room!). Beer garden at the front.
Nice italian food! Perhaps, the best place in this part of Berlin. Service is pleasant and atmosphere is comfortable.
Worst Italian food ever, served without manners. We refused to finish our meal because it was gross, and we weren't the only ones. This place is a disgrace for Italians.

The food was pretty good - as you would expect in a german pub, with decent schnitzel. The decor is typical of an ecke-kneipe. The service was pretty poor, the waitress aggressive and unfriendly. It seemed a chore to serve anyone other than her regulars.

Great neighborhood eatery easy walk from andel's Hotel on Landsburger Allee or Landsburger S-Bahn Station in residential neighborhood. Very reasonable prices and friendly service. Staff very helpful with non-German speaking diner. Enjoyed.
Great food for meat lovers. Fresh and of good quality at very reasonable prices. Away from the touristic spots but I can only encourage the tourists to go there.
Bad food. Not tasty. Low cost ham and a sauce based on nothing.

Mein Lieblings-Supermarkt! We drive here every now and then to stock up on supplies. It looks fancy but many products are well priced compared to other supermarkets. A great atmosphere inside with courteous staff and patrons. The products on offer are of a higher quality than your average supermarket. Many 'Feinkost' goodies on offer, a good range of fresh seafood and great dairy section. Beef is $$$ and mostly sold in larger or bulk portions (as the FPL supplies to caterers, restaurants etc). Fruit and veg section not organic but still very good - the herbs are amazing and come in generous quantities. A wide selection of wines with knowledgeable staff to assist. We have bought superb whites and reds here for as little as 4 euros!
Worth a visit. Good and fast service. Extremely fair prices. Esben, Denmark.
No doubt the steaks are good, but I had hoped for better given the price. Comfortable atmosphere. But I won't be a return customer.
Excellent authentic food with friendly service, This place is a "must go" if you are in Berlin! Remember to set aside at least 3-4 hours if you plan to eat starters and dessert ;)
Reliable good quality Mexican food. Nothing adventurous on the menu here, but always a safe bet!
Dont go there - worste experince ever - bad service and bad food !
Very nice place to rest! Very very polite waiter and some real good dishes, proper portions and fair prices! Nothing to complain, i'll come back!

The building itself is a very interesting example of a good old DDR architecture, that I have to admit. However the crew of the place (if you visit it by night, when it's a party time) is that kind of unfriendly, agressive and unpolite appleknockers dealing with you not like with a customer, but as with a garbage... It is disappointing, that such a nice place is now in hands of such guys blemishing a human race. Possibly you could rent that place _without_ its team (it should cost you much more though).
Super lovely staff, relaxed atmosphere, but the food ain't great, after several tries :-(
The deco is so kitch!

I've been here for brunch several times while vacationing in Berlin. What makes Cafe Sibylle special is not the food (very good) or the service (excellent) or the relaxed atmosphere, but the historical exhibits in the back sections of the building. Dine alone or with a few friends, most tables seat four.
The exhibition is awesome :)
Excellent food! Surprised to see there were no other customers.
Was here more than 4 times. A nice Restaurant serves good food with reasonable price. I will dine here every time when I go Berlin.

Went there as it was close to our hotel, read the Google reviews. Small but fantastic atmosphere! Oh, if you're at a table waiting, just order at the counter, they can be pretty busy with the to-go orders. Very nice!
Fantastic pizza place with friendly staff, busy counter and great prices.
The best pizza in Berlin, without question. A laid back, very friendly place with a great atmosphere. The prices also suit a small budget, so there's no reason not to go!
My favorite pizza place in town...
Fast and very tasty sushi for little money!
Good food at a very affordable price. Fast and friendly service.
Coole Location
We had a rumpsteak and a pork steak. Both were chewey. Was nicely medium rare though. They offered kindly an exchange. So complain after the first bite.
I adore this place. I enjoy coming here with friends for a couple of drinks from time to time.
Cosy bar, nice basement for dodgy dancing when theres a dj playing.

Someone in our group had to do something early the next morning, so we only stayed for a beer and food. I was very surprised to see lamb burger on the menu. It was quite tasty. They also have Murphy's Stout on tap (which I prefer to Guinness). I really liked the atmosphere. Next time we will catch a show and stay longer.
Monday's 50% on every meal. Really good food.
I've been here twice now and noticed that the prices have gone up and the portions have gotten smaller. 3.50 for 15 chips and a spoonful of salsa is ridiculous. I will not be going back here.
Very good mexican food.

I was visiting Berlin on may and stayed at Karl Marx Allee. The street is full of restaurants, but one of them really stands out from the rest."Da Salvatore". The owner, i think, a bold man with glasses, welcomes everybody and makes you feel at home from the first moment you walk in. The staff chats with customers and make sure that you are feeling great. During my 10 day stay i went there few times. Beefs are exellent. Risotto with fried fish. Exellent. Pizzas...best that i have ever had. The restaurant is nicely decorated and they also have nice terrace. I highly recommend this restaurant for everyone who visits Berlin. It's very easy to reach. Almost next to a Frankfurter Tor metro stop. Away from the touristhell and seems. To be very popular among the people from the surrounding areas. - Marco, Finland-
2.50€ pasta and pizzas... 3€ cocktails... Are adamant on closing right at 12... The waiter is a bit pushy and weird...
Too loud music and annoying “DJ“

Grandma's place - our favorite. A large selection of great schnitzels but also lots of other German food. Costs a bit extra but the ambiance is real nice. I'd actually say that this place is an experience in itself - comfy chairs and couches to sit on, no place on the walls which doesn't have something weird to look at and no two plates or pieces of silverware are the same... Rings true to the 'unique' in 'Englers' Unique'. Certainly worth a visit.

Seth is excellent! We have dined here twice, the candles gave a nice atmosphere, the food was delicious, the portions great and the service is wonderful. It's a great value for money, I highly recommend it.
Super place for a beer and a haircut
This place is a little gem, beautifully decorated and the food is delicious - well worth checking out if you are within the area! Highly recommend!
Some of the best Indian I've had to date. Eaten pretty extensively in both London and Boston and nothing there compares to this. Will be adding this treat to my regular dining routine.
Great Russian dumplings.
We have been three times, tried the breakfast/brunch and it was wonderful. The service was excellent and the staff really nice.
Great sunday brunch for 8€. Many dishes and the best cod I have ever tasted! The only thing I would change was the bread.
Not so Russian. Had the beef stroganoff. Not so tasty. More like a bar with bar food then a restaurant.
Great Spanish wine.

When in Berlin, we live across the street and eat there as many times as possible. Not only is it really cheap, but these are really delightful people, who will make you feel at home. They cook wonderfully, using only the best ingredients. Half of the menu changes every week. Among the permanent dishes, favourites of mine include the Mio Teller (Turkish mezzé) or Mio Brot (same, but smaller, in a warm bread, which fuses tastes divinely) and the Bonbon Nudeln. The Italian house Chardonnay, though nothing to write home about, is extraordinary good value for the price.
Great atmosphere! Good food!
Very friendly service, personnel was interacting with customers and knowledgeable. Diverse choice of food, decent portion size and high in quality. Freshly made and self made.
I have eaten here three times. Very authentic, very good food and very good service.
Delicious Korean food!
More expensive than other Asian restaurants in Berlin and the portions are small, but the food is tasty and original...
Quality of fish is top and the sushi is nice. But could do without the silly garnish.
The sauces made in this restaurant are fantastic and the food is very Delicious compared to the price.. I prefare eating fresh rather than having frozen cheap food.

Pricy... There is a place right around the corner with the same food but 10-30% cheaper. Since the place remodeled and I guess they now have a new owner they have raised their prices, but the quality and portions are the same.
Probably the best cakes and gâteaux in Friedrichshain. And the coffee... mmm! Also, Berliner Zeitung (one of the quality morning newspapers) is available for reading.

ok, the brunch is above average for Germany, on par with everything around it, but the real reason to go to this place is the awesome chicken wings. the wings-for-brunch thing is a revelation and Germany's greatest contribution to culinary history and this place makes the spiciest, most delicious wings on the continent. I pay for the buffet but end up eating 90% wings! sehr lecher!! great hummus too.
Food: 3.5 We went there for the breakfast buffet. The food was decent but not fantastic. The fresh apple-orange-carrot juice was pretty good.
Ok Thai food, but kind of bland. Had the red curry, was very watery and not much taste. The people working there are nice and the atmosphere is pleasant.
Very small place, food is good and price are low. The place inside is not so nice, though...
Wish they had more vegan options. As a vegetarian you can have many items from the menu.
Tasty food, low priced menu; lots of salads, cheese, bread 'n fresh orange juice. Friendly people. Reservations for lunch is probably a good idea as the place seems to get crowded around noon. Enjoy.
A pleasant refuge for a hot coffee and a nice piece of cake on a cold, late winter Sunday.
Best brekkie ive had in ages, great prices, cosy vibe. Highly recomended! Probably worth reserving a table as they were nearly full on a monday morning!

I came to II Tinello for dinner and I must say it was beyond amazing. I will never forget this dinner experience. It is a very sophisticated, cozy, friendly, romantic, etc restaurant with one of the best customer service. Every penny that I spent was worth it. I can't wait to come again, I felt very welcomed . Next time I'll share this experience with the people I love. II Tinello is now on my top list as one of New York's best restaurant! You name it they have it. If you want a night to remember, I highly recommend II Tinello!
Nice small and simple restaurant, with a great offer of tasty dishes and very cheap price.
A small place, very calm and nice. Food is tasty and price are low. Great place!
Truly incredible club. Worth the wait in line—even if you have to try another weekend. Guaranteed to come away with a memorable experience and the club is even better than the hype!

Bonkers! Best night club I've ever been to. if you like it dark and dangerous then go and try to get it. Don't be disappointed if u fail as many have before u. If at first you don't succeed then try, try and TRY again.

THE BEST. Words cannot describe. I had high expectations of Berghain and really, it was even better than I expected. WAY better! And Jay Yao, no, it's not because you're Asian. I was with 3 other Asian girls and we got in. You make it seem like they're racists, but they're not. Also, when we got to the door, the bouncer immediately spoke English to me. We didn't even speak to eachother the last few meters in line. For some reason he just knew we weren't from Germany, and it didn't matter. The next time I'm visiting Berlin I will definitely try to get in again. It was so, so worth the long wait.

Simply amazing. Be prepared to spend a long time in line, and have an alternative plan in case you don't get in (welcome to Europe). The music is loud and fantastic. Take the free earplugs they give out at the door or at the bar because you'll need them. You can literally feel the music in your body. So sexy. Will definitely be going back. Learn at least a few words of German. Be open minded and cool with the crazy stuff that happens in the dark corners. No giggly girls taking pictures on their iphones allowed.

It's everything they say it is, and more! Can be tricky to get in. Girls - side-sheds and high-tops are the order of the day. Leave your heels at home! The head steward is known to "look into your soul" when deciding whether or not to let you in to the Berghain, so there's not much you can pack in your suitcase to prepare for that! Sunday late-morning is a good time to go as the queues are usually non-existent. When/if you get in, the Hurricane cocktails are the bomb!
Its German and good and I saw it in deutsch eins lol
This place is awesome. Great Jamaican vibe, great people and good drinks and smokes ;)
A must-visit experience in the heart of Berlin
cool setting in a former warehouse on the banks of river spree. food service not acceptable: pizza comes from one kitchen, other food from another, which means food comes not at the same time.

My partner and I were visiting friends in Berlin and we decided to eat at the Sage Restaurant, following a recommendation from a friend in the Berlin restaurant business. First impression, was that the restaurant is very 'Berlin' and a desirable and trendy place to eat. We sat down and were handed our menus (helpfully in English) and all decided upon what to order. We waited around 10 minutes before being asked what drinks we would like. After 20 minutes, the waitress came back to advise that one of our drinks was unavailable. It took four attempts until we managed to find a bottle that was in stock. By this point, 45 minutes had passed. Shortly after our drinks had arrived, our starters arrived, however, one of the dishes was not the right one, therefore it was sent back. Twenty minutes later, the correct starter was brought out, but so were our main dishes. Not wanting to eat our starters and our mains at the same time, we queried this with the waiter, who pleaded ignorance by saying he did not speak English and aggressively shoved out mains under out noses. Fortunately, two people at the table, could speak excellent German, saying that it was inappropriate to service a starter and a main at the same time. Consequently, we asked for the manager to resolve the issue, but when he arrived, he was completely nonchalant and asked us what it would take to resolve the issue (note, no apologies were offered). We advised the manager what had happened and he was discussing with my friend what could be done, when I commented that bringing out a main and starter was not common sense nor appropriate. The manager turned around and lambasted me by saying "what does it have to do with you, I'm talking to this guy" in an aggressive manner. At this juncture, we decided to leave and as we left, the manager followed us and gave us the finger! Needless to say, we would not recommend dining at this restaurant, which is a shame, as the food looked great. This might be an isolated incident, but their behaviour was completely inappropriate and aggressive and far worse that any of us had experienced in other restaurants. Verdict - nil point!

Cosy restaurant in Kreuzberg serving traditional German food. Portions are LARGE, and very tasty. Good beer, good service. Not sure if there is an English menu. Would visit again. EXCELLENT SCHNITZEL. Visited November 2012.
Traditional German food in big portions in a cozy atmosphere. Vegetarian options as well.
Really Good Food.
Awesome German food
The vegetables fondue was good but the chocolate fondue was awesome!

Pretty cool club / karaoke bar. They have a number of cabinets that you can rent. This is definitely not an Asian karaoke bar, as it seems like all of the songs were in English, German, or Russian. Although the bar isn't exclusively or explicitly a gay bar, the clientele was very mixed and "respect" is one of the house rules. I really like the resulting atmosphere. Also, by the end of the night, people were cabinet hopping a bit, which was pretty fun. My biggest complaint is that the drinks are a bit expensive, and there isn't a good selection of beer.
The worst. Had to order a burger three times to get it made right. Otherwise rude stuff and high prices.

This place sucks! Went there with five friends and the staff didn't except a discount voucher for our party of five. The voucher didn't state that it was only valid for one person, just 10% discount on all burgers. However, we ordered onion rings and I expected more than 8 (eight!!!) of them for a price of € 4.50. In the end they took of the drinks from our bill since we complained to store manager. I will not return and rather go across the street on the backside of the Ostbahnhof to East Burger!
If you enjoy chinese food, come here. Nice service and delicious food.
Uhm. Ok food . Guy next to me was roling joint. Anti gay rap playin... ok cheap food.
the service was not very friendly this morning, bread was old : /
I like this strange chinese sign that looks like an uneven smiley face.
I had a wonderfull meal here. Loved the ambiance of this little family restaurant. Total friendly people, with really good food

Recommended to us by a walking tour guide as a good place for German food, this hole-in-the-wall turned out to be amazing! We waited a while for our food because the man running the place who took our order went to cook all of it from scratch, but it was worth it. I'm really craving the schnitzel with hollandaise sauce and white asparagus that I had right now!
Excellen food! The waiter was awesome, funny, full of useful information. The breakfast menu includes more than what is said on the menu (fresh fruit and bread). Excellent location, great prices.

Avoid this place like the plague! I had to wait a half hour for a simple medium steak. It was hard as a shoe sole, accompanied by 3 potato slices and a decorative quantity of mushrooms. They did not have a knive to cut it and while eating inside the waitress did not think it would bother anyone if a begger roamed the tables - again: inside! The bill was very pricy for Berlin, heck for any place considering what was on my plate. By any standards this place sux, 1 star because of free wifi
get some Canelés there. they are delicious.
Very calm and cozy bar. Excellent decoration and music. Perfect for a beer and some relaxation. Do try it!
One of my favorite spots in Berlin. The cupcakes were sooo tasty!
Delicious cupcakes, but a little sloppy service.

This is a charming shop in a good location with a lovely-sounding menu of comfort food. Their cupcakes look beautiful, and if I actually liked cupcakes, I would be going back to this shop every day to try out all the flavours. Sadly, I don't like them, so maybe I'll have to go back and try the brownie. But if you like cupcakes at all, and you're in the area at all, this place is worth a visit.
Great cupcakes and American snacks. They also sell cans of PBR.
I had fantastic brunch here. Great selection, everything was delicious. I really enjoyed fish food... definitely going to try it again on another sunday.
Very good Russian food and beverages. My favourite: vegetarian breakfast!
Very interesting food and decent prices. Staff quite 'Russian' in their approach though.
Good food, average service.
A nice bar with often great "garage" or other wild music. Great old furniture with a galacted atmosphere! Had many great evenings here!

Als wir uns, da es kalt wurde, nach innen verzogen, stießen wir in der Bar auf das obere Stockwerk, was das eigentliche Highlight der Dachkammer ist. Dort finden sich urige und kitschig eingerichtete kleine Räumchen im Stil von Omas altem Wohnzimmer. Hier kann man den Abend in ruhiger Atmosphäre zu guter Musik ausklingen lassen. -- Because it was cold we went inside the bar where we found a staircase which led to another floor of the bar. And this floor is the main highlight of the Dachkammer. You'll find some small kitschy rooms that will remind you of the old living room of your granny. It's a great place to end the evening with a relaxed atmosphere and good music.
Nice bar for a late drink, cosy sofas and atmosphere.
Fantastic brunches on Sundays. Crowded but waiters do their best to find you a spot.
Great taste! While being brunch there are some warm dishes. I only tried them and they were very good!
Cayetano is one of the best cafes in this part of Friedrichshain. Great service, good food and drinks. They also use Bio-ei (organic egg) for their egg dishes. Great place.
Great fruhstuck! Bit quiet when we went on a friday lunchtime but very friendly waitress and fitted the bill for a hangover recovery: large juice, tea and wurst and kase breakfasts!
God-awful. I see no reason to return. Ever. No good for food, drink, or atmosphere.
Pricy and the fish is not fresh. You can find much better sushi in Berlin at a more affordable price.
VLADIMIR III 2729
Fab lunch today. Beetroot and coconut soup. My eight month old and I both loved it. Great chai too and friendly service.
A wonderful place for good coffee or a nice sandwich. Many vegan dishes!
It is a very cosy and delicious cafe. They have the best croissants in the World and the cakes and cookies are just a dream! Besides this the baristaboys are the cutest in the whole neighborhood! ;-)
As a cafe, I found it disappointing. The recommended vegan pie proved to be rather inedible. The decor is nice, though.
Great sandwiches, friendly service, funky vibe.
The most authentic Thai food in Berlin. Highly recommended. Reasonably priced and good food.
Justifiably busy. Really tasty soups, great presentation. We tried the curries and the noodles, and were not disappointed. Cosy inside, and had outside tables when we visited as well. Recommended!
Awesome Thai food in a great neighborhood.
just too touristy and too much food in less tme, so quality suffers
favorite thai restaurant in berlin. yummy mango smoothie.

himmelreich is a nice friedrichshain gay bar. Large smoking area in the back. Despite one of the reviews my impression was that everyone is welcome there even if you are straight. On wednesday they have self service happy hour.
I found out its a GAY bar me & wify felt weird in za place, so will finish our beer and leave :)

Very nice gay and straight friendly bar. Prices are good, service is friendly, customers appear willing to leave the straight customers alone contrary to the previous reviewers fears. Will be back my next visit to Berlin

We come here on average weekly since just over a year now. Well what can I say? Ever since we visited the first time we have completely fallen in love with Lemongrass. In the beginning we tried different dishes and all are incredibly good, however we find their Matsaman and especially their Phad Thai the best. We love Thai food and have been to many restaurants over the world but we haven't been served an as good Phad Thai as here. Fortunately the restaurant is just around the corner. ;-) For drinks we can recommend Nam Ta Kai (a Thai lemonade) or Mango Lassi. The service is brilliant. All the girls are so sweet and we generally have a chat. The boys are sometimes not that charming, but hey, the food EASILY makes up for it. Even though we eat these two dishes so often we just don't get tired of them. Each time it feels like another food orgasm. Summary: Best Thai food EVER for barely any money (€5,50-8). All our friends agree.
Fantastic Thai food. They have a wide selection of curries. The waiter was really nice. They have menus in English and German. Main dishes cost on average 7 euros.
My favourite thai place. Try the matsaman curry.
Very good thai food at moderate prices. Very friendly service - always.
Great food, good service and one of my favorite neighbourhoods in Berlin.
Cheap cocktails of acceptable quality. Many can be ordered by the liter. Nice lighting, strange decor, but all in all, quite okay.

This place is amazing. They have a large collection of games in English and in German at many different difficulty levels and of many different types. You can also check out games to play at home. They offer snacks and beer comparable to what you would eat during a game night at home.
I don't know a better place to play board games and enjoy some good beer.
Service is great! It's the thing that impressed me the most! Friendly, smiling and full with positive spirit! We love coming here!
Far too expensive. Jolly nice waiters, but the food is very, very disappointing. House wine shabby quality.
This is my favorite falafel place in Schöneberg. The falafel with haloumi is delicious and they always play great music.
Absolutely great food, friendly service, at more than reasonable prices. So far my prefered fastfood in Berlin.
Awesome food!!

Modern Vietnamese/Thai food. Excellent quality, and excellent flavors. Best rice paper rolls I've had in ages. The duck curry was incredible. Very affordable, if I lived locally I would eat here every week! Romantic atmosphere and friendly/fast service.
One of the best burgers I ever had! It's big, juicy and cheap.
The staff is friendly, a cozy bar where you can find schwäbisch beer and food
WORST SERVICE IN BERLIN. We had to pay one more dish because of the waiter´s mistake !!! sehr böse Service. Average food quality. NOT RECOMMENDED !

Cool ambiance, music was a bit too loud for conversation, but good for pre-going out. We ordered two pizzas--which cost us 6 Euros in total, but tasted and looked like frozen pizza. If you're looking for good food, this is not the place, but if you're looking for a cheap meal, you're in luck.
Tastiest 3 Euro pizzas ever. Lasagna is pretty good there too.
Worst place ever. Waiting for half an hour, then getting a black thing that's called a pizza.
cozy place with good, reasonably priced dished
Were very accommodating seeing as we didn't arrive till after 11pm. Lovely service and reasonably priced.
Ich mag dieser Weinladen viel, viel. A small shop, nice selection, and the owner et al. are always very nice and very informed about anything wine-related!

Very delicious doner with very fresh ingredients, not heavy. The "Ali Baba" plate for two is sure to fill you both up with an overload of literally everything they have for an incredibly cheap price! My first choice in f'hain.
Happy hour for pizza and pasta from sunday to thursday.
Good nachos, good cocktails

A definite must-stop on any F'hain pub crawl. Even though there is metal playing through out the bar, it isn't played so loud that you can't have a conversation. The atmosphere is quite friendly. They have Diebels on tap, which is quite a rarity in this part of the country. Overall a pretty cool place.

Paule's Metal Eck is "the" ultimate heavy metal/rock bar. Even if you are not a metal/rock fan, you need to visit this place at least for one beer. But don't do the mistake to ask "What kinds of beer do you have?" - Cause they have almost 50 different kinds there... %-() The service personal can be compared to coyote ugly: "hot chicks". Plus they are all really nice and speak fluent english. The Bar has a pool table and a view slot-machines to play with your friend while having a drink. My personal recommendation regarding the drinks is the "B52" that they mix there. All in all, this Bar is among the top #3 of Berlin, even if you are not a metal fan!
Yeah. hard'n'heavy

The burgers here are pretty decent, not quite as good as the ones at Burgermeister. The fries with ketchup, mayo, and onions are surprisingly good. The onions are very finely chopped and sauteed. They have beers from Rothaus and Augustiner, so you don't have to drink Berliner Pilsener or Beck's.

Got a take away bacon burger. It was OK, even though the taste reminded me a bit of burgers from franchising companies. Especially disappointing was the quality of meat: definitely the worst of all non - Mac Donald's burger places I have tried in Berlin so far.
Cosy place with great soledor coffee and sweet selfmade cakes, salads, yoghurt and shakes. Friendly Service :) Wlan available.
They offered a wifi for free when i was using iphone!
A butcher/deli that does classic german dishes at fast food speed and prices. Clearly popular with the locals, i was impressed with my goulash, and already want to try the rest of the menu.
Just like Mama's cooking. If she were German!
the best 2,50EUR pizza you can find! not the best pizza you had in your life, but the price/value is fantastic!

The food was nothing special. The service was bad, I had a really bad experience and the waiter didn't treat me good at all. When I payed they didn't gave me the change, so I asked for it and they throw the money on the table in a bad way, thinking that I was tipping him with 5 euros (something that I should decide). I don't recomend this restaurant, the portions are small and the prices normal/high.
Bilig, Schön Toll, alles prima :) SKY Bemear, Gute Atmosphäre.. wery well

The best pizza I have had in a LONG time. They don't make them like this at Peppez. Also, I came in late, they kept the restaurant open for about fifteen extra minutes to make me a pizza from scratch. Quality all around with this one.

This place has its unique charm. A break from some of the dingy Berliner bar motif, but still eccentric in character. The low lights, hushed buzz and curious decor make for an excellent backdrop for an intimate gathering with good friends or a special someone.
As far as I'm concerned, best Italian place in a 10 kilometre radios.
Good and cheap hookah (schischa) and very good service.
Bagelheaven. Great coffee too. Tiny.
Just really nice guys working here and most important of all great coffee
Very nice food!
I don't think there is a better Italian place in Friedrichshain. I ate their several times, fish and meat are both excellent and fresh. Great atmosphere, great food!
Pretty German for a supposedly Italian place. But everything was edible and the place was nice to sit in.

Im on holiday in Berlin and I tryed different locals but yesterday I had the best evening in Metamorfosia! Is an excellent ambient for a romantic dinner with the incredibile taste of italian food! I m sure I will come back!!!
Fantastic place, amazing bartenders, good music and good people. I had here one of the best Old Fashioneds I have ever had.
Tasty flammkuchen, great location especially in summer. Service usually very slow though, so be prepared to make yourself seen!

Worst service ever. We visited the Kurhaus Korsakow on our every year trip to Berlin. The food looked quite nice on the Internet. The place wasn't even crowded. Sad thing, the waiter totally failed to serve our ordered food. We've been sitting quite close to the bar with the barkeeper behind the whole time. My girlfriend and me had a nice conversation and our one and only drinks, so we forgot about time. 45min after we ordered we were wondering about the fact that every guest who joined after us, already got their food served. It turned out, the waiter didn't send our order to the kitchen. Disappointed and even a bit angry, we didn't leave smiling. <Dat hab' ich echt noch nie erlebt.> Do I have to rate one star , to get out of this ? So one star is for serving 2 drinks

I came to this place on my search to find good Jägerschnitzel in Berlin. Unfortunately, the internet misinformed me me, and there was no Jägerschnitzel on the menu. I did however have some delicious Käsespätzle. It reminded me of the mac'n'cheese at Dogfish Head AleHouse in Gaithersburg, MD (obviously with Spätzle rather than elbow macaroni). My friend's Schnitzel (Wiener Art) was also pretty good. The waiter was very friendly. He also brought an English menu for my friend without being asked to. However, the restaurant quickly filled up, and it seemed like this one guy was the only actual waiter. Thus, it was next to impossible to get another round of beer and then to pay.
Very nice one. Huge portions, delicious european food, relaxing atmosphere, polite staff. Excellent restaurant to spend a night out.
Delicious vegan food, great choice. Service was very friendly and prices are fair. It's a little rustic, and not very cozy, but that's ok.
Great vegan food, cool atmosphere and fair price. recommending the cordon bleu and the home-made burgers.
Exceptionally tasty!

Food and the spices blend well. Reminds me of home food. Glad to have found it and most definately will return again and again. Waiters and chef keep up the the good work. To the owner give them a raise you have a wonderful saff, cheers
Great dinner, you have to try the hoppers :)
Very balanced food. Lots of vegan options.
Had my meal with a Roti bread and a salted Lasso - yummy! Big portions too.

Very friendly and tasty restaurant, for a very nice budget price. I ate here more than often, when i cross Berlin, they cook with a delicate taste, not too spicy if you don't like it. Their nam breads are really nice!
Was always great, and still is in the new location. Much more space, quite crowded at weekends. But definitely worth waiting for!
I went here because it was marked as excellent on google local. Its ok but wouldn't make an extra effort to go back. A bit plain and nothing you couldnt easily rustle up at home
Great Bulgarian food for a very reasonable price. Really friendly service!
. Texture of the felafel was perfect. Two sandwiches, a pastry, and two drinks for under 9€. Unbelievable.
Great BRUNCH on weekends. Only 6,90 € all you can eat. Everything was very tasty. Save some room for wonderful apple pie..included in price.

15 Jan 2011 We went here last night as 4 people and were very impressed with the food.I had a fresh mozerella salad and rumpsteak with brocolli and potato wedges in a gorgonzola sauce,Portions were a nice size and the price was cheaper than i expected,They do every type of breakfast between 9-4 .I will definetly come back here again

Excellent food at prices that cannot be believed! Pizza, pasta, and Middle Eastern offerings like falafel and tabouleh. Try the lentil soup: creamy, heavenly and served in a big dish with pita on the side. Every visitor I have had from the States has absolutely enjoyed themselves. A solid bet!
nice interior, very polite personnel, good selection of wines, and what I did like the most is the petiscoes with hap, cheese and chorizo. recommend!
Good company, good food, good wines!
Great Burgers cooked just right at reasonable prices and funky environment... I'll be back here!

I had a mediterean burger at this place. It was delicious! And also the value is very good. I payed 7.10 Euros for the burger menu which comes together with fries and a coleslaw salad. I had more than enough.
Nice location, friendly staff, good food. Would visit again :-)
The best sit-down burger restaurant in friedrichshain. There seems to be a lively atmosphere and good service.
Fantastic sandwiches, delicious (and healthy) shakes and a really amazing fudge cake. Love it.
Superhealthy food! Best quesadilla with guacamole in Berlin

unfriendliest bar i ve been to. been there about 7 times. staff hates tourists, which is understandable because there are so many in this area. but they will demand (!) a tip before even ordering. dont go there. great music, great place as such, just the worst waiters i ve ever witnessed. seriously, out of 7 times i ve been treated like a cockroach ^^. even when tipping a lot they dont give a s*** about you.
Good both meat and vegan options :-).
Very good Vietnamese, Thai, Cambodian and Lao food. Worth the money, nice ambiance and friendly English spoken staff.
Absolutely delicious crêpe in a charming little bistro.
best Crêpes in town.
Awesome coffee + cheesecake + staff/owners. Let the barista guide you!!! Lovely filtered coffee!
Video Clips on Wall TV, bilhar, beer and girls, beautiful girls.
Nothin thrilling about that place... I went 3-4 times there in 5 years (I live in nearby)...
Schnitzel tag on Sundays for cheap schnitzels :-) good atmosphere and good varieties of German food on the menu.
I love their food and that they have a delivery service. However, their website is a horrific, customer-killing nuisance! If you're gonna do delivery, call. Or use one of the delivery apps. Trust me!
Nice place all over
Great cakes, great atmosphere. Highly recommended!
Very expnsive
Closed on Tuesdays
Perfect prices, friendly service
Meat was acceptable, but not excellent. Chicken wasn't fresh. Service wasn't bad.

If you want slow service and waitresses with attitude then this is the place for you. Unfortunately I can't give a good review of this restaurant even though the food was ok (although there was a huge difference between the 3 schnitzels we ordered) as the service was terrible. It took more than an hour for our food to come out even though there were only 5 or so other tables also dining and we didn't order starters. Drinks took about 15-20 mins to be delivered even though the barman wasn't busy. When we asked if our food was coming out we got told a short 'Yes' without even checking with the kitchen or apologising for the slow service. When paying by card at the end I was told no credit cards even though mine was a visa debit. She didn't even try using it in the card terminal before handing it back to me. I loved staying on Simon Dach Strasse as there were plenty of amazing bars and eateries but this was not one of them.
Great food and great value.
Genuine place, very cosy. Pizza looked great, but no taste.
Best truly italian pizza in Berlin!

A lovely little restaurant that consistently produces high-quality authentic Italian food. They might not serve a huge variety of food, but what they do, they do brilliantly. You can tell this is a labour of love and passion. Highly reccommended! Details: The staff is all Italian, very attentive and friendly even during the busiest of times. The place is tiny and usually packed, so there is a lot of jostling and manoevering going on, but everyone keeps their good mood. The decor is pretty much non-existent, which makes the place look deceptively plain. You may have to sit on a folding chair next to the till, but let's be honest – who goes to a restaurant for the seats? The menu (which has all dishes listed both in Italian/German and English – not standard in Berlin restaurants!) is a little pizza-heavy, but those are simply to die for – wafer-thin, baked in a proper wood-fired brick oven, with fresh and often home-made toppings. There is an additional weekly menue of slightly more upscale appetizers, primi and secondi. You'd best come with a really empty stomach, because there is so much good stuff to try – like the anchovy bruschetta I'll be dreaming about for the next week or so. If you still have room after your main course, I recommend the dolce sampler, with a little tiramisu, panna cotta and mousse ciocolatta – very good to share, too. And have a cappuccino with that. Oh, and I can only echo the call to RESERVE, preferably DAYS AHEAD! And be prepared to wait a bit between courses. There is a constant stream of take-away customers besides the table orders, and a pizza oven only has so much space. Freshly prepared food takes time and effort. It's definitely worth the wait.
One of the best (affordable) italian restaurants in Berlin: the toppings of the pizzas are smooth!
5.50€ for the gigantic burger
Good place, though sometimes a bit empty and there is an entrance fee if a DJ is present
Awesome little open air bar/cafe half-hidden between abandoned warehouses covered in graffiti. Had a beer and currywurst with fries there in the afternoon sun.
Excellent food, service, atmosphere and wine.
Like the Wiener Schnitzel and the fresh Kaiserschmarrn. Nice designed place, all white, fresh and tasty food, homemade. Prices are a bit more expensive than average in that area
Try the grießmehl desert for an orgasmic experience.

Wasn't sure whether to go here as it was a bit outside the city but we tried it following a Twitter recommendation. It was quaint, welcoming, interesting and the beer is flippin ace! I would highly recommend a visit to this unique microbrewery, you'll be hard pushed to find anything like this.
Do try their homebrews, they are excellent! Nice staff, good atmosphere.

This is the best Hausbrauerei that I've been to yet in Berlin. The beer is pretty decent. The Dunkles is a Schwarzbier. I'd rate it as better than a Köstritzer but not as good as the Schwarzbiere at Siegburger Brauhaus in NRW or Bayerischer Bahnhof in Leipzig. Their current special beer, a Braun Lager, was alright. It wasn't as malty I would have liked. The Brotzeit looked tasty and according to the menu contained local and organic cheese and meats. I definitely plan on trying the snacks the next time I come. Although I didn't have any, I noticed that the tequila selection looked quite promising -- no Sierra Tequila to be seen.
The best cider in the world! A good place away from all the touristy stuff
Fantastic microbrewed beer
Good music, can be a little crowded but the bar at the back with sofas is a nice place to chill
A great chillspot with a nice concept. Breakfast is served although the portions are on the small side. Great service though and lovely music.
Lovely little indie bar in Friedrichschain; great music and interesting decor. Slightly flimsy chairs.
One of the last authentic places in the kiez... perfect coffee and breakfast and really good atmosphere for beer and wine...

Authentic northern-Italian home-cooking style food at decently good prices. I come here mostly because my roommate who is from Milan vouches for it's authenticity. What's important to note about most restaurants you go to (especially the asian ones) are that the menu has all been germanified. Here it actually tastes like Italian food. Your pizzas will be on point, and this past weekend I ordered a pasta and was a bit shocked at how big my portion was. (of course this will vary depending on which pasta you order). The pasta is quite good. I haven't been to the other locations, but if you want a very low key casual environment and good food, then come here. It's not fancy, not overdone, not touristy, not really romantic- it's a good hang out place for people from all over. Plus.. grappa or limoncello at the end of your meal ;)
It's my favorite italian restaurants in Berlin. I never think possible to eat real italian food in any other city but already it's a fact that is possible. Thank you for the team!

Good food, Atrocious service. The Lady and I had eaten there a few times, the pizza is good and the service average. On this occasion, however it was terrible. We waited at the door for fifteen minutes catching the eye of waiters and waitresses, and they just ignored us. I asked to be seated and we were given a table. No menus arrived, in the meantime, three other tables were seated and given menus and orders taken. I had to go adn ask for a menu at the service hatch, and was told it was coming. 5 minutes later I went again to ask for a menu, the waiter went off to get one, evidently expecting me to follow, but I went and sat down again. The waiter shouted at me, walked to the table and threw the mus at it from couple of meters away. We stood up, thanked him for his friendly service and left. We have not been back since. There are other places in Berlin which do equally as good, and better, pizza and have impeccable service. Pizza Lubau in Friedrichshain is one top choice and Papa Panne in mitte is another. I would heartily reccomend these two over. Il Ritrovo-Cucina Casalinga Popolare.
Good pasta, nice service. Food took 10 mins to arrive. Didn't like the decor but it's a matter of taste.
great italian-punk-rock atmosphere and superb italian PIZZA, very good desserts too.
This place is like sitting somebody's living room. Unfortunately my living room is nicer.

The decor was kitschy and fun. The music selection was eclectic but quite good. The bartender was quite surly. I asked him what beers they had before I sat down, and he walked me to a table, pulled out a menu, and told me to look at it. A friend of mine ordered a Jack and Coke at the bar, and the bartender was very annoyed because my friend hadn't looked at the menu yet. It ends up that the bartender hates Jack Daniels so the bar doesn't stock it. To tourists: You can't order in English at this bar.
Loaded with GDR-Memorabilia. Great Czech Beer from tap. Very eclectic music selection.
this is the restaurant part of the Almodovar hotel. Everything of high quality, very good home-baked bread! Extensive vegan/veggie breakfast. Nice atmosphere and friendly service.
Came here and wasn't disappointed - cheap entry, friendly staff, great music and fabulous club. Only wish I'd had the energy to stay for longer!
nice place, nice club and I love the chill out area in the style of an old east german kitchen
nice outdoor ping-pong table
Awesome club in the spirit of Club der Visionaere but bigger and less crowded.
Probably one of the best asia-resturants in Berlin

There is much I love but some thing which are going the wrong way. I love the concept of asian food served tapas style on small affordable plates. A party of 4 should order 3 plates (3€/plate) each and share. Great idea! The food is very tasty and amazingly all dishes are served at the same time even if you order 10 or more different ones. You have a selections of pork, beef, chicken and vegetarian options. I love the fresh summer rolls, yummy! Although you feel the quality suffering on a busy night on the weekend, the food is not so much on the point, spices and herbs not being used in the same perfect way, which made this place great. The also can order quite good cocktails there, BUT prices has gone up ridiculous (10€ a glass), a Mai Tai is now known as Transit Thai, which means smaller glass, even less rum inside and no longer served burning. It used to be really strong (at least for me), now its more like a juice and I don't drink cocktails a lot. So ending up paying so much more for bad cocktails than for good food earns that place only 3 stars any longer. A year ago it would have been a strong 5 stars, its a shame.
a charming restaurant that serves a kind of 'fusion' food. service and food are excellent
Really nice twist to traditional thai. Small servings of dishs for 3 euro and large servings for 7. It's a nice way to have multiple dishs for cheap.
Great food. Affordable prices.

Wow, so many bad reviews! I went to Zebrano many times and it's still one of my favorite bars in Berlin. I've never had any issues with the service, maybe that's because I always go just for coffee or a beer, but overall I would totally recommend it to anyone because the location is great and the place itself is super nice as well.
Fantastic breakfasts and friendly staff

Pleasant staff and good food on a Saturday afternoon, but when we went back on Sunday morning we encountered what I can only assume was the manager, who proved a nasty piece of work and put us off going there again. With the wealth of choice in the area, that's not going to be hard.
A true Kneipe, focussing on exactly the right things without trying to emulate the sometimes overly trendy neighbouring bars.
Long lines. I hate waiting for 20 minutes to pay for my shopping.

German Cusine With Flair. This unassuming restaurant in the middle of the former East Berlin* is a great place to have a fine selection of German dishes and wines / beers (try the Würzfleisch for starters [ragoût fin] or the delicious pumpkin soup, and the Eisbein [leg-of-pork], Hirschgulasch [deer stew] or the warm Blutwurst [black pudding - who would have thought so?!] for mains). All this comes at very reasonable cost (three starters, three mains, two desserts, OJ,mineral water, two large glasses of wine for Euro 80 all-in), and with a level of service that you'd associate with much more 'upmarket' places (very friendly, with just the right level of attention, meals served at the same time, etc.). I think the UK equivalent is captured by the term 'gastro-pub', and this one would be one of the better examples in this niche. The setting is rustique, but in a pleasant (clean) way, parking is easy, and public transport is ~350m walking distance either side (between tube stations Frankfurter Allee and Magdalenenstr., that is ~6 stops from Alexanderplatz). *) According to our waiter, the impossible-to-pronounce name Fünf-Ländereck (5 countries point [or corner]; suggestive of a geographic location where the borders of five states meet in one point) is, in fact, a reference to the 5 new Bundesländer in Germany, and "-eck" is simply indicative of the restaurant's (corner) location...
Nothing special but OK.
The food was fine but uninspiring. Service was very slow.
medium quality food on plastic furniture
The third time we have been here now. Always excellent food and service and a very comfortable terrace. Chefs specialities have always proved a winner.

A pleasant surprise - the place and service are neither good nor bad but the food is really nice and the prices are low. One of those places with good sushi: the shrimp actually tastes like shrimp and the squid won't be confused with a piece of rubber... The Vietnamese dishes like Duck with rice and such are also excellent. Most of the Vietnamese dishes are between 5 and 7 euros and drinks aren't expensive either so good value for money. Am Deutsch: Gestern hier Sushi gegessen. Die Lage und Service sind nichts Besonderes, aber das Essen ist sehr gut. Die Garnelen schmeckt wie Garnelen, Tintenfisch ist kein Gum mi und das Vietnamesischen essen ist auch excellent und die Preisen sind sehr gut.

You want Thai food? You want it quick? I think you'll like this places. It is made from scratch and is cheap. The quality is good for the price, don't expect miracle rice at this price though, it is rice, but nothing special.
Amazing. Go here. Ask for some shots of Mexican if you like bloody Marys.
Exellent looking restaurant with fair prices. Exellent food and service. Quiet and relaxing chinese atmosphere. Outside the restaurat looks a bit neutral and can be hard to spot.
