Just finished a great 4 hour lunch. It was great. Excellent schnitzel, service and tequila. Very reasonable prices for the quality and comfort. Highly recommended cafe bar in the area.
For a breakfast, a piece of cake and tea, a drink with friends or the awesome schnitzel... THE address.
good food, little bit long waiting,but acceptable. nice environment a. staff
Really nice brunch spot - be sure to try out the lime soda where you add your own sugar syrup! The sandwiches really hit the spot too and the coffee with ice cream is a hangover's worst enemy.
Tasty coffee pastries and sandwiches. Great bagels, too. Would love a salad, though.
Great place, good breakfast (try the müsli), good music, calm and pleasant atmosphere
Chesss very goodd
Nice place to talk and drink a coffee; phantastic apple cake with vanilla ice :-) Definitely a must !
Anywhere where you can discuss whiskey options for an old fashioned gets kudos from me but having a selection of rye whiskeys is even better. A bit expensive for Berlin standards but serious quality.
Nice atmosphere, excellent food! Creative dishes, a great place to enjoy a Steak! In addition to the restaurant there is a Blues Bar area within the bar with live music.
Great food!
Awesomely nutritious vegan doner in the middle of a meaty country. Service was fast and friendly, great urban east berlin look and feel. Loved it and will be coming back as often as I can ♥
maybe it was the late hour, but the place was kinda dirty and the french fries were brown! okay burger. limited choice. friendly people.
RADDEST SHOP EVER. All vegans of the world should take a pilgrimage to this cruelty-free mecca. Make sure you get the Spezial Pommes too!
Top veggie-snack place. Fairly cheap and the Vöner is delicious. The staff is usually nice, but the process is a bit slow. So its a nice place to sit down and relax.
da job! Irish translation- a very fine eatery indeed,cheap and fufilling
A glass of still water 2,80€, tomato sauce disgusting, chicken burned.....but on the top water 2,80€!!!!! Bastard!!!
Acceptable place to have Mexican food and drinks
Very nice place to have a breakfast
Awesome place to hang out and have a descent coffee! And for the coffee lovers you can even buy their home roasted blends there!

Almost the best coffees you can buy in Berlin. Great variety of different sorts of fair traded coffee specialities from all over the world. Sometimes the small café is a little bit overcrowded. They also offer barista education and professional coffee machines.
So good, it's incredible! Not very big so better to go during the week. Vodka shots are served all the time, courtesy of the house. Highly recommended!
Tasty food, excellent staff, good vodka.
Leckeres Curry, super Fruchtshakes.
Nice little local with very tasty "modern" German dishes. Service is very friendly but can sometimes be a bit spotty.

ATTENTION!!!!!!! Racist Behavior at Lidl of Einbecker Str at Friedrichshain - Berlin. I just got pushed out from this Lidl by a very rude employee without any explanation at all... The employee of this supermarket (an old blonde lady) was very rude and pushed me and my wife to the door like we were criminals!
Best quality at low cost.

The restauant is a nice place to be. Lying in an urban area, a quiet street. You can sit out on the terrace and enjoy the meal and/or drinks. The price is great for the meals served: good quality, abundant food, reasonable price. Be sure to try the Berliner rote or the Berliner weisse, both beers with a sweet taste. It tastes like lemonade, so don't drink too fast ;)
Not the best Kaufland
L.E.C.K.E.R.*-* TOTALLY TOP
Lived around the corner for 6 years, great food, great service, awesome views and very family friendly. I miss this restaurant.
Big portions, great food, very expensive though regardless how upscale the neighborhood is.

I decided to bring my wife here for our 10th anniversary! It was so romantic and relaxing. Amazing place with great rooms, restaurant, views. Everything was made with style till the last tissue! We had a wonderful stay. Thank you!
Very traditional German food. Tasted great. Main meals from about 6.90. Really friendly staff and great wine
Very good german restaurant, great costumer service.
Very delicious German cooking, good service, nice atmosphere, not cheap. I especially liked the wienerschnitzel and fried potatoes.

While this place has good food, it's clear they're completely focused on their (wealthy) regular customers. I was decently dressed but they would only seat me outside. They didn't bother to bring me bread or parmiggiano for my pasta until I asked for them; these were brought to the older customers in suits immediately. Also, my pasta with shrimp had just 2 shrimp on the side; the diavlo sauce, while tasty, was not spicy at all; and they charged 4 euros for a very small apfelsaftscheurle. I would not recommend this place.

Very well prepared Italian food in a calm dining room. I've been here twice and tried pizza, a couple of different pastas, as well as soup and dessert. Everything has been unpretentious, fresh and nicely cooked.
good place to start your day or just coffee and sweet
I'm italian and I can say that is the best italian food I ever ate outside italy
One of a few places in Berlin I don't want to be at. But I am.
im Sommer mit Fußball: the place to be!

Best Chinese Restaurant in the city. It's very close to our house, so we are regulars. The food speaks for itself..delicious! You have a huge assortment of food to choose from. The Restaurant is spacious and very tastefully decorated with Chinese art. And what makes all of this coming together, is the great service from the Waiter and Waitress. Berlinmc5.

If you want to have tin of sardins for 19 euro - it's you place. They have such dish, you can check it. I thought that it something delicios from their kitchen, but I had realy tin of sardines which I can buy at the grocery store! My salad was with nice sauce, but also with sand, unfortunatly.

Extremly tasty are the Tagliatelle prepared at your table on top of a parmesan cheese wheel flambéed! Servers are very child-friendly. Occassionally special events such as "Pasta... e non basta!" combined with live music.

Little nice bakery. You can buy bread and bread rolls, croissants, cake and pretzel. For an emergency you can also get butter, eggs, juices or wine. Assortment isn't overwhelming, but if you are in need, it comes very handy. You can drink coffee and eat something there as well. They also have daily press as well as some magazines. Open at sundays.
I like going to this restaurant, and almost everything is great, you can even bring your pets ......
great food, nice people
Nettes Personal, toller Kaffee!

My wife and I have been to The Middle Way several times. We invite friends to join us in this very calm, peaceful, wonderful atmosphere. The Service is Very Friendly and the presentation of the dishes are beautiful. The food quality is excellent and all our friends have enjoyed the experience as well. They do not mind adjusting the dish to suit your taste. It is always a pleasure to visit The Middle Way!
This place have exellent quality of dishes and service. Besides, it has splendid view.
Perfect! Great food and low prices. Nice staff too.
Go there in winter on a Friday night - listen to live music, drink ouzo and get involved in the real mediterranean fun on a gloomy Belin day
Have visited this restaurant 3-4 times now. Always good food, reasonable prices, generous portions. Nice selection of beers eventhough some of the 100 are quite gimmicky. Highly recommended!

The only thing that came quickly was the bill. Lovely setting with view of the lake, but the food was nothing special. It was okay but not good or very good, which one could expect from the high prices. You are basically paying for the views. What is totally unacceptable though is the appalling service, which even by German standards was charmless and inefficient. We had to ask several times for items we had ordered, including 30 minutes for a bottle of water. Of course, not once did we get an apology and when we asked the waiter why the service was so poor, we were told that this was just the way it was! We had some pasta with clams. Unfortunately nothing special and lots of broken shells mixed in. They had no diet coke, again not acceptable for a restaurant of this kind. We like going to good and expensive restaurants and also happily pay for good service. We are really not sure why anyone would give this restaurant 5 stars. I guess they must have been written by the owner.
Fantastic place! On 30 november I've been there with my friend Ewa (she lives in Berlin) and we listening a new orleans jazzband. Marvelous!

The food is hit-or-miss, but I appreciate the comfortable family-friendly atmosphere. My kid really enjoys "Pizza a la Mickey Mouse", where they form a round "head", comprising the main pizza, with two big mouse ears of pizza crust. I lean toward the pizza myself. I'm not too excited about the pasta.
Good Italian restaurant "around the corner". Family place. Good pizza and pasta
The best one in Berlin
Nuce Pub worth a drink or two
best pub in town! ******

This English friendly bar in Charlottenburg is a nice place to spend a few hours after work or on a lazy weekend day. The bartender is friendly and the drinks are not watered down as you may find at other bars. There is outdoor seating as well as a brick walled interior. Diners can view a large projection screen TV while eating inside or, they can listen to the oldies (usually American jazz). Burgers are good however they would be better if the meat patty was a little larger to match the size of the toasted bun..
Very nice atmosphere and service. Even for tourists! ! Thanks
We had a great time and a wonderful dinner. The drinks were spot on.

A short visit to Berlin can only be fulfilled with a visit to 'Juleps'. Possibly the only totally authentic New York cocktail bar,in Berlin. Great food, cool cocktails and a really friendly atmosphere. Don't miss this one folks!!!

The food was great and the decor was quite nice. However, Genazvale, which is walking distance away from Mimino is the superior Georgian restaurant. The bread, khachapuri, and house wine are all much better at Genazvale and the decor more Georgian. The only reason I tried Mimino is because Genazvale was closed for a private party, and that is the only reason that I would return.
Excellent Food, top Interior, friendly stuff - I love it
They have Forgotten to Cook my food and told me 1 hour later.

what can I say...I find this place so great that I am not sure I want to share it....but I want that their business flourishes... great cuisine, great service... a perfect place for romantic gourmets evenings.... yes, the price is high for Berlin but the ratio price/quality is great... no tourist here we are between berliners /

The host was a cool Italian guy with a ponytail. Service was good and they understood me and my girlfriend's english just fine. Food was good, the olive oil was very tasty. The housewine (pinot gris) was not very tasteful. Antipasto Rustico is a good starter for 2. Not expensive at all. Chairs outside could be uncomfortable for seniors but fine otherwise. Would recommend.

This is an excellent Italian restaurant. I ordered what I thought was some plain spaghetti with sauce, but it turned out to be surprisingly spicy (in a good way). I really liked that you get to have some bread with olive oil while you wait for your food. It is definitely a plus that it is located right on Ku'damm and that you can eat outside and enjoy the sights and sounds of the city.

It's a must, if you like Italian Cuisine: situated at the Ku-Damm, directly vis-a-vis of the Schaubühne, one of the most famous theaters in Germany, Francucci's Ristorante is the right mix of a casual Italian Pizzeria with a high quality kitchen. Taste the home made pasta,, the wonderful foccacia with fresh herbs, the excellent olive oil as well as the meat dishes. Franco, the owner, is one of the few chefs who is using La Fina beef, from special uruguaian Estancias, with a great natural taste. The winecard is compared to a lot of other Italian restaurants well assorted and gives a wide range from casual good wines from Sicilia and Sardegna to other fine and premium ones. Maybe the open wines could be calculated a bit more friendly. The only lack we could find are the deserts which seem a bit lost beyound all the other great offers: dry profiteroles with a not at all superb chocolate topping, an indifferent and not inspired Tiramisu... So better drink the wonderfull espresso and have a lovely limoncello - its worth to be there anyway.

Balthazar is an upscale restaurant at the upper end of Kurfürstendamm in Berlin-Wilmersdorf. Chef de cuisine Holger Zurbrüggen presents a great menu with great specials. For example during the Soccer World Cup 2010 in South Africa they were offering a african inspired menu. The food is always superb and the service is great as well. You should call in advance to make reservations. In summer it is possible to sit outside.
good and consistent standby, a safe harbor to take guests, walk away full without emptying the wallet, leaving enough money to get a gelato somewhere afterwards
For German standards fantastic, friendly, competent and efficient service. The steaks are good for German standards and the cheesecake is to die for.
Great service and rib eye. Fair pricing, great atmosphere.
We went there for a birthday and got a nice surprise from the waiters :D
2.5 stars. Not too terrible but also not too great. Vegetarian dish was burnt, meat dish was too sweet.
Unsual Chinese dishes, but the flavors are a bit generic. Huge wine selection.

The food is average but I would be cautious with any of the Mexican dishes on the menu. Depending on the person, some staff are just rude, others are friendly. Is a cool place to hang out and people watch.
Excellent breakfast and great value for money.
Always nice
Old hamburgers, soggy fries and very rude staff! This restaurant is p*ss poor.

Great fun place. Definitely one you need to visit while in Berlin. A unique place that will make you uncomfortable at first before you fall in love with it. Never laughed so hard in a pub before. Friendly staff and novelty drinks a plenty.
This is a one of its kind. If you go to Berlin its vital you go here.
This pub is a legendary one. It's funny and the staff is friendly. A must visit if you're in Berlin. This one is not your regular pub. Period !!!
perfect place, perfect food, perfect price, perfect to eat and spend your time with friends
Samos is a pretty good Greek restaurant. I had the lamb kabob, which was tasty. The beer they had there was delicious too.

Very customer-orientated. Dishes have distinct flavour, a welcome change from the ubiquitous Thai-Chinese restaurants in Berlin. Menu is quite meat-intensive, but can be adapted to suit the vegetarian palate - thanks to their service attitude! We got a complimentary dessert (and warm hand-wash towels, which were perfect on that freezing evening). Will surely visit it again.
Traditional and not touristy

If you cannot speak German, forget about it!! Rude and dismissing staff. Could not bother to translate some items on menu. The waiter threw the bread on the table like we were bothering him. Some insulting words as well. Sam from London

I ate here last summer. It was incredible. The beet soup was fantastic. Our dinners were incredible. The women who worked there gave the best recommendations. If I'm ever in Berlin again I will go here for sure.

I went in the first time not sure what it would be like as I'm from UK so not a local but was very pleasantly surprised, when I went in the place was absolutely packed to the rafters, in fact I recall on the first visit that I was asked if I wanted to wait for a table or take a seat at a table now with others already eating. (I was alone) When a place is so full people have to share tables (not everybody's idea of fun I know) it is a sign of an establishment with a great local reputation! When I saw the menu I saw why, It was very very cheap. I thought it would be cheap & cheerful grub but no it was Excellent food and despite the place being overcrowded it arrived in good time. The staff were very helpful and were working extremely hard, giving good service to so many people is not easy. it was so good that I went back again another evening despite my trip only being 4 days! The only very little thing that made it a bit tricky for me was that the menu was not translated and staff did not speak English but that is my issue not theirs and to be fair it is not in Alexanderplatz so you don't expect them to have to cater for foreign speakers anyway! It was -15 outside when I went so to be so full when everywhere else is deserted shows how good it is, People tend to stay in out of the cold in that weather but lots were prepared to brave it to eat here!
good food, too expensive cocktails.
One of the best indian restaurants I ever went to
My family and I had a great time and loved the food. Proffesional and kind staff
TOP

The first thing they do is poor you a glass of water and place the bottle on your table. This will cost you 6 euro the bottle. We ate good and planned to leave a tip. The bottle of water cost them there tip. To bad.
Best sushi in Berlin. Small place but excellent !
best and very fresh Sushi in town

This fantastic little place in Wielandstr. we found only because it was right below our hotel pension. From the first, first course to the very last we enjoyed every bit - both times we were there. The couple that owns the place are extremely hospitable and the kitchen is over all exclusive - very much worth every single cent - which was not a cent too much in a Danish view. We hope to be back again - in Berlin as well as in La Caleta!! Danish woman with father and brother

Higher quality restaurant with fair pricing. The portions are on the smaller side, but satisfactory. They serve French/Italian/German style dishes, that are always very well prepared. Especially the daily changing lunch offers are a great. Can't really go wrong with this one.
Nice place, good service. They have smoking room

24/12 beautiful view on the snowy outside. Planning my stay in Berlin was nice there. Unfortunately my breakfast was not heated correctly. I went back, the lady heated it again, but no sorry or offer for a new sandwich or anything. Wasn't too bad, but I expected more from Starbucks. Hopefully one-time incident.
One of the best Sushi places i have ever been, don't know why people say that the quality is bad... i love it ;)! Good prices / good quality / good Quantity / normal Service
tasted of nothing, vegetables not fresh and overall bad quality. Definitely not worth going there again

Its a nice place to eat during the warm weather, since you can sit outside. I had some of their pasta, and I thought it was very good. The service was fast and friendly. I would definitely return to this restaurant again.
Very good place. Nice owners, not expenssive.
After strolling through the city during a heat wave in July of 07 I stumbled upon Pasta Nova. The free wi-fi, the simple but very tasty food and conversation made this American very comfortable.

Having visited Berlin twice in 2007 and 2008 I would highly reccommend Pasta Nova for its great coffee, pasta and good converstation with the owner Rene. You can enjoy a relaxing drink outside and meet the locals. Try the pfifferlinge mushrooms with pasta...top class! (Yum!)

During a six day stay over New Year 07/08, found Pasta Nova to be a haven. Great service, good coffee/food and good conversation with owner Renee. Welcoming, quiet and ideal for planning next days itinerary, with the help of the free wi-fi. Apparently normally busier out of holiday season when the locals are at work. Busy or quiet, this place really works. I will definitely pop in on my next visit.
I don't have to say more. They changed their menu and offer now sushi and other japanese food. Everything is very tasty and delicious.
Great hotel. Beautiful, clean, and got everything you need. Breakfast is really nice and really complete. Good service and also fair price for what you get.

The people hear are incredibly rude. If that's the kind of service you want, and wish to reinforce people who should by all rights be working in a factory far from the public, then you'll probably have the best currywurst in Berlin. It looked fantastic, but the people were so rude, we didn't get anything.
Standard currywurst
Great Italian restaurant
awesome ,u can find everything in a low price

The service was very poor. We had 4 different waiters during our meal but that was not the problem. One of the waitresses was very unfriendly, openly racist (she made a jab at coloured people) AND on top of that this very same waitress refused to give us our bill BECAUSE we didn't speak GERMAN. She UNDERSTOOD what we asked of her and yet she walked off and called out loud that she won't bring it to us if we don't ask in German. We had to ask one of her colleagues. But come on. This is an American Diner. The workers SHOULD be friendly and NOT make very rude and racist comments towards their customers. If you are a tourist and don't speak German, I would recommend you going to another place. Route 66 has very poor service. Very uncomfortable to be around and served by unfriendly staff.

Avoid at all costs - Berlin is full of cheap, great and quirky cafés. This is an expensive, tacky fastfood joint that does not even rival McDonalds. Value - very poor, compared to Berlin standards. Atmosphere- was OK, but tacky - I guess that could have been part of the fun, but the service and food soon ruined that. Service - was just below the bare minimum, the only time the waitresses engaged with us, was to point out that the tip was not included. Food - absolutely horrendous. A diner calling itself Route 66 should at least be able to cook a burger. The milkshake was passable, but everything else was horrid - we did not finish our meal. To be precise - the cheeseburger consisted of the flimsiest, nigh-translucent bread imaginable, with a beef of grey, more-boiled-than-grilled, mystery meat. I have bought better ready-made from my supermarket. The cheese was a "cheddar" of equal cheapest imaginable quality, and solidified quickly. The onion rings, chips and especially vegetables were just boring and far below par.
You can choose between more burgers than you have time for, and they all seem delicious!
Generous portions. Decent price. I recommend the ribs. We will come back for sure.
Very poor service.
Very good food and excellent service. Not far off Ku'damm.
Friendly, family atmosphere. Great authentic Italian food. Inexpensive.

If just got back from my vacation in Berlin and of all the places if been this is definitely one I will always remember!!! Service: The service was really great! Christian ,the owner of the restaurant, helped us find the perfect meal & drinks for me and my girlfriend, Suzan. And he also gave us some recommendations for places we haven´t seen jet. Food: I had the wiener schnitzel with french fries and my girlfriend the nürnberger sausages with sauerkraut and roasted potatoes and it was really good! I loved the schnitzel and Suzan fell in love with the sauerkraut. Drinks: I had a big Jever out of the tap witch was one of four beers they offer from the tap, which was quite nice. I especially liked the stronger fast of the german beer. Suzan had a Cosmopolitan and liked it as well. Lokation: We loved the old style of the restaurant! lot of love and greetings from Trikala, Greece

We visied Da Roma one Sunday night after a long drive down from the Baltic coast. We were staying locally and just thought we'd try the place out. We were warmly welcomed and recieved good service. I for one enjoyed the Argentinian steak with peppercorn sauce and I quite liked the competitive prices as well ;)
Very good almost lebanon food. Especially the startor

Wonderful Berliner "pub". When we visit Berlin we always stay just around the corner from "Die Gute Stube". We first visited it a couple of weeks ago and went back for a second time two days later. Good solid hearty food at very reasonable prices. Not sure how how much English was spoken there we were warmly welcomed and we got by easily with our basic German. We'll be back for sure!!
Essen top service flop...... Ambiente ist auch ok

First, the wine, in this case, Riesling "Der Dachs" feinherb QbA Bioweingut Hamm, Rheingau: €5,20 for 100ml, which is a 420% markup from the retail price (€7,50 for 750ml)!!! Given that restaurants pay the wholesale (i.e., no Mehrwertsteuer) price for wine, this is an outrageous markup – unheard of (the normal markup would be 250% of retail, maximum); secondly, the wine list (on an IPad) displays no prices (not surprising...); thirdly, the tasting notes for this Riesling are plagiarised, taken directly from the website of an online bio wine merchant, which tells you a lot about how seriously wine is taken at La Mano Verde; fourthly, the wine itself is dull and has no business being on the wine list of a restaurant in this price league (main courses hovering just under, or just over, €20,00), with "aspirations". My Vorspeise of "Salade de la mer" was quite acceptable, flavour- and texture-wise, but it looked like strangulated seaweed that had been wrapped around a propeller. My main course of Tortelli looked fine on the plate, and the ingredients tasted fresh and no doubt they were healthy, but the dish tasted bland, lifeless – there was no "synergy" effect of the ingredients working together to lift the dish above its individual components. Does the chef have something against salt, I wonder? (although salt is surely vegan)... All in all, I remain unconvinced.

Very tasty. Funky place with iPad menus, you can even check your facebook profile. Lunch special well priced with perfect portions. Friendly staff. Take any anti-vegetarian here to show them how food actually tastes when it's not drowned in animal fats and salt

Excellent service and good atmosphere for small groups or couples. This would be a good place for an anniversary/birthday celebration or to impress a date. I enjoyed the variety of menu items, although I found my dish to be a bit heavy on the salt (spinach ravioli). The other courses - including the sushi - were delicious and creative. The food portions are not generous, this is more like gourmet-style cuisine you might find in Paris... which is fine every now and then, as long as the budget can handle it. If you're really hungry and looking for a less refined and cozier place, head to viasko in Kreuzberg instead.

Das 3-gänger tagesmenü war viel zu essen, aber ganz gut. The daily 3-course menu was great, although a lot of food. My husband got a smoothie (a little pricey, but nicely done) and the main dish of the day (a veggie wrap). He helped me with my bean salad (appetizer) and dessert. It is in a nice, fairly quiet courtyard, which we enjoyed after being out in the city earlier.
Very nice german cousine.

Starters range from medium to high priced (€7.50 for soup, €10.50 for Boar wurst and sauerkraut and €14 for grilled octopus for example) although the portions are good. Similarly for mains, although these seemed more reasonably priced to me (€25 for steak potato gratin and veg, €19.50 for their beef special). Food was tasty and decent all around. Skipped dessert due to being so full. Service a touch on the slow side but friendly. N. B. €60 minimum for credit cards.

My dad and I just recently went there to try it out since I just looove a good steak... Even though the place is nice and cozy and the service just real friendly and considerate - the prices are NOT!!! There is just no reasonable explanation for charging 16 Euros for a medium sized steak with no side dishes. You have to order a baked potatoe or whatever you want to eat along EXTRA and pay for it EXTRA! That's just so typically German about it: pay more - get less! Still, I have to mention that the food was pretty tasty - just way too expensive. Sorry.
Very good french kitchen restaurant. Excellent selection of wine.

coole location, easy going and a great quality of food and drinks. I had a fresh made juice and an espresso. Made with love and great taste. My friend had a cookie which was great as well. Fresh made Tartes which look lovely.

Used to be better. Usher is too lazy to look for a table, suggesting the guest return 30 minutes later. Looking for an empty table by yourself is OK, though... After finding a used and not clean table, service does their proper and quick job of cleaning up and taking orders. The French red wine is great. The Sirloin slices on toast, with onion, mushrooms, and a layer of nondescript cheese is disappointing. Served almost cold, no distinctive taste of the mushroom-onion mix, the cheese kills the last hope of taste. Not important to me, but not too many fries on the plate. Served with Heinz ketchup, which is the least one would expect. Yeah, get a new usher, or just rid that part. Might thus cut the exorbitant cocktail costs. And yes, outside seating offers a great view on the noisy bus-based traffic.

The Berlin Hard Rock stood out as the best one with regards to the decor...lots of incredible rock and roll history pieces. The food was very tasty and came out in a hurry. The wait staff was nice, but it was busy and very loud, kinda hard to hear...which I guess is too be expected in a place called Hard Rock. Tshirt - check, beer glass - check
Great food, great music, great atmosphere! Both the starter and main were so big that I couldn't finish it.
Great place, food is excellent, friendly staff, great atmosphere. Tough to get in most of the time. Used to be able to make online reservations. Enjoy the Hard Rock Berlin every time!
Awesome staff, music, food and interior / as always mind the waiting time! ;)

Really nice, open plan restaurant where you seat yourself at communal tables. Ours was surrounding a tree and you could pick fresh herbs if you wanted to add to your pizza / pasta. Food is cooked fresh in front of you. Reasonable pricing too. Only suggestion would be to reduce waiting times. Free gummybears on the way out are a nice treat though!
Even though it was more or less empty, the pizza took 30 minutes. For Pasta, most of the dishes were not available.
Love it!
Not as quick as one might expect.

This is a great place for weekend brunch, but busy. People dress well to come here, so expect white tablecloths and fastidious waiters. Faultless service and a beautiful building count in their favour. Food was traditional but perfectly cooked.

The ambience is the best trait of this cafe, like a Parisian literary salon. We sat outside even though it was cold because the sun was shining. I can't wait to return when it is warm and plants are green. The fresh croissants were good, but why weren't there vollkorn brötchen in the bread basket? In fact, the bread basket was the most disappointing element of the breakfast. I liked the fact that there were three different choices of sparkling wine by the glass (French champagne, Italian prosecco, German sekt). The service was friendly and attentive. They accept EC Carte.
It's a nice environment. Try to reserve a table if you are going on weekend. I was satisfied with taste and service. Price: 15 - 30 € for a meal
Lovely seating in the winter garden, with nice coffee and cake in the afternoon, followed by a nice dinner with braised ox cheek and ice cream. An absolute joy
Very touristy and expensive...
Try the crepes.
Not too bad...im Italian so the food was pretty good but definitely over price for what it was!!
Nice atmosphere and quite authentic - the food does not match the prices they charge. The wine I wanted was not available nor the main course...... overall not bad but not great value for money.
Very friendly staff, authentic atmosphere
Friendly staff, well maintained. Great place to study. Just watch out for the homeless men selling newspapers, because one stole my friend's phone.

New partners are so unskilled and very unfriendly. I'm also a regular customer at exactly THIS place because it's spacious, cozy and partners WERE so friendly. But today somethings happend. I odered a venti size coffee, but the one I got was grande size. I thought they had some mistakes with communications, so asked back to the partner who made my coffe that is that a certainly venti size, and he said 'yes' with so unpleasant face. (It was exactily grande size. I compared with other customers after that.) Actually, few weeks ago, they added the syrup in my coffe even though I didn't ever mentioned any "S" word. At that time, I thought it's just a little mistake and understood that without any complains, because it was huge rush hour and I liked the people who work there. But now, after today, I don't know. I'll never get there again. And hope you guys also do.

I am a regular Starbucks customer and always get good friendly service EXCEPT at this particular location. I had the unfortunate experience of running into a rather surly fellow by the name of Denis. I ordered 2 coffees to go and a hot sandwich. He put it in a to go bag. I then asked if he could cut it in half. You would have thought that it was the end of the world. I got a huge dose of attitude. When I tried to make light of it by saying,"Oh, you are having a bad day?".his sour demeanor continued. Not fun at all to be treated like a pain in the butt when you are paying customer. Sunday, February 10....12 noon.
Gino is an incompetent, arrogant a******!

Do not go here if you are in need of a quick breakfast. After 15 minutes of waiting we finally got to order. After another 15 came the coffe - and another 15 minutes came the breakfast. Of course the coffe was cold by then. We paid for new coffe. The waitresses were rookies all over.

Heavily overpriced tourist trap. Hot cocoa, (no whipped cream) e3,50 and simple curry wurst with fries e9,50. It wasn't particulary good, either. You can get much better curry wurst for much cheaper at one of Berlin's numerous street food stalls. Staff was ok - not very fast, but not too slow either. Mostly friendly. Atmosphere was ok, but the place is quite big, so it doesn't feel very cosy. They don't have WiFi.
Probably overpriced, but service good compared to other places. Would visit again so pretty good.

If you are searching for a breakfast place, you should definite not come in this horrible restaurant. The scramble eggs are super duper oily. I used five tissues to suck the oil out but it's still a lot underneath the eggs. The bread was from yesterday, that's a big no no in Germany. If you just want to drink a beer,maybe it's a good place, but for breakfast, disaster!
Great place to eat any time of day or night. Huge portions, solidly prepared. Best Calf's liver I ever had anywhere. Big menu, something for everyone.
Very kind staff and good place to eat.

Delizioso! There are many Italian restaurants in Berlin, but this is definitely one of the best. Large variety of dishes, and most of them are very unique and tasty. Good location - close to Kurfurstendamm waiters speak italian, what makes you feel just like you are in italy! :) Good prices on "Business Lunch" & fast and professional service. VERY RECOMMENDED
Terrible place!!! The food and the service are the worst ever. Just a shame and what's really important... a RIP OFF!!! Do not spend a second thinking about eating here!
Smal and kitchy restaurant. We received pasta half cooked. It's a simulacra of an italian restaurant recommend it because are better restaurants in the neibhorhood at the same price
Ok pasta pesto verde. Nothing fancy, just ok food.

Pizza - nice + Pasta was okay. Beer/ Wine - varied options available. Nice and dainty. I willed their wall- filled with pictures of Italian actors :) Neat. I liked the ambiance :) I guess it was a relive from the crowded street - non -stop shopping for 2 hours :) Their Service was very good , warm & helpful
Very nice cafe...... Very nice food ..But no one speaks arabic well any more like the past ... I hope they can make all the staf a part of egypt
Excellent place with great atmosphere and delicious food!
Good but too expensive
Very good italian food , you feel like in italy
Very cheap and excellent food

Quality matches price (Qualität passt zum Preis) - it's not the best Italian you'll ever eat, but for €5 you really can't complain. The pizza and tortellini are both much better than the gnocchi. Nicht das alle beste italienische Restaurant, aber für €5 hat man einen fairen Deal. Pizza und Tortellini sind gut, und die Mitarbeiter sind freundlich.

This place is unique. While the place can get a little busy to the point where you might go un-noticed (hence grading the service "good",) I should not that this only happened to me once. The cakes are art. By which I don't mean bad art, or phony art - they are beautiful in their appearance and are beautifully done - not all of them are lost on the rest of us who don't have 5-star palates as well. As someone familiar with small-batch and house coffee roasting, (something they do in-house here,) one can easily judge the quality of the product by the drip-brewed filter coffee - the plain Jane cuppa Joe. I judge it to be good: consistently robust without going overboard. All told, I'm glad the city's got a place like this. They could add more hours, but hey - that's their bag.

We had the schnitzel and the stuffed cabbage which were both excellent. The pancake and cottard cheese for dessert was also amazing with the rum cherrys and vanilla ice cream. Good service and even with a full house the noise wasn't loud and we could hold a conversation easily. The price was more than decent for all the food we had and it was cheap if you consider how good it was.

This place rocks!:)tortellini with butter,sage and parmeggiano were amazing,never saw them anywhere else before but loved them here.pizza del papa was also great and pinot grigio too.service perfect-although the place was crowded we got the meals in 10 minutes or so
The food is ok, perfect for a business launch. Very good service and the deco is nice...

Quaint and unassuming with absolutely fantastically good food. I ordered the "surprise" 3-course menu. They are very flexible since you can tell them if there is something that you do not eat or what kind of food you do eat.
Really good food and wine selection, staff very good !!
Absolutely a recommendation. Nice staff and atmosphere. Fantastic food for a reasonable price. And we have high standards...!

The restaurant in itself is lovely. Service is great as well. But the food I had was really not great. Had a steak that was difficult to chew or cut. Fries were ok. The others I went with were ok with their food. I had been here a few years ago and had a much better experience than this time. Now I think I won't go back again.

They did a good job of serving our party of 25 people. Food was ok but nothing more. They served us perch, and preparing 25 servings at the same time is not an easy task when it comes to fish. Perhaps we should have chosen something else from the menu. The staff was very nice.
Food and service excellent. Reasonably priced. Would definately return when back in Berlin.
Classic French style restaurant. Dishes served very nicely. Rather expensive.

Is this a tourist trap? The restaurant was nearly empty and old pictures of celebrities on the wall may represent the good old days, but this restaurant is now only a shadow of its past... Here is the point: - After my order, I had to wait 35 minutes for the antipasti and 29 minutes for the main course (remember the restaurant was nearly empty). - The courses are not bad but tasteless and therefore overpriced! - The waiters are bored and clearly unmotivated (where has their passion gone?). As a final word, there are great Italian restaurants in Berlin, I would pass on this one...
Fresh quality food at an affordable price. Recommended if seeking for an Arabian restaurant. The only problem is that it's rather small.
Great sea food. Grilled Raiserclumbs with garlic are the best.
Excellent food

The only good thing about this place is the food, which is way too expensive. The service was horrible. The staff offended us after we missed a sign by asking us if we couldn't read English. The waitress was arrogant and rude. The decoration is strange. For a few pieces of bread and a little butter, our group of four people was charged €5,60. Soft drinks and apple juice costed almost four euro's. We suspect that we were charged extra because the waitress made a mistake in the order. We ordered two dishes with two times an extra plate (an extra plate costs 3 euros) and we received three dishes and one extra plate. After my sister paid the bill, the waitress returned 10 euro too little. Don't go to this restaurant if you want to have a nice dinner in a nice place with nice staff and good service. There are much nicer places to eat in the area.

Way too expensive, 'service' is a word they don't really know - I was charged €3 for my wife trying small piece of my meal (the charge was not included in cheque and they refused to include it in cheque but took the money, I think waitress just steals the money), waitress was arrogant and rude. Children toys look really weird in interior. Not worth visiting, there are places with friendly service in Berlin.
Terrible service for terrible food. Complete tourist trap! Try the McDonalds or the Chinese place next door.
Broccoli soup was super salty, salad had too much balsamic, pasta had no taste at all. Avoid this place!

This place has the best juice in Berlin. It's a shame they lost their original building, but they're still there in a food truck, where they've always been. Do yourself a favor and try their juice creation they call an 'Ibiza'...it's a delicious combination of strawberries, banana and other tasty stuff! BTW their food is also great...it's all apparently made by them fresh (not carted in from elsewhere). They have great roast beef and the Schlemmer Max sandwiches are LECKER.

After being handed a flier as we walked down Ku'damm for all you can eat ribs for €17, we had to go try it out. My standards are high since I come from Texas and we usually make our own smoked ribs. Although these were done in the oven, they were at least cooked alright. But the restaurant would be doing themselves a huge favor if they looked up a few recipes on how to actually cook ribs. They had very little flavor and no one knew to pull the back fat off. Some sort of sauce on them at the end or to at least dip them in for some moisture would have been a smart idea. The fries on the side were good but the coleslaw was not. Overall it was alright and we brought home most of our ribs because we couldn't finish them, slapped some sauce on them and warmed them in the oven -- which made them pretty darn good. There's also no kids menu which sucks.

The food was okay-ish. Not bad but not very good. The restaurant looks clean. At least one of the waiters know the products used in the dishes. The knowledge of the English languange is so so. Good to know: they only accept cash. No cards!
Delicious beef goulash!
The staff was very nice. We received tasty bread, for free. The food was good. We had a good time here. I could sit next to the heater which was very pleasant.
Some dishes were very bad. The service is slow.
Verry good food, service are top

Great Sichuan food served around here. Very well cooked and the right amount of spice was added to make the guests go back for more of those dishes. The fish was incredibly tasty I must add. Design-wise, I would say it was a bit off. It has more of a western feel to it, normally a chinese restaurant would have the swiveling glass top on the table which allows easy access to the dishes for everybody around the table. Service was fine, friendly but a bit slower than usual. And if you speak chinese, now would be a good time to use that language. An okay restaurant with very good dishes.

The food on offer was what you can expect of Sichuan cuisine with lots of spice. However I felt that many dishes, especially the chicken and pork, to be overly salty. Since this restaurant was half bar half restaurant, the decor felt a little odd as I had never seen a bar within a Chinese restaurant. Nevertheless it didn't feel as bad as it looked at the entrance. Do watch out for pesky waitresses who would ask you non stop about refilling tea or rice. I understand the intent, but I would rather spend my time on my meal, thank you.

I've been craving Sichan food ever since I was in China last year. Now I've finally found a place where I can eat my favourite hot-as-hell dishes :) It tasted just like in China. The prices are normal for a restaurant in Germany. For two people we paid 31 Euros which included 2 main dishes, 1 salad, 1 soup and two large drinks.
Tasty and (potentially) spicy dishes provide a good schezuan meal in the middle of Berlin.
Food is fantastic at a reasonable Berlin price. This resteraunt is popular so worth booking so you are not disapointed.

Very poor quality. Miso was too salty. The sushi rice too gummy. The nori gaggingly chewy. The gari astringent - there's a bucket of it on the table, but one slice will curl your nosehairs. I really wanted to like this place and we left a lot of sushi on the plate.
Good for a fast and cheep lunch, always fresh and tea inclusive.

This is the best Indian food that I've had yet in Germany. I'm so glad I bought a Groupon for this place. The papadum served before the meal was tasty but quite peppery. I would have liked to have some tamarind sauce to dip it in. I've had some bad naan in Berlin, but the naan here was good. They have an extensive bread menu, which I intend to explore more the next time I am there. We ordered two different dishes that were "recommendations of the chef." Both were quite good. One was chicken and mango in a nut sauce and the other had ground lamb and a bunch of sauces. Unfortunately, I don't remember the names. My only complaint is that we ordered the food "mittel sharf" thinking it would be spicier because the waiter compared the spiciness level to the papadum; however, it wasn't spicy at all. One of our meals did come with a hot sauce that we used to add spice, but next time we will order the food spicier to begin with. (If the "scharf" is truly spicy, then I'll change my rating to a 3.) They also had a special mango menu with an amazing cocktail called the "Crazy Mango" -- mango puree, Kahlua (?!?!), brown rum, and cardamom. I ordered one in lieu of the mango lassi that I usually get at an Indian restaurant.

The food itself was amazing, but we were not able to enjoy it, because of discomfort... The restaurant was completely empty and we felt there a bit awkward... maybe some noisier music would help. The waiter looked 14 year old, he looked depressed or something, we were a bit nervous because of him. There is rice served automatically to every meal and we wanted naan instead of rice (which should not be a problem!!!), but the waiter was not willing to bring us the bread. Then another waiter came to us, an older man and he agreed to bring us naan. !?!?!?! And then we ordered our meals, but they made a mistake and they brought me a completely different meal. oh.
Good indian restaurant.

Excellent food and great service!! The combos they have for 2 or 3 people are great, a lot of food and very tasty. Only inconvenience was the temperature, the place was so hot that I had to go outside a few times to cool down. Very recommended, I would definitely come back!!

"Don't you think you have too much on your plate? Are you sure you're not going to explode?'' - this is what we heard from the owner (or whatever she is)(blond woman in her 40ies, on pics here) in this restaurant when we ordered buffet today. Really, what kind of person asks something like that (we didn't have so much on our plates)? Moreover, the soup bowls are weirdly oblique shaped, so you can only put a bit of soup in it. When I was filling my soup bowl, she remarked "Put only small amount", and when I replied "I've got it", she replied "No, you don't. Here, let me help you to put some soup back.", leaving me with almost no precious soup in my bowl (isn't it easier to get just small bowls instead oblique nonsense??). After this, I was not really hungry for their food at all. I'd rather pay some more and eat in another restaurant, where the owner is not so weirdly greedy. I am most definitely not coming back to this place nor recommending it to anyone.

Great Cypriot restaurant. I went there in a recent trip to Berlin for a quick dinner. I hadn't had Cypriot food before. The cuisine is quite similar to the Greek. Ordered white bean soup and Sieftalia (their Cypriot specialty), and both were excellent. The service was friendly and fast.
Slow service. Cold food. Bland foood

I have lived in Berlin for 5 years now and since then I have mainly been to restaurants in East Berlin (Pan Asia, Borchert, Luther & Wegner, Boca di Baco and the rest). But I eventually wanted to try the west. So asking around, I heard three times within four days about Fagiano on FasanenPlatz/ Square, West Berlin (not far from the Kurferstendamm (or Ku'damm). The seafood at Fagiano always looks really fresh, decor is modern and minimalist but still cozy. The waiters (who talk in in an amusing Italian/German accent by the way) are friendly and attentive and allow you to construct any starter you wish. The clientele are mainly locals (which is reassuring). The menu covers all the bases you would expect from a good Italian, but no pizza. Everything they do serve however, tastes super. Prices are fair - In my book this means that when the bill comes you don't feel like you've been rear-ended by an elephant. All portions were near on perfect which meant no bloatiness but also no need to stop off at McDonalds to fill in the gap (although I definitely could have had 2 more servings of the amazing tiramisu).
delicious and typical food, really low prices (from 6 to 12 EUR / dish) regarding quality and quantity! definitely worth a try!
Best Schokocroissants in town
Excellent Drinks, great quirky host. Small place. Trust the recommendations!
Food was tasty and arrived promptly, wine was good, and my wallet felt no pain at all from the experience. Haute Cuisine it ain't, but it was entirely satisfactory.

I went there because a friend recommended it to me and there I had the best Indonesian food ever! Schwein Sate is my favorite and they also have very yummy spring rolls and chicken rice. The cafe has a very nice atmosphere and the service was very good as well! Definitely worth trying :-)
Food good. But the service was really bad. Visit only if you can abide rude waiters.

Food was nice, although it was a bit to much of the spices. The owner was really friendly and entertaining. This is not something that will be appreciated by everyone tough. Definitely worth a visit ! :-)

We really enjoyed this place. The owner is always there. He is the friendliest guy you will ever meet. He speaks both German and English. I swear he can read minds. The food is only second to him in what makes this place worth visiting.
Nice food but definitely not the Vietnam taste
Really good food, best prices and a awesome service!

We turned up (5 of us) without a reservation and the restaurant was packed. The staff were great and found us a place without too much of a wait. The food was delicious and the staff were so helpful and friendly and you can tell that they genuinely love their job. I would recommend this venue to anyone who wants a taste of traditional German cuisine in a great setting. A real local feel with no attitude. I also recommended this restaurant to a group of English friends and they had a similar experience a few days later. They raved about it.
Very large portions. The pickled pork hock was great; the broccoli with cheese was okay.
Excellent atmosphere, the owners are very lovely people, food is simply delicious. You defo must try tortellini sorrentino. I truly recommend.
The food is very good, plus the attention.

apart from the very hospital owner, staff is quite reluctant when it comes to customer contact. food and wine very good, though. look out for special events such as a 12 course winemakers' menu with accompanying wines, water and coffee for under 80 €.
Very good food and friendly service.
A beautiful and cosy place, very nice service and delicious veg and non-veg food. definitely my favorite Indian restaurante in Berlin
Absolutely wonderful food. Excellent service. Value for money and staff really friendly. I'm from the UK and I always go here whenever I'm in Berlin.
Very friendly place, so reasonably priced too. Will be returning.
Good quality and price
Love to sit there, reading a book, watching people...
My favourite restaurant in Berlin. Great location. Al fresco dining. Very tasty pizzas at a good price. No-fuss service.
Very nice place with good service and very tasty food. I am coming back regularly!
Great Burgers, open till late! :D

This is our local café. Very convenient location, very good food for the price, nice atmosphere (excellent in the spring when the glass walls are open to their extensive outdoor dining area), and very pleasant service (excellent service by Berlin standards). A Sunday afternoon at the Parkcafé may be enjoyed by the entire family. Parents can even enjoy the last sips of their drinks while the kids play in the sandbox, or head across the part to the playground. It's also very a very nice place to meet a colleague or prospective customer for lunch...

"nice, relaxed tapas style restaurant, not limited for spanish fare, but ""tapas"" from germany and other european countries, too. look out for moderated winemakers' evenings every few weeks presenting high class wines from germany and austria accompanied by 12 to 15 small plates for a steal."
The atmosphere was good, the food was reasonable, price was reasonable as well. It Is far from city centre.
Just to set expectations, it's the kind of Mexican restaurant that has honey-mustard wings on the menu.
eVery tasty burgers for a good price. Delicious!

For some reason, it was really hard to find a great restaurant with traditional German food. We asked a German in Berlin where we could find a good restaurant with German food and she said, "Bayern." She was WRONG! This place is AMAZING. The knoedel where huge and delicious. The rotkohl, roladen, everything was ausgezeichnet. My husband and I were only in Berlin for a short amount of time, but we ate there every night after finding it. Try the Haxe for sure! I'm from the States and it isn't quite what I would normally eat, but it is delicious.
Very creamy but not too heavy!

Very nice restaurant. The food was great, low prices too, the drinks were awesome. Cosy pub feeling and very friendly an helpful staff. Next time we go back to Berlin, we'll definitely return, even if we live on the other side of the city. Top score!

The food was very good, the proces low, and te staff was very nice. The ambiance of this restaurant is very friendly and the food is made with love and passion. When we visit Berlin a next time, we will visit the restaurant also!

For authentic German cooking, friendly service and family atmosphere Berliner Hof deserves top marks. Sebastian and his staff make everyone very welcome and the food is excellent. Be warned the portions are generous! This is very much a neighbourhood restaurant with friendly locals eating there most nights. It's not on the tourist trail,- in fact Wilmersdorf is not a touristy part of Berlin and this is reflected in the very reasonable prices and the daily special offers. Well worth a visit - you'll stay for more than your meal - a well stocked bar and very palatable house Riesling make for a good night out!!
I've used their delivery service twice now and the food has been very good both times.

Wonderful renovations by the new owners - beautiful colors, relaxing music, great staff! The entrance price is reasonable and everything is so clean and in order! I enjoyed the spa-like atmosphere and most of all the sauna overlooking Berlin through a floor to ceiling window, then running right outside onto the roof deck and releasing a bucket of ice cold water on myself for a complete shock to my body! The massage was absolutely wonderful and I felt like a new person coming out at the end of the day. I loved being able to sit and order something to eat at the café, enjoying my book and not being disturbed by loud people. I would recommend this place very much!!

The Berliner Strasse Yoko Sushi is the worst sushi place to be found. The makis and inside outs we ordered were hard, dry and definitely not fresh. The fish meat tasted so much of salt it was barely edible. It gave the impression somebody had made it long before it reached the customer. It is not worth any money and we strongly discourage anybody from trying Yoko's food unless you want to waste your money. We threw half of our order to the bin as we did not have the nerve to try and eat it and the sushi gave both of us stomach cramps. It is a true disgrace to other sushi bars. a big big NO ! >:(
You have to pay 3 euro xtra p.kid to let them play in small playground..why??
The best meal we had in Berlin. The food was great and plenty, the service pleasant and friendly, and the pricing was very fair!!!
Completely disgusting

They have a well-curated collection of wine here. I came in looking for a particular Ahr valley wine, which I knew that they have because they post their wine catalog online! (Talk about a great time saver.) The staff were also friendly and knowledgable and were able to recommend an addition wine for me. It also seems that they have wine tasting seminars.
dont like italy // web culture // wc //
Really enjoyed the food and the drinks. Service was good as well.

came in for lunch today and had a Pizza Rusitca. It was simply amazing. Really good Italian food from Italians. The wine selection was a little poor and place probably had better times, but hey, I was there to get food and that work out much better than I expected.
Ok. Wouldnt recommend
A wonderful Kaffeehaus, not cheap, but worth it! Wonderful cakes, always a big selection, good coffee, very friendly waitresses.
Excellent restaurant, super service and prima food. We were there in Ostern, away from home they made feel us at home. We will go there next time we go to Berlin. Maria&Guillermo from Argentina.
My food was spoiled! Waiters are not arrogant but agressive! I ll better stay away. Owner seems to be drunk.
Good food, desserts, and lots of Gemütlichkeit!
Great food, one of the best French restaurants in Berlin ... don't miss it!!!
Very good food, wine and service. Not the cheapest one but worth of a visit!
Best place in berlin to feel at home... fanci but well priced i can truly say, i love it
It's MacDonald's, there is not much to say.

I recently traveled to Berlin and was lucky enough to stay within walking distance to this restaurant. The prices were great, and the food was even better. We actually went there two nights in a row - including the final night of our week in Germany, because it was so good. The atmosphere is quaint and comfortable, service is very friendly, and the menu has anything you could ask for - from eggs, potatoes and sausages to more exotic meat and rice dishes. It was truly a gem in the outskirts of the city!

This supermarket with a very local touch combines the sole purchasing experience with the owners idea of having a local community and getting together. Make sure to look out for the date of the annual summer and christmas celebrations for which the carpark turns into a really nice little farmers market area e.g. with the kids from the local kindergarden singing christmas songs, some mulled wine or hot chocolate and maybe you'll even sneak a picture of santa claus telling a story. Definitely a business worth supporting!
Very nice place and very nice personell. Wonderful food. I recommend this place! Weltklasse!

Wonderful little restaurant. Tasting menu was packed with gems - multi flavour delights kept assaulting the palette. Service was excellent and the wine recommendations matched the food perfectly. Floor manager spoke flawless English - very useful for those of us with rusty German. A real delight I would be very happy to eat there again and again.
Good cakes, favorite hangout for parents while kids play on the adjacent playground.
Great bar, friendly atmosphere. Been there for over 100 years, an absolute must see.
Great food, cozy relaxed atmosphere, loads of taste. Best breakfast in Steglitz so far.
A very nice place for an after concert meal - always open late so no need to rush. Two minutes walk from the Kammermusiksaal in Isolde Strasse. I have many happy memories of both venues.

The food was good and very decently priced. I asked for menu 11. The presentation could have been better and I agree with other critics of this place that it would be more hygienic to have the wasabi and ginger served in single portions with your food as opposed to a big pot that has been sitting there for weeks getting watery. It was so cramped up in there I just didn't enjoy myself. People around you can hear every word you say. I would go back again but maybe on a less busy day (went on a Saturday). 7/10 for food 2/10 for atmosphere 6/10 for staff service
A small restaurant but with very good Asian food especially sushi.
Clean bathrooms, low prices.
Great place to have breakfast.service a bit slow and not all waiters willing to speak to you in English

Having had our first dinner date in Berlin in 1980, my American wife, who I had met in West Berlin, myself and our son and daughter and their other halves visited IL Gattopardo on January 20th, 2013. It was a pleasure to see the original owner, Renato, still there. From the Bruschetta appetizers to phenomenal main courses with amazing wines and an unbelievable dessert platter and Capuccino, our entire family felt the IL Gattopardo dining experience was the best we had in Berlin. Convenient walking distance from U Bahnhof Breitenbach Platz.
Had a very nice dinner

Came here a few years ago. The place was ok then I thought. Now my favorite Thai place in Steglitz was closed so I thought, why not give it a try. Well, I sort of regret that. The food was not that tasty nor fresh. And the service was quite bad as well.
Friendly staff. Restaurant itself deserves an update. Nice area to sit outside when weather permits.
Love the atmosphere, the nice personal and the food. Our standard pizza&pasta place!

You can´t beat it. This is one of the best thai places I have ever been to outside Thailand! Here you get proper thai food and not the european version of it. I moved away from the area but have to go back regularly for my thai food fix!

UN-BE-LIEVE-ABLY Good. We have been there a couple times - the first time we ordered off the menu and it was OKAY - not the best of the best, but okay. At that time the food was fairly German-ized Thai and as such was similar to some other good Thai available elsewhere in the city. The second time we went, we did not order off the menu. Instead we asked the owner if she would prepare something not on the menu, and to please make it traditional Thai. This second time was one of the best meals I have ever had, anywhere, of any type of cuisine. The ingredients in both cases were fresh and authentic Thai. I recommend this restaurant in the strongest terms, and only hope that I don't have to compete for table space with you when you take my advice and decide to dine there. Bar none- fantastic, 5 star experience.
Nice bar and friendly owners!

I went there with a few friends and not only was the service really bad we also all fell ill. They didn't have three types of fish they offered on the menu and the waitress failed to tell us each time. A few minutes after finishing eating the first person had to run to the bathroom and later in the evening everybody had to leave because they were feeling quite sick. I will spare you the details. The food wasn't amazing either. Just standard cooked fish. Mine was over salted and the others weren't too impressed either. So in short, bad service and really bad quality fish. If you don't want to spend all night in the toilet I would suggest not to visit this place.
Good food, prices are according to Stegliz district. Service is not fast but free dessert covers this drawback
You are leaving the Berlin sector, you are entering Korea. Try bibimbap!

I had an excellent asian coconut soup (Thai-like), vegetarian option. It was a generous portion -- I probably will test the small size next time. Nicely seasoned, solid consistency not too thin nor too thick. Service was friendly and obliging -- I got butter for my bread with no questions asked. And the outdoor seating is comfortable and "gemütlich".
Nice food good atmosphere , funny dog :)

The food here is great value for money and tasty to boot! Be prepared for lots of creamy sauce with your schnitzel. The staff are also very friendly and I would bring all my visiting friends here for at least one meal. They have nice big indoor plants too and an interesting sunset kind of wall colour, very warming!
I go there very often - love the place! food is always fresh, staff is attentive and nice and you can drink as much tea as you wish. Also can recommend mango lassi there.
Friendly staff, interesting food. A bit out of the way but worth it.

This pizzeria has a good quality. They have pizza, pasta, meat and fish for affordable normal prizes. We have been there for 5 times in the last two years when we are in Berlin, and sure to come back. Elly Woudenberg Den Haag The Netherlands
For what I've seen in berlin this is a great option!!! Super good food real Italian food! No tourist trap! Super recommended!!!
This place is perfect for swingers if you compere to the bad and boring Fabriklounge.
Great food!

It was the most amazing Italian food I've eaten in Berlin, and I haven't found a place like it. It's a beautiful, tiny little place with the best pizza, pasta, and other Italian delectable meals I've tasted so far out of Italy. The people there are great and friendly, and the atmosphere is so warm. I love it there and I'd eat there every lunch and dinner if I could.

Until I wandered into this restaurant, I felt out of place in Berlin. Once I was speaking Spanish with the (Italian) chef, Flavio, I felt like a guest in his home. On a one week trip, I was back for a total of 3 meals there. From the inexpensive home made pizzas to the reasonably-priced entrees, to the grappa & espresso for dessert, this is more than I could have asked for in an Italian restaurant in Germany. I loved it, and you will too :-)

Visited on 18th March for Breakfast with a friend. I had the English breakfast and hot chocolate. Both were wonderful. My dish was less than 7 euros and it included 2 eggs, 4 mini sausages, baked beans, two pieces of toast, tomato, mini salad. I think adding mushrooms and bacon would have made it a true English breakfast but I found the meal very filling. The service was prompt and friendly. Less than 10 euros for a filling breakfast...is not bad! They have seating outside but be ready to sit next to a semi-busy road. I would visit he cafe again.
Nice breakfast.
Food is nice, close to Indian food. :-)
Fun bar. Starts maybe a bit late but friendly service, nice music.

The service was really bad, the waiter argued that we had ordered things we know not to have ordered. We have never experienced so poor service, or so obnoxius a waiter - whom even argued with us in a very loud "I know better" tone. 3 out of 14 courses were wrong, and the waiter tried to say it was not so, although we could see he was aware to have given us the wrong courses. When we got the bill, it turned out that at least 2 courses had higher prices than on the menu card. This restaurant was really beyond poor.

I'd been hunting for some authentic Indian food in Germany since arriving in Heidelberg last month. I'd found some good ones, but none that were willing the eschew the German fear of spicy food. It was with this is mind that I was willing to order "real, Indian spicy" lamb vindaloo at Maharadscha. They weren't kidding. I thought I could handle spicy food pretty well, but this blew my head off. It was fantastic though. The 2 mango lassis (lassii?) I ordered helped too. We started with a samosa and mulligatawny soup Both were very good. The soup was spectactular, nice and spicy, enough to warm you up on a cold, wet, snowy day in Berlin, but not painful or overwhelming. The samosa was also excellent. We also had the lamb vindaloo and chicken madras, probably the two spiciest options on the menu, and as mentioned, were persuaded by the waitress to try the "Indian spicy" versions as we were from the US and could handle it. These were without a doubt incredibly spicy, probably the most I've ever had, but were still phenomenal. It goes a long way toward explaining this that even when sweating like crazy and having to blow my nose every minute, I cleaned the plate. Don't get me wrong, it was spicy, but still delicious and not unenjoyable. I'm not sure how it can be that spicy and yet maintain a great flavor profile but they found a way. The staff was incredibly friendly, spoke great english, and gave us suggestions. She also talked with us a bit about where we were from and what kind of Indian food we had had before. The price was also very good for Berlin. Definitely worth a visit for authentic Indian food when in Berlin.

Had the most amazing dinner last night with my partner on our last night visiting Berlin. Joeshi (probably wrong spelling) was the most lovely and friendly host we had in Berlin. Our food was beautifully presented, very tasty and healthy too (I often feel heavy after curries which are maybe too rich with oil in Oz, and bread can make that even worse for me). We shared the wholemeal chappati, tandoori chicken and lamb with three sauces which cave with a plate of salad and rice included. My taste buds were stimulated and satisfied afterwards, as good food should do. I could go back to Berlin just for that meal and service again! We finished with mango and coconut ice cream in cute ceramic pots (reminiscent of Weiss bars) and we were told we could keep the pots as souvenirs if we liked (it's like she knew me and my collecting habits). For those new to the area, this restaurant is located in a hotel and gay-friendly district with many options for Italian/pub food, all which looked boring, over priced and customers seemed unimpressed. I highly recommend if you are in the area!

We had a lovely meal in this restaurant on our last evening in Berlin. If we had of found this place earlier we would have been in a few more times during our stay. The food was lovely and the lady working there was lovely to chat to and spoke English. We were staying in the Sorat Ambassador and this place was less then five minutes walk. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes really well prepared and tasty Indian food. This place had a good vegetarian section on their menu.

visited this restaurant after trying Maharadscha 2 and found it equally good service and atmosphere were excellent . punjabi platte was a super hit i can recommend this place to the Indian food lovers.
Great restaurant with very good food and super friendly service. Will go again, when I am back in Berlin and can definitely recommend to anyone who likes Indian food.

An Italian restaurant in the centre of Schoenberg is something I wouldn't expect to be especially good but I was surprised how fantastic our meal was. The lasagne was simply the best Italian meal I've ever had, mouthwatering tomatos playing harmony with fresh basil on my tastebuds. Homemade potato soup was also exceptionally good. It became my favourite place to eat in Berlin.
Definitely not worth the price

Unluckily we had the experience as described in the other reviews.Also see tripadvisor. Very unwelcoming atmosphere. A very rude manager. Starts a fight with you with no reason if you honestly ask for some help for minor problem (lost ticket for the coatcheck). Manager starts to shout immediately. And if you ask him please to lower his voice, he shouts he hates people from the Netherlands. After that the only thing he can say is "Hausverbot, hausverbot" (not allowed to get in anymore). And that includes also for all your friends. Not at all the example for the many nice, and friendly people we met in Berlin. Luckely there are much better (service wise and atmosphere) gay bars to go to. Stay away from the hysterical and power driven manager. It must not be easy for the employees to give some welcoming and friendly service with such management.
This is now called touch
Terrible food worse service, offensive that they claim to serve mexican food, will never come back
Never, ever again. Food was under coocked, almost raw chicken and the service?! Which service?!
Kinda bland food, and the personnel always points out that one should tip, quite annoying :/
The best shnizel I had in berlin

Food The appetizer was good, as the tarte flambée had been tasty. Main menu was okay (max.!!): Not enough chicken, too much cream (and the cream was not tasty) and the potato was cold. Waiter Quite bad! I got asked about more tip even the service was not good and my food was cold. Place Quite crowded place. Many tourist and the street right next to the restaurant has heavy traffic. Tables outside are nice below the sun shade. Overall Not recommended and below my expectations.
The worst salmon dinner I have ever had! It was like a cat food. Salmon was grey, dry, old and it smelled really bad. Potatoes and green beans were fresh neither.. Never Again.
Last stop on a Schoeneberg night itinerary - have a go!
Good food very nice service affordable
Ordinary place, bad experience.
Cheep and good food. Affordable
Went twice and the staff were terrific! I'm not sure how common this areas is but we Would have preferred if it had non smoking areas though.
Best Mojito ever!!!! And the barman very friendly and cute :)
Nice personal and great Cocktails
Sweet bar with friendly staff in a great neighborhood. Music is not too loud and decor is fabulous.
Great starter or hangout place
Best Currywurst with Pommes
Nice small Austrian restaurant with regularly changing menus. Try the Schnitzel if it's available when you're there.

The food here is very good but not perfect. I was a bit spoiled by all of the amazing Ethiopian food I ate when I lived in Washington D.C., so I am a bit picky now. If it weren't for this, I would probably give this place an "Excellent" food review. Four of us split 15 (vegetarian combination platter for one person), 21 (kotfe -- Ethiopian beer tartar), and 23 (meat-based combination platter for two people). It was more than enough food. We could have just gotten the 1 (a smaller serving of kotfe) instead of the 21. At 8 p.m., a woman started roasting coffee beans(!). The coffee was then made with (I believe) cardamom. It was a lovely ceremony. At one point, the woman walked around the restaurant with the pan, spreading the aroma to each table before she ground the beans. The brewed coffee was then distributed to all of the customers. It was quite nice, but because it tasted very different from "normal" coffee, some of the people in the group didn't like it. They ended the meal with a choice of alcohol. We took the tej (honey wine). It was not as good as the housemade tej at Abissinia Restaurant in Berlin. A previous reviewer complained about how long it took to get the food. It also took awhile for us, but otherwise the service was friendly and attentive. Also, I ate a ton of raw beef tonight and am definitely not sick.

The welcome was very nice and the food enjoyable, although not spicy at all (and I had specifically asked for spicy food). We still had a great dinner for two...alas to regret it a few hours later as we both got sick for the rest of the night and most of the next day... I am quite surprised this could happen in Germany...!

Great food and great atmosphere. If you come with a group, you can order an enormous platter with something like ten different dishes (mainly wots) served on a bed of injera. They also make quite a show of preparing coffee. However, if you don't like eating with your fingers, or don't like spicy food, then you should go elsewhere.

A great restaurant, great service, mega tasty! Unfortunately I will never be able to eat here again :( 5 hours after eating I had horrific food poisoning, we believe it was from a poorly prepared lemon (in a corona) as another person did not get sick (from the food) yet another did get sick (who did not eat there but also had a corona with lemon). So, my lesson learned is not trust any prepared foods in cheap german bars :P DEFINITELY VISIT THIS RESTAURANT Just don't show me any more photos of the cuisine as I have already seen it all twice :P
I checked "good" about food but actually I don't know the taste because I have been waiting for over 90mins for a dish.

I thought this place was awesome. we got there a bit earlier than the normal crowd and chatted up the bar tenders who spoke reasonable good English and were quite friendly. The cocktails were top shelf and once the regular crowd started shuffling in the place was quite lively. If I ever get the opportunity to stop back in I won't hesitate!
Good cocktails in a quiet part of town. Nice selection, good knowledgeable staff and atmosphere.
bis 24h offen :-)
This is the best RESTAURANT IN Berlin!!

We went here twice this past weekend and it was really good. On Tuesday morning, we had breakfast and found the location really comfortable and the staff super attentive. Breakfast was delicious (English breakfast) and a good value. My latte macchiato was also really tasty. We went back a second time in the evening for drinks. The service was a bit less attentive but the drinks were strong. Kinda wish we'd had dinner there and tried the pizza. It smelled heavenly. We'll definitely be back again soon. Our 3.5 yo loves playing in the nearby fountain on the very quiet side street.

Food was fine for a good price. Fajitas were excellent, but the schnitzel needed some salad on the side. Terrace was okay, but the couches could be better. Very friendly service. Will certainly return here.
Any of their dishes are really good. And at fair prices. This place is a must visit when in Berlin. I'm there at least once each time I'm in Berlin.
Nice place for a coffee. Their chai is excellent, as well.
very nice quiches and coffee!

My opinion: By far the best Pizza in Berlin. Yes, it is fast food but this fast Pizza make really fun and they have fresh Pizza in 5, 6, 7 different varieties at all time. Just grab a piece or 2 - sit outside and - yummy :-)
Earlier I had issues with their delivery. I ordered a few more times again and it was absolutely fine. The products are nicely packaged and promptly delivered. Keep up the good work guys.

Some of the best cocktails in the area, but unfortunately if you head here on a Saturday night, you can expect to wait at least 45 minutes for a drink. The personnel are friendly and competent, but the place could use some renovating inside.
