The long seating area along the side wall was looking really rough the last time we were in there, which is kinda pathetic when you've got little else to look at while you wait. This is one of many smoking bars in the area and they don't have much of an air handling system, so if you're a non-smoker, prepare for the smog.
Beautiful hidden gem with amazing cocktails. Must visit.
Amazing friendly service and great food!
Very nice restaurant a little off the center but well worth the trip, very good pizza and pasta and good service. And thanks for the extra grappa...
Carpaccio wasn't perfect. Otherwise a great place. Good pizza, friendly service.

I went to this restaurant many times with my girlfriend or with a bunch of friends. It was always excellent: the food is awesome and the weekly specials make it hard for you to get bored. The service is effective and friendly. It's a little more expensive than most places I know in Berlin, but it's definitely worth it, as it really does make a difference on what comes into your plate. I really recommend this place!
Food is absolutely horrible. Ordered a cabonara that came with two slides of tomatoes. Do not go there. Menu is not in full english!
Great schnitzel in a nice atmosphere
drinkable art. seriously. belly up, spend the money and don't look back.

Food isn't too bad considering its a cheap option. Service is underwhelming and the English translation of the menu was wrong. The menu said green peppers and the meal had peppercorns instead. I also ordered a pasta that was supposed to have a pesto sauce but was definitely not pesto. Still, not a bad option if you want to dine in at a low budget restaurant and aren't too fussy.
This is the place to be if you're looking for great German food!
Decent Italian food, friendly but outrageously inattentive waiters, and literally every other outdoor table with a smoker.

Lovely restaurant, we ate there twice on a 2 day stay. Creative burgers, excellent salads. Quick efficient, a good non-smoking inside area. Great drinks including non-alcoholic cocktails. Gay/straight clientele.
I really liked this place. Tasty and original burgers and very homely atmosphere. Even simple chicken wings were amazing.

Excellent burgers- especially for the American traveler. Unlike the service throughout most of Europe- the service you receive here will be much better. The waiters are attentive and actually provide good service!
The top as leather bar!
Very very good breakfast! I was there with my friends for breakfast and we really enjoyed it! Don't miss the fruit pancake!
Great food! I especially liked the lamb soup. The terrace is very nice too.
Very good food, good atmosphere, nice people. Good place to eat a fancy meal.
Not exactly as good as its seem! Overcrowded place but the food is just not as I expected

Well, lets start from the beginning. Have you ever been to India? Then you should know how REAL good indian food is alike. Amrit is european indian food; its a LOT of food, yes - but the quality is not better than any snack you get in any other indian place, which steals the name from à country where you can get the most delicious food in the world.

To me, these sort of restaurants are the archetypical example of taking advantage of people. Everything great on the surface, but if you dig a little, it's fatty, all tastes the same and is only half a step above McDonalds...
Huge pizzas - consider sharing them.
One of the best olaces we ate. Good asian food, very nice place.
Great food!
Authentic Asian Food. YUMMYYYY

My favourite Paris-style café in Berlin. Food and drinks are good quality, service is friendly, not the fastest though, but that's not the point. The point is to relax and take time to enjoy your food and drinks and the view! For what it's for top marks.
Good food, but not the most attentive service. Best spot in Berlin for people watching if you like watching the same sort of people as I do.
If it helps anyone: I don't speak German and found it very hard to order here. And the service is very slow. Does it take an hour to make a sandwich?
Very good food. go for a selection of 2, 3 small dishes, greek wine and you'll be amazed! The greek waiters are efficiently friendly rough.

From the outside looked like an inviting place to try. The menu was interesting and diverse. Also some vegetarian dishes as could be expected in such type of restaurant. Service was quick but unfortunately not knowledgeable about the dishes or just simply not willing to explain the different ingredients and dishes. I was looking for some flavorful, a little spicy dish. Unfortunately the lamb in ginger tomato gravy was just the exact opposite. I must say that the lack of spices came quite as a surprise as other similar restaurants of that kind never fail in Berlin. What a shame...﻿
Best sushi we've had in a long time. Their daily special is awesome, otherwise we recommend the spicy tuna crunch.

I have tried lots of places for bibimbap, and this little 6 table restaurant might be the top one. Two friendly senior women take care of food and service, and the ingredients leave nothing to wish for. The chili paste is really good. The decor is rather simple, there is Korean writing on the walls for the philologically interested. The menu addresses a limited selection of dishes, which usually is a good sign. They even have chachangmyeon, which may take a while to prepare. Bibimbap is ready fast and fresh. Prices are quite fair.
Best Korean food. Try Soup #3. Bam!
Quirky place! I concur with my fellow reviewers: yummy Bibimbap.
The best Bibim Bab found in Berlin. Moreover the small room has been nicely renovated!
good Music - SUPER COCKTAILS - great CREW ^^
Hands down best falafel I've had in Berlin. Salads and sides are delicious and fresh and everything tastes like home-made Lebanese cooking. Also: real tabbouleh (with pomegranate syrup.)
Great food, friendly service, low pretence.
Great breakfast spot! Had a Turkish breakfast menu and it was really tasty.

I'm a native English speaker from Northern California (San Francisco area) and I love this coffee shop for reasons most people in Berlin may not... This coffee shop reminds me of cafes in the U.S. where, as a PhD student, I spend hours upon end reading and working on my laptop on FREE wireless. The wireless here is almost always working, and it works fast, and unlike most places in Berlin they don't charge you! This cafe is also very comfortable, with couch seating, fleece blankets, dim lighting in the evenings, and very nice down tempo music (nothing obnoxious). The staff is helpful and friendly, and even though I speak only ten words in German they don't act like jackasses. The espresso is good and they have lactose-free milk!! As someone with a milk allergy (or a vegan) knows, getting a latte or cappuccino in Europe without cow's milk is nearly impossible but not here! Also, their snacks -- mostly cakes and some light food -- are quite good with reasonable prices (2-3.5 euros for a piece of cake, soup or sandwiches 3-5 euros). Finally, their hours are great (9AM-midnight every weekday) and they'll never kick you out. :-) Lastly, even though they have an outside area open in the summer, I do not think this cafe is for people watching or meeting up with lots of friends... For that, travel down the block to a noisier place.
Chillig... gut!

There's sand on the floor and the beers are appropriately priced. They don't really go all out with the theme and I'm not sure what the draw is beyond the sand on the floor. Not a bad spot - nothign special either
A real pleasure of fresh fallafel and good food. Must go! Oh and only 8 euros w drink
Fresh and good: hummus, felafel, shawarma, and fresh-squeezed juice. Order at the counter, and take away or eat at the few tall tables.
Perfect food, a nice place with huge choice for reansonable prices!
Extremely good burgers. Highly recommended.

First off, the front room has been recently painted and smells strongly of fresh paint. My friends and I sat in the back room, which was not so much better since the fumes of the bathrooms in the cellar, under us, leek out and fill the room with a horrible stench. Add to this the lovely presence of fruit flies all over the restaurant and particularly the kitchen. The food is garbage, seriously, the same bland sauce was used on the 3 different dishes we ordered. The rice was stuck together and also bland. But I'm really not so surprised that this restaurant is still alive, we are after all in Berlin and almost no one knows anything about Indian food here. I would STRONGLY suggest you do not eat there.
Cosy bistro, warm atmosphere, friendly service and excellent food, I highly recommend !

All of the sauces were quite excellent. The starches were also good. The meat, unfortunately, was clearly very cheap cuts. It was actually a challenge to even chew it. I would definitely return here, but I would order all of my dishes without meat (which is an option). They have a couple of items on the menu that must be ordered in advance (like the intriguing fried yeast balls). Out of curiosity, we ordered the Nigerian Guinness. It is different than normal Guinness but pretty good.
Familiar atmosphere, delicious food, run by owners out of love to pleasure clients with best Nigerian food. Can you dream about something better?
One of the best nigerian dishes home and away. A trial will keep you coming for more.
Always enjoy my best nigerian food here; )

Really thought this was going to be a wrong choice to visit, looked dodgy getting in up inside what looked like a housing block. So glad we were wrong! 4 euros to get in which includes cloak room, 11 euros for 3 large beers, fantastic value. Felt welcomed & safe, great venue, will be back when next working in Berlin. Thanks guys.
In an unlikely place for a restaurant it turns out to be really be really an interesting place, that feels utterly authentic Norwegian. You need to eat fish there, it is superb!
The best kebap in town! Found out about it from old Berliners.
Some of the best Döner in town

A Korean restaurant it is, with the usual several dozen entries in the menu typical for old-fashioned places. This one caters to busloads of Korean tourists, it has a provincial flair, just like the main body of clientele, and a Westener would feel out of place. So did I. The food is not decisive in this assessment. But eating out always means an experience of atmosphere, and alas, it doesn't deliver the right note. It's within walking distance from Potsdamer Strasse.
Too bad you have to pay extra for the live music (even though it is worth it), but otherwise a very nice bar.
Had a great night in there last year. Very friendly place.
Great jazz concerts! Nice breakfasts only sundays...
Very unique bar. Cool decor. Amazing cocktails. Highly recommended.
Amazing and unique cocktails. Extremely funny menu. Great decor in general.
It's so awesome! Great atmosphere, awesome drinks!
One of the best bars in Berlin. Unique atmosphere, great drinks. Greatly recommended!
very cool place! recommended!!!

Best chocolate cake I ever had and because of it I tried the hazelnut cake and that was amazing. the hot chocolate is amazing (According to my Girlfriend) I dont drink hot drinks but I'd take her word for it.
Best cakes and tartes in town!
really delicious and fresh food. We never had such falafel! Still dreaming of :P best regards to sufis!
the atmosphere, the drinks, the nice people working there and always willing to help and make the costumers happy! the fact we can smoke inside! we meet always there although none of us live near!
The famous croatian pizzeria "Karijola" is now in Berlin. Wooden Oven and strong balkan red wine on the quiet side of Yorckstrasse - just next to Victoria Park.

Good place to get a taste of modern German/Austrian cuisine at reasonable prices. Service on the terrace (when in use) can be on the slow side. Visit next-door Pinguin Club for a drink afterwards - it's a pubk rock institution way back from the heydays of 80ies West Berlin.

German food including grilled meats, sausages and sauerkraut but very expertly prepared -- slightly more sophisticated than it sounds. The Alsatian tarte flambée is good. The dining room has an organic feel with brick and unpainted wood, and striking photographs on the walls.
Good service, but a bit slow, great food.
best lunch place around this hood. fresh good food, great service. i like it a lot.
The asparagus-cream soup, salmon carpaccio, and grilled fish were all excellent.
Had excellent meals twice in April 2012. Quiet neighborhood place with many families dining together. Salmon with asparagus dish was exceptional.
Perfect!
Really awful. Insolent waiter, nagging to you before you enter, TV set with some match and nothing interesting. Awful.
One of the best places in Berlin. Excellent food, warm people ... You have to visit it :)
That was mighty delicious! I just had the best fried squid ever here. The staff is friendly and attentive. The place has a great, buzzing atmosphere.
One of the best greek Restaurants in town
The marinated octopus was great. I'd definitely go here again if in the area.
don't try getting a table here without reservation! best greek restaurant in berlin. not for the claustrophobic and noise sensitive.

Lots of small dishes meant everything came at different times, which is fine if you expect it. Was great Greek food! There was even some mandatory shots included for free at the end. We went early, at 17.30h; this might be the only time you can get a table without booking :o)
Amazing food for great prices. They have marrow bones and the oeufs en cocotte are just...yum. Probably could get away with just ordering a couple of appetizers.

Been in Berlin for 6 years now and I have to say that the coffee culture have changed a lot! There are today many places where you can get a good coffee in Berlin but for me there is only one place and that is and will always be Double Eye. It's just a pleasure to get a coffee there and it's always, and I mean always good!
Simply the best coffee in Berlin.

The best espresso in Berlin, without question. All that and they don't even charge me extra for a soya milch latte - everywhere else it's at least 0,40 more. The espresso macchiato is also divine. Thank you for asking me it I want it kräfitg oder mild. Now if only the shop was closer to home... the only advantage to the distance is that it probably saves me money...!
Best espresso in the world. No joke.
Great caps but not a nice place to hang...

Huge selection of teas and breakfasts of various compositions and sizes in addition to scones and even high tea. I had a pot of English Breakfast Tea and the breakfast "de la casa". Both delicious! Highly recommended
A really good restaurant, with a very tasty and affordable menu.
Very nice place with tasty german food
I love it here! Great food and great staff.
Just a fantastic breakfast at a very reasonable price!
Tasty food, good wine and reasonable prices. A good find!
Fantastic brunch spot!
Nice cafe-restaurant and diner in Schöneberg. This is where mostly locals come. Very pleasant atmosphere, fine food and friendly service. Ask staff for free WLAN code.
Waited for 40 minutes and no drink. Bad service!
Awesome place even in the winter. Great for smaller and bigger groups as well.
Awesome drinks awesome prices :) great place to watch world cup for a low key relaxing experience

Every time we stay in Berlin, we have breakfast at Savo at least once. I'm puzzled why it isn't more crowded here, because the breakfast is amazing. Friendly people and a great and relaxed place to hang out.
amazing pizza experience at lucky's pizzeria. and maybe you even get played a song for dessert. HINGEHEN! ;)

This is a solid Ethiopian/Eritrean restaurant. We came in with a Groupon, and our experience was much better than at the last place we used a Groupon at in Berlin. The food was better-than-average Ethiopian food (but far from the best I've had -- Etete in D.C.). The tej (house made honey wine) was, however, the best I've ever had.
My family is from Eritrea and the cuisine was almost authentic-maybe not that spicy-and good service, with free delicious liquor at the end. Try it.
Food was good .. But serving isnt enough

Lived in a nearby flat in the Easter 2009 and went for a late dinner. This restaurant seemes very popular in the neigbourhood. The food was good as expected, and the service charming and pleasent. Worth trying!

One of the best experience of eating out in Berlin for Indian food. The service is awesome and we always got a personal touch at every visit. We get to see the chefs in action from where we sit. The waiters and courteous and helpful. Highly recommended.
Best Miso soup of Berlin! Very tasty sushi and Maki, always 100% fresh! It is a shame that they do not have any edamame!

This shop is small but had a very good selection of whisky. It's like an antique book store meets whisky shop. I didn't spend too long time there, but I noticed a bottle of Port Ellen. If I had been living in Berlin, I would have come back many times, but as a tourist I can only bring one litre back home, so that tends to prevent shopping sprees. At the time I was there spring 2010, they didn't take Visa.

Quiet place and friendly service on a Friday night in the summer. This is your typical take-out Asian food in Berlin--in other words, it is not that great, and definitely not "real" Asian food (pretty sure the guy who made the meal is Turkish.... maybe they didn't want to open yet another döner kebap stand?). The main thing about this place is that it's dirt cheap, they have vegetarian (vegan) options, and they give you a whole pile of food for under 3-4 euros/dish. The drinks are not expensive either; I think 1,10 for a bottle of juice, probably same price for beer. We got Chop Suey and some coconut milk curry dish, spring rolls (8-10 for 3 euros?) and some drinks. I think our total was 10-12 euros or so. Advice: Avoid the spring rolls. They were barely food. The Chop Suey was passable, tasted a little too saucy for me. The coconut milk curry dish was medium-spicy (yay!! :-) ) and not bad, but overall I think I could have whipped up something better at home. The guy at the next table had the equivalent of Asia box noodles but enough for two people (cost maybe 3-3,50 for the plate). The main thing to remember is that you're getting cheap food that is OK but is definitely 100% not real Asian food.
Nice place, friendly staff, good food and interesting decorations.
The Hansel and Gretel and the 4 Bremen Musicians breakfasts are amazing :)

The ambiance is very nice, a good place to have a long chat or read. It isn't overpriced or pretentious. With that said, the food and drink is pretty basic. It's well-presented, but taste is "meh" - it's the kind of stuff you could cook at home, but you're just too lazy to do it yourself.

First off, the food was fine. But we booked a particular table four weeks in advanced and then arrive (at opening time, no one else was there) to be told it was no longer available. The place was really cold (end of march and no heating) and did not get warmer: my tea was cold within 15 minutes. And the waiter was very unfriendly. No apologies when we mentioned the coldness etc., very mechanical service. We all agreed we will not go there again, although it's a lovely looking place in a nice street. Shame. seems like the restaurant runs so well they don't have to care about being nice and giving good attention to customers.

It's a pathatic club, with pathatic body guards at the front door. They treat you like shit and give you no logical reason why your not able to get in, even if you are suited up!!! If you like getting humalated without no reason for things that dont worth than this is right club for you.

Avoid at all cost unless you are a woman or Turkish! racist door policy for sure which is ironic. Turks run the door, and make up reasons you cant get in, unless you are a woman or Turkish! plenty of cool places in Berlin. this is not one of them!

Hot place for salsa - figuratively and literally -- don't know what's the problem with the cooling system, maybe no A/C at all. There is smoker's area in UG, so I think they have some kind of ventilation.
Was a good place for dancing salsa (and related - also did some Bachata and Cha-cha-cha in between). I don't have experiences of other places to compare to though.

I had the vegetarian Menü with an amazing bean soup, Momo (a MUST! really tasty), three different kinds of vegetarian dishes, and a yummy dessert. It was a great way to try new things and I loved everything. I will come back again and again
Very good and very fast in simple, nice ambiente. Typical Indian food and drinks. Always a good start for an envening in this area.

This is a bar that is not easy to spot if you do not know the place. But it is a really excellent bar. Friendly staff and friendly customers. Most locals, but also some from around the world that has spotted this place. No music. This is a place for people who enjoys a chat. Good selection of beers and the tap pilsener is poured in the old fashion way to make it more tasty.
Very tasty.
Most friendly barman in town!

My husband and I had a great meal here recently. The food was excellent, the service warm, friendly and efficient and the atmosphere lively but cosy. Prices were also very reasonable. Highly recommended! (yes, you should reserve!)
Go to this bar! Very friendly staff that went above and beyond to help us and serve us well. Free wi-fi. Had a blast talking to the owner and hearing his stories. You will love this place!
Best pizza place in town. Serving original thin italian style pizza.
Great pizza - try the jimmy Hendrix with buffala mozzarella
One of the best pizza places in Berlin.
great place with great pizza!
The Eggs Benedict are simply kick-ass.
Nice house by the Park, the food is good.

Been 3 times as we like to give places a chance. 2 bad meals and 1 good one. The pasta is actually BLAND. In an Italian place!? The only thing you should eat is the Lasagne because apparently the Mother makes it and she evidently cooks a lot better than her family. Not good enough, better eating at Il Casolare instead.
Food tastes good and seems to be real Italian.
I am not even sure I would call the thing they serve 'pizza'.
Fully equipped Lidl for all kinds of shopping food and beverages, friendly staff. Historical Site »Schwerbelastungskoerper« right across the street. Definetely worth taking a look!
Cosy outside when weather is good. Cosy inside when weather is bad!
Took a breakfast here, taste and service ok, prices acceptable.
Good food, great atmosphere, friendly service. Always a pleasure going back there.
You can get much better value at other places in Berlin. Had some variations on classic receipes that didn't really work out.
We had a very nice evening with very friendly personnel and really amazing Greek food. Big portions. Nice taste. Good price. Definitely a recommendation.
Amazing food, very nice people and excellent prices. Had the best garlic bread ever when I was there. Highly recommend.
Great food and friendly staff!....
Everything is very nice. halal material. halal food. nice service. fast service. a high-quality Turkish restaurant. Thank you to all the employees

Waiter was rude about where we should sit and bringing outside drinks into the restaurant. Atmosphere leaves something to be desired. Food was bland. There are so many turkish imbisses in Berlin- skip this one!

We visited Berlin back in June, and found this place around the corner from one of our points of interest. It was around 5 or 6pm on a weekday, and the place not crowded then - my girlfriend and I enjoyed that. The owner/server was extremely accommodating. All the food and drinks were awesome. From our experience I think it's safe to say quiet tourists are very welcome here. I would definitely revisit this restaurant again.

And the search for halfway decent delivery food in Germany continues. How hard is it to make pizza that isn't gross? I'd even go for a Domino's Pizza in my neighborhood. How sad is that? The pizza salami here was the typical chemically-modified cheese on cardboard bread that every delivery pizza place has here. The topping on the garlic bread was pretty decent (garlic, tomato, red onion,etc.), but the bread itself was chewy and definitely not fresh. One upside: they have a larger selection of Ben & Jerry's than other places. Chunky Monkey FTW. But oh no, wait, they delivered the wrong flavor, which I didn't realize until well after they left. (Note: I can't actually rate the decor since I didn't go to the store, but you can't leave a field blank on Google Local.) The delivery was quick, but the delivery driver seemed really confused. I buzzed him in and said, "Hallo!" multiple times through my open door, but he wouldn't come in. We only live 1/2 story up, so he should have easily found us.
A very basic but welcoming working class pub, VERY cheap prices and worth a visit if you are in the area!...

One of the best store to buy Indian and Sri Lankan grocery food stuffs .. almost they have everything that i needed for my Indian Kitchen. The service is also good. The shop owner cannot speak Hindi or Urudu but he speaks good English. This Indian store is also having an Online shop , so we can also purchase anywhere in Germany. I recommend to everyone who is interested in Asian food.

Got the 2 currywursts with the pomme frites for 4.40 Euro. The currywursts were deliciously fried and crispy on the outside, with flavorful meat on the inside. First sprinkled with curry powder with an option to smother either with mayo or ketchup, and I tried the latter. The ketchup has a sweet, un-sour flavor unlike American ketchup. The fries were also impressively crispy, especially considering how liberal they were with the ketchup. Amazing how it was still busy after midnight on a freezing Sunday (Monday) night. Servers didn't speak English, and there was not seating but at least there were standing tables.
Great place with cheaps menus. If your will be lucky you'll order your meal before a lot of customers. Sundays at 20h is perfect !
It's certainly a good Currywurst, maybe the best I've had yet, but unless you are an enthusiast, it's not such an attraction everyone makes it to be.
Nice sausages; there is no seat but they have standing tables nearby the store. Ordered currywurst and bockwurst.
Great currywurst and good value!...
Best Doner in Berlin. Be prepared to queue, but it is worth it...

It's very tasty, but waiting 45+ min in line is retarded. You will realize this half way through, but then you already waited so long, you reached the point of no return. After an endless wait you will try it, but at that point it is impossible to be so good to make up for the wasted time. So then you eat it and it's quite good, but you still feel dumb that you waited so long for something like this and say it will make a good story, so you feel better about yourself having waited so long.
Absolutely the best kebab I've ever had. You won't spend a better fiver in Germany. Expect to queue.
Exceptional food! Beware though, it seems busy at all times of day and night (30 min wait at 12 noon). It's also right outside metropol hostel :)
Best doener kebab evar! The mix of the ingredients plus the feta cheese and a squeeze of lemon is just delish. I eat this everytime I am in Berlin.

Nice fry up, but lacks real tea bags which is a massive disappointment considering 300 PG tips are available across the road for 10 euros. Fryup is ok but felt 10.50 + tea is expensive for Berlin where I can get a nice kebab for 3 euros.

A very nice cafe/bar/restaurant that serves British beer and food. Fish & chips, pie and scones were all very good, and I am told that the cakes are excellent. I don't think I have been served by the same person twice, yet, but I have had no reason to complain about the service either.

The place is okay. Too bad we got thrown out after 1 hour for no apparent reason. (we were three adults and a kid that were not bothering anybody and barely managed to finish our order ) definitely not going to recommend this
Good fresh juice

This is a great bar to have fun and also relax. The atmosphere is inviting and the bartenders are hot. It's location is right in front of the famous kebab place so if you get hungry after singing you can grab one. :). Definitely a must go on weekends.
Very good pasta and pizza. Highly recommended.
I just adore this place! Best restaurant in the world and I mean it!!!

Horrible service. When I wanted to complain, the manager pushed me and tried to start a fight. Schrecklicher Service. Als ich mich beschweren wollte, schubste mich der Manager und wollte eine Schlägerei anfangen.

We visited Restaurant Split, no knowing much about Croatian food while spending a weekend in Berlin based on the great reviews, and novelty of it. The staff was super friendly and made us feel like family. Our waiter was very friendly and helped us with the menu, offering suggestions of what to try to get the best overall experience of Croatian food. I had a Croatian beer which was light and super refreshing. I can imagine it would be fantastic on a Croatian beach in summer. My wife had a Croatian red wine which she really enjoyed as well. My wife had the stuffed cabbage, which I'm not supposed to say, but she said was better than the kind her mother made. I had the potpouri plate with sausages, cutlets, and the best slice of bacon I've ever had, as well as fries and curried rice. All the food was absolutely fantastic. Incredibly well cooked and seasoned deliciously. All the meat was amazing. It was prepared very well and delicious. We enjoyed the food so much, we decided to get dessert as well. We got the crepe type dessert which contained raspberry filling and vanilla creme and ice cream. It was also amazing. My wife tried to steal my half but I had none of it. After paying, the waiter even offered us complimentary shots of Croatian liquor. My wife got a sweater type and I had one that was reminiscent of vodka. Both were great and helped with the long walk back to the hotel in the cold and snow. It was an overall great experience and we are seriously planning a trip to Croatia now based on the amazing food and friendly people.

Attentive service, lovely beer garden, good food and mini golf in a picturesque city centre location - what's not to like... ...well, when you are asked what you are doing for trying to translate the menu with your phone and are then completly ignored by the waiter for doing so. From 5 stars to 2 in an instant.
Although we arrived there half an hour before they were closing and the only food available was pizza for that reason, they were very kind and the food was good.

A decent restaurant with good, professional service. I regularly go there with my foreign clients: it´s just right in the center of a typical part of Berlin: Kreuzberg with all it´s personality. And although we are right in the center of the city, me and my clients always feel a little bit as if we were somewhere in the countryside: surrounded by trees, next to the river, no street nearby. For me service is very important, here I find what I´m looking for! And the food is good, too. In August I will also celebrate my business anniversary there with 35 people, since I have seen twice how these guys managed a larger wedding and the event of an embassy´s employees I´m writing this, because as a self-employed person you always depend on the good, straight to the point work of the people around you. This is one of the businesses in Berlin who really know how to do their job. Both thumbs up for the owners who put their heart, passion and professionalism in this nice little restaurant.

A decent restaurant with good, professional service. I regularly go there with my foreign clients: it´s just right in the center of a typical part of Berlin: Kreuzberg with all it´s personality. And although we are right in the center of the city, me and my clients always feel a little bit as if we were somewhere in the countryside: surrounded by trees, next to the river, no street nearby. For me service is very important, here I find what I´m looking for! And the food is good, too. In August I will also celebrate my business anniversary there with 35 people, since I have seen twice how these guys managed a larger wedding and the event of an embassy´s employees. I´m writing this, because as a self-employed person you always depend on the good, straight to the point work of the people around you. This is one of the businesses in Berlin who really know how to do their job. Both thumbs up for the owners who put their heart, passion and professionalism in this nice little restaurant.
like eating in that grandmother's house in the woods, this pretty standby is worth the taxi ride.
Very positive - kind staff, service is quick, there is WiFi, the prices are reasonable and beyond. Best Berlin breakfast so far.
Very nice! With bikes next door and saved us after a mad cycle ride, oh and Chris thought waitress fit ;)

A rather nice local cafe/restaurant which has the unusual distinction of having a bike shop attached to it. Although that might not seem so strange, the bike shop can be seen through an enormous picture window at the far end of the cafe.
Great breakfast!
It is great, i usually go all the time

Random and very unfriendly door policy!!! After having waited for over an hour in the queue (ppl are always trying to enter from the side), we were refused to go in because the club was said to be overcroweded... Except that they let almost everybody else pass and just randomly picked groups of ppl who were not supposed to enter without obvious reason!!

one of those clubs pretending to be underground or "so berlin" but is in fact nothing else than a big gloomy disco with teenagers in it. i used to go there regularly one year ago. i don' understand why - but music, audience and door policy has changed. people are too young, music is crap and the worst thing: people at the door are really unfriendly - but that's actually pretty normal in Berlin
Went there for the "Shoeless in Berlin" Party. Shoeless dancing on carpet. Confetti all over the place. Best electronic music. Epic night!

Great place, we appreciated a lot the typical Berlinese cuisine .. so if you are searching the original Berlin's taste, this place is for you!! the non-filtered home made beer ("Kreuzberg Molle") is AWESOME and also the food is very good, at a fair price!! All is surrounded by a kind staff and a nice "old-style" atmosphere

Amazing restaurant with great food and a really cozy environment. We got there without a reservation but the owner, who was really friendly and spoke many languages, got us seated anyway. We had good food and good beer and were really surprised in the end for how little we had to pay.

Was really busy, but they managed to sit us down reasonably quickly. One of the last nights I had in Berlin, and it made a lasting impression on me with regards to cuisine. A hearty steak cooked to perfection (medium-rare) with boiled potatoes and greens - just what I needed before a long night/morning at Berghain.
Really good place to spend time with tasty cusine and warm atmosphere.

Amazing place. If you'd like to have some authentic taste of Berlin, then this should be the place of your choice. Nice selection of brews, huge dishes, and it's delicious! Carnivore or vegetarian, you will be happy here.
Really delicious food.
The staff are excellent -- really friendly, and they love to play along. I'll definitely be going back there...
so chill i could sleep there. go there if you are tired after mad friday.
Awesome food. Pretty cheap for this area. The people are smiling and friendly. I eat there every time I'm in the surrounding area.

Good place to hang around after Quo Vadis / / Deutsche Gamestage /Next. Especially the Championsleague-Projection was well done Would've loved to hear more about the history of the place, since a friend told me this place has been part of the Pechstein-Manufactory (swimming pool for the employees)
Creative office complex, good renting rates, nice facilities.

I only had a quick house wine there but I do know what a good place to eat and drink is. I think the whole design of the place seems chaotic and uncomfortable. That includes my observation, in the short time I was there when costumer couldn't find the light switch manged to hit a switch that light up the whole candlelit restaurant. A house wine is the most inexpensive wine on the menu(normally), I payed Euro 6,- for it which is just completely beyond anything I had been expecting (And it wasn't even a bio wine) I can't recommend this place it's expensive and wannabe yuppiesk

Top Food in Berlin, everything there is delicious & the prices are ok. Everytime my family comes we love to go everyday. This business knows about customer service. Anil in Oranienburger Str. is one of the best waiters that i've seen in my life.
Very nice experience. Tasty food. Great personal for serving and everyone speaks English. Menu for 2 is the best deal ever! Try it..

Excellent food and ridicolously cheap! We went during day time when they other special lunch meals: soup, nan, rice, 3 dishes a salad, 2 big and 1 small mango lassi and all of this for just €26,80. We are very spoilt with Indian food, since it's very good from London where we are originally from. This is by far the best Indian we've been to in Berlin.
Great food and large cocktails for little money.

Overrated. Bibimbap is good, the dolseot kind. Where is the summer version? Bulgogi is the usual mobile bbq way, it's no mistake. The Korean style pancake had all the right ingredients, but was way too dry. If the pan is not right, over-frying does not make it better. Some oil would have helped, or properly preheating the pan. The featured red wine was not as great as advertised. The Korean cold drinks are the usual suspects. The table manager does a good job, so do some of the waiters and waitresses. Exceptions do damage to the whole picture. The vain waitress who ignores guests should be fired. Table legs are obvious dangerous stumbling traps for both visitors and employees. The idea seems to be that of a lounge. Yet it isn't. Some tables offer an elevated position, obviously for sitting on cushions without shoes. No one uses them. And where is hot kimchi, or at least well-fermented kimchi? No hint at the princess theme. Inconclusive overall. But the food is definitely better than at Mosch-Mosch junk noodle outlets.
Great food, fun environment. If there are no tables available at the main restaurant, go next door to their sister spot and have some awesome Korean style chicken wings and beer while you wait.
Really great food but also not cheap (especially the drinks)
very good flavours!

Great Korean place, but it is super busy so it is best to make a reservation. The few times I have not done so I have waited for a very long time, cause people usually enjoy the nice food and atmosphere for a long time. And when you finally get a table you will probably do the same.
The venue is nice, I can't deny that, and it is lively almost every day. Nevertheless, it is pricey, and the staff quite unfriendly. I think there are better places in the zone.
Great music and atmosphere, sometimes the service is not that fast and the staff not that friendly, but that's Berlin and the location makes up for it!
This bar is always full (hipster crowd) and is worthy of its reputation. Worth coming for a drink or three, if you don't mind the crush.
Quite crowded at times. But still enjoyable.
Fun hipster cafe
Best brunch in Berlin! It is always full, so try to go "early" to get a table near the window :D
Good brunch place but full on sundays
Probably depends om your state of mind. For it was too noisy and caotic.
to Little Room to sit
Super friendly service, great atmosphere and one of the best meals I've had in Berlin. I thoroughly recommend this place. While the area can seem rough, the restaurant is top-notch!
On the pricier side but my daiquiri was excellent, as was my friend's pizza. Quick service given the time of day and plentiful clients. Def. will could back.
Good cocktails
Fantastic cocktails. Ask the bartenders for their recommendations.

This is the most ridiculous place I have been to in a long time! Never seen waiters that arrogant. I would never write a review like this, but I was amazed by the incompetent service. When the waiters told us that there was no chicken left, which was fine, they recommended something, but seemed to have a problem with us getting the menu back to pick something else. Some of our orders just never arrived (humus and a coke), but still tried to charge us for them. Then when they gave us the bill, they put down different names for our drinks, a coke was then suddenly a fanta or an apple juice. And finally when we asked to pay separately they would not let us, and the reason: 'I don't have time'. After convincing them to pay separately, we were planning on giving them 0 tip, but ended up paying 5 euros, because he didn't have sufficient change to give to each of us. The place is very well known and the food is good, no doubt! But thats no reason to be rude to the customer. We did not enjoy our evening here at all.

We had one night in Berlin and knew we were looking for Turkish in Kreuzberg. In the end, we decided on Hasir and were very happy with the choice. The restaurant was packed but we were given a table fairly quickly. I wouldn't call the service "friendly", but they certainly weren't unfriendly. Instead, I'd say they were professional and efficient and this was a good thing. Everything came out quickly, we got just what we were looking for, and it was very, very good. Overall very pleased with the experience and will certainly return and recommend to others.
Great Turkish restaurant with several branches in Berlin.
This place serves food which I ate with vigour following a day's trekking.
A great pub/café/restaurant that has a fantastic Sunday breakfast brunch!

Käsespätzle: 5+, Burger: 3, Service: 4 They have perhaps the best Käsespätzle that I've ever had. It is just fantastic. The burger was just alright. The waiter was friendly. They serve food until 2 a.m. on the weekends, which is quite nice.
The consume with liver blew my mind. Great atmosphere and staff.
I was there for dinner with my friends. Very good typical plates.
Furious chicken!!! Spicy, but doable. Crispy, yet not so greasy. Sticky, garlicky, wonderful.

This is a quirky little fast food place that sells Korean fried chicken. We tried the So So Angry Chicken and the Sexy Chicken. The chicken pieces weren't perfectly fried, but they were good enough for an expat who's craving fried chicken. The sauces were pretty tasty, but the So So Angry sauce was basically not spicy at all (certainly not the "extra spicy" that describes the sauce on the menu). Next time I will definitely try the Furious Chicken. The french fries were fantastic, some of the best that I've had in Germany. The sweet potato fries were actually fried thin ribbons of sweet potatoes, but regardless were quite delicious and crunchy.
Best spicy food in town. Always order the L-large....
Korea and chicken. two of my favorite things, now combined into one. Also, it turns into a soju bar at night! How cool is that?!
It should be more spicy to Korean taste, but this is the only place to try Korean style fried chicken.
Very cheap but tasty and fast...just a bit crowded at peak times!
Very small, but great food, prices and atmosphere. Vegan / vegetarian options as well.
Best food in town
The food was ok-ish, but you get out smelling really bad.
Went last spring with colleagues. Went back tonight. Great food; great atmosphere
A good place to visit :-) Nice service, and good food. Try the lamb.
Good sized portions. Free rice and salad with every dish is good.
Extremely poor service. Even though food was average, all is wasted by the service quality

Good vegetarian sushi! Reasonable prices for this area. The guys don't speak fluent English and as it's a pretty busy place, they don't have time for a proper polite service but still the environment is very cosy and welcoming. You can see your sushi being made in front of your eyes.

FOOD POISONED I went to Aki Tatsu Oranienstraße last Friday and got food poisoned with their sushi. After a sleepless night feeling sick I called them to warn them that their fish was not in good condition in order to prevent further customer poisonings. Rather than apologising they were relentlessly telling me that that was not possible as their fish was fresh.

Minimal service, but that's fine, because they are busy making the sushi fresh in front of your eyes. Go during the happy 'hour' for reasonably priced, fresh sushi. Delicious miso soup too. Perfect for a quick snack.
Garbage ice cream full of artificial flavours and colors. Avoid this place at all Cost, there are far better places in Berlin.
very cool and over the years still - in a good way - hip place in town.
Hidden gem of berliner style; everything goes till the morning rises.
Too crowded. Everyone from here avoids the place.

This is a great bar that slants more towards gay, but definitely more of the divey yet completely casual and comfortable, open with high ceilings, and some of the cheapest drink prices I've encountered. A pint of beer from draft at 2.50 - 3 €...oh my stars. yes! Thursday night is the busiest night, but personally I do not see the point of trying to squeeze yourself into a sardine can where everyone is chain smoking. On Thursday nights, most people know each other and are meeting friends, but maybe you will meet someone new. It'll take you 15 minutes to walk 20 feet though. Friday nights etc are much more low key if you want to have a nice chat with friends or someone new. Recommended! (ps. I don't really understand the other trendy place berliners like to go- roses, which is too small to dance, or walk, or breathe clean air. It's fine to go a few times for the kitschiness but it should be a place you grow out of.. in my opinion)
Smoky, Noisy, Scruffy, Beardy. But fun. And interestng drinks.
Would have been fun if it wasn't choked with smoke. Why are all the gay bars still smoker bars?

The food here is SUPERB! Their lunchtime menu for 10 euros is well worth the money. I like to grab a newspaper and have Sunday lunch here, peaceful, cheap and sets me up for the whole day. Make sure you ask for the extra hot sauce if that's your thing, they don't always give it to you as standard. Be prepared for some ahem...follow through with it though!

Fantastic Mexican restaurant in a bustling area, lovely staff, very friendly and open. Food was times perfectly, as we finished one dish another was brought over straight away, couldn't have asked for more! Their burritos are HUGE too! Such good value!

Long story short: the food is really great but the service is terrible! These chicks see you come in and hold convos instead of asking you what you would like or give you the menu. If you already offer bad service, at least be friendly but i guess that is also too much to ask for.
Very fresh and tasty...but WiFi doesn't work that well and they take only cash.

Amazing value for your Euro, great service (although busy), and the food was excellent. Situated on the busy, but interesting and lively Oranienstrasse - if that is your thing, you will love this place.
Staff were obnoxious. Wont be back.
in 2010 was quite good, but steadily going down with quality of their nights.
Great wee bar and club. Some old school tunes to keep everyone happy
Cocktails taste like cheap syrup, probably what they are

Haben die Bar kurz vor Silvester besucht. Nette, lebendige Atmosphäre und freundliche Bedienung. Die Musik ist ein wenig laut und die Playlist haut einen nicht vom Hocker (aber ist auch nicht störend). Haben aber prima Cocktails und die Auswahl ist auch nicht schlecht - auf jeden Fall einen Versuch wert! Decent place when we visited on a New Year's Eve trip. Lively atmosphere, nice staff though the music tends to be a bit loud and the music choice is a bit bland. Nevertheless, a wide range of brilliant cocktails and very enjoyable, definitely recommended. Note: people are allowed to smoke inside (which may be a plus or minus for you).
lovely people! delicious goodies.. pls bring back the chai-mango-late ; )
legendary place. just listened to almost the entire demanufactured album by fear factory. fancy graffiti art. good beer. seems to have a screen for fußball or tatort. who cares... lazzzer!
Punky and Funky. Be careful if you are normal.
Punk Rock Bar Old School. Bilhar and beer.

The döner was pretty good. Their bread was pretty good for the döner as were the sauces. On the wall are several pictures of Angela Merkel coming by to slice some döner meat. Honestly, if Merkel gives it two thumbs up, I can't say why I don't.
The guys are real experts in cuisine, explaining every detail of the herbs used. Friendly staff and amazing viet food!
This is my one of my favorite asian place in Berlin, no one can beat their summer rolls!

Really slow service. Not bad perhaps, just really slow, like really really. One of the slowest actually. Till like ages to get the food. Yes, the waitresses were nice and polite. But really slow. Very much so. Nice food.

We were in Berlin a few weeks ago for 5 days and ate here a couple of times. we thought the food was tasty, plentiful and very reasonably priced. Main course 6-9 euro and bottle of wine 12 euro. Nice pub across the road. Flat round the corner.Sorted
Excellent no frills Persian food and a wealth of vegetarian options. Service a little haphazard but well worth a little bit of waiting. Cheap.

Definitely not one of the best burgers that you can get in Berlin but still alright. The buns are not good, but the toasting overcomes some of the weakness. Highlights: a ton of very creative burger toppings (like hallumi cheese on the Charlottenburger), curly fries, and .... jalepeno poppers!!
Quite good burger. Ask for the Bio one (not sure it really is, but sure tastes better!).
Curly Fries are the way to go!
Great cheeses and meats for breakfast.
Super comfy, and great cheese breakfast
nice bar great breakfast.
I Love The Roses!!! It's so small, trashy, cheap gay bar and always full of people. Thats what everybody love in it. There working my Friend Gabi, everybody loves Her ;)
This is a great bar... you will find people of every kind of backgrounds there, good mood and its decoration is just fab!!! :D
Smoky den, two crowded rooms. Avoid if you value your lungs.
One of the best restaurants in town. Nice and homy. Sometimes you need to wait, which is since many others have come before you came to order :-) Don't miss it.
We are waiting 1 hours for a meal. Don't go their. Choose an other restaurant
We had some pretty awesome kebabs here. Comfy booths.
if you are in Berlin, you have to come here. !

This would be a nice bar if it were not for the psychotically hostile staff. If you are looking for a nice quiet spot to enjoy a drink with friends then you at Zum Elefanten you can expect to be openly insulted and treated with a special brand of aggressive disdain which borders on open hatred. Having worked extensively in bars all my life, I don't expect my drink to be served with smile and wink, I don't even care if it takes a while. But barstaff, in general, should resign themselves to the fact that they will have to interact with strangers, it is part of the job. I have never been made to feel so unwelcome in any bar, ever. Avoid this bar at all costs.
Decor and everything was nice, the food OK, but it took ages and the service isn't great.
Delicious waffles & crepes! Awesome Latte Macchiattos too. I always recommend this place to people who will be in Kreuzberg.

Quaint little creperie in Kreuzberg. Excellent prices and the lady that makes them puts so much love into the presentation! I only wish I'd found out about this place earlier in my trip so I could go back for more :)
i regulary eat waffles there, and the pancakes are also good friendly service, low prices, cosy atmosphere.
nice place to eat waffles - they have 2 kinds of belgian waffles with many variations. the atmosphere is so welcoming.
The worst Felafel and Doner kebeb ever.
very good food, for very good price, lovely service
Delicious! Perfect for a fast and cheap lunch!
good cheap & fast
quality food, fast service, cheap.
Unfriendly staff. Food: average. Pretty long waitingtime... not recommended

One of my fave burger joints in Berlin. Been there a few times and the wait was on average about 20min. Food was always excellent. For about 6 bucks you can get a big burger, fries (seasoned nicely) and a drink. Either way, worth the wait.
Best kebap in Berlin! Nice for vegatarians, too – they are offering lots of delicious turkish fine food! Best: It's really affordable and in the heart of Kreuzberg!

Very eclectic and comfortable. Great assortment of wines. A must visit when in Berlin! The staff is very hospitable as well as knowledgeable and can recommend the right glass of wine for you to enjoy. On the weekends they serve excellent small bites to enjoy with the wine.

When you look at the window you see 2 Asian looking tables and lights, when you look in the kitchen you see Turkish tiles, when you look in the restarant you see couches placed in a curious way. The restaurant looks a bit confusing to me, but once the food is on the table you forget about it all. The crispy duck skewer is indeed crispy, the beef skewer is tender, the chicken skewer has a nice lemongrass taste. The sushi is made when ordered, the big (huge) bowl with rice(glass)noodle soup could use some more meat, but is delicious. Normally during my stay, I don't eat at one restaurant more than once because there is more to explore, but for this restaurant I make an acception! Very affordable also!!
Superior sushi for a decent price, friendly service and great Jasmine tea. Even though the location could be better it's definitely worth a visit.

I've probably had dozens of espressos and cappuccinos at Companion coffee / voostore, and every single one was better than any other I had before. Espresso at The Barn or Bonanza is really good, but Companion is outstanding. Every week you can taste other types of beans and different flavours. If you love coffee, that's your place!
The best Kebaps of my life !! They prepare them with love, also this guys know the definition of Customer Service.

This is restaurant is definitely worth visiting, especially for brunch on weekends. The amount of good food you can eat for a really fair price is hard to find somewhere else. Probably one of my most favourite places in Berlin!

My favorite restaurant in Berlin! Cozy and warm, reasonable mid-range prices (for Berlin), delicious and filling food portions, and friendly service. They have a Sunday buffet which is quite good, but even the regular menu is impressive - most impressive because you can also bring along non-vegans and they will likely love it too. The main dishes usually include a few new and creative choices and the drink menu (especially the cocktails) is plentiful. You won't regret a visit to this restaurant.
Actually the best vegan food I ate in Berlin!
Great food, they really know how to make vegan food tasty.
This place is crazy fun :-) the decor is super cool AND they have Anchor Steam Beer. The San Francisco treat!! Chill outdoor terrace and very English friendly.
Best vegan burger in town!

Of all the pizza joints in all the world, I walked into Ron's... again and again and again. The Couch Potato is the best pizza I have ever had and the spicy maple syrup is just the cherry on the cake.

I am a Canadian, born there and raised there. I have been from London Ontario to Toronto, to small neighbouring towns, to Montreal, Quebec, Winnipeg, Edmonton, Calgary and Vancouver and I have NEVER seen a "Canadian" pizza with dough so very thin. I have never had "paper thin" crust in Canada, nor have I ever seen it sold or made. To call the store "Canadian" then makes me wonder where in Canada anyone has ever had this? Or what stores sold it? All that aside, the place was great, the people were kind and the food was good. Just don't call it Canadian if it is not.

Canadian pizza. Who knew? I'm not sure what "authentic Canadian" pizza is, but this stuff is delicious. The pizzas are tasty and the toppings are very interesting. Make sure to try the chili-maple syrup. They also have random North American sodas, like root beer and flavored Dr. Pepper. Unfortunately, we live just outside of the delivery radius because delivery pizza in Berlin is horrible.

the best and surprising pizzas in town for openminded people. Ron Telesky offer pizza slices and whole pizzas in many variations you won`t expect finding on a pizza. For example couch potato: feta sauce, potatoes, sweet potatoes and rosmary served with special sauces like the hot-chilly-maplesyrup.

Beautiful spot on the Landwehrkanal, with a bright, warm atmosphere and chill, friendly service. Anglos welcome and humored, and a pile of events, free or inexpensive, offered. Shows, poetry, storytelling, you name it. The kitchen is on display, impeccable, and smells scrumptious. Get through a coffee without ordering a fresh pastry, a glass of wine without a droolworthy entrée. This is your challenge.
Good food. Nice environment on the water in Kreuzberg district. Especially in summer. Boat roundtrips with good food on board.

Order the daily soup and a Tom Kha soup. The daily soup tasted so bad I didn't eat it at all, but got billed full price for it anyway. My sister had the Tom Kha with chicken, which tasted equally bad and had no chicken – except on the bill where we paid full price plus extra price for the chicken, that wasn't in the soup.
Schnitzels all the way!

The Decor and Service are pretty grim. We got lucky with our waiter who understood enough english but we came very early (by German standards), so the place wasn't packed. I can imagine your experience service wise can be very different. The pizza was very solid Neapolitan style, stacks up well with any of the great places I've had this variety. The house wine was fine and when you factor in the price it's an overall a killer deal.

It's perfect. Discodamaged's favourite restaurant in Berlin. The pizza is only exceeded by its sister restaurant Pizza Bra in Kudamm. It's the best Pizza in the world and Il Casolare has a much better buzz.

Finding a table for two people on a Sunday evening? Forget it. When we finally made it to a table, we were told that waiting time for pizza is around 50-60 minutes. Staff hardly speaks English, so if you're a tourist, it's German, Italian or bust. Pizza was decent, but not very good although way better than what you usually get in Berlin. In short - if you have a lot of time, speak German and want to eat a decent pizza, it's worth it. If you're looking for nice service and decent food - wrong place friend.
Welcome; You have entered Berlins Number One Tourist Trapp. ACTUALLY, one can write the worst review ever, people won't care, THIS PLACE IS PACKED 24/7/365.

If you don`t mind making your own salat then it is safe to go here. Il Casolare has lots of seats outside which is nice in the summer, the pizza is good and the staff was friendly enough. Pizza the Italian way.

Amour Fou has the best cakes in the area, maybe even in the whole of Kreutzberg. The interiour is cozy with lots of magazines, and they have a really nice garden that is open in the summer time. A place to leave diets plans behind and treat yourself to something good.
The cake is always excellent. Home made and lots of variety. A nice little gem in this sometimes a little bio-show-off neighborhood. Yummy.

This is a really nice bakery and the staff is always very friendly. If you don`t know what you want they let you taste a few different ones so that you can choose the one you like best. It`s not a lot of seats here, but you can take it to whereever it is that you are going.
Great bagles. No industrial bullshit here but high quality, homemade bakery. Kake looked very tempting, but did not try. Everything just the way it should be. Very friendly service. Keep it on!
One of my favorites in the neighborhood. Very cozy.
Great cocktails, best G&T in Berlin, way too smokey though! Avoid concerts in the basement if you like breathing, 2m ceilings and everybody chain smoking rolling tobacco, pity :(
Intimate, love the atmosphere, bring your girl friends here ;)
Great atmosphere, lovely personnel and good drinks. Highly recommend!
I grew up in Ethiopia and search out Ethiopian food whenever I can get it. Great food, great atmosphere, excellent service, good price. We got Doro wat, Tibs and a veggie choices. Excellent.
Interesting food, quite home-made as it takes a long time, but worth it!
toller Äthiopier..
Cosy pub for a drink with friend early on the night.
too long to serve and not very polite. At least the terrasse is cool.
Pretty good ramen for a decent price. Nothing amazing but good if you are craving ramen. Noodles are of the thinner variant.
Awesome balcony on the canal. Great in summer
Mojitos! Great service from staff who seem to enjoy working there.

In the Fuchsbau it is fashion week all 52 weeks of the year, and it is a fun place to observe just how creative some people can get when they put their clothes on. The barstaff is too cool to work in a bar, but they are nice in this quiet distant way, so as a Skandinavian I feel at home. The drinks are ok and the breakfast is good, but weekend nights it gets too loud and smoky for me. I prefer this place on quiet weekdays, where it is not too busy but still has a few entertaining characters.
The quality of the food is quite low (meat, rice and even the bread), the quantities are not enough for the price you pay. don't go to defne, definitely.

The food here is of a reasonable quality, although it bears little resemblance to the Turkish food you can find in some of the more hidden corners of Kreuzberg. But the quantities are tiny for the price you pay, the service slow and unfriendly, and the atmosphere lacking and slightly fake-feeling. If you want a tourist's Turkish meal, go to Hasir and have done with it. Avoid this place.
My expectations were too high: the food was not bad, but nothing was special. Cussels, clams and the octopus were defrosted
They accept bitcoin. That makes it the best bar I've been to, in my opinion.

Hamburguers (at least Chilli and Cheeseburger) are average at their best, fries suck and both take ages to "enjoy" outside, in the cold!! Service is as arrogant and impudent as it gets... Their home made tomato sauce makes you wanna find a McDonald's nearby!! Definitely hamburgeur's nightmare.
Right on the street without bathroom etc yet with excellent burgers.Had cheesebuger,chilliburger and fries,all were perfect.5e for organic burgers is an amazing price.
The burgers are fine but not as good as their reputation. Great fries. Majo so so. Long waiting time.

We ordered a Bioland cheeseburger with Emmantaler, a BBQ burger made with regular beef topped with cheddar, small fries with ketchup, and small fries with curry sauce. I had read that the Bioland meat really tasted better than the regular beef, but I couldn't discern a difference. The patties were large but cooked well done, which meant that they were a bit dry. (UPDATE: I just ordered from them again, and the burgers were cooked medium rare.) The house-made ketchup was not very good and the curry sauce didn't really taste like curry. (UPDATE: I tried to order curry sauce and honey mustard sauce the other night, but they forgot to put them in the bag.) The fries and the hamburgers were both too salty. (UPDATE: The burgers weren't nearly as salty the second time we ordered from them.) All of that being said, this was still hands-down the best delivery food that I've had anywhere in Germany. The delivery area is quite large, covering Kreuzberg, Kreuzkölln, and Neukölln. This place will become our go-to delivery place, but I don't plan on going to the storefront. There are many better places to eat in the area.
I ordered explosive diarrhea (they call it a veggie burger) and they delivered perfectly.
The best falafel ever! And try the nut paste.
Amazing food made with care! Good food takes time... do not expect anything fast here. Great vegan options, try the nut sauce. Restaurant is halal
Excellent carrot cake, crumbles and other delicious treats! The coffee is good, too. I always stop by, when I'm in the neighborhood! On Sundays it's often unbearable crowded, tough...
Matilda has nice cakes and good breakfast during the day, and at night they keep the music down which makes it a great place to meet people you actually want to talk and listen too.

Gute Tapas in großer Auswahl. Steak war akzeptabel (medium-well done statt medium-rar; Malus), dafür aber sehr gutes Fleisch. Großes und gutes Weinsortiment. Achtung: Keinerlei Kartenzahlung (Malus). Insgesamt zu empfehlen; Marke "Geheimtipp" ------------- English: ------------- Great variety of good tapas. Steak was acceptable (medium-well done instead of medium-rar), however the meat was very good. Large assortment of good wines. Caution: Not credit or bank cards - Cash only! Conclusion: Recommended; insider tip.

The food there is tasty and the staff is very friendly. The menue is a bit hard to read as it is scribbled on the wall, but the staff is more than happy to help you choose. They also have some really nice wines. This is a very popular place so you should order a table in advance.
Had veal with potatoes and asparagus, was delicious (and the home baked bread was phenomenal).
Great food, super-friendly staff. It was very crowded and hard to get a table when I went, but it's also probably the best restaurant in the neighborhood so it figures!
dark atmosphere. good food.

This place is so small that it can get quite unpleasant to eat there in the winter time when you have lots of people waiting for their take out while the staff are trying to move around. But in the summer time they have seats outside so it is not so crowded. They have nice Japanese food and very good sushi, but I do recommend to take it out and eat it in peace and quiet. Good food deserves that.
Best sushi I ate in my life. And very cheap.
Really small place, great Japanese food, reasonably priced.

The taverna is so warm and cosy, friendly staff is serving fresh and tasty food. The prices seem reasonable and portions are more than enough. They really pay attention to details that make the experience more pleasant - the warm bread, complimentary ouzo, freshest and most delicious vegetables for salad. The meat is tender and perfectly done. I really couldn't be more satisfied.

Hat so geschmeckt wie das Essen von meiner türkischen Gastmutter als ich Austauschschülerin war -- also total lecker! Sehr gut zum Mitnehmen aber im Sommer richtig angenehm, draussen zu sitzen. This tasted like the cooking of my Turkish host mother when I was an exchange student -- so delicious! It's good take-out and in the summer it's great to go and sit at the tables on the sidewalk.
Very nice and calm place. Great deserts, good prices. Eat the Cannoli it is superb.
Really cute cafe.
Love it
One of the best places I'm berlin
Excellent vegetarian restaurant. The meals are cheap and various. The best alternative to the famous Curry Wurst acrros the street ;)
Very very nice! Low price & great food
Very kind place with outstanding, delicous food. If you're not a vegetarian you have to step in too.
No standardised tastes: Real spice combinations made by the cook. Good sign: several vegetable dishes, including dahl curry. Moreover: Neuland Fleisch und Fisch. Bio Gemüse. Price is good.
The tea is of such a low quality that it tastes awful. The rooibos is drinkable, but also of a low quality. The orange and the lemon cheesecakes just tasted sweet and creamy.
Essen ist okay, Cocktails B-Ware.
Welcome home! That is how they make you feel. And the cakes are delicious. Sarotti and Mr Minch (Yorkstrasse) are the best places for Kuchen in the Bergmannkiez.
This is a fun club and a nice place to dance and have fun with the boyzzz...but it is also kind of smoky.

We went there for a small brunch on a Saturday. The guacamole bagel was really delicious, would definitely get it again. Would love it if the bagels were made there, but doesn't matter. And they seemed really proud of their coffee and the taste reflected it. The coffee was reasonably priced, but some items were a little of the $$ side. The seating on the street is really cute and it was pleasant spending an hour there on a sunny summer morning. There were a few delays on some items of food we got but that didn't really worry us.
Cozy little thing with a bar, a stage, and a small -- a small -- dance floor. Not too crowded.
Good and cheap Arabian fingerfood..
Had a lovely meal here. Friendly, polite service. Meal delicious and for someone used to London prices, an absolute bargain.
Thanks for the nice evening. The food and the service are great. We will come back soon.
One of a kind. Fresh foods and very good service.
nice, friendly service.. even recommended dishes.. thats a rare quality in waiters..i really enjoyed it all :)

The fish is of very good quality and the food is always freshly prepared. Good value for money. Staff is very nice. Only small drawbacks: you can only pay by card for amounts above 10€ and you pay a supplement of 0,50€ for takeaway (packaging).
Definitely recommend. Service was a bit slow, but then again, it was quite full. Waiters were very friendly towards closing ;) Otherwise food was value for money, nice portions and specials.
good, affordable sushi. was totally stuffed for less than 16€
I come here frequently. This place has really good sushi at affordable prices. I have been coming here for years and always look forward to the next visit.
Great Japanese restaurant at affordable prices

Note that this is not a Thai restaurant, rather a Tibetan / Nepalese restaurant. The food was decent and inexpensive. For an appetizer, we had the momo (dumplings) that had been both steamed and fried. Both cooking processes together yielded a chewiness. The next time I go, I will try them either steamed or fried but not both. The entrees tasted good but could have been spicier.
very good food, nice price and excellent service!
We are from India. The food tasted authentic, service was friendly and prices were good. Enjoyed the mango beer too.
... friendly service and cheap and delicious food. Lot of vegetarian food too.
Very good Korean, better than YamYam. Usually full so be sure to make a reservation. Some dishes are quite spicy but they'll make them less spicy if you ask them to.
Yum. Spicy enough.

Authentic food (meaning delicious!), friendly service, and a very charming ambiance. This is my favorite restaurant in Berlin, because it is classy, affordable, and the food is always great. It is ideal for a date, a celebration, a night out with friends, or to bring visiting family. I recommend starting with an apero spritz, make sure not to miss the stracciatella (picture creamy, gooey, fantastic mozzarella), order some wine with your meal, and end with an espresso and some grappa. Or, if grappa is too much... Then limoncello...
Very nice. Familiar atmosphere. Had a good time there.
Good: Cheap. Bad: The pizza was strange: the basis of the pizza seemed to come from a factory. This was not an Italian pizza.
one of my favorite coffee shops...the staff are always friendly and the coffee is excellent.

The food was really good (brick oven pizza, homemade pasta), the service friendly, and the prices reasonable. However, my husband's pizza showed up around when I was finished eating my pasta. Something similar happened to the table next to us. The waiter apologized, but it was odd eating at different times. There were also a couple of fragments of shell in my lobster pasta.
Excellent bar to have really nice cocktails.
Nice restaurant, very good food, really greek taste and chip. The greek owner Ciriaco is a fantastic person: he is very hospitable and friendly! I reccomend it!!!!!!!

I came here because I've been craving a real bagel. So far the only "bagels" I've had in Germany have been bagel-shaped rolls. The bagels here were real, but certainly not the best I've had and also a bit on the small side. They only have plain cream cheese, but you can get fillings like lox with cream cheese (NY Special) and chicken salad. As soon as I saw chicken salad on the menu, I knew I needed to order i as it suddenly stuck me that I hadn't had chicken salad in long while either. The chicken salad had a bit too much mayo but all of the nice crunchy elements that make chicken salad good. They also had a number of other baked goods from home that I've missed -- challah bread, lemon meringue pies, marble cheesecakes, cream cheese brownies, pecan pies, and more. I tried the cream cheese brownie (Monster Brownie). It was pretty good, but then again, I've never had a bad cream cheese brownie. I look forward to trying more of the goodies here. I should note that I got my items to go, so I don't know how good the table service is.
Excellent coffee, try their cinnamon rolls too.
Great coffee, amazing cake. Highly recommend the bread sampler as well: two bagels, two pieces of bread and cream cheese. Yummy. A bit on the pricey side, though.
Great american cake, cookies and pies, right in the heart of Berlin, Germany! (Not too thrilled by the bagels, though...they're not like in NYC.)
an institution! famous for the bakery, roasting their coffee including aroma...
been there many ti es when i first moved here and didn't know any better ...the food is ok, the staff is rude. never again.
Fast and tasty food.
fast food... but tasty!
Try the spinach risotto!
Sultan plate tastes great. Nice staff. Good location.
Wonderful vegan food.
they were really slow and the sushi were not made correct.. but they were good
nice fast food sushi...
I love this place. The atmosphere is so calm and inviting.
Great place to eat!
If you looking for a proper German pub with good beer , here it is. Don't ask just go.

We loved our Berliner breakfast place. The selection was outstanding and the price was outstanding for the value. We had the Berliner which came with ton of charcuterie and breads. Highly recommended if you want to feel like a local. Maybe not accessible if you are in downtown area but definitely worth!!
Good prices, seemingly good menu and cool enough looking place.
I can't comment on the other meals but the breakfasts here are great!...

I live right there. So its open every Saturday from morning to afternoon. Many times they have live music group. I wake up to this music many times. All of these shops are not so cheap not incredibly expensive but have the price of Bioproducts plus the quality of veggies are good and fresh. JUst a small market, just one side of the CHamissoplatz. Good for a walk around the old buildings, a bite or two, shopping small items, etc.

From someone who KNOWS: this is amazing Mexican food. In Mexico, this would be considered an excellent menu of authentic food but not typically available in the fast made restaurants in the USA. Namely great mole enchiladas. The guacamole was too creamy though. Europeans never get guacamole right.
we were not really enjoying the food but the waiter was very nice!
Totally awesome. Nice people. Great and tasty food. EC payment possible

Authentic and tasty Thai food (which I hadn't yet had in Germany). We had the chicken satay appetizer, pad thai, dish #141 with beef, and fried bananas with ice cream. All were good. The price for the food with two beers was 32€. The sauce for #141 was fantastic. The service was also attentive and very friendly. My only complaint is that they don't have pad kee mao, which is one of my favorite Thai dishes.
Authentic thai, great spicy fish.
Authentic interieur and great service. A must recommendation for alpine food fetichists visiting or residing in berlin. Expensive but worth every penny. Triple A

It is a subtle and homey interior, dimly lit with candles and multiple small rooms, tables with red checkered vinyl covers. The food takes a bit to come out.. perhaps 20 - 25 minutes? So hopefully your beer will keep you satiated until then. It is quite a large portion of schnitzel, yummy fried oiliness! It is not cheap by any means, Berlin standards or New York.. but it is a place you would go to for special occasions or finer dining I imagine.. comprable to a steak house. I think our meal ended up being like €35-40 per person (salad, entree, dessert, bier). Hehe, usually in Berlin my groceries are €11 per week, and eating out is usually under €10 a meal.. but I ate here for my last day in town!

The Wiener Schnitzel (veal - authentic Vienna schnitzel) was chewy in places and definitely not worth the high cost; however, the Schnitzel Wiener Art von Schwein (pork - only "Vienna style") was fantastic. This is the best schnitzel I've had yet in Berlin but not in all of Germany. The service was typical for a restaurant in Germany and friendly enough. They were even able to squeeze us in on a Saturday night without reservations. 4x 0.5 L beers, 2 schnitzels, and tip cost 57€; so it is a bit pricey for Berlin standards.
Really a godd restaurant, i went there with some spanish friends and german friends and all of us enjoied a lot. Godd presentation and great portion.
always on the top of my list when someone is visiting Berlin. their vegetarian option has gotten much better too, helps when a vegetarian is in the group too.

The Wiener Schnitzel here is far superior to that at the nearby Austria Restaurant. There was no need to saw through the veal -- it was quite tender. The Kässspätzle was also pretty good. It was very cheesy without being too oily. I came here with visitors from the U.S. who hadn't yet had a pretzel in Germany, so we ordered one. Unfortunately, it wasn't incredibly fresh (not stale, but not warm and soft either). We also had a sausage with a quartet of delicious mustard as an appetizer.

Possibly the worse tandoori bread that I've ever had. It was very rubbery. The chicken tikka reminded me of European-Chinese dishes rather than authentic chicken tikka. At least the lamb vindaloo was decently spicy. The delivery service was quick. The mango lassi tasted like it was made from a mix.
Amazing setting with cosy sofas upstairs. The food is very enjoyable as well, both the savoury and sweet things. Staff is also always very nice and friendly (and patient!).
One of the best coffees in Berlin. Great place!
Good coffee. Chocolate zucchini bread and other tasty treats made in-house. Free, fast wireless.
Very friendly coworking atmosphere.
Just a great place. All i would want from a coffee place.
Great cake! NomNom.

They bake using actual recipes not just from frozen dough. Their Laugencroissants are fantastic. All of their ingredients are certified organic, and they locally source ingredients when possible. For the vegans -- they actually make some vegan baked goods!

At first it was great to have found a typical colombian place in Berlin, however the warm and welcoming feeling one could have expected, was not there. The first thing we were asked upon our entrance was if we had a reservation, even though the place was completely empty.
