The reaction of the lady running the place was of great discomfort, as if were had annoyed her with our presence. Having gotten over that, we decided to make the best of it. The food was ok., the traditional flavor, of course, was not the same as at home: First of all, the meat needed more salt, whereas the beans and rice had too much. The empanadas were not so tasty, they seemed to be frozen, and also lacked salt. The manager lady (who also acted as waitress/cook/manager) had always this fake and somewhat hypocrite way to adress us. It was as if she impersonated a "always-annoyed" mean mother, whose child invited a friend over, and she was obligated to share her attentions towards someone else. When we paid the check and gave the tip, the costumery "Thank you, come back soon", was never there. To summarize, the feeling of "costumer service" was not nice at all!!! I really do not understand what was going on, and it is a true shame to have this "little stone in the shoe" experience, when it could have been much better. Unfortunately, I guess I will not be returning, in other words, one potential faithful costumer less for the business! :(
i liked the coffee very much. the atmosphere could be a little friendlier though. not the staff - they are very friendly and helpful if you have questions.

Yet another great coffee house in Berlin. This is where my husband and I buy our coffee beans for home and office. Each member of the staff that I have interacted with is very knowledgable about the characteristics of the beans being sold. The selection changes depending on the season, and we haven't yet bought the same beans twice. They also offer more "cutting-edge" coffee options than nearby Cuccuma, like the Australian coffee drinks flat white and long black and particular styles of coffee preparation like cold drip and syphon. However, I prefer the atmosphere at Cuccuma. I'm not even sure if there is WiFi at Chapter One, which would make it hard to get work done there. Also, at Cuccuma there is more seating, a wider selection of food, and good music playing. So, Chapter One for beans and short stays and Cuccuma for long stays.
One of the best coffee shops in Berlin, probably THE best espresso in the city.

The food here is alright. As usual in Germany, the spiciness is significantly reduced for the German palette. Even the lamb biryani is not spicy. They do at least provide a complex, flavorful hot sauce on the side. It took forever for them to take our order, even though the waiter wasn't helping any other customers. The food is cheap and the restaurant is open late.
My favorite Indian!

Don't eat here unless you want to leave the place starving. The portions are a joke compared with similar places in town and it's overpriced at that. I ordered squid, which looked like it fell into the plate by accident. You get far more for your money and better quality in another Greek Tavern just a few minutes walk down the road. I don't recommend it and certainly won't be going back.
Just wonderful nothing else to say :)
Very good espresso italian coffee and very good sweets. The typical products from Sardinia are the unique touch of this place, together with the nice photos on the walls!
Very good place in general but especially recommended for having breakfast because of its fantastic sweets!!! The guys are also very friendly and pleasant people!!!

Brauhaus Südstern had a pretty good atmosphere when I stepped in, quiet and mysterious with amber coloured lighting. Food was served fast and fresh, very nicely cooked and delicious. Dessert came in the form of cherry cream, which was unexpectedly sweet and scrumptious. Drinks are on the downside though. Plain water was free, but 200ml of soft drink costed 2.20 Euros. Atmosphere and decor was excellent, as I have said before, and creates a pretty good ambience. Brick walls and wooden furniture gives it a cottage like feel to it, and with the bar situated in front, the overall layout and design is pretty nice to appreciate. Service was friendly and fast, though occasional mess-ups did occur. Still they did their part to fix the issue. Overall a good place to have a meal at if you are in Berlin. Not a must, but definitely a recommendation.
Well worth a visit, great home brewed beer and they do one which is 25% alcohol!!!!

Don't be fooled by the unimpressive decor, the food here is excellent. I had some of the best curries in Berlin here (try the mushroom and peas curry, it's delicious!) and it's very cheap. Nice: they have Indian beer on tap here.

this is my favourite place to go eat out and feel real contentment when your belly is full! Authentic Indian flavouring and they optimize to suit your taste buds...great and friendly people and I always get smiles when I am there ;)
This is the best indian restaurant i know. Great food!

Good eating, but definitely not worth at star in Guide Rouge. The price had a higher level than the food. Staff friendly but unexperienced. We told the waitress about a serious allergy, but there was some kind of misconnection. Fortunately, we discovered it before eating.
Eating delicious food and the best Mahalabia in Sofissimo Restaurant
The chef himself is pretty funny and generous. Very good wines!

Unpretentious joint that smashes out some of the best European food in Berlin. If you want a schnitzel as big as your head that you will be talking about for years, this should be your first port of call. It gets busy, so get down early or book ahead. Wash it all down with a beer and a pear schnapps or two.
Super! Great atmosphere, Great staff, the best wienerschnitzel I've ever eaten! I higly recommend but beware, the place is really small and crowded :)

If you want a real solid, great tasting meal then this is the place to go. It is usually very busy so it is wise to order a table in advance. It is also important to remember that making great tasting food takes some time, so be patient. And if you thing you are going clubbing after eating here, you are not, so you should relax and enjoy the beer and food all night.
Food takes to long. New & confused service nearly every week.
what a find, we loved it. yum, too much food, great price.
The Original Brick-and-Mortar Business. Beer and Burger for Bitcoin.
Absolutely delicious, try that cheese burger with fried egg on top! Yummm!

Hands down the best nachos that I've had in Germany. Granted, there isn't much competition considering I was once served a plate of imitation Doritos with a side of runny ketchup as "nachos" in Bonn. The burgers were decent, but not as good as The Bird's burgers. I liked the atmosphere of the bar as well. The menu was filled with "Deutschglish" -- only people who know both languages will understand the entire menu. They accept Bitcoin, which I've never seen before.
I love the chili cheese burger (made with Chili Con Carne) and appreciate that I can pay with Bitcoin.
Good burgers with a wide variety of ingredients, good selection of beer and drinks and decent prices. Odd furniture. Some seats slightly too small/low. Live music at times.

We came here with a Groupon for a 75€ 5-course meal for two. I would have been livid had we paid that much for what we got. The food itself was pretty good, but it was certainly not 5 courses and not worth 75€. A glass of sparkling wine with guava juice (and ice cubes?!?) was one "course," and I guess another "course" must have been the bread basket. We only received three food courses. When we received the check, we were shocked to discover that the basic sides did not come with the "5 course meal." We had to pay extra for a side of rice and a side of fries. The service was incredibly slow. The live singer, however, was a nice touch.
Very good value for money, vegan. Also very popular with the hipsters.
Really cheap, original viet good food.
Amazing value, great food. A little busy at times - but that is a good thing right? Plus we usually get tea on the house when we are waiting.
No Viet Food is Fantasy Food with glutamate
Food was perfect and service excellent.
Hard to find good chinese food in Berlin. I was very impressed with this place
Tasty selection of pizzas, good value. Very busy so worth booking. Friendly staff, good atmosphere.
If you wanna get a real Neapolitan pizza just sit down and order the Verace Rossa. PS I'm from Naples
If you're looking for real neapolitan pizza in Berlin this is the right restaurant. Excellent ingredients, pleasant atmosphere and friendly service.
the closest you can get to a Neapolitan pizza in Berlin

The best Pizza I've ever had outside of the Napoli region. I can't describe how happy I am that I don't have to drive down to Napoli to have proper, proper Pizza. Thank you, Masaniello, I will be back soon (next week).
The best quality Turkish Brunch in Berlin. Not like the ones which imitate but an original cuisine

They have good vegetarian food and nice vegetarian cakes, but the whole experience was ruined for me by another thing.... Sing Blackbird also have a shop that buys and sells vintage clothes and second hand. When I was sorting all my clothes out I selected a few items that I wanted to sell cheap to them since I want to support these good initiatives. On the website they write that you don`t need to make an appointment for dropping by with your stuff, so I didn`t. So when I finally got there the girl would not even look at it and asked me to come back two days later. Not cool.
Good and cheao beer
Very very tasty
Very good noodle soup.
Very relaxed place. Great for coffee and drinks at night.
Nice during the week, crowded on the weekend.
Nice design bar with modest sound quality electro music and average drink prices.
its in Neukölln. Nice place to have a beer during weekdays
Nice place, nice people. Lovely streer
Decent Mediterranean fare. Self service. Nice atmosphere.
A great Berlin pub. Lots of character and friendly staff.

Best Turkish breakfast in town. The Simit (Sesame bread rings) are freshly prepared, you can watch them being rolled and taken out of the oven. All breakfast dishes are yummy and very authentic. I love the "Menemen", the Turkish scrambled eggs with tomato and various spices. At the peak hours, it might get a bit full and chaotic, but we were always quickly served by the polite and friendly staff.

This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food is Sudanese falafel is fantastic. The specially seasoned tofu served in a pita with an amazing peanut sauce is also delicious. Really unique food.

Best pancakes I've ever had. They have both savory and sweet ones. The pancakes are very unusual in terms of preparation (baked) and incredible flavor combinations (camembert stuffed inside and covered with fresh cranberry compote). My favorite place in Berlin!

Super nice place, the food is excellent (typical Italian recipes) and great selection of wines and spirits. Perfect for a late afternoon aperitivo or a romantic/classy dinner. The guys there are nice and friendly, definitely a place to check out in the Kreuzkölln area.
Best italian brunch ever. 10€ for unlimited good food. Jazzy atmosphere.

Superb foody hangout at klein prices in Kreuzberg. Some regional Roman staples with classics: lunchtime there's a deal, in the evening there are tapas with excellent apertif cocktails. I really like the supplì (rice balls with mozzarella), the grilled lamb, the heavenly burrata, and the Tiramisu is known as the best in the city, and I can tell you it's the truth! Friendly young couple from Rome run the place. Go eat here.
Very nice, small cafe with comfortable lighting, wifi, home made bread, a number of vegan food options, soy milk for coffee drinks. They also accept #Bitcoin which is fantastic.
Brilliant sushi!
Great Japan freaks!

We go here so often it freaks out the staff. Wonderful homemade cakes, lovely rhubarb schorle, delicious quiche. I've never had food from here that's been anything but utterly delicious. Highly, highly recommended.
Hands down the best Indian restaurant in Berlin. Top food, Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnisse Stimmt volkommend, super attentive service. If you are looking for authentic, this is it.

Everytime I go eat here I'm amazed that more diners aren't there. The food is excellent and entrees are two for one on Wednesdays. I've often gotten complimentary mango schnapps at the end of my delicious meal.
Superb food, excellent service, truely indian tandoori food and all these at half price on wednesday(16:00 to 23:00 hrs) and sunday(12:00 to 23:00 hrs).

Hello Guys out there, I would like to recommend Indisches restaurant, Masaledar, all the people looking for authentic Indian taste in Berlin, Germany. The ambience is superb and Head Chef is very friendly. The service you get is very good and the taste which you experience once, will never forget.

My Comments on this beautiful-hidden restaurant in Berlin: Heaven to be here. Eating food at Masaledar is like eating food at home made by my Mom; it is delicious - mouth watering. I like all the dishes made of Paneer (homemade cheese) and Chicken tandoori is also my favourite. I tried Mango lassi here ufff...just mind-blowing.
Charming little "Kneipe" typical for Berlin, with a surprisingly diverse selection of good food. Excellent service.
There is a sandwich. We have been talking about it for a week. It is unique but a bit expensive. Still it is so awesome.....
Good stuff.
Free refill available: €1.19 / €1.99 / €2.39. Restroom offers hot water as well. Nice freestander & drive-in. Combo starts at €3.99. Good connection to Brandenburg Gate! April 2013
Lovely place to have authentic Italian food and some good wine
Love the atmosphere at this place.
Super "Döner" with the biggest meat piece I ever saw on a grill, it was bigger then the guy cutting from it.
Wonderful. Such a unique and marvellous place with fantastic, surprising border experimental food. Do not miss if you're in the neighbourhood
Amazing menu with 10 delicious starters and 2 mains meals. A must!

With huge expectations arrived - and left with a complete disappointment. Arrived with three friends all in good mood, expecting nothing but an okay eating experience. But the meals were a pretentious catastrophe, and I mean every single one from starters to the comically too sweet, lovelessly prepared dessert. The waiter was friendly for exactly five seconds - when he greeted us. One of my friend's question about exchanging one ingredient of a dish was commented with "honey, trust me, this is how you want to eat this". which would have been completely fine except that the dish was a gross puttogether of old vegetables screaming for euthanasia, a too buttery sauce hitting any other taste in the face and fingerprints of someone really fat on the plate. The tip of the iceberg was meeting the owner: without getting into details, a message for you little guy: You have chosen a completely wrong career path when you decided to go into gastronomy and guest services. You are a miserable little creature full of bitterness. The way you handle your staff and guests is a milestone in unfriendliness. You should actually honestly be ashamed every time you look into your own face. Oh, also, you should not pick your nose in public. Even when you think no one's watching. Someone always might!
Great! Taking it to Leeds :)
Palm trees painted on the walls. Neon colored tabletops. The service is not the most friendly you'll ever encounter, however the food is edible. Pricing is a little high for the neighborhood.
Good food, pitty that the waiters are really relax...
Very nice place, good food, good music, nice waiters, overall good experience. You don't pay for extras like ketchup and mayo. I will definitely go there again.
For tourists. High prices, slow service, but unfortunately the sunniest place in the area.

The man serving was really nice, the coffee was absolutely great. The milkshake was wonderful but at 3 euros I would've hoped for a bit more. Lovely place all in all and well worth a visit. Cakes looked great too but we didn't sample them.
Unique place... Superior italian coffee, in-house prepared cakes and snacks, high quality ingredients... feels like home... but better!
Bäreneck has a good mix of different people. The place stays open late. The Kellnerinnen are really nice. Almost everyone there is up for some chit chat.
Best Pizza, the focaccia is EXCELENT!!!

The name describes it perfectly. The decor consists solely of posters from bad movies all over the walls. I wish that I didn't have to walk past this place every day and see Alec Baldwin staring out the window at me. I don't think that they have food and the service is ok I guess. Go to Bäreneck across the street instead!

For those looking for one of the worst and bad educated services in a restaurant, here is the place to be. I was with a guest there and had never had such a bad experience anywhere else in Berlin. A shame!
Nettes Lokal. Super Personal und Service.
ESSEN SCHMEKT NICHT
Really tasty food! Excellent!
Wow einfach toll...

I am a great fan of Italian gelato. Checking out ice cream parlours in Berlin is kind of a spleen of mine. Can't believe that I didn't come across the "Ital. Eis Azzurra" earlier, because they already celebrate the 20th anniversary this year. Maybe it's due to the somewhat hidden location. In this place I found the best home made gelato in the South of Berlin. Mmmmh... great selection, natural taste, nice consistency, just perfect. The choice of available flavors is changing - new creations are always possible. Unfortunately, sitting here is very basic, but you can also take home your treat.
Food was really good, but everything else was awful! Service was more than lacking!
All you can eat is relatively allright...
Gutes sushi und thaifood, und das lunch special ist jeden Tag super!
Love the creamy cocktails. Dish portions are generous and well presented.
Very delicious ice cream! :)

What a wonderful way to spent an evening in Berlin! Recommended by our hotel around the corner, we just had dinner at the Pesetas. We took a number of tapas from the special weekly menu and they were just awesome! The restaurant topped it off with a great house wine (red) and an unbelievably good desert (Creme Catalan). And before we noticed three hours had gone by and I would not want to miss any minute of it. A true recommendation!
Was there for 2008 ST Patrick's day. Awesome Shepard's pie, great Strongbow on tap! WARNING: Do NOT order a "Irish car bomb" (Shot of whiskey + irish cream into a guinness) it is disrespectful.
Much more than just good sushi: The hot array in dishes and the weekly menu are to be recommended! Friendly quick service. Not expensive at all.

Visiting Berlin, we stumbled into this nice little pub on our very first evening and felt comfortable right away. Thanks to John for his scottish stout, new zealand whisky & latest rugby news from the southern hemisphere: We enjoyed staying and will for sure come back.

Very good pizza and very tasty mediterranen dishes. Just like in Italy. Every Tuesday night at 20,00 there are also many italians meeting there to eat and watch a movie together. Great place. It feels like home for real!
seher gute esen seher gutes service . danke an gargano team

Located not in the downtown of Berlin, but it is absolutely worth to visit this place. Epicerie bon appetit is a small food shop (delicatessen) with plenty of fancy food and good wine. They are also offering daily choice of breakfast and lunch dishes. Everything is fresh and delicious. You can sit inside or in a small garden in the cosy courtyard. After your first visit you will never ever buy food in a supermarket. Don't forget to try all the tasty sweets, tarts and fresh croissants. The owner are always there and they will very friendly take care of your wishes or recommend you something very special.
Netter Wirt tolle Auswahl an Whiskey!
A nice and small Italian restaurant with good food and not expensive prices.
Very good pizzas, low prices, good friendly service
The Cheese Diavolo Pizza is the Best Pizza ever!
So delicious. These kebabs may be the best I've had in Berlin or even all of Germany.

We were very happy when we heard there would be a new Tomasa near us, however after visiting the restaurant several times we have been sadly disappointed. What we liked about the other Tomasa restaurants was the fast service and the play corners; inside and out: perfect for young families.The service at this Tomasa is very slow and often lacking in charm, there is no indoor play corner and the tiny sand box outside is filled only with a tiny bit of dirt. There is so much potential, but sadly someone lacking the vision in an area filled with children.
Bad customer service
Authentic chinese food.
Good food for reasonable price and nice staff!

It's a bit of an adventure to get here from central Berlin, especially at night, but the flavorful food and cozy hospitality make this a rewarding visit for any fan of Bavarian cooking or old school, local-style dining.

Aaina-Singapore restaurant is one of the best Asian restaurants in Berlin, which actually serve Asian style food. I like Chiken Tikka Masala and Fish Punjabi Very much.Each dish have its own speciality, I just loved it.
The food tastes good and the prices are very fair. It's a nice looking restaurant and the service is excellent. They're around all the time without being intrusive, something I found very comforting.
Good service, mediocre food :(
Super Shop
Great place to grab a delicious turkish breakfast
Local watering hole, great homemade food.
Rewe find ich besser als penny ;-)

The food portion was huge and yummy. And the service was also excellent. We all enjoyed so much!! Previous few comments are not too favorable to the restaurants. I am surprised because we had a completely opposite experiences with superb and kind service and all. Maybe they changed their attitude after some bad reviews?? Toilets were very clean, too. We were there for early lunch, by the way. Anyway, we were very delighted.

Staff under too much pressure to keep the owner happy. Not a relaxed athmosphere. The proprietors full of themselves and too arrogant for my liking. There are lots of chilled out and nicer places around. Don't waste any time there.
They don't accept credit card. That's a pity
Guter Service
Low priced restaurant with meals that taste ok :)
good, but not spectacular german/austrian food, rather expensive regarding the rustic atmosphere.
Too expensive. And the apple strudel is always overbaked.

A mexican restaurant run by indians?!? Epic fail, you would at least expect the spicyness of the indian dishes but the food is disappointingly conceptless. I had an Enchilada Pollo which came on hot plate looked reasonable. The size of the portion is bit too much for me and the seasoning, well not even salt and pepper made it to horrible dish. The beans... no comment on that, the enchilada roll was dry and tasteless although the texture was right. The veggie rice as a side dish has nothing to on that plate but the biggest mistake was not serving a reasonable amount of sauce to it. The menu is like a 100 pages which is just bad enough alone. The draught beer and the service is okay the waiters are kind but this place needs a revamp and a mexican chef.
Really bad. Waiters asking for money before the end of the meal, disgusting food, prices aren t that cheap considering the quality. Sad but true

Trying to find decent Mexican food in Berlin is a never ending quest. We'd heard mixed review on this place but decided to see for ourselves. The chips and salsa/guac/oniony sour cream app was on par with an El Torritos style restaurant - totally decent but not mind blowing. I had the chicken quesadilla - never have I seen so much meat in a quesadilla, ever. It was good quality white meat, tender but not quite flavored for Mexican food, the tortilla was really good. My husband got the burrito con carne and again good but rather bland as far as anything close to Mexican flavors but in a pinch worth a try IF you aren't too picky. Got the flan for dessert, fairly certain it was a pre-made flan that you can pick up at the store, again a little bland. The waiters were very un-German-like regularly checked in, cleared empty plates - it was quite nice! We also got a free shot at the end of the meal, another nice surprise.
Quepasa is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Berlin. where we had tasty Mexican food for reasonable price. Worthy to visit the Quepasa Mexican restaurant.
Bettet mexican food in The Area don't go here
Besst food ever...

Love this place, the food and the service are just perfect. Have been coming back here while on travels and introduced it to friends who also loved it. The prices are very reasonable and they have a great selection of wines and gins. Can't wait till next time I get to visit!

Though Bar Raval didn't blow us away, it was a nice spot with good food. It has a very simple but well put together atmosphere. The prices were good and the wine selection was pretty decent. Worth going to if you are staying in the neighborhood, but not sure I would go out of my way to go there.

Edelweis is an ok place for breakfast outside in the summer. But the best thing about eating there is to look at all the stuff going on in the park, spontanious stand up shows, film making, rappers, singer songwriters, girls fighting you name is, everything can happen.
The upstairs (then jazz session) room was quite unbreathable.. smoke everywhere and not a single window (or vent) open...

The staff was not very helpfull, telling about the menu. The food was under middle, the brunch was served with hard and dry bread. But the sitting outside on the terrasse was fine. But this place need to shape up.
Great ambiance, delicious coffee and pies!
Nice location in the middle of the park, but comparatively mediocre value...

We took a real risk and ordered a hamburger and nachos. The burger wasn't nearly as good as one from The Bird, but it was edible (which is more than I can say about some other German burgers I've had). The chicken nachos were decent. We had them with Sauerrrahm (which just doesn't have the dipping-friendly texture of sour cream) and salsa after finding out that the Avocado Dip was not made fresh (and thus was probably over-processed fake-colored glop). I didn't try any of the cocktails, but my friend said that his mojito didn't taste right. (In fact, he didn't even finish it.) It had a decent atmosphere.
Good white Russians. Maybe not the best in Berlin, but a good price and a nice place to enjoy them.

Arrogant, lousy service. We sit down, and order 1 nachos to share then 3 mains. I ask politely the waitress, just in case, "can you please bring the nachos before the rest of the food?" She tells me disdainfully "ja taaaatsaechlich", in a way meaning "of course, how dumb do you think I am?" We wait and wait and wait. Food arrives: the nachos and 3 mains together, dropped on the table and there she goes. No big deal about the hick-up, but BIG DEAL to have people giving you 1 arrogance and 2 lousy service. I call her and tell her we can't pay the nachos because we started our mains and nachos will go cold. She just says it's not her fault, and leaves. At the end nachos are on the invoice. Food was reasonably good and well-priced (29,90 for 3 inc. drinks), so we pay - insisting for the 10cent change from the 30euro bills. She doesn't understand, I explain that leaving her ANY tip would be disrespectful towards all the good waiters out there. In the end, too bad this happened, as otherwise the place is ok (not exceptional - ok. there are plenty of better locations in the area.) But such arrogance is just a no-go, especially in Berlin where I find service otherwise great.
awesome place delicious food if you travel to berlin and don t eat there it s like going to paris and not see the eifel tower
Will not be able to eat Arabian food for a while... Pity. It was really tasty but only in an hour or so after the dinner I felt sick. Spent next day at home with stomach ache...

Can't recommend. You know, place looks nice and cozy, taste of most of the food is alright, price is cool. So far good. Just for that price you don't get much food as well. Big plates for two or three people look like something, but is kinda disappointing. Vegetables tasted like straight from conservative, that was not so good. Service I experienced as bad.
They might not serve alcohol but the place is a real gem. Great food for cheap prices - and it's so comfy you can sit there for hours and enjoy the tea!
Nice cafe good food
Typical Kreuzberg (West-)Berlin scenery. Hardly any tourists here. Ask staff for free WLAN code
Good atmosphere and service! Came in a bit after 10. Kitchen was closed but chef was very kind to make us a good meal. Good atmosphere and service!

The place looks great! Everything from the high ceilings to the bits and pieces of Marx and DDR memorabilia on the walls. The food here is great - come for the breakfast. Great range, something for everyone, and very affordable. The chef is a fun guy too!
Fantastic breakfast. Come early.

I know what is mexican food & my standards in Mexican Kitchen are high, i was expecting more of this restaurant, but not worth the price. The guys are nice but they could smile more at their jobs, anyway nothing to be mad... es geht.

I was looking for real Mexican food as I live in Central America and wanted to invite a lot of friends and former employees from the time when I still lived in Germany. The Ta'Cabron has been reffered by employees of the Mexican embassy and I('m happy that I asked as my experience - 10 evenings at Ta'Cabron - was absolutely amazing. They even do food that's not on the menu if you just ask: One night I asked for Cillaquiles and they did them perfectly. If you go there with 2 or 3 people please order one of each, place in the middle of the table and taste from all plates: That's a great dining adventure. By the way - service and friendlyness is so so so very good. Thank you for this great experience.;

Good Mexican fast food. We had the guacamole mit chips, cochinita pibil tacos, and pollo en mole burrito. The guacamole was alright, definitely not a good as what I make at home but actual guacamole (unlike the ubiquitous jarred "guacamole" in Germany that has less than 5% avocado content). The salsa verde served with the guacamole had a bit of a kick to it! Oh, it's the little things that makes an expat happy. The cochinita pibil tacos were pretty good, but if you want absolutely sublime cochinita pibil in Berlin, you must go to Papalotl in Prenzlauer Berg. The pollo en mole was also pretty good, but I don't think it belongs in a burrito. Next time, I will try it in tacos or a quesadilla. I noticed after we ordered that they have tamales. I must try those next time. Oh, how I miss tamales. They offer Corona, Dos Equis, and Dos Equis Amber if you want the Mexican beer experience. I had a margarita, which was quite good. They had a number of tequilas, most of which were real tequila (i.e 100% agave, unlike Sierra or Jose Cuervo). The girl working the counter was very friendly. We discussed the cuisines of the Americas. She came from Peru and recommended a Peruvian restaurant that I will try. Finally, there were a number of vegetarian options.
Best Mexican food in town!
Try the pizza, it is great.
nice funky place on Skalizer Str!
Chilled out café. Good for a date as there are no bright lights:-) Living room style interior.Not a hipster place. Very cosy.Great mojitos.

Great place for live performances in the evening or a quiet rainy afternoon. Lots of creative energy, unusual, sometimes freaky characters and süße Kellnerin. Sitting at one of the small tables on the sidewalk one is always going to see something interesting.
unmistakable atmosphere and delicious wine
Very cozy place. Perfect for a rainy Sunday.

A great little place to get some Mexican food. They offer a number of vegan options. The nopales (cactus) tacos were tangy and delicious. The pork is also perfectly cooked, crispy yet tender. They place three different salsas on the table.
Homely place , wholesome food and friendly service
They are slow here and the food really isn't worth the wait. I'm from Australia and I've eaten better Mexican at home.
For me the best mexican in town.
Great little dive bar with Kicker table
Great place in an interesting neighborhood. The eggplant main course and hummus appetizer were wonderful. Just go! Even meat eaters will enjoy.

While searching for a nice veggie restaurant we found this one. From outside the neighboorhood might feel a bit dark but the food is absolutedly nice. Recommendable and near metrostation Görlitzer bhf.
An absolutely great place with nice waitress and wonderful food.
Very nice place, good food for vegetarians and nice staff.

(Note: this is a review of their other location in Marheineke Markthalle) I like the variety of flavors. Their sea buckthorn (Sanddorn) ice cream was tasty, and I haven't seen anything with that flavor south of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. They also had dragonberry, and a few other exotic flavors. However, there were ice crystals in my ice cream! That's a big no-no and shows flaws in their production method. Although I am not vegan, I should mention that they do serve vegan ice cream. I haven't seen this elsewhere in Germany, so I would recommend this place to vegans. For the non-vegans, do yourself a favor when you are on Bergmann Straße -- skip this place and go to Vanille Marille (one block north off of Mehringdamm) instead. The variety of flavors there is even bigger and the ice creams and sorbets are flawlessly made.
Great homemade icecream! And free wifi!
Delicious homemade ice cream and great atmosphere. And a nice price 1 eur / scoop
music, drinks and girls...
Good German fast food yummy

It woun`t take to long to order here cause they don`t have lots of options on the menue. But what they do make tastes really good and is served quickly by the nice ever smiling staff. They also have rice snaps if you feel like trying something new...
I really enjoyed the food, the simplicity of ordering, the staff were nice and effecient. Very good experience!
Very good location, nice food and excellent service.
Dishes are large, but the food was very dull. We ordered rissoto and a pizza. The rissoto wasn't made and the pizza had no flavour.
Delicious
Fast yummy and at the right price. 1/2 chicken and fries for 3.50 euro
Tasty and affordable chicken
Lovely chicken

Absolutely love this place! Whenever I'm in Berlin I stay round the corner from Huhnerhaus and its part of my staple Berlin diet! Gets pretty busy but its well worth the wait! Gorgeous chicken, well dressed, tasty salad and nice chips! Oh God, I'm starving just writing about it!

This restuarant is surprisingly affordable and the food quality is top class... authentic Indian... this is ideal for students in Berlin and Potsdam running on a shoe string budget ;-) Where else can you get a plate of Chole Batura for 2 €? Note for Bengalis... the owner is of Bengladeshi origin so he likes to speak in Bengali and also serves some Bengali delicacies (just ask him)
I absolutely recomend this place. In my opinion is the best shcawarma/falafel place to it! A must when you come to berlin. I love it. (And also the cheapest, incredible)
Best Falafel / Schawarma in town. Sit outside and watch Kreuzberg go by.
My favorite falafel place in Berlin.

One of the best and cheapest places I found in my years in Berlin and they're open late to boot! I recommend the schawarma either as a sandwich or as a plate. Make sure you get a lot of the tahini, the mango sauce and especially the hot sauce-- they're all delicious.
Great atmosphere: feels like at home in the sofa, good cakes and coffee while listening to enjoyable tunes.
Love coming here for a beer and for watching german soccer

Worst Indian Food experience ever. And I am Indian! First trip to Germany and first restaurant and was moderately hungry. Entire restaurant was empty, and still bad service. Ordered milk tea, was bland. The food was worse. Seemed dumped out of a can and microwaved. I usually never leave food on my plate, but just could not finish whatever they called was food. I was with a friend, and he also agreed. The service lady was reading magazines and not very helpful at all. NEVER GO AGAIN! every minute this restaurant is open is a digrace to Indian cooks everywhere.
Went there for a Soul/60s party. Great dancefloor, great air conditioning: It's never too steamy or stinky in there. The music was a bit monotonous, but I guess that's the case almost everywhere.
Great Place.. Friday's nights, with rock and roll, are the Best! Good Drink's Also
Awesome place for rock lovers!! and also great jagermeister!!!
Nice view
Nice ceiling.. but too Smokey for a non-smoker
Loved the music, set to a volume so you could both talk and enjoy it. A place for common people. Loved it.
I had a great night, that night.... If I could remember all of it :)

I thought this place was great. When you first arrive you receive a strawberry drink, free Papadums and at the end of your meal you would receive a yoghurt and mango shot which was amazing. The service was fast and everyone was very friendly, attending to every need. The food was also delicious and was out quick so didn't have to wait long as I was hungry! We were even offered a free drink on the house! The only downside is that they would take your plates only a moment after you put your fork down. Sometimes I do like to take a breather while eating and would have to say several times that you were still eating but their intentions were good. I would definitely come back.

I am Indian and I can tell you that this is not at all good or authentic Indian food, in fact it might be the worst Indian food I have ever had (I haven't eaten Indian out much in Germany so I don't know how competitive it is). My German colleagues enjoyed their meal though so perhaps others won't mind as much! Service was friendly.
Really good food. Casual atmosphere and service, but really friendly. Friendly prices also! We all had a great time!

This place is a tourist trap. The food is tasty but fat and salty, which made it for all four of us quite heavy to digest. The service seems ok until you get literally wiped away. No chance for a 10 minutes after dinner. They take our empty plates as soon as they were empty and they wiped the table 3 [!!] times over again as a gentle but forcing way to please make place for the next paying customers.

Great great great Indian food but at a price: rather harsh service. Their intentions are good but it was painfully awkward: asking my Chinese girlfriend if she perhaps knew a random other (Asian looking) customer as a kind of 'joke'. Will return though, the food is insane. Try the chicken himalaya.

Our expectations were shattered as soon as we got there! The place is an old smelly public toilet under a bridge. To be fair, the meat tasted ok and the fries were descent, but the staff are extremely rude, unprofessional & makes it not worthwhile to visit this place! NOT RECOMMENDED @ all
Great burger. Nothing fancy. Just a good fresh burger.
Awesome place! Burgers are good, fries are good... the only thing that could've been better is organic meat.
Found this place accidentally, and loved it, the vibe is great, fresh and not expensive cheeseburgers, fries and drinks, right on the road...
A lot of trouble and waiting for a basic burger. Wtf ?
cosy bar.. quite full usually.. but I guess thats a good sign ;-)
Good sushi, okay venue, okay prices and good service
Very good sushi and very good soups!

To my great regret I am in this new review pulling my earlier review (summer 2013) back. I was surprised by the food and drinks in this restaurant but this deteriorated over time. Flavorless non original food, increased price= no value for money. On top of this during my last visit I was so extremely offended by the rude manners of the bartender/ waiter that I feel forced to share this with Google as such a thing never happened to me before. As I was kindly asking for the soup of the day and whether I could have the WiFi password (that i used over ten times before but not on my new device) to do some work, I was given the reply: 'no soup of the day, well hmm something with lentils' in a very aggressive fashion. When asking for the code the reply came back: 'no not today'. the bar was not full, it is a normal service (advertised on the door) so again the guy was getting even more rude and even offensive. That made me decide to leave and that was done under constant offenses and swearing from the bartender screaming (in front of multiple guests) that I should go to my mother if I had a complaint?! I wonder if he might have been using too much of his own supply? And breaking rule one of being a good bartender. Safe to say he was breaking more rules altogether. In general service is low in this restaurant. Its a very strange bunch of people working here. No card payments only cash and low flexibility. Hate to say it but this former favorite will be changed for one of the multiple very hospitable alternatives around the corner on Görlitzerstrasse.

This place was lovely. Stumbled across it on a cold wet day in Berlin. The waiter spoke English and helped me with a little German lesson, which was good. The food was superb. The atmosphere was very eclectic and sort of eco-trendy. Would definitely go back when I get back to Berlin. Nice prices too.
Coffee, tea and breakfast were good. Very good atmosphere and nice decor. :-)
Muesli with a mint-chocolate stick in it and a gloopy mango syrup... 1 star. French toast 2 stars.
Hipster atmoshpere, open wifi, cool decoration and decent food. The service was a bit snobby but we didn't mind because we found a comfy sofa and enjoyed the music and atmosphere.

I ordered a bagel with avocado. Simple, right? no, the avocado was some sludgy guacamole type of thing, the bagel was chewy and plain, and the few veggies that came with the dish were browning at the edges. not to mention their internet didn't work -- and when i asked them about it they acted like i was being obnoxious. it was literally the question, "hi, is there a problem with the internet right now?" and got major attitude. then a bee got into my coffee and drowned, when i asked them if they could maybe make me a new one, the server said "but the bee thing is not our fault." So what was i supposed to do with an iced coffee with a bee drowned in it? just shut up, pay for it and go somewhere else. bad service, no internet, bad food.
I like the interior with its granny-style sofas and armchairs. They have a large selection of drinks and it's nice to have breakfast there.
Unique and beautiful place. Fantastic staff. Great music
Absolutely great drinks!

Every meal I have had here was perfect. My complements to the chef! Super good prices and a very healthy selection. I didnt even know it was a vegetarian place until the 3rd time. and I usually hate vegetarian places :)
currywurst!
delicious with low prices.

nice place, good drinks, arrogant barkeeper, unfriendly and slow service. if you like being ignored or rebuked like a schoolgirl ("i will come later to you, i'm busy!" with 4 people in the room...) - that's your spot!
I keep coming back as the coffee is the best around Berlin. Rich, earthy flavor, fresh roasted beans and staff is always with a friendly smile.

it's a bit hard to find, tucked away behind the s-bahn, but the search is more then worth it. it's a simple and small bar with some in- and outside seating, some cakes and juices and ofcourse coffee. they make the most beautiful and tight microfoam i have ever seen and you can really taste in their espresso that they use more coffee per shot. so if you make it to berlin and are in need of a proper shot of espresso, i would certainly recommend passenger espresso.
Best coffee to be had in Berlin. An international mix of staff bring the knowledge of European and Australian coffee practices to Kreuzberg. Fully recommended!
Awesome coffee!

We were 9 people. The food was horrible, the service was clumsy ans the bill was frightening. The decor gave us headache. To top it all off, the Pakistan map was wrong (it showed Kashmir s part of Pakistan). I am NEVER returning and I would advice others the same.
Delicious food, exellent service!!!!! :-)
I really enjoyed this bar, it was quite small but had a nice relax atmosphere. The bar girl was extremely friendly (I can speak no German!)
Excellent food, nice coffee, good mood and great people!
Worth the slightly longer walk from the tube station. Nuff said.
Salut has the most delicious turkish pastries. Everything is warm and fresh and they're open almost all the time.
We went on our first night in Kreuzberg and really enjoyed the Flammkuchen.
my favourite one: pide with spinach and eggs. it is simply the best. salads are also ok. but pasta is not recommendable.
Tourist trap. Don't expect Italian food there. Schnitzel could be nice for lunch once in a while.

The prices here are the same as in any other vietnamese place in Berlin, but the quality of the food really stands out. You can also get "Mittagsmenu" in the evening, they only add 1€ to the prices (so you end up having a great meal for 6-8€). The restaurant itself is also very cozy and not tacky. One of my favorites in Crazyville:)
Cool place for some punk or rock music
tolle Konzertlocation!!

Amazing experience all around! I'm from the USA and was more than satisfied by the generous portion of Raclette laid before me and my partner! It was a quite a task to get through the skewered choice of meats and vegetables. The French onion soup, wine selection, and locally distilled Schnapps also proved deliciously sensible! Careful candle lighting, the aroma of firewood burning in the corner fireplace, and the cozy brick walls in this nook of a restaurant offer a perfect French mountain escape among the streets of one of the hippest neighborhoods in the world at the moment! Can't wait to come back!
Fantastic drinks and food!!! Must be tried..

Went here with two friends on a Friday evening. Tables are so close together it very uncomfortable. Very smokey from the kitchen and fire so thst the air felt very stuffy. Service was terrible we had to ask for a menu and were shown a blackboard with the food and drinks. Most dishes were in French and we had to ask what they were as we could only guess. When our food arrived we had to ask for cutlery and napkins. My dish was undercooked and for what I ordered overpriced. We left feeling ripped off and it was a damper on our evening. None of us would recommend this place or think of going back.

Had a lovely dinner with my boyfriend- found everything to be great. The entrecote was a very high quality meat, perfectly prepared. The fish was tender and moist. Service was just how it should be- casual but attentive and knowledgeable. Our waiter suggested two wines that would be good for what we ordered and had us try them both and choose what we liked best (I personally prefer this to an extensive wine list) . It is a small and cozy place, probably not suitable for parties larger than 4 people. The cost us exactly what I feel it should have for the quality of the food, preparation, and service. I look forward to going back and trying the raclette and I will be recommending it to friends.

Very good Indian restaurant in Berlin. Food-wise, meals came in a buffet form. Butter rice was very well cooked, meat was very tender, and the curry was simply delicious. A dark and unique atmosphere surrounds the restaurant, with amber colored lighting around the tables. Service was pretty good and polite, and if you have the chance, stop by at their bar and see the bartender do tin tricks, better known as "Flair Bar-tending". Very friendly guy who was extremely skilled. Great indian food if you wish to sample a different cuisine in Berlin.

Food was excellent, especially the butter chicken and the naans. The atmosphere was also very good, being in a dark room lit by traditional Indian candles. Indian music also played softly in the background, helping the dining experience. Do come here if you want the best Indian food in Berlin

The food was excellent. The butter chicken and the naan was just delicious. The restaurant was very beautifully decorated with indian paintings and there was some very nice background music. A must visit for all Indian food lovers!
Amazingly good tasting food! Great price for delicious food! I recommend the assortment of 3 Indian dishes.

Found this place as we were taking a romantic walk by the canal. The food was superb (vegetable tikka and butter chicken). The place is very cozy and the service is great. I highly reccommend this place!!

i was there 3 times during my five days trip, it was great!!! I especially liked the Lapland vegan burger :-) I've eaten the Vegan teremisso and it was yummy as well :) (The vegan chicken burger was fantastic as well)

Been here quite a few times and it has gone from 'ok' to just dreadful. The usual Berlin attitude to anything alternative/vegan/vegetarian is: "cleanliness and manners are uncool' and they bloody well live up to this. The other day I went in there again, and that was the very last time, trust me, and the staff was uninterested, bitchy, moody, the tables grimy (a typical Berlin disease for an efficient waiter or busboy with a clean damp cloth is non existent). the chips were mere crunchy leftovers from the chippan rather than chips (or pommes as they are called in German) looking very much like brown dregs. The accompanying burger was stone cold. Anyway, my advice is: stay in, have dinner at home with a few friends instead and avoid this place like the plague. It is just one of a long line of really bad eateries in Berlin.
nice place, but kinda difficult to reach by public transport if you're not really in the neighbourhood. best veggieburger ever, vegan cheeseburger. lots of choice.
Vegan and veggie fast food. I wouldn't make a special trip but it did hit the spot!
Awesome fries super crispy and yummy
Service doesn't really exist but they do a super brunch on Sundays for €7.50 (i.e. help yourself) and all I can complain about is that it could be a bit warmer... both the food and the room!
Rather unfriendly service. Took very long till dishes were served. Rather boring food, yet large portions.
Service is on its own time. Nice venue in summer if you're prepared to wait.
Absolutely fantastic burgers, especially the veggie one. Good music, and interesting interior. Worth 5 stars :)
Great Burgers, especially the Veggie-Burgers rule! Sooo Tasty, go down even better with a Cocktail ;)
Excellent Breakfast, Burgers and Cocktails. Breakfast till 5 pm! Classy!
My fav whiskey bar. Relaxed atmo and over 200 whiskey
Great scotch selection, knowledgeable barkeep.
Decent food and pricing. Good atmosphere and service. Many vegetarian alternatives. Great desert.

Absolutly not advisable. "Croquetas" means "poison" (i found strange pieces of rice, meat and fish in the same Croqueta, when i was in Spain there was just Ham, i´m sure it was thethe remains of other foods) , and they dont know what "fresh" means. 5 minuts after my visit to Manuela Tapas I felt terribly sick. About the service, the waiters told me they have no contract. A couple of inspections could be a good Idea! Please, DON´T GIVE YOUR MONEY TO THIS PEOPLE WHO DONT CARE ABOUT THEIR WORKERS AND THEIR CLIENTS.

Manuela serves classic breakfast, tapas and some spanish dishes. I had a vegetarian paella which was ok and the wine was good, but the service could be a lot better. The waiter did not seem to happy to work there and that always takes the eating out experience down for me. Luckily I had the best company when I was there so I did not let the miserable waiter bother me too much.

NO STARS! Service fine, food was lovely, came to pay and waited for our change....... and waited...... and waited..... finally after 30 minute wait we decided to get our coats on and ask the waitress for our change to which her response was that in Germany the waitress keeps the change as a tip (been in Germany 6 months first time ive heard that) obviously was not familiar with this method of tipping and politely asked for the change back so then we could leave a somewhat smaller token to which we received little more than a blank stare before she explained a second time the 'German' way of tipping. Will not return!
Great selection. Helpful and friendly staff. Delicious and fresh and several good options for vegetarians. Nice comfy atmosphere.
One of my favorite places for breakfast in Berlin. The eggs in glass are amazing, the homemade bread is so good and the service is great.
My new fav local in Berlin. Excellent food and service. Nice and cool.
Had to wait 80 minutes for the pizza (counting from the moment we ordered). Thus only 2 Stars. The pizza itself is really really good. fyi, there is only one pizza size: huge. - It feeds 4+ people.
Small place with cheap tables, and awesome HUGE pizza. Real deal italian style, thin crispy, great choices for toppings, very fast service. Highly recommended!
Very nice cosy place with calm ambience. Food is nice, not something extraordinary, but big portions make up for it.
This is one of the best Asian in all of Berlin. Prices a bit higher than usual, but generous portions.
Good italian food. Nice restaurant and atmosphere with moderate prices and overwhelmingly kind waiters.
Good food , nice service ;)

One of the few places in Berlin to get an actual bagel sandwich, they are delicious! We love their coffee and if you are so lucky to get one of their brownie bites (they often come with the coffee) - mind blowing good! Services is great, staff is super friendly. Comfy decor, lots of room and free wifi. They often have homemade soups and quiches that are quiet tasty.

I love the perfect espresso drinks they make here! Amazing! But they are expensive (for this area) and the atmosphere is quite different than what I expect from a Kreuzberg cafe. I'd use "safe", "clean" and "peaceful" to describe a place (sometimes reminds me of a child's bedroom). For less tasty coffee, but a creative, bohemian, less expensive hole-in-the-wall - head up 1 block to Cafe Mano.

Great atmosphere, especially in winter and when the Wimdu crowd is around. Projectors are set up when football is on, so a good place to watch footie and chat as well. Let you play some of your own music on quieter nights (Summertime - Vybz Kartel)
One of my favorite hangouts*****
The location and food was good, however dreadful service. Both waitresses were absolutely rude, annoyed that I asked about something on the menu, or anytime we ordered something.
Brunch was great, really good food. Service was ok speed.
Nice place to chill, eat, drink and talk. It's located in the heart of Berlin Kreuberg. Lunch: Cheap prices. Dinner: Moderate prices
spacious, kids friendly, laptop culture, wifi, nice food.
Decent coffee for those with high standards. Flat whites, Wi-Fi, polite but not particularly chatty staff.
Good coffee, sombre, small place, nice, quiet staff, good, mostly directly sourced coffees, a small assortment of bakery stuff.
Great coffee and freaking amazing cheesecake.
Great blues sound check and a delicious bagel with a delicious variety of filter coffees available!
Tasteful coffee and cozy environment
A likable rogue of a park.
So many different things happening at the same time and somehow everything works well together, truly amazing!
Off Central Park :-)
open the door and you ll get in another year,somewhere in 60's. great cocteils,rare groovy music and an original barman. chris ex/greece
the food is wonderful, excellent choice of wines. A hidden gem of a place.
The food was superb, the service was great. It's a very small restaurant, so you should better reserve a table in advance. I will definitely return to this place for my next Berlin visit!
Great little bar

In keeping with the stylishness of the hotel, the food served in the restaurant is incredibly stylish and decorative. Full of delicious flavours but don't come expecting huge portions: this is bite-size artisan food. Service was a bit slow but the views onto the Spree in the evening are nice to soak up
Friendly staff, great atmosphere, good beer and cake. Plus a cosy cinema. Altogether a memorable experience.

Perched along the river, this club is a super-chilled spot to spend an evening. They've got various areas of decking right by the water, and room inside to get down to the minimal house playing on the soundspeakers. The bar staff are super good looking and the crowd is refreshingly eclectic. Get there early if you want a seat and don't expect the decor to be too glitzy - this is grungy Berlin at its best.
OMG this is one of my favorite spots in Berlin. Awesome music and really cool people.
Very nice place! Drink, food and good music +++
Great place to enjoy a sunday afternoon and some techno
Sometimes it is full and quite full of hipstery hype.
better than a yellow submarine
limited choice of food, but nice atmosphere, by the lake
great location, good food
Good chillin' here. Nice open fire in winter.
Great location, average food, generally lousy service.
The location isn't worth the long wait and unfriendly staff.
Nice atmosphere. Good Music.

Place to go If you like to be treated like 2. class scum by the doormen and hang around in a run-down appratmentbuilding with lots of hipsters. What is up with the people working at the door? I feel this harassing style, started by Berghain several years ago is so passé. Although when u first get in the guys in the bars and stuff are really friendly, but appaled by the really unecessary aggressive treatment some people got in the door, I could never warm up to this place. The backyard garden is cozy, and has a nice vibe. Although inside its just a crowded old house with lots of tourists that thinks everything is "amazing", even though its just typical berlin retro-furniture and a mediocre soundsystem on most of the floors. Will never go back.
Maze closed for three weeks. :-( We had a couple of decently-priced drinks, explored a bit, and moved on. Hope to return when the maze is open again!
Club in an old mansion. Cocktails in the kitchen and dancing in the bedrooms. Like a surreal haunted techno house
One word - "labyrinth". Best and craziest 10 euros you will ever spend!
i went with some friends. we got there around 9 thursday evening and it was chill atmosphere, not crowded, with very berlin decor, prices were quite reasonable.
Our four-hour tour somehow finished after only three hours and five minutes.
Free WLAN, nice & friendly. Interesting Folks.

Special place. I didn't know much about the Paleo style of life before eating at Sauvage. The waiter was a real treat - she educated us on the nutrition principles of the diet and helped us make amazing choices for our dinner. Everything was absolutely delicious and despite having dinner at almost 10PM we both had lots of energy after dinner and later on had a great sleep. This is a must-go when in Berlin!

Absolutely Best Food Ever! Gluten-free bread that tastes like normal bread that comes with the salad entree. Main of pulled ox, so frigging tender and sugar snap pees with that awesome crunch. Gf had seafood paella to DIE FOR! Riesling Wine worth 21€ and whole meal costs 57€. Wait staff very attentive. Absolutely nothing at all wrong with this place, a must visit for anyone in Berlin. Ignore all bad reviews because this place is the best!

The one and only Paleo Restaurant in the world. The food is absolutely amazing, not to mention incredibly healthy. It's well worth the money spent - this quality of food is impossible to find elsewehere, even in the expensive restaurants.

It was absolutely not worth the money! The paleo [palaeolithic] diet's principles are healthy, though well, extremes are not always the best! (this goes for everything). It can be done so much with this idea... but meals here are tasteless... and we all know it is possible to prepare this diet WITH taste! And... if people who go to this restaurant are focused on being healthy... why do many of them go outside to smoke in front of the restaurant? A bottle of water costs EUR 6, only cash... Safety tip: Make sure you go there by car (or taxi)... do not attempt to cross the park a couple of blocks before this restaurant!... unless you go in a group of 25 tall men!

Absolutely amazing place. The food is ambitious and creative. Our waiter was a cute and very passionate young woman who clearly was very enthusiastic about the food and the people behind it. She told us the story behind the place and all details about the food which was clearly a great interest of her own. And the food itself, oh my... just about perfect. So many little details and perfectly balanced tastes. The steak itself was fully worth the trip to Berlin, so tender and savoury. We could hardly fit the desert in our bellies so we shared just one slice of grain-free blueberry pie which was absolutely amazing. I can't wait to go back and try more of their food!
Great place. Easy but cosy. The food is great. You get good portions for reasonable prices.

As I live pretty close, I must have passed this place a hundred times or more without really noticing it. Maybe it is to close to ice cream shop Fraulein Frost.... But it came up on a search online, and I decided to try it out. They have a very good selection of different dishes and all of them can be made in a vegetarian version. I had some really nice summer rolls, a spicy red curry and a glass of good white wine. I thought I knew the area, but as with many things in Berlin, the good stuff is not the first thing you see.

Delicious pan Asian food. My beef Laotian lab salad was awesome. Everyone else in our group loved their food, too. There are spicy dishes and non-spicy dishes on the menu. I'd definitely recommend making a reservation because the place is tiny. The service was good and the server bilingual.
great food, great atmosphere.. good prices. The music is also great!
The breakfast is just great, but the prices are over the average and sometimes you just sit and wait,...and sit and wait... But it's a great place anyway.

Ok fine I'm not an expert on Indian food. We have a lot of indian restaurants in new york, and I guess if I had real indian food I would be running to the bathroom for days... BUT this was the best indian I have had in Berlin, thus far. It was quite tasty, and of course aside from everything being germanified, it seemed relatively indianish. It was very affordable for lots of delicious appetizers and entree eats. Added bonus was being able to sit out on the patio and enjoy the late afternoon when we ate a few weekends ago. I would definitely give this place a try!

So weird waiters behavior!!!! we still tried to understand why was he so rude with us, and show us how was he so kind with other guest next to us. and at the end when we paid he did not return the rest of money like a he took by himself his tip, soo weird. He left so clear that we were not welcome.

This place is wonderful for price, quality and taste of the food. When the owner's in he takes care of guests personally. When we ran out of money he offered us to pay the bill at our next visit (of course we just went to an ATM and paid right after) which we found really generous.
overpriced brunch at california breakfast slam...
Come here for awesome north American breakfast in the weekends.
Such friendly, welcoming staff, Tuesday night movie club film-cycles, delicious soup, cheap drinks, great atmosphere. We love Heroes.
Nice place, friendly barman, good cocktails and belgian beers. Well worth the visit.
Terrible food. Terrible interior. Avoid

Me and a friend of mine are visiting Berlin from California and did a quick search for nearby Italian food - this place came up on the results well within walking distance of where we are. The food was good, service was prompt, and the prices were very very reasonable. I had the lasagna, my friend had the pasta arbiata...both were really good. After we settled the bill, they even gave us both a free small glass of grapa. Depending on this pesky volcano, we'll be returning to Restaurant La Musica before heading back home.
One of the most inspiring cafés in Neuköln.
I loved this great vegeterian dish Yemista and the iced coffee.
What to mention first... Great food, good atmosphere (winter & summer), very generous portions, well priced, and friendly and fast service. Only negative would be the effect on my waistline.
I sometimes wished this place was not so close to my jogging track along the Maybachufer, but then again after jogging for one hour you do deserve some ice cream.....
locally brewed beer, good music from DJ, good whisky selection

Das Essen war typisch amerikanisch. Ich aß die "Eggsplate" und die "Strawberry Mint Pancakes" und meine Erwartungen wurden übertroffen. Der Bacon war perfekt auf den Punkt gebraten und die Pancakes waren locker luftig. Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis stimmt hier. Auf jeden Fall einen Besuch wert! Das Lokal selbst ist innen ganz schön eingerichtet, außen eher schlicht und die Bedienung war freundlich. Beim nächsten Berlin Trip auf jeden Fall eines meiner Anlaufziele! -- The breakfast was 'real' american. I ate the eggsplate and the strawberry mint pancakes (you have to check them out!) which both were fantastic. The bacon was perfectly fried and the pancakes were nice and fluffy. The price-performance ratio is ok too! The restaurant is definitely worth a try. The restaurant itself is inside nice decorated, outside it's more or less boring. The staff is friendly and courteous (you won't find that too often in Berlin). Next time I'm in Berlin I'll go get my breakfast there for sure again!

The place is very nice: Unpretentious with a nicely lit retro atmosphere. The service was awful though: The waitress screamed at me as I arrived into the restaurant telling me the way to the restrooms. I ignored that, and then I asked if they were serving dinner at that time so she basically tossed a menu on top of a table with a mix of anger and attitude. She was extremely rude and nasty. Then I had to wait forever for someone to come and take my order. There was a brazilian lady that noticed me and she made sure I was being helped properly. She was very sweet and just her presence made up for all the nasty vibe from the other waitress. Food was extremely good, so I might give it another try just to check out lunch.
We were there in August last year quite a few times, a great place . We will be back soon !
Lovely little restaurant with laid-back atmosphere and unpretentious food. The lunch menu (€6 for three courses) is excellent and the coffee is good and served in large quantities.
Big Trouble in Lidl China! FAB!
Freshest Berritos i have had in Berlin. All vegetarian made with care and love!
Small, not fast, but great vegan burritos!
Amazing burger! I'm pretty sure it could be the best I've ever had!!
Fantastic burgers. Definitely worth a visit.
Quite good burgers for reasonable prices.
Amazing hamburger. Best I've had in a long time. Small hole in the wall place. Barely space to stand but WELL worth it!
Veggie burger is not great. Fresh, but I had much better.
Good and normal brost بروست وفروج
Amazing place
Typically small, but good atmosphere with a pool table. Blues on Monday.
Fresh croissants of all shapes and sizes baked right in front of you.

The best Hummos place in Berlin, you can get amazing plate with extras in 5 Euros. Keep in mind that you will need to come early on Saturdays since the place might be packed, and the best thing is that you can get a real pita bread here...
Stay in the front room. The back room is haunted.
The food is divine. A bit pricey but well worth it. It's a cosy place with lovely staff.
Amazing! Staff are friendly and fun. Food was amazing and this is the only place out of Melbourne you can get top notch coffee. Keep it up!
Good breakfast good coffee friendly staff...

I would do recommend this place for every grilled chicken lover. , sadly there is no hot water in the wc. Para todo los amantes del pollo asado deben visitarlo. Der Laden laden ist ein Muss für jede Händchen Fan. . Veramente un vero sapore autentico. Mai ho mangiato il pollo così buono . شخصيا رأي أطيب دجاج مشوي عله الفحم مجربه. الخدمة جيده ، عاشت الايادي. بس يا ريت لو بس يكون في ماء حار لغسل اليد بعد تناول الدجاج المطعم سعره معقول ومحافض عله نوعيته. نتمنالكم التوفيق.
Homely feel, DIY atmosphere and cool people. Very nice.
Super cool!

Nice interior, fresh flowers, really good cocktails and the audience is not excessively hipstery. The owner/shift manager/guy in charge seems to overpolice the place a bit. That beginns with telling you off for sitting the wrong way and ends with locking the door when it's too full. Nobody can enter, people only can leave when they press a button on the door. Nobody really gets it and they've got a serious firehazard on their hands. If you're afraid of too many people getting in, get a bouncer!

the best barteners ever and their special home made syrops and tradicionally made drinks. No bullshit no mojitos, but 10 tipes of negroni, whiskey sour with egg white, old fashioned, rosmarine smash, plus many crazy possisions like drink with balsamico and chocolet liquier, made with love really its like eating in a michelle star restaurant, love it!!!
NO NO NO! went on Monday Feb 20th... paid tap water 2,20€ per glass.. what more should i say??
It is a wrong place - Lidl is ca. 100 meters right-down by map. It is near to Aldi. 52°29'03 N 13°27'42''E
Delicious coffe, paninis, very nice people and place.
Fantastic place - reasonable prices/amazing food. The staff were so friendly and they do menus in English. Definitely would go back there again. Very very happy customers!

The salad was absolutely yummy! I enjoyed every bit of it. Nice setting and so close to the city. A great relaxed, low key place to meet (distant) relatives for the first time. :-) Would love to visit the next time I'm in Berlin and check out the rest of the menu.

oh no! what a terrible experience! don't ever take this hell-ride of 3 hours down the maybachufer. the 'tour guide' ceasely speaks over a deafening megaphone, describing each building and bridge passed no matter how inconsequential or banal. the 20 euro ticket comes with no service what-so-ever. we watched the waitress literally yell at old women, a child who wanted ice-cream, and ourselves (with a 1 year old child) that no she would not take our order- no coffee, no water, no food would be served to any of us 'until she had time'-- which didn't happen in almost two hours. after starving for 1 hour we finally asked the captain to let us off- we took the u-bahn home. one of the worst experiences i've had in berlin after living here for 3 years. a guaranteed waste of time and money.
Great place, wonderful food for a really neat price (7 EUR thebuffet...). Ich kann es nur empfehlen !!!
Very nice place, good prices and good food. Just a bit sloppy service-wise. First German breakfast of my trip, everything went as expected... I'm full !
The ambiance is great. Once you understand that you have to actively flag down a server, everything is lovely.
Excellent authentic Thai food. Very few tables and seats, but they do takeout.
testy thai food
Tasty and fast.
gute ware, alles sehr sauber, nettes personal.
Underdog! Good value food. With a little touch-up this could be a real goodie, especially in that area.

Oh this was the best schnitzel ever. I ate it for the next few days - they always give a wrapping to take out - and shared it with friends. It was a great surprise to see that something this big can be made. But they also have smaller schnitzels. If you plan to see/eat something extraordinary in Berlin this is the place to go!

Best meal we had on our German trip - great atmosphere - everything freshly prepared - unbelievably low price. We had the trout that came with a delicious salad and vegetables. The giant pizza (1 meter diameter) that the group of people at the next table were eating looked great fun!
Excellent vegan Café. The cakes are extremely good! Love also the atmosphere.
Closed until 22 January 2013

I've only gone once when they were offering all you can eat buffet. They do this offering every other Sunday. The good was average and the selection as well. So I'll only go again if I'm very hungry and I feel like Indian food independently of the quality. The service could be improved in many ways, specially considering the provisioning of the different dishes.
A rather disappointing place, with bad chairs.
If you live in a small place, then this cafe is a nice "third room" where you can relax with a coffee and some retro videogaming!
Large and dark living room, the perfect place to sit and chat in candlelight. Bonus that you can smoke and the blonde waitress with tiny breasts looks amazing
Food was ok. Nothing special
Not tasty, really expensive for what it is and not very fresh: don't go!!!!!
Game of chess and a cheeky espresso macchiato. #Boom
Best Coffe in the Area!
The food is very good, The Pizza i ate and the Salami which were Vegan, felt like the real deal, very good job! really enjoyed the meal.

The outside of the building is a bit drab, but once you enter, the place brightens up. Good selections, found what I needed. The cashier was very efficient and was on to the next customer before I picked up my change.
Great breakfast; nice interior

Decent accommodation at a very low price. Close to Oberwiesenthal ski resort and at 1/3 of thevm price of accommodations of the German side. Good breakfast, which changes daily. Decent German/English speaking levels.
Really friendly staff, great food, good value. They also have an English menu and lots of vegetarian options. I will definitely eat here again.
Food is bland and tasteless, tandoori chicken in a total lie - it's marinaded but boiled - and the service was awful

My girlfriend and I visited La Serra two times at our stay in Berlin and the food was excellent and the prices low. They have both pasta, pizza, pork, cow and fish so there is a lot to chose from. They were all very polite and speak English well.

My co-worker and I was in this restaurant once last year and was amazing. The food was really good and everything was really cheap! I don't remember if they talked a good English. The place is very good and very close to the Subway... I recommend. Eu e minha colega de trabalho estivemos uma vez nesse restaurante em 2011 e foi fantastico. A comida era otima e era absurdamente barato (3 Euros por um Espaguete a Bolonhesa, por exemplo). Não me lembro se o garçom falava ingles, mas o lugar era otimo e ficava proximo ao metro. Recomendo
Very cheap and very good food for this price! Love it!

Leuchtstoff is the most awesome coffee bar with excellent coffee, tea and homemade lemonads as well as delicious cakes, sandwiches and snacks. Conveniently located in a side street close to Hermannstrasse station and uniquely furnished with mostly self-built, I stop by for a cup of coffee and nice talks with the staff and regulars pretty much daily on my way to work. If you're in Neukölln and like good coffee and food as well as a nice athmosphere, you should definitely go there.

A small but very nice and beautiful coffee place, with lots of charm, creativity and love for detail. Most of the interior is built by the owner itself. And of course, you get a splendid coffee. It is a perfect place for getting to know the Berlin lifestyle a bit better.
Superb! Honestly... The best coffee around my house...... The best!!!
A really nice Italian restaurant with a friendly owner & serving staff, acceptable prices and tasty food, nothing outstanding, but very tasteful.
Good basic food and for a tourist attraction quite cheap!..
Friendly staff, very tasty food at moderate prices, good atmosphere.
Beautiful idyllic garden with fountain, tucked away from tourists. A gem of a park, really.

Walking into Big Market is like stepping back in time. It starts with the owner - Herr Horn. Brash to the point of overbearing, he is a true Berliner (not a lot of small talk, and getting straight to the point). Herr Horn cares about his customers in a paternal sort of way, keeping everyone abreast of the dozens of new bottlings, and paring up newcomers with the regulars (effective knowledge transfer!). His knowledge of whisky and other alcohol is extensive such as soon-to-be released bottlings and distillery production issues. Part of the experience of Big Market is meeting Herr Horn, trying to estimate his current mood, and hopefully getting a few good jokes in before leaving. Then the store (well, actually some of the expats here also refer to it as the whisky temple as mentioned in an earlier review). Its a combination of 1) an antique shop with pieces of Berlin history strewn about - massive wood cabinets, old hats hanging on the ceiling from various Armies (Prussia Germany, British, American, etc.), dated books in cabinets, and other various ancient objects; and 2) an incredibly deep selection of thousands of bottles of precious whisky and other tasty offerings (rum, wine, cognac to name a few). Whiskys and other alcohol dating from the early 20th century are on display and can also be purchased. There is a tasting corner where about 100-200 whiskys are open and available to taste for a fair price. The trial whiskys have the standards in there (Laphroaig QC, Glenmorangie 10, etc.), but also have exceptional, one-off whisky bottlings that are in the middle and upper end range. I almost forgot to mention that the pricing in general is quite fair...you wont get ripped off as you would in Mitte or other hip location in Berlin. Finally, the community. This place is a living piece of South Berlin - its been here for decades. Older gentlemen customers appearing to be in their early 80s come in to say hello and pick up their weekly bottle of whisky. Early 20-somethings stop by for a first time rum to mix for their girlfriends. The bulk of the clientele are whisky drinkers in their 30-50s. Quite a few have visited Scotland distilleries (several times). About every third visit, Ive met someone who is a major collector - the kind of people who buy cases of whisky. At Big Market, learning about whisky, getting great tips, and having a good bit of fun and conversation with the other customers is a large part of why I enjoy coming back. Long live Big Market!
Great place in a breathtaking environment (an old windmill !!!) . German cuisine at its best, Friendly, english speaking staff and chef. Whenever back to Berlin, MUST go there again.
Very peaceful place,an old mill in a residential area.nice service,honest price,also available a few fish dishes
Not the cheapest greek restaurant in town, but definitely one of the most delicious ones. Great food, very friendly staff who think of everything to make the dinner worth remembering!
Best Japanese place in Berlin I've seen so far. Good service and traditional food in a good place. A little far from the center but worthy the effort.
Alles top
This is a place where you feel like a desired and dear guest. Friendly staff, delicious food, not to mention lowest prices I've seen.

had such a terrible experince in this restaurant. Turkey bone meat used as chicken filet in Chicken Nawabi dish and it tasted so horrible. The dish Palak paneer was eatable but not with something special.....Naan....I think they buy cheap ones and heat to serve. To compensate the real Frassen they charge high prices.... It was exteremely bad experince.....Avoid it......
use tobe one of the good restaurant in Berlin....
While the service can come off as surly and the (outside) decor a bit cheap, the food is good and fairly cheap. I had a good experience here and will likely be returning.
Horrible food, friendly service

Had a hard time finding the door, there were children everywhere and Germans don't know how to queue. But this is a McD. They serve McD in a McD. If you go there, it is because you need to. So whatever.
is great

Very nice outdoor seating with a view of the river. Food is traditional and uniformly good. On occasion, it can take a long time to be served but they are aware of this and have taken steps to mitigate the situation. I certainly recommend this nice place, especially in the summer.
Right in the middle of the oldest part of Köpenick, the coffee is excellent, the food is fresh and from the best ingredients. Informal, rustic café atmosphere with a great kitchen.
Have been there for a wedding. Nice location, friendly and helpful staff. Try to get there when the sun shines. It is nice to sit outside.
Tolles Cafe und tolles Personal

The food served is a mix between Asian fusion and traditionally inspired German cuisine. Unfortunately they get neither right, resulting in a meal which is often bland with minimal variation in taste. The coffee is decent and good value. The place is located in an extension of two historical air field workshops. The interior is minimalist in style but sadly lacks the love for detail. The major downside, however, is the lousy service. Customers are regularly being snubbed by the stroppy employees.
Very good german food. Nice service.

We had a nice evening there, good restaurant with nice dine. Additionally there´s some kind of "Biergarten" affiliated in the rear part of the site. Nice located, delicious german beer and food (hamburgers, scampi, currywurst..) English-speaking and kindly hosting, good live-set performance that friday when we were there. Was impressive, coming back soon for sure!
Excellent home-cooked food and a pleasant atmosphere, ideal for street-watching. The beer is brewed on the premises and is amazing!
Excellent food, great service, huge portions, super view of Müggelsee from the terrace. Henry the waiter was amazing!

I've been here three times, once solo with my book and the need for quiet. The food is plentiful, the service is impeccable, and the cafe's interior design is comfortably modern. They serve breakfast late into Sunday afternoon, which neighboring Hohen Neuendorf does not. And thank goodness for that. A solid choice!
Top preise lohnt sich
